description:
Job Summary:


“Any sufficiently complex technology is indistinguishable from magic.” - Arthur C Clarke

The Team

In a time where children carry devices with AI in their pockets, robots deliver fast food meals, and other science fictions have become mundane reality, we need new magic: New ways to connect with our guests, to surprise them, make them smile, and open their minds to magic - not just in our parks and resorts, but everywhere in the world.

At Disney Research Imagineering this emerges from the application of bleeding edge science to everything from enabling new guest-facing experiences in the parks to assisting cast members and transforming critical business processes.

At Disney Research, we focus on new ideas and ways of thinking, working to solve the biggest challenges that are otherwise unsolvable without deep understanding of both the complexities of the Disney business, and the opportunities afforded by bleeding edge scientific exploration and application.

Our work is centered on 4 key areas
  • Character Intelligence
  • General AI/Data Analytics
  • Computational Robotics
  • Interactive Immersion
and is organized around core platforms that enable rapid integration, evaluation, communication and transfer of research concepts and results to the business.

The Role

We are looking for deep applied scientists who are passionate about their field of expertise and want to use their domain knowledge to create magic for our guests and fellow cast members.

As a member of Disney Research Imagineering you will be part of a team that defines and maintains a vision of the future enabled by a melding of deep science with deep artistry within a company that provides an unparalleled platform to share this vision with the world. You will work with partners across the company and academic/industry research teams across the globe to realize this vision: working with talent and leveraging unique data sets and content from the entire spectrum of Disney properties including Parks, Resorts, Cruise Lines, Marvel, Pixar, Lucasfilm, and Disney Animation Studios.

Areas of interest include, but are not limited to:
  • Embodied Conversational AI including:
    • Speech Processing
    • Natural Language Understanding
    • Dialogue systems
    • Voice Synthesis
    • Affective Computing
    • Knowledge representation
    • Generative Animation
  • Applications of Data Science and Deep/Machine learning
    • Deep generalists
    • Recommender systems
    • Robotics, control systems
    • Computer vision, including activity and action recognition in videos
  • Computational Behavioral Science
    • Social psychology
    • Cognitive science
    • Behavioral econometrics
    • Behavior and choice modeling
NOTE: General Posting for Post Doc, Associate Research Scientist, Research Scientist, Sr. Research Scientist

Responsibilities:


As a researcher at Disney Research Imagineering, you will
  • Conduct advanced research projects in areas of interest to Disney Research and our partnering Business Units
  • Closely align and integrate with the Disney business to create value for the company by developing cutting edge technology and impactful demonstrators in the form of hardware and software prototypes and demo systems
  • Contribute and deliver to major research projects and platforms of Disney Research
  • Keep Disney Research at the forefront of technology research by surveying relevant technologies, attending conferences, reading papers, meeting with technology companies and research labs, and sharing new findings with team members.
  • Assist in the hiring and mentoring of Researchers, Lab Associates and Interns
  • Draft and submit strategic papers and patents based on research
  • Establish and maintain effective working relations with collaborators within and external to the company.

Basic Qualifications:

  • You are passionate about your area of expertise, deeply inquisitive and open minded, informed, but not limited, by your domain of expertise.
  • You enjoy intellectual debate.
  • You are comfortable guiding other team members but willing to get your hands dirty and help build research systems when needed
  • You are driven to perform research that is not simply novel, but deeply impactful to the company and society have a deep desire to reduce the research to practice in the form of prototypes and technology demonstrators.
  • You are excited by the platform provided by Disney to connect with children and guests of all ages to have a positive impact on the world.
  • You have a deep sensitivity for ethical use of technology and data.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced collaborative environment.
  • You are self-directed and independent, but open to constructive feedback.
  • You are a team player, able to work in collaborative interdisciplinary groups
  • You are willing to take the time necessary to understand the business and adapt your knowledge to maximize the value of your contributions.
  • You understand that communicating the value of your research to non-technical stakeholders is critical to continued investment.
  • You understand that there are times when deep scientific rigor is necessary to validate a concept, and times when this is counterproductive, and are eager to discern the difference.
  • You value sharing knowledge with the world but understand the need to drive and retain value in a private company.

Required Education

  • PhD in relevant research area

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering makes the impossible possible, by combining innovation and storytelling to bring Disney stories, characters and worlds to life. Imagineering is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of The Walt Disney Company. Its talented corps of Imagineers is responsible for the creation - from concept initiation through installation - of all Disney Resorts, theme parks and attractions, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, and new media projects. Disney Imagineers are uniquely talented individuals that bring together the best aspects of creativity, innovation, and passion.

At Imagineering Research and Development, our mission is to use technology to build new experiences for our Guests and new tools for Imagineers and the Cast Members who power our parks. R&D is a team of engineers, designers, artists and scientists who share a passion for solving hard problems and building ground-breaking experiences. As a creative technologist, you use your unique combination of creative and technical expertise to design, visualize and prototype new experiences. You’ll work with cross-disciplinary teams to translate ideas into something tangible. Using a variety of medium, from drawings, diagrams or visualization to hardware and software prototype, what you build will inform and inspire.

Responsibilities:

  • Translate new, innovative experience and technology concepts into visuals for discussion and iteration (e.g. concept sketches, 3D modeling, graphic design, technical drawings, animation, infographics)

  • Help build and support small and large-scale interactive prototypes, mock-ups, and play-tests using a variety of industry-standard and Disney-proprietary software and hardware tools

  • Persuasively pitch compelling new experience concepts to project team and R&D leadership

  • Provide necessary inputs to Project Leads and Technical Program Managers to assist in the definition of project scope, schedule, and budget for new development concepts

  • Collaborate across diverse cross-functional teams, communicating clearly and with a positive and inclusive attitude

  • Assist in or be solely responsible for the development and delivery of presentations and demos that clearly and persuasively communicate projects to a variety of stakeholders, including high-level executives

  • Keep up-to-date on the evolving social, cultural, technology, and design landscape and apply knowledge of new trends and innovation in the marketplace

  • Contribute to the culture and community of the department, adding value to the organization outside of direct assignments

Basic Qualifications:

  • Portfolio that demonstrates strong design skills and sensibilities, with a well-developed sense of aesthetics (e.g. illustrations, presentations, graphic designs, 3D models, UI/UX mock-ups, production drawings)

  • Proven ability to efficiently prototype new experiences, turning concepts into tangible artifacts that can be experienced and tested

  • Driven by the idea of creating new experiences for people, that our technological development is always in service of delivering magic to our guests

  • A broad understanding, comfort, and enthusiasm for technology and the ability to quickly and proactively learn new technologies, techniques, and tools

  • Mastery of design and productivity applications (e.g. Apple Keynote, Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office, Google Apps)

  • Experience writing code and/or scripting

  • Strong presentation skills and professional writing skills

  • Responsibility and flexibility. Excellent time management skills combined with the adaptability required in a dynamic and constantly changing innovation environment

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Proficiency with software prototyping tools and game engines (e.g. Unreal, Unity, Touch Designer, etc.)

  • Experience with hardware prototyping tools (e.g. Arduino, Raspberry Pi, microcontrollers, sensors, etc.)

  • Experience in 3D solid and/or surface modeling, rigging, or animation (e.g. Maya, SolidWorks, SketchUp)

  • Experience in the design and fabrication of physical objects, props, signage, or setwork (e.g. carpentry, 3D printing, solid/surface modeling, laser cutting, etc.)

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s or Master's degree or comparable industry experience in a field related to creative technology applications (e.g. Industrial Design, Product Design, Media Arts, Animation, Experience Design, Entertainment Technology, etc.)

  • Additional engineering degree, minor, or coursework preferred (e.g. Computer Science Engineering, Human- Computer Interaction, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering)

description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering makes the impossible possible, by combining innovation and storytelling to bring Disney stories, characters and worlds to life. Imagineering is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of The Walt Disney Company. Its talented corps of Imagineers is responsible for the creation - from concept initiation through installation - of all Disney Resorts, theme parks and attractions, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, and new media projects. Disney Imagineers are uniquely talented individuals that bring together the best aspects of creativity, innovation, and passion.

At Imagineering Research and Development, our mission is to use technology to build new experiences for our Guests and new tools for Imagineers and the Cast Members who power our parks. As R&D’s Business Manager, you will join a team of engineers, designers, artists and scientists who share a passion for solving hard problems. Your primary function is managing R&D department finances. You will be a trusted partner with R&D leadership, project teams, and WDI finance, working to deliver cutting edge technology planforms. You will also own key operations functions, using your analytical skills and creativity to enable innovation across the department.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage department finances, including budget tracking across all projects and operational costs

  • Provide strategic analysis of department spending, analyzing trends and providing insight into risks and opportunities

  • Develop qualitative and quantitative financial justifications for the development of new technology platforms

  • Attend project updates, becoming a trusted partner to R&D projects teams

  • Manage monthly reconciliation of forecasted project spending and reported actuals as well as fiscal year-end close out

  • Produce spreadsheets and documents to support yearly financial planning for both capital and P&L budgets

  • Manage all capital equipment requests and depreciation of assets

  • Assist project teams with make/buy analysis, partnering with team leads to strategize how to most effectively use available resources

  • Partner with the R&D productization program lead to build capital funding requests

  • Build strong relationships with WDI and DPEP finance and controllership

  • Own department resource planning

  • Manage the project pitch process and project close-out process, working with new project teams to articulate project work plans and ensuring that project complete final deliverables at completion

  • Manage space planning for the department, ensuring that all projects have the space they need to be successful

  • Functionally manage R&D support roles

Basic Qualifications:

  • 7+ year experience in a financial analysis or business management role

  • Strong excel skills and financial modeling experience

  • Thinks strategically, with demonstrated analytical decision-making skills

  • Proven ability to creatively solve challenges

  • Strong communication skills with a demonstrated ability to craft compelling and influential business justifications

  • Proactive, able to work in a flexible, fast-paced environment

  • Works collaboratively on diverse teams

  • Manages & prioritizes multiple assignments in a highly dynamic R&D environment

  • Has a passion for technology and delivering new tools, platforms and experiences

Required Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Economics, Finance, or related field

Preferred Education

MBA preferred

About Walt Disney Imagineering:

Founded in 1952 as WED Enterprises to design and build the world’s first theme park — Disneyland — Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is where imagination and creativity combine with cutting-edge technology to create unforgettable experiences. WDI is the creative force that imagines, designs and builds all Disney theme parks, resorts, attractions and cruise ships worldwide. Imagineering’s unique strength comes from its diverse global team of creative and technical professionals, who build on Disney’s legacy of storytelling to pioneer new forms of entertainment. The Imagineers who practice this unique blend of art and science work in more than 100 disciplines to shepherd an idea all the way from “blue sky” concept phase to opening day.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Walt Disney Imagineering Research & Development, Inc., which is part of a business we call Walt Disney Imagineering.

Walt Disney Imagineering Research & Development, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

R&D is a team of engineers, designers, artists and scientists who share a passion for solving hard problems and building ground-breaking experiences. As a mechanical design engineer, you will create new ways to design, build and animate dynamic physical characters, immersive environments and interactive experiences.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop mechanical designs that meet functional requirements.
  • Own all phases of the design and fabrication process – early concept design, prototyping, 3D modeling, detailed design, production drawings for manufacturing, assembly and testing
  • Lead internal design reviews and reviews with external vendors and fabricators
  • Interface with Disney fabricators or external machine shops to ensure that designs can be successfully produced
  • Test and iterate on proof-of-concept designs, evolving requirements and designs as the team learns
  • Contribute to the culture and community of the WDI R&D Studio

Basic Qualifications:

  • 6+ years' experience as a mechanical design engineer
  • Strong mechanical design experience, ideally in robotics or mechatronics industry
  • Experience designing and building complex, electro-mechanical systems
  • CAD experience (preferably SolidWorks) mastery of parts/assemblies/drawings
  • Rapid prototyping experience, ability to fabricate your designs at a prototype level
  • Knowledge of manufacturing processes (plating, milling, turning, EDM, grinding)
  • Embraces flexibility and adaptability as the team learns through prototyping and playtesting, adjusting strategy as needed
  • Experience managing fabrication vendors
  • Ability to work collaboratively with other technical and creative disciplines
  • Ability to provide clear direction and feedback to other team members
  • Thinks strategically and creatively to solve challenges
  • Manages & prioritizes multiple assignments in a highly dynamic R&D environment
  • Demonstrates a desire to constantly improve and adapt to new technologies

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with actuator design, motor selection and sizing
  • Materials science and metallurgy experience
  • Experience designing and fabricating with flexible materials
  • Complex surface modeling capabilities
  • Experience with kinematic motion analysis
  • Structural FEA experience
  • Experience with tolerance stack-up analysis
  • Sheet metal and weldment design
  • CAD administration, configuration, standards and roll-out experience
  • Matlab, Simulink or Python experience
  • Industrial design experience, ability to pair aesthetic form with function

Required Education

  • BS (MS preferred) or equivalent in mechanical engineering

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering makes the impossible possible, by combining innovation and storytelling to bring Disney stories, characters and worlds to life. Imagineering is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of The Walt Disney Company. Its talented corps of Imagineers is responsible for the creation - from concept initiation through installation - of all Disney Resorts, theme parks and attractions, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, and new media projects. Disney Imagineers are uniquely talented individuals that bring together the best aspects of creativity, innovation, and passion.

Walt Disney Imagineering’s Research & Development organization is building a new Intelligent Interactive Character Studio to take the most well-known characters in the world and turn them into interactive experiences for a new generation of fans and guests. The team is comprised of a cross disciplinary group of designers, writers, artists, and software engineers. Its charter includes developing a robust and scalable entertainment platform supporting interactive character experiences with up to millions of concurrent users. The studio develops mobile, VR, AR, Mixed Reality, and custom physically situated applications built on a core platform, independently and in partnership with 3rd party developers.

This role combines a strong engineering and technology background with proven project management abilities to cultivate innovation and drive project execution. As a Technical Program Manager, you are a critical part of turning ideas and prototypes into reality, collaborating with engineers and designers to define, scope, budget and execute project work. In the Intelligent Interactive Character Studio, you will drive the planning and execution of high-complexity software initiatives to deliver new character experiences for the Walt Disney Company.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with Intelligent Interactive Characters Team to define the programmatic strategy to accomplish the technical and creative vision for the product and respective projects
  • Create and maintain requirements, project scope, schedule, budget, staffing plans and product/project roadmaps
  • Build, lead and motivate diverse teams that include creatives, various types of engineers, manufacturing, vendors, operations, logistics, and shared services
  • Source, identify, and qualify external vendors through the generation of requests for proposals, conducting make/buy analyses, vendor down-selection matrices and working with legal to negotiate contracts for vendor selection
  • Drive communication across team members, project leads, executives, and project stake holders, creating and delivering information in different methods including verbal, written and visual
  • Plan and execute internal and external play tests
  • Risk analysis and development of mitigation strategies for technical, creative, business, regulatory and competitive risks
  • Define post-delivery sustainment requirements and level of effort estimates
  • Identify and deliver on technology transfer opportunities
  • Identify and recommend internal process improvements
  • Engender internal and external relationships

In collaboration with conversational designers at the Intelligent Interactive Character Studio, the tools group will define and create the software that enables our world class artists and designers to bring our characters to life and connect with our guests in new ways. You are willing to take the time necessary to understand creative goals and propose and effectively communicate solutions. Members of the new studio are expected to thrive in a fast-paced, startup-style environment where ambiguity and building things from zero to one are the norm.

Responsibilities:

  • Support development of a production pipeline and related tooling to deliver robust, scalable interactive character experiences integrating internal and externally developed AI/ML tools for speech, language, and other domains.
  • Compile and understand system requirements and assess their feasibility to enhance the character experience production pipeline
  • Analyze existing features in the engine and available tools and suggest improvements by designing and implementing new systems whenever necessary
  • Support the features and systems designed for production: production workflows in the engine, plugins for third-party applications and productivity tools (compilation, build process, etc.)
  • Produce tool documentation to educate production talent on tool features and usage
  • Work with a production-oriented mindset, delivering efficient, scalable, and maintainable code.
  • Communicate complex technical, architectural, and/or organizational problems and propose thorough iterative solutions.
  • Deliver maintainable code in a dynamic development environment with rapidly changing requirements.
  • Conduct code reviews of peers and contribute feedback to improve overall system quality.
  • Write unit tests
  • Specification, design and development of tools for creating, modifying, testing and deploying interactive AI systems.
  • Work with content creators and designers to identify and develop features that speed up their character creation process.
  • Designing, prototyping, and deploying tools which leverage machine learning to provide non-technical users an intuitive interface for building autonomous characters.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Expertise with multiple modern programming languages including Python, C++ or Javascript.
  • Experience with container orchestration tooling (Docker, Marathon)
  • Knowledge of common developer tools such as git, CMake, package management systems.
  • Familiarity with Unix based operating systems.
  • Experience working in a collaborative development environment and a shared codebase.
  • Expertise with game engines such as Unreal Engine or Unity.
  • Familiarity with game engine tooling and workflows.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Understanding of game design or interactive experience design.
  • Familiarity with NLP tools and/or other ML based conversational AI design technologies and their inherent limitations
  • Experience with key machine learning libraries such as PyTorch or Tensorflow.
  • Experience integrating and deploying machine learning in a relevant domain – computer vision, natural language, speech processing.
  • Familiarity with 3D content creation tools such as Maya or 3DSMax

Required Education

  • MS in Computer Science or equivalent or BS in Computer Science or equivalent with 2+ years industry experience.

Additional Information:

description:
Job Summary:


“Any sufficiently complex technology is indistinguishable from magic.” - Arthur C Clarke

The Team

In a time where children carry devices with AI in their pockets, robots deliver fast food meals, and other science fictions have become mundane reality, we need new magic: New ways to connect with our guests, to surprise them, make them smile, and open their minds to magic - not just in our parks and resorts, but everywhere in the world.

At Disney Research Imagineering this emerges from the application of bleeding edge science to everything from enabling new guest-facing experiences in the parks to assisting cast members and transforming critical business processes.

At Disney Research, we focus on new ideas and ways of thinking, working to solve the biggest challenges that are otherwise unsolvable without deep understanding of both the complexities of the Disney business, and the opportunities afforded by bleeding edge scientific exploration and application.

Our work is centered on 4 key areas
  • Character Intelligence
  • Artificial intelligence/Machine Learning/Data Analytics
  • Computational Robotics
  • Interactive Immersion
And is organized around core platforms that enable rapid integration, evaluation, communication and transfer of research concepts, and results to the business.

The Role

We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Research Scientist who is passionate about their field of expertise and wants to use their domain knowledge to create magic for our guests and fellow cast members.

As a member of Disney Research Imagineering you will build and lead project teams consisting of scientists, engineers, software developers, mechanical engineers, artists, and designers to envision and deliver new transformative applications of AI/ML technology to the Disney business.You will define and maintain a vision of the future enabled by Machine Learning within a company that provides an unparalleled platform to share this vision with the world. You will work with partners across the company, academic/industry research teams and vendors across the globe to realize this vision: working with talent and leveraging unique data sets and content from the entire spectrum of Disney properties including Parks, Resorts, Cruise Lines, Marvel, Pixar, Lucasfilm, and Disney Animation Studios.

Responsibilities:


As a researcher and project lead at Disney Research Imagineering, you will:
  • Conduct advanced AI research projects across Walt Disney Imagineering R&D and our partnering Business Units.
  • Closely align and integrate with the Disney business to create value for the company by developing cutting edge technology and impactful demonstrators in the form of software prototypes and demo systems.
  • Lead, contribute and deliver to major research projects and AI platforms of Disney Research
  • Keep Disney Research at the forefront of AI research by surveying relevant technologies, attending conferences, reading papers, meeting with technology companies and research labs, and sharing new findings with team members.
  • Assist in the hiring and mentoring of Researchers, Lab Associates and Interns, and other Machine Learning talent.
  • Draft and submit strategic papers and patents based on research.
  • Establish and maintain effective working relations with collaborators within and external to the company.

Basic Qualifications:

  • PhD in AI/Machine Learning/Computer Vision or related field.
  • Demonstrated experience independently designing, specifying, integrating, and testing real-time machine learning systems in challenging real-world environments.
  • Familiarity with key machine learning libraries such as PyTorch, Tensorflow and Caffe.
  • Ability to write, debug and review C, C++, and Python software.
  • Experience applying different machine learning architectures (DNN, GAN, RNN, CNN, LSTM) to a wide variety of problems and data types.
  • Experience taking applications from concept to solution: including data collection, annotation, model specification, training, and deployment.
  • A positive, energetic, and collaborative attitude necessary to provide support and guidance to peers.
  • Proven track record of adaptability and creativity in a dynamic work environment.
  • Proven ability to communicate ideas clearly and effectively.
  • Proven ability to build and lead diverse project teams.
  • Strong desire to build practical machine learning solutions informed by (but not limited by) theoretical underpinnings.
  • You are driven to perform research that is not simply novel, but deeply impactful to the company, and society have a deep desire to reduce the research to practice in the form of prototypes and technology demonstrators.
  • You are excited by the platform provided by Disney to connect with children and guests of all ages to have a positive impact on the world.
  • You have a deep sensitivity for ethical use of technology and data.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced collaborative environment.
  • You are self-directed and independent but open to constructive feedback.
  • You are a team player, able to work in collaborative interdisciplinary groups.
  • You are willing to take the time necessary to understand the business and adapt your knowledge to maximize the value of your contributions.
  • You understand that communicating the value of your research to non-technical stakeholders is critical to continued investment.
  • You understand that there are times when deep scientific rigor is necessary to validate a concept, and times when this is counterproductive and are eager to discern the difference.
  • You value sharing knowledge with the world but understand the need to drive and retain value in a private company.

Required Education

  • PhD in AI/Machine Learning/Computer Vision or related field.

Additional Information:


Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering is the creative force that imagines, designs and brings to life all Disney theme parks, resorts, attractions and cruise ships worldwide. Working across a spectrum of disciplines that range from creative and conceptual to scientific and technical, Imagineers blend an innovative mixture of storytelling, art, science and technology to create immersive experiences, memorable destinations, and innovative entertainment for families around the globe.
We’re looking for professionals who are thirsty for diverse experiences, who are eager to learn and who are confident they can maintain the exacting standards for which The Walt Disney Company is known. If this sounds like you, we look forward to discussing the possibilities!
You already know what it means to be a Mechanical Engineer, but can you imagine using your skills at a place like Disney? You’d work to support all the theme parks, waterparks, golf courses, destination shopping districts, and resorts that are spread out across over 29,000 acres. This Imagineer is responsible for mechanical engineering including design, analysis, calculations, modeling and specifications for HVAC and plumbing systems; compressible fluid and cryogenic systems and central energy plants installations for the theme parks and resorts portfolio.

Responsibilities:

Every day as a Mechanical Engineer is different! On any given day, you might:
  • Provide Mechanical Engineering support to multiple stakeholders and partners across property as part of a larger team.
  • Under senior staff supervision, design, analyze, and provide mechanical engineering calculations for a single attraction of limited complexity
  • Provide construction administration support though site visits, shop drawing review, and sketch documentation under the direction senior staff supervision
  • Prepare designs and analyses in support of construction contract documentation
  • Ensure technical quality and conformance to department standards and procedures
  • Provide technical guidance to one or more mechanical designers in the production of construction contract documents
  • Provide root cause analysis with solution options, risks and recommendations to senior leadership
  • Function comfortably in a matrix organization, interfacing with outside vendors, local regulatory agencies, Disney leaders, and fellow cast members
  • Research and select systems/equipment that satisfies design parameters, all applicable codes and Disney standards

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Proficiency with Trace 700, eQUEST, IES-VE, or other energy modeling software
  • Understanding of fundamental plumbing systems (storm, sanitary, vent, water, and gas) is desired, along with proficiency in designing and sizing the plumbing systems
  • Advanced knowledge of the mechanical engineering discipline as it relates to facility design and construction, including campus piping network design, HVAC design and engineering, plumbing system sizing and design, construction methods and materials, and regulatory codes and standards.
  • Proficiency in current technology (Revit, Dynamo, Navisworks, AutoCAD) for the preparation and use of contract documents in all phases of design and construction administration
  • Familiarity with industrial design, including water treatment and process piping
  • Familiarity with industry HVAC and plumbing sustainability practices to reduce carbon footprint and improve facility efficiency
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Experience with developing BMS (Building Management System) control diagrams and sequence of operations is preferred
  • Experience performing life cycle analysis of various HVAC systems on the basis of energy use, first cost and life expectancy
  • Active membership in ASHRAE

Required Education

  • Graduate of an accredited engineering school with a Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering
  • Engineer-In-Training certification, if not already licensed as a professional engineer

sections.text:
Walt Disney Imagineering is the creative force that imagines, designs and brings to life all Disney theme parks, resorts, attractions and cruise ships worldwide. Working across a spectrum of disciplines that range from creative and conceptual to scientific and technical, Imagineers blend an innovative mixture of storytelling, art, science and technology to create immersive experiences, memorable destinations, and innovative entertainment for families around the globe.
We’re looking for professionals who are thirsty for diverse experiences, who are eager to learn and who are confident they can maintain the exacting standards for which The Walt Disney Company is known. If this sounds like you, we look forward to discussing the possibilities!
You already know what it means to be a Mechanical Engineer, but can you imagine using your skills at a place like Disney? You’d work to support all the theme parks, waterparks, golf courses, destination shopping districts, and resorts that are spread out across over 29,000 acres. This Imagineer is responsible for mechanical engineering including design, analysis, calculations, modeling and specifications for HVAC and plumbing systems; compressible fluid and cryogenic systems and central energy plants installations for the theme parks and resorts portfolio.

Every day as a Mechanical Engineer is different! On any given day, you might:

* Provide Mechanical Engineering support to multiple stakeholders and partners across property as part of a larger team.
* Under senior staff supervision, design, analyze, and provide mechanical engineering calculations for a single attraction of limited complexity
* Provide construction administration support though site visits, shop drawing review, and sketch documentation under the direction senior staff supervision
* Prepare designs and analyses in support of construction contract documentation
* Ensure technical quality and conformance to department standards and procedures

* Provide technical guidance to one or more mechanical designers in the production of construction contract documents
* Provide root cause analysis with solution options, risks and recommendations to senior leadership
* Function comfortably in a matrix organization, interfacing with outside vendors, local regulatory agencies, Disney leaders, and fellow cast members
* Research and select systems/equipment that satisfies design parameters, all applicable codes and Disney standards

* Proficiency with Trace 700, eQUEST, IES-VE, or other energy modeling software
* Understanding of fundamental plumbing systems (storm, sanitary, vent, water, and gas) is desired, along with proficiency in designing and sizing the plumbing systems
* Advanced knowledge of the mechanical engineering discipline as it relates to facility design and construction, including campus piping network design, HVAC design and engineering, plumbing system sizing and design, construction methods and materials, and regulatory codes and standards.
* Proficiency in current technology (Revit, Dynamo, Navisworks, AutoCAD) for the preparation and use of contract documents in all phases of design and construction administration
* Familiarity with industrial design, including water treatment and process piping
* Familiarity with industry HVAC and plumbing sustainability practices to reduce carbon footprint and improve facility efficiency
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Experience with developing BMS (Building Management System) control diagrams and sequence of operations is preferred
* Experience performing life cycle analysis of various HVAC systems on the basis of energy use, first cost and life expectancy
* Active membership in ASHRAE

* Graduate of an accredited engineering school with a Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering
* Engineer-In-Training certification, if not already licensed as a professional engineer

* An advanced degree in the Mechanical Engineering field is desirable
* We greatly value service in any of the US Armed Forces.

Representing more than 150 disciplines, the talented corps of Imagineers are responsible for the creation of Disney resorts, theme parks and attractions, hotels, water parks, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, cruise ships and new media technology projects.
The WDI Technology Studio is an embedded product and technology team, looking for a Sr. Product Manager to drive enterprise products within our business management product portfolio. This individual will be responsible for build & buy & integrate product development efforts across the business management which includes products focused on resource planning, project planning and scheduling, cost estimating, financial reporting and data analytics.

Responsibilities:

  • Own a set of products within the Business Management product domain as the responsible individual driving vision, prioritization, delivery, and sustainment decisions.
  • Create and iterate; author a clear vision for how business workflows and practices are performed today and can be improved/innovated on in future with WDI leadership.
  • Guide and mentor junior product managers.
  • Establish, evolve, and champion product management practices within Walt Disney Imagineering, including quarterly OKRs and key metrics.
  • Collaborate with peer leaders across software engineering, product design, project management, project technology integration, finance and legal.
  • Drive annual investment and funding strategy.
  • Prepare go-to-market materials in partnership with field teams.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Strong software product management acumen and leadership experience.
  • Expertise in a broad variety of enterprise or B2B products and best practices.
  • Excellent communication skills: written, verbal, and presentational.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity and/or experience with the low-code SaaS market.
  • Entertainment experience; content, interactives, or otherwise.

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, media management or equivalent experience. Advanced degrees preferred.

About Parks, Experiences and Products:

The Parks, Experiences and Products segment includes Disney’s iconic travel and leisure businesses, which include six resort destinations in the United States, Europe and Asia, a top-rated cruise line, a popular vacation ownership program, and an award-winning guided family adventure business. Disney’s global consumer products operations include the world’s leading licensing business across toys, apparel, home goods, digital games and apps; the world’s largest children’s publisher; Disney store locations around the world; and the shopDisney e-commerce platform.

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc., which is part of a business we call Parks, Experiences and Products.

Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

description:
Job Summary:

Construction Management manages all on-site construction activities through installation on a project or multiple projects. Monitor safety, quality, and schedule in the field, while providing technical expertise and ensuring work in place meets quality requirements of contract documents, applicable codes, and Disney standards. Coordinate and interfaces with all Walt Disney Imagineering Studios, Walt Disney World Operations and Security, contractors, vendors, and governmental agencies. Construction Management is the primary responsible Studio for everything that happens on Walt Disney Imagineering construction projects, including all impact to Operations.

Responsibilities:

  • Authorship of construction strategies, managing multiple bid packages and on-site construction documents
  • Update natural disaster preparedness annual protocols and manage and secure all construction sites during emergency preparedness
  • Monitor and approve schedule, quality control, and reports status
  • Work with DPEP and WDP&R Senior Executives and manage relationships with all partners
  • Ensure directives, change orders and pay applications are completed to avoid contractor payment delays
  • Arbitrates directive negotiation conflicts between contractor and estimating
  • Manage construction efforts on complex projects
  • Perform constructability analysis and value engineering recommendations
  • Manage pre-construction services scope and provide pre-construction input
  • Facilitate production of mock-ups for approval (ED&E, Creative & Operator)
  • Manage insurance program together with Loss Prevention
  • Participate in the hiring process
  • Manage performance management/reviews, performance counseling, and talent development of direct reports
  • Lead/manage the project delivery system
  • Manage a more complex and larger team of personnel providing mentoring and direction for junior level field managers and interns
  • Direct priorities for assigned project/s
  • Daily decision-making for construction activities within scope
  • Know when to elevate issues requiring executive leadership direction
  • Point of contact for all construction vendors and contractors on a daily basis
  • Work with governmental and utility agencies through the life cycle of a project
  • Communicate and coordinate with other WDI and WDP&R departments on a daily basis

Basic Qualifications:

  • 10+ years of outside job related experience or 7+ years WDI Construction Management / coordination experience
  • Lead a project team, managing through conflict and complexity
  • Present to all levels throughout the Company
  • Direct, establish relationships, collaborate, and anticipate roadblocks
  • Project environment is extremely diverse and requires a depth of character and social excellence. Projects are dynamic and require daily partnership with WDW Operations, WDW Engineering Services, & Regulatory Agencies, etc.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experienced in Theme Park and Attraction Construction.
  • OSHA 30
  • AED/CPR
  • Stop the Bleed
  • H4/H5 Risks
  • General Contractor License
  • Experience with scheduling, estimating, budgeting, and quality control
  • Experience preparing professional bid packages
  • Experience hiring outside vendors
  • Understanding of the Project Development process
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office
  • Read and interpret construction drawings and specifications
  • Bluebeam (Drawing Reviews)
  • BIM 360 Field, BIM 360 Glue, BIM 360 Docs (desktop and mobile/iPad)
  • General Construction Project Management Platforms
  • Reservoir (WDW Only)
  • Per Division 1, GC may recommend a project management software (WDW Only)

Required Education

  • College degree in a Walt Disney Imagineering core discipline such as Construction Management, Engineering, Architecture, Landscape Architecture or related profession (or equivalent relevant experience).

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

description:
Job Summary:

"We Change Lives.” Walt Disney Imagineering is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of The Walt Disney Company. Its talented corps of Imagineers is responsible for the creation - from concept initiation through installation - of all Disney Resorts, theme parks and attractions, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, and new media projects.

What we’re looking for…

An Illusion Development intern will be a part of the very early stages of ideation in the Imagineering process. The intern will take part in creative and technical brainstorms which will lead to creating quick proof of concept mockups. These mockups will be for new special effects and illusions used in our theme parks. This is a very iterative process which will require all of the skill sets listed at any given time. The intern will be paired with the Illusion Development lead and take their direction. Must be a self-starter and motivated to innovate and invent!

Responsibilities:

You will…
  • Research materials and processes
  • Refine designs
  • Produce quick mockups and iteration
  • Provide hand sketching
  • Be involved in installation and integration
  • Participate in brainstorming sessions

Basic Qualifications:

What you bring to the role…
  • Ability to manage time while working on multiple projects
  • Proficiency in foam core assembly, soldering, and woodshop skills
  • Basic electronics knowledge
  • 3D printing and laser cutting experience
  • Eagerness to learn new technical skillsets
  • Experience with the following software:
  • SolidWorks
  • AutoCAD
  • Maya
  • Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects)
  • Microsoft Suite

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Minimum 1 year related experience

Required Education

  • Currently enrolled as a Junior or higher, or graduated within the past 6 months, from an accredited college/university, earning a degree majoring in Mechatronics, Electrical/Mechanical Engineering, Industri8al Design, Product Design, Interactive Media, Theater Design, or Exhibit Design

Additional Information:

Internship Eligibility:
  • Must be enrolled in an accredited college/university taking at least one class in the semester/quarter (spring/fall) prior to participation in the internship program OR must have graduated from a college/university within the past 6 months OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Professional internship at the time of application
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must not have completed one year of continual employment on a Disney internship or program
  • Must possess unrestricted work authorization
  • Must provide full work availability
  • Must provide own transportation to/from work location
  • Must be able to provide own housing for the duration of the internship
  • Current Active Disney cast members must meet Professional Internship transfer guidelines (for Walt Disney World cast members this is no more than four points and one reprimand in the last six months; for Disneyland cast members this is six months of consecutive service and a performance record clear of any disciplinary issues (warnings, suspensions, etc.) for at least six months)

Program Length:

The approximate dates of this internship are June/July 2022 through early January 2023. Interns must be fully available for the duration of the internship.

These mockups will be for new special effects and illusions used in our theme parks. This is a very iterative process which will require all of the skill sets listed at any given time. The intern will be paired with the Illusion Development lead and take their direction. Must be a self-starter and motivated to innovate and invent!

You will…
* Research materials and processes
* Refine designs
* Produce quick mockups and iteration
* Provide hand sketching
* Be involved in installation and integration
* Participate in brainstorming sessions

What you bring to the role…* Ability to manage time while working on multiple projects
* Proficiency in foam core assembly, soldering, and woodshop skills
* Basic electronics knowledge
* 3D printing and laser cutting experience
* Eagerness to learn new technical skillsets
* Experience with the following software:
* SolidWorks
* AutoCAD
* Maya
* Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects)
* Microsoft Suite
* Minimum 1 year related experience

* Currently enrolled as a Junior or higher, or graduated within the past 6 months, from an accredited college/university, earning a degree majoring in Mechatronics, Electrical/Mechanical Engineering, Industri8al Design, Product Design, Interactive Media, Theater Design, or Exhibit Design

description:
Job Summary:

Créer la magie et rendre l’impossible possible… Voilà ce que nous faisons chez Euro Disneyland Imagineering !

Depuis 1988, la grande famille des Imagineers (composée d’équipes Etudes, Travaux, Show, Ride et Support), réalise l’ensemble des Land et attractions de Disneyland Paris.

Aujourd’hui nos équipes sont engagées sur un vaste programme dédié à l’extension du parc Walt Disney Studios, et notre pôle Estimation a besoin de vous !

Nous recherchons un Ingénieur Etude de Prix - Quantity Surveyor H/F.

Sur votre périmètre donné, vous reportez au Responsable du département Estimations, et vous aurez la responsabilité et la gestion de:
  • La production des estimations budgétaires TCE (restaurants, magasins, attractions, voiries…) toutes phases (Esquisse, Concept, APS, APD, DCE) à partir des documentations, créatives, architecturales…
  • Les analyses des évolutions estimatives de différents projets y compris propositions économies / optimisations budgétaires.
  • La mise en place d’un suivi financier des projets en collaboration avec le département finance.
  • La participation active au processus d’appel d’offre, y compris l’assistance à l’élaboration de la stratégie d’achats, la constitution des cadres de décomposition de prix et bordereaux de prix unitaires par lots, A l’analyse des offres, des négociations et des recommandations d’attributions des marchés de travaux.
  • Les suivis en phase exécution des contrats (Revue des instructions, chiffrages, analyses et négociations financières) et ce Jusqu’à la clôture des contrats)
  • La production de rapports mensuels d’états et d’évolutions financières des contrats et des projets en collaboration avec le département finance.
  • La production de rapports de fin de projet comprenant, Rapport financier, Leçons apprises, Ratios, et toutes extractions nécessaires et utiles pour intégration dans une base donnée budgétaire.
  • L’analyse des risques budgétaires, y compris propositions de solutions pour la réduction des risques
  • La supervision et gestion d’un ou plusieurs économistes et ou consultants intervenants en support de l’effort du département estimation.
  • L’interaction continue avec les différents départements constituants EDLI (Finance, Contrat, Construction, Arch et Ingénieries, créatif, Show, Manège…).

Ce qu’il faut pour nous rejoindre ?
  • Bonne connaissances de la construction et de ces techniques
  • Curiosité, ouverture d’esprit, ouverture aux autres et adaptabilité, sont des atouts vous permettant de ssir et de vous épanouir chez nous.

Votre profil :

Vous avez une formation d’économiste de la construction (Bac+2 minimum).
Vous avez une expérience de 8 ans minimum acquise en entreprise et/ou en maîtrise d’œuvre.
Vous avez pu travailler sur des projets de construction de bâtiments complexes (hôtels, hôpitaux, salles de spectacle, parc d’attraction…).
Vous savez travailler en environnement projet, avec des équipes multidisciplinaires et des contacts avec différents intervenants.
Vous avez un bon sens du relationnel, du travail d’équipe et de la communication.
Vous êtes curieux(se), ouvert(e) aux spécificités des parc d’attraction.
Volontaire et autonome, vous avez de réelles capacités d’apprentissage et d’adaptation.

Vous avez un anglais courant vous permettant d’interagir dans un environnement anglophones (écrit, oral, animation de réunion…)

Poste à pourvoir dès que possible.
Contrat CDIC (durée de fin estimée : mars 2025).
Basé à Marne-la-Vallée (77)

Venez agrandir la famille des Imagineers !

description:
Job Summary:

"We create happiness.” That’s our motto at Walt Disney Parks and Resorts. And it permeates everything we do. At Disney, you’ll help inspire that magic by enabling our teams to push the limits of entertainment and create the never-before-seen!

Walt Disney Imagineering is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of The Walt Disney Company. Its talented corps of Imagineers is responsible for the creation - from concept initiation through installation - of all Disney Resorts, theme parks and attractions, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, and new media projects.

The sound editor/mixer position at Walt Disney Imagineering is a diverse and unique opportunity in the professional sound field. You will work with project teams and an Audio Media Designer (Sound Supervisor/Producer) to record, edit, mix and install the sound track for Disney attractions. You will need a strong post production sound background and experience with network audio as time will be split between studios in FL and on location mixing at Disney parks around the world.

Responsibilities:

Work with Audio Media Designer, Music Department and project team to support animatic stage production efforts.
  • Scratch track recording and editorial
  • Temp sound design and efficient picture conforms/changes.
  • Temp music editorial
  • Temp mixes for reviews and playbacks
Work with Audio Media Designer to support production and post production efforts on small and large-scale attractions.
  • Voiceover recording and editorial
  • ADR prep, recording and editorial
  • Sound design, effects editorial and sound effects recording
  • Attend live action shoots as Imagineering sound representative.
  • Production dialog editorial and cleanup
  • Manage large FX sessions from exterior sound design vendors
  • Manage large stem sessions from composer/music production team.
  • Assembly of scene mixes and track layouts per the Audio Media Designers track lists
  • Management of large track count conforms to picture updates
  • Custom I/O set up for non-standard output formats and field mix prep
Support Audio Media Designer and project team in performing final field mix
  • Work with A/V engineering to set up site-specific venue mix system. Have experience with network audio protocols, configurations, and troubleshooting (Dante, AES 67, etc.)
  • Perform field mix of music stems, sound FX units/pre dubs and dialog on attraction specific audio systems with custom routing and I/O. Work with Audio Media Designer, music department and project team to mix, address notes and install changes.
  • File installation, management, and revision control per sound department SOP
  • Burn final media and QC complete show.
  • Archive projects according to sound department SOP
Addition responsibilities include:
  • Master of background music
  • Transfer of historical archive to current technology
  • Studio trouble shooting/maintenance
  • Recording vocals, overdubs or other small-scale music session for the music depart.
  • Travel to domestic and foreign venues for extended periods of time

Basic Qualifications:

  • 5 or more years of experience in post-production audio
  • Proficiency in sound production and post-production equipment including: Protools, digital consoles and controllers.
  • Understanding of network audio.
  • Ability to learn proprietary digital formats (Mac and PC based) with minimum instruction
  • Experience with SMPTE, different frame rates, and video formats and how to sync them together.
  • Work Independently in patching, digital routing, equipment operation, signal flow and technical operations
  • Trouble shoot technical problems with mixing equipment, computers, and network.
  • Work with new technology with a minimum of instruction
  • Create new techniques, especially in special venue mixing, including taking tracks on location, setting up temporary, full-service production environments and performing a mix in the final venue.
  • Strong collaborator and team player.
  • Experience working in immersive environments
  • Understanding of acoustics and how it effects audio delivery and intelligibility
  • Flexibility to work on multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize workload.
  • Must be willing to mix and work in challenging environments.

Required Education

High school Diploma or Equivalent

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

description:
Job Summary:

Story development at Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) involves creating a story experience, establishing themes, and creating written materials detailing story outlines, story intent and scripts, with the ultimate objective to entertain and inspire Disney guests. The WDI Japan Show Writer provides support to the Walt Disney Imagineering Japan team and Third-Party Owner/Operators, with a particular focus in the realm of story development by, for example, providing story treatments and nomenclature ideas.

As part of the Show Quality Standards Global team, the WDI Japan Show Writer is also involved in maintaining consistency in how the stories Imagineering creates are told. This role is responsible for producing educational materials and administering a standardized curriculum, utilizing them to communicate the original design intent, themes and stories for venues at Tokyo Disney Resort (TDR).

*This role is a local employee role in Japan and expat benefits are not included except for minimal relocation support as appropriate.

*The position will be a full-time contract position with a number of renewals and contract terms based on business needs.

Responsibilities:

* Depending on the individual selected, this role will require different levels and amounts of training and development in Disney Storytelling, Disney History as well as learning the background stories and design intent of the existing Tokyo Disney Resort venues and experiences. Upon completion of training and development, the responsibilities of this role will include the following:


• Brainstorms with project teams in organized and timely fashion to support the story development of the guest experience.
• Partners with concept designers to create the written content that will guide the team throughout the project.
• Partners with Creative Directors and Producers, ensuring stories support the creative vision.
• Collaborates with multi-discipline teams in the development of story-based content.
• Responsible for creating original story concepts and developing them through outline, treatment and final script.
• Partners with Owner/Operator Theme Show team on nomenclature and sign copy for supporting show and operational graphics, operational and safety spiels, show dialogue, which will often include language translation work (Japanese/English).
• Assists with Cast Member Performance Training.
• Tracks the content of sponsorship efforts in order to maintain narrative integrity of existing venues.
• Creates and maintains Show Information Guides, ensuring that they are updated and relevant.
• Stays on top of consumer research insights related to brand, franchise and marketing as well as site needs assessments, to inform creative story approach.
• Supports internal and external communication requests.
• Coordinates with WDI SQS and Project teams to establish, maintain, and deliver standardized comprehensive story and thematic deliverables for all existing TDR venues.
• Assists with the development of WDI standardized templates, processes for story and theme documentation, and educational programs for the TDR venues.
• Assists with maintaining a WDI, TDR archive of thematic and story research materials to provide long-term assets that enhance the ability to sustain, enhance, and advance the stories at TDR.
• Assists with maintaining documentation in the TDR Show Awareness Resource Library.
• Sets up and facilitates TDR Show Awareness training programs.
• Assembles input from key WDI personnel (e.g. Designers, Art Directors, Producers, and operating venue representatives (Internal/External).
• Clearly communicates the goals and objectives for the curriculum's content.
• Partners with WDIJ Leadership, WDAJ HR and Communications and OLC Leadership on sharing content and identifying specific needs of Imagineers and the Operations teams.

Basic Qualifications:

• Bilingual (Japanese/English) individual who is a native Japanese writer with an exceptional Japanese writing ability and excellent verbal communication skills.
• Basic computer skills in word processing, presentation programs and database management (Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and FileMaker Pro required)
• Capacity to interpret and communicate concept and ideas from a variety of mediums.
• Ability to produce and deliver presentations that are effective at communicating content.
• Ability to work within a team environment, collaborating towards common goals.
• Ability to Direct performer talent for recorded spiel sessions.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Minimum 2 years of experience as a professional writer
  • Theatrical, thematic, placemaking story development experience a plus.
  • Some working experience in theatrical or other media related design/production and field installation including interaction with Creative Talent a plus.
  • Experience with presenting to a variety of audiences a plus.
  • Disney experience a plus

Preferred Education


• Bachelor degree preferred
• Creative Japanese Writing, Playwriting, Screen Writing, Journalism or Communications studies preferred

Additional Information:

description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of Disney’s Parks and Resorts business segment. Representing more than 150 disciplines, its talented teams of Imagineers are responsible for the creation of Disney resorts, theme parks and attractions, hotels, water parks, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, cruise ships and new media technology projects.
Within the Show Systems studio is where we produce the magic. Our processes and tool sets take us from concept design or mock ups to full production, assembly and installation. A staff level imaging engineer is responsible for delivering projection systems that integrate into the entire attraction. You will work as part of the team creating world-class attractions. Thinking outside of the box and creative problem solving is a must. We’re looking for professionals who are thirsty for diverse experiences, who are eager to learn and who are confident they can uphold the Disney quality that our quests expect. If this sounds like you, please apply today!

Responsibilities:

  • Work with creative/project team to establish & develop applications of projection systems to support the show concept
  • Participate in attraction level design/production/procurement strategy and activities
  • Develop and manage interface with all integrated disciplines for projection
  • Oversight and management/delegation of all production activities ensuring budget & schedule are met
  • Participate in facility integrations of projection systems.
  • Technical, creative and personal skills blended appropriately to ensure delivery of a quality product throughout changing scope, schedule and budget conditions
  • Participate in design of projector mounts
  • Vendor management
  • Attend Design and Peer Reviews
  • Lead project installation efforts
  • Create technical documentation of projection systems

Basic Qualifications:

  • Projection layouts (i.e. throws, format)
  • Image blending techniques
  • Distortion correction
  • Digital projection systems (video & digital Cinema)
  • Stereoscopic technologies
  • Lens selection criteria
  • Experience at producing a complete, maintainable and operable projection system.
  • Front projection and rear projection screen technology
  • 3D and 2D screen technology
  • Luminosity and color spectral science
  • Familiarly with video formats
  • Understanding of opto-mechanical concepts
  • Solidworks / revIT / Maya / AutoCAD

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Scheduling methods / experience
  • Knowledge of legacy Film Systems (70mm, 35mm, 16mm)
  • Knowledge of theme park projection systems from a technical and aesthetic show perspective
  • Understanding of communication / automation software and networks
  • Scheduling methods / experience
  • Estimating methods / experience
  • Field integration experience (Test & Adjust)

Required Education

  • B.S. degree in optical, mechanical engineering or 10 years related work experience post college.

description:
Job Summary:

It’s the magic of immersing yourself in a motion picture masterpiece, or a new track from your favorite band, or the spectacle of a live Broadway show. It’s hard to define and even harder to create, but that’s what we do at The Walt Disney Studios. Ours is a culture of innovation, collaboration and creativity. We raise the bar, then step over it, blazing trails through the production and distribution of world-class entertainment around the globe. If you want to help tell compelling, enduring stories through movies, music or stage plays, then we want to hear from you.

The Walt Disney Company
Imagine a career with an organization that brings smiles to millions every day. Imagine working with people whose passion for what they do is simply indescribable. We are The Walt Disney Company, live with a rich legacy of innovation, entertainment, and lifelong memories. With our vast array of both businesses and professionals, you’ll have the opportunity to join a team that’s beloved around the world, and to find out how it feels to love what you do. We invite you to discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you‘ve been looking for.

Responsibilities:

description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research arm of The Walt Disney Company’s (TWDC) Parks and Resorts business segment. Representing more than 150 disciplines, the talented corps of Imagineers are responsible for the creation of Disney resorts, theme parks and attractions, hotels, water parks, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, cruise ships and new media technology projects.

The WDI Technology Studio is looking for talented software developers to create and deploy the next generation of show technologies that will drive our guest experiences in upcoming attractions and venues.

Responsibilities:

  • Estimation, design, implementation, peer review, testing, documentation, training, and turnover of all Show Control software artifacts pursuant to attraction and/or venue scope.
  • Task definition, organization, prioritization, scheduling, status tracking, and distribution of tasks among software project team members.
  • Must work closely with other technical divisions of work to ensure constructed systems (inclusive of both hardware and software) operate cooperatively and reliably over the expected usable life of project.
  • Must balance evolving technical requirements with fixed budgets and schedules, and communicate both risks and options to Studio, and Project leadership (as appropriate) in a timely fashion.
  • Partner with both Studio and Project leadership to execute project goals while employing best software development practices and adhering to relevant company and industry standards.
  • Work with other software project and product developers to provide incremental and overall updates to status and condition of software product progress.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum 10 years of Industrial Automation and/or Process Control experience, primarily focused on software development within the same domain.
  • Knowledge and experience with modern software development practices, including version control and workflow management tools including JIRA, Clarity, Github, Gitlab, Subversion, Perforce, Bitbucket, Bamboo, Crucible, Jenkins, etc.
  • Knowledge and experience with process control/controls engineering industry standards, platforms/languages/technologies, including PLCs, FPGAs, embedded controllers/microcontrollers, RTOS programming environments, HMI and SCADA solutions.
  • Prior experience authoring and/or augmenting motion control software packages for Industrial or Entertainment focused applications.
  • Demonstrable technical writing, documentation, and communication skills.
  • Willing to travel on behalf of company to project destinations for the purposes of business trips (between overnight and 6 months stay), and also relocation (between 6 month and two year stay).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with: IEC61131-3 programming languages, EtherCAT, ADS, DS-402, Profibus, DMX/sACN, OPC-UA, MQTT, C#, Python, Java.
  • Familiarity and/or experience with: MS Visual Studio, RSLogix, Matlab, Robot OS (ROS), AutoDesk Maya, Motion Builder, AutoCAD
  • Experience with TwinCAT3 is a strong plus.

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, electrical engineering, computer engineering from accredited college or university. Advanced degrees preferred.

About Walt Disney Imagineering:

Founded in 1952 as WED Enterprises to design and build the world’s first theme park — Disneyland — Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is where imagination and creativity combine with cutting-edge technology to create unforgettable experiences. WDI is the creative force that imagines, designs and builds all Disney theme parks, resorts, attractions and cruise ships worldwide. Imagineering’s unique strength comes from its diverse global team of creative and technical professionals, who build on Disney’s legacy of storytelling to pioneer new forms of entertainment. The Imagineers who practice this unique blend of art and science work in more than 100 disciplines to shepherd an idea all the way from “blue sky” concept phase to opening day.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc., which is part of a business we call Walt Disney Imagineering.

Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.
