description:
Job Summary:

Can you imagine a career in Tax that includes one day working with the inner workings of Pixar, National Geographic, Disney theme parks, the Imagineers, and corporate Walt Disney? Your career can start here at Disney Tax! Disney Tax is a fast-paced, dynamic environment made up of multiple subgroups that collectively manage the tax needs of The Walt Disney Company and its Subsidiaries. This opportunity is truly once in a lifetime.

The Tax Compliance Group is responsible for the preparation and filing of all income tax returns. This generally encompasses 1 federal consolidated return which includes all >1000 domestic subsidiaries and information returns for all foreign subsidiaries. The group also files many state income tax returns. The group assists other groups within the tax department (e.g. tax planning, tax provision, audit controversy) with the tasks that reside in those groups and in implementing department objectives.

Responsibilities:

  • Data collection and analysis (including SAP, Tax Driver, Tax Packages, Direct Inquiry)
  • Preparation of tax return permanent and temporary adjustments specific to business segment (Direct to Consumer / Streaming)
  • Analysis of changes to federal and state tax laws
  • Analysis of changes to federal and state tax laws
  • Prepare federal and multi-state income tax returns
  • Prepare/assist preparation of global tax adjustment calculations (e.g. Film Amortization, Partnership, etc.)
  • Project taxable income amounts for estimated tax purposes, provision and extensions
  • Stock Basis calculations
  • Develop and implement process improvements
  • Prepare responses to notices from states
  • Reconciliations of deferred tax assets and liability balances
  • Assisting with federal and state income tax audits
  • Special projects (tax planning and department wide initiatives)

Basic Qualifications:

  • 0-2 years’ experience in federal and state income tax
  • Strong desire to broaden and build skills
  • Innovative orientation with a proactive approach to collaboration and problem solving
  • Excellent analytical skills and the ability to independently identify and resolve issues
  • Excellent communication skills with ability to frame communications appropriate to audience
  • Strong information technology skills: Microsoft Excel, MS Word, and PowerPoint
  • Deliverable-focused, strong work ethic, and the capability to handle multiple projects and stakeholders
  • Demonstrate professionalism through a positive and cooperative attitude; ability to work in a fast paced environment
  • Understands cross functional impact and ability to build consensus with internal and

Preferred Qualifications:

  • SAP experience
  • Workday experience
  • MicroStrategy
  • IBM Cognos Analytics
  • OneSource RS (tax preparation software)
  • RIA (or similar research software)
  • Knowledge of Alteryx preferred

Required Education

Bachelor’s in Accounting, Finance, Economics or equivalent.

Preferred Education

Advanced Degree – Master’s in Tax, Accounting, or Finance

description:
Job Summary:

DMED Technology Design:
Design at Disney is at the forefront of creating intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that our fans love and crave. We strive to design high-quality end-to-end experiences while maintaining an inclusive and collaborative culture. To us, team-fit and attitude are as important as hard design skills.
DMED Technology Design is the unified design org for 90+ customer-facing websites/apps and hundreds of enterprise products in the Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) Technology organization. We are the storytellers responsible for adding “something special” to our consumers’ experience every day through exciting design, artwork, branding and UX globally. We are responsible for driving the product design, user experiences, creative direction, production design, motion design, service design, UX copywriting, UX research and UX engineering. It is our job to create a framework that delivers consistent, creative and innovative user experiences for people – whether they are using Disney’s consumer-facing products, or the platforms, products and tools that help power our business. Crucially, how we do that work must be both imaginative and efficient, allowing us to also free our team devote energy to using design to drive innovation.
The consumer portfolio we get to design for includes many of the most trusted and beloved brands in the world – ABC, ABC News, Disney, ESPN, Freeform, FX, Marvel, National Geographic and Star Wars. These are great products, and our charge is to always imagine ways to make them even better; to deliver happiness and magical moments through artistry and inventive design, reinforcing the emotional connection between consumers and Disney’s brands.
The enterprise portfolio we are responsible for is also critically important – and our colleagues, partners and businesses will be relying upon us to bring the same kind of imagination, ease and consistent excellence to those experiences.
Platform Design:
DMED Technology Platform Design lays the foundation across Mobile, Desktop, and TV apps for our consumer experiences. This mission includes the continued development and proliferation of our design system framework and platform user experience teams, including streaming, discovery, editorial, identity, and commerce patterns and templates. We are a multi-disciplinary design team affording you the opportunity to collaborate with many design groups and specialties to create innovative products that people love to use. A designer at Disney is a creative problem solver who looks to collaborate inclusively throughout your design process and evolve the way Disney operates.

Design System Team:

Within Platform Design, the Design System Team is responsible for constantly evolving our framework of brand-agnostic, best-in-class storytelling solutions. This team manages the ongoing grown of the DMED Technology Design System, driving efficiency, consistency and innovation across the DMED consumer and enterprise product portfolio.

The Manager, Design – Design System team will oversee the majority of design work that happens across our products, building and maintain trusted partner dynamics, establishing guiding principles to pixel perfection, and envision opportunities for product elevation through all aspects of the design process. They will be responsible for managing and mentoring a large team of Designers; highly innovative, creative, engaging, and able to work with all types of people; and deeply knowledgeable about design systems and high-quality user experiences.
#LI-LS2

Responsibilities:

  • You will be an expert of the DMED Technology Design System and anticipate opportunities to evolve and implement
  • You will be responsible for managing, leading, inspiring, and growing the Design Team
  • You understand consumers and can solve their problems through product innovation and platform-based design solutions
  • You will coordinate requirements with stakeholders and partners and present design to executives and business partners
  • Your design work sets an example that all designers want to follow
  • You will operate as a point-of-contact on strategic initiatives for design leadership
  • You will be expected to partner with a variety of teams, inspiring confidence that your team will deliver compelling design and UX that are cohesive, inclusive, and well- informed on time.

Basic Qualifications:

  • 7+ years of relevant industry experiences, of which 3+ years of management experiences
  • You are an expert in design system strategy and development
  • You have a track record of overseeing large bodies of work and delivering multiple complex projects simultaneously
  • You have led and inspired a team of designers
  • You are a true innovator and eager to lead the creation of design solutions that challenge the status quo
  • You have a broad understanding of different systems, theories, and practices of design leadership
  • You have been proactive in bringing together groups of individuals to solve a problem
  • You can communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization
  • You have managed stakeholders and set priorities
  • You can confidently design in Figma

About Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution:

Comprised of the Company’s international business units and various direct-to-consumer streaming services, Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) aligns technology, media distribution and advertising sales into a single business segment to create and deliver personalized entertainment experiences to consumers around the world.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Disney Streaming Technology LLC, which is part of a business we call Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution.

Disney Streaming Technology LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of The Walt Disney Company. Its talented corps of Imagineers is responsible for the creation - from concept initiation through installation - of all Disney Resorts, theme parks and attractions, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, and new media projects.

What we’re looking for…

A Project Coordination Intern who will be responsible for coordinating the quality, schedule and scope of Company projects by ensuring streamlined communication, product movement and process flow from concept design through implementation and closeout. The Coordinator must consistently maintain a broad perspective across all disciplines in order to ensure that all aspects of the work are covered and no efforts are duplicated.

Responsibilities:

You will…
  • Work with the project team on the day to day needs of design projects
  • Manage a definable scope of work with the guidance of senior team leaders
  • Develop and/or maintain scope lists, show lists, deliverable matrixes, shipping documents
  • Gather design input and distribute communication
  • Monitor meetings and other communications and provide updates as necessary in order to ensure proper integration and to resolve issues in a timely manner
  • Partner with various disciplines to create physical and digital presentations throughout a project’s life cycle
  • Coordinate mock ups and vendor liaison issues
  • Communicate with more senior level Project Coordinators, Producers, Show Managers, Project Managers, and discipline Leads relative to status updates of schedule progress, design inputs required, completion of design milestones, metrics on earned value, etc.

WDI Project Coordination Interns may work in support of a variety of projects, including (but not limited to) the development or redesign of themed entertainment experiences or the production of digital media or visual arts projects.

Basic Qualifications:

What you bring to the role…
  • Computer proficiency with Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Keynote, Photoshop, Illustrator, and the Internet
  • Ability to edit video clips within a presentation if necessary
  • Understanding of creative development/process and workflow for complex projects
  • Ability to integrate collaboration within the project team
  • Appreciation for an integrated design and production experience with multiple disciplines

Required Education

  • Currently enrolled as a Junior or higher, or must have graduated from an accredited college/university within the past 6 months, earning a degree in business, theater, environmental design, other entertainment or business-related fields

Additional Information:

Internship Eligibility:
  • At the time of application, must be enrolled in an accredited college/university taking at least one class in the semester/quarter (spring/fall) prior to participation in the internship program OR must have graduated from a college/university within 6 months OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Professional Internship
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must not have completed one year of continual employment on a Disney internship or program
  • Must possess unrestricted work authorization
  • Must provide full work availability
  • Must provide own transportation to/from work location
  • Must be able to provide own housing for the duration of the internship
  • Current Active Disney cast members must meet Professional Internship transfer guidelines (for Walt Disney World cast members this is no more than four points and one reprimand in the last six months; for Disneyland cast members this is six months of consecutive service and a performance record clear of any disciplinary issues (warnings, suspensions, etc.) for at least six months)

Program Length:

Interns must be fully available for the duration of the internship. The approximate dates of this internship are:
  • SUMMER ONLY: June/July 2022 through August/September 2022 (3 Months)
  • SUMMER/FALL: July/August 2022 through early January 2023 (6 Months)
(Candidates with summer only availability will be considered for an immediate start)

description:
Job Summary:

It’s the magic of immersing yourself in a motion picture masterpiece, or a new track from your favorite band, or the spectacle of a live Broadway show. It’s hard to define and even harder to create, but that’s what we do at The Walt Disney Studios. Ours is a culture of innovation, collaboration and creativity. We raise the bar, then step over it, blazing trails through the production and distribution of world-class entertainment around the globe. If you want to help tell compelling, enduring stories through movies, music or stage plays, then we want to hear from you.

The Walt Disney Company

Imagine a career with an organization that brings smiles to millions every day. Imagine working with people whose passion for what they do is simply indescribable. We are The Walt Disney Company, live with a rich legacy of innovation, entertainment, and lifelong memories. With our vast array of both businesses and professionals, you’ll have the opportunity to join a team that’s beloved around the world, and to find out how it feels to love what you do. We invite you to discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you‘ve been looking for.

Disney has explored new worlds through magical storytelling since its first completely live-action film, Treasure Island in 1950. Across pirate-laden high-seas or down a mysterious rabbit hole, Disney’s collaborations with renowned artists and filmmakers has produced some of the most successful live-action family films in history, including Disney’s Alice in Wonderland, the Pirates of the Caribbean films, The Jungle Book, Cinderella, and Beauty & The Beast, with more extraordinary stories on the horizon.

Each production executive is assigned film projects and interfaces with film makers during the set-up of the production, scheduling of the project and then oversight of production during filming. Physical production interfaces with many departments, including but not limited to, Post, VFX, Creative, Labor Relations, and Legal.

Responsibilities:

  • Work directly with and assist the Production Executive to coordinate all features directly associated with the Production Executive’s office from pre-production through the wrap of physical production.
  • Set up Studio policies and procedure manuals for films supervised by executive.
  • Management of materials which include maintaining lists & contracts, researching information, compiling, archiving and securing files.
  • Work directly with production companies to secure day-to-day updates during set-up and production.
  • Answer and screen phones.
  • Schedule appointments.
  • Arrange travel as needed.
  • Occasional script analysis required (breakdown sets, cast & location).
  • Special projects as required by the production team as needed.
  • Miscellaneous departmental duties as needed

Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Film Production or equivalent.
  • Solid familiarity with Film Production.
  • Strong proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel). SAP knowledge a plus.
  • Computer skills, Mac knowledgeable, familiarity with Production scheduling and Budgeting programs a plus
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize, multi-task, meet deadlines, make preliminary decisions and change course of action quickly.
  • Detail oriented with the ability to work well under pressure and maintain professionalism and service orientation.
  • Strong organizational and follow-thru skills, keeping manager informed on completed tasks and status of current tasks at hand.
  • Strong assistant skills a must (phones, calendar, contacts). Ability to resolve routine issues and raise complex issues to management.
  • Ability to work with highly confidential material.
    Effective communicator, both verbally and written.
  • Ability to be proactive, resourceful and flexible.
  • Ability to take initiative and work with minimum supervision.

Across pirate-laden high-seas or down a mysterious rabbit hole, Disney’s collaborations with renowned artists and filmmakers has produced some of the most successful live-action family films in history, including Disney’s Alice in Wonderland, the Pirates of the Caribbean films, The Jungle Book, Cinderella, and Beauty & The Beast, with more extraordinary stories on the horizon. 

Each production executive is assigned film projects and interfaces with film makers during the set-up of the production, scheduling of the project and then oversight of production during filming. Physical production interfaces with many departments, including but not limited to, Post, VFX, Creative, Labor Relations, and Legal.

* Work directly with and assist the Production Executive to coordinate all features directly associated with the Production Executive’s office from pre-production through the wrap of physical production.
* Set up Studio policies and procedure manuals for films supervised by executive. 
* Management of materials which include maintaining lists & contracts, researching information, compiling, archiving and securing files.
* Work directly with production companies to secure day-to-day updates during set-up and production.
* Answer and screen phones.
* Schedule appointments.
* Arrange travel as needed.
* Occasional script analysis required (breakdown sets, cast & location).
* Special projects as required by the production team as needed.
* Miscellaneous departmental duties as needed

* Bachelor’s Degree in Film Production or equivalent.
* Solid familiarity with Film Production. 
* Strong proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel). SAP knowledge a plus.
* Computer skills, Mac knowledgeable, familiarity with Production scheduling and Budgeting programs a plus
* Demonstrated ability to prioritize, multi-task, meet deadlines, make preliminary decisions and change course of action quickly.
* Detail oriented with the ability to work well under pressure and maintain professionalism and service orientation.
* Strong organizational and follow-thru skills, keeping manager informed on completed tasks and status of current tasks at hand.
* Strong assistant skills a must (phones, calendar, contacts). Ability to resolve routine issues and raise complex issues to management.
* Ability to work with highly confidential material.
Effective communicator, both verbally and written.
* Ability to be proactive, resourceful and flexible.
* Ability to take initiative and work with minimum supervision.

What we’re looking for…

A Color and Paint Intern who will be to supporting documentation and implementation of approved color design intent. The Color and Paint Intern will work with the Color Designer and the Project Team to implement the color strategy from documentation to implementation. This dynamic and creative individual must be capable of creating paint finishes that fulfill design intent and will be responsible for ensuring that the Color documentation is supportive of current best practices and supports production strategy.

Responsibilities:

You will…
  • Take color and paint direction from Color Design Lead

  • Provide support as necessary for models, color boards, sample production, vendor liaison, scenery production
  • Mix paint colors to match palettes as directed by Color Design Lead

Basic Qualifications:

What you bring to the role…
  • Ability to mix paint to match commercial color swatches
  • Ability to paint architectural renderings, 3-Dimensional models, props, scenery, and perform faux-finishes on a variety of surfaces
  • Familiarity with typical tools of the trade, such as brushes, rollers, and spray equipment
  • Ability to read and interpret architectural drawings
  • Ability to take verbal direction and implement such from a variety of team players such as the Color Designer, Art Directors, and Show Producers

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with 2-D and 3-D digital design tools, such as Photoshop, Illustrator and AutoCad
  • Familiarity with black light painting technique
  • Previous internship or related experience/Studio experience preferred

  • Currently enrolled as a Junior or higher, or must have graduated within the past 6 months from an accredited college/university, earning a BA, BFA or MFA in Theatrical Design, Film Design and Production, or Two-Dimensional Art or related

Additional Information:

Internship Eligibility:

  • At the time of application, must be enrolled in an accredited college/university taking at least one class in the semester/quarter (spring/fall) prior to participation in the internship program OR must have graduated from a college/university within 6 months OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Professional Internship
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must not have completed one year of continual employment on a Disney internship or program
  • Must possess unrestricted work authorization
  • Must provide full work availability
  • Must provide own transportation to/from work location
  • Must be able to provide own housing for the duration of the internship
  • Must have valid US driver's license.

  • The approximate dates of this internship are June/July 2022 through early January 2023. Interns must be fully available for the entire duration of the internship.

  • A portfolio is recommended - please include link to your portfolio site on your resume.

description:
Job Summary:

It’s the magic of immersing yourself in a motion picture masterpiece, or a new track from your favorite band, or the spectacle of a live Broadway show. It’s hard to define and even harder to create, but that’s what we do at The Walt Disney Studios. Ours is a culture of innovation, collaboration and creativity. We raise the bar, then step over it, blazing trails through the production and distribution of world-class entertainment around the globe. If you want to help tell compelling, enduring stories through movies, music or stage plays, then we want to hear from you.

Imagine a career with an organization that brings smiles to millions every day. Imagine working with people whose passion for what they do is simply indescribable. We are The Walt Disney Company, live with a rich legacy of innovation, entertainment, and lifelong memories. With our vast array of both businesses and professionals, you’ll have the opportunity to join a team that’s beloved around the world, and to find out how it feels to love what you do. We invite you to discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you‘ve been looking for.

The Walt Disney Studios encompasses the creation, production, promotion, sales, acquisition and domestic and international distribution of live-action and animated motion pictures, home entertainment releases, live stage plays, and music and soundtrack recordings. From movie concept to film production, and global premieres to direct to consumer mobile applications, Studio Technology innovates and delivers solutions that support a studio whose content is legendary and transcends generations. As part of the Studio’s Technology team you’ll be joining a group of passionate, dedicated technologists solving a range of interesting problems in innovative ways in an exciting and dynamic industry. We are looking for high-performing, motivated individuals who are generalists and proficient in many technologies and languages. Our team embraces disruptive thinkers who can drive innovation.

The Walt Disney Studios has created one of the most powerful brands by bringing memorable, life-changing storytelling to the world. Our studio film franchises have redefined the genre in building a universe filled with creativity, innovation, and collaboration.

As part of the Production Technology Team at Walt Disney Studios; you will be joining a group of seasoned, dedicated technologists solving a range of interesting problems in innovative ways in an exciting and dynamic environment.

The Production Technology Team is looking for a Workflow Technical Director to provide technology support on projects across the broader Disney Studio Technology organization. You will provide end to end expertise for teams on set to post; investigate emerging image processing technologies; oversee pipeline solutions; and contribute to the development of standards for our studio and the broader industry. You will report to the Manager of Production Technology at Walt Disney Studios in Burbank, CA

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with our producers, directors, and supervisors with a focus on technology needs while also maximizing efficiencies.
  • Design end to end workflows for various stages of the production.
  • Troubleshoot with vendors and internal teams or users when workflows are challenged.
  • Understand, innovate, and facilitate the technology used in our screening rooms.
  • Collaborate with cross studio teams on large scale projects.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum 5 years experience in the post production industry.
  • End to end workflow experience.
  • Proven knowledge of pipeline production workflows and tools.
  • Ability to understand the demands of a production driven environment.
  • Experience working alongside senior management.
  • Talent to influence and build strong working relationships across multiple vendors and departments

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Cross experience with Feature Animation, VFX Theatrical and Streaming Live-Action, and VR special projects.
  • Experience working within standards organizations and proven experience contributing to the industry at large.

About The Walt Disney Studios:

For over 95 years, The Walt Disney Studios has been the foundation on which The Walt Disney Company was built. Today it brings quality movies, episodic storytelling, music, and stage plays to consumers throughout the world. The Walt Disney Studios encompasses a collection of respected film studios, including Disney, Walt Disney Animation Studios, Pixar Animation Studios, Marvel Studios, Lucasfilm, 20th Century Studios, and Searchlight Pictures. It is also home to Disney Theatrical Productions, producer of world-class stage shows.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. If you want to help tell compelling, enduring stories through movies, music or stage plays, then we want to hear from you.

Imagine a career with an organization that brings smiles to millions every day. Imagine working with people whose passion for what they do is simply indescribable. We are The Walt Disney Company, live with a rich legacy of innovation, entertainment, and lifelong memories. With our vast array of both businesses and professionals, you’ll have the opportunity to join a team that’s beloved around the world, and to find out how it feels to love what you do. We invite you to discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you‘ve been looking for.

The Walt Disney Studios encompasses the creation, production, promotion, sales, acquisition and domestic and international distribution of live-action and animated motion pictures, home entertainment releases, live stage plays, and music and soundtrack recordings. From movie concept to film production, and global premieres to direct to consumer mobile applications, Studio Technology innovates and delivers solutions that support a studio whose content is legendary and transcends generations. As part of the Studio’s Technology team you’ll be joining a group of passionate, dedicated technologists solving a range of interesting problems in innovative ways in an exciting and dynamic industry. We are looking for high-performing, motivated individuals who are generalists and proficient in many technologies and languages. Our team embraces disruptive thinkers who can drive innovation.

The Walt Disney Studios has created one of the most powerful brands by bringing memorable, life-changing storytelling to the world. Our studio film franchises have redefined the genre in building a universe filled with creativity, innovation, and collaboration.

As part of the Production Technology Team at Walt Disney Studios; you will be joining a group of seasoned, dedicated technologists solving a range of interesting problems in innovative ways in an exciting and dynamic environment.

The Production Technology Team is looking for a Workflow Technical Director to provide technology support on projects across the broader Disney Studio Technology organization. You will provide end to end expertise for teams on set to post; investigate emerging image processing technologies; oversee pipeline solutions; and contribute to the development of standards for our studio and the broader industry. You will report to the Manager of Production Technology at Walt Disney Studios in Burbank, CA

* Work closely with our producers, directors, and supervisors with a focus on technology needs while also maximizing efficiencies.
* Design end to end workflows for various stages of the production.
* Troubleshoot with vendors and internal teams or users when workflows are challenged.
* Understand, innovate, and facilitate the technology used in our screening rooms.
* Collaborate with cross studio teams on large scale projects.

* Minimum 5 years experience in the post production industry.
* End to end workflow experience.
* Proven knowledge of pipeline production workflows and tools.
* Ability to understand the demands of a production driven environment.
* Experience working alongside senior management.
* Talent to influence and build strong working relationships across multiple vendors and departments

* Cross experience with Feature Animation, VFX Theatrical and Streaming Live-Action, and VR special projects. 
* Experience working within standards organizations and proven experience contributing to the industry at large.

  • PMP (Project Management Professional)
  • Lean manufacturing 6 Sigma or higher
  • M.S Manufacturing Engineering or related areas

  • programs, concepts that maximize engagement of ESPN+ subscribers

Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of Disney’s Parks and Resorts business segment. Representing more than 150 disciplines, its talented teams of Imagineers are responsible for the creation of Disney resorts, theme parks and attractions, hotels, water parks, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, cruise ships and new media technology projects.
Within the Show Systems studio is where we produce the magic. Our processes and tool sets take us from concept design or mock ups to full production, assembly and installation. An associate A/V engineer is responsible for delivering A/V for the entire attraction or even land under guidance from the team. You will work as part of the team creating world-class attractions. Thinking outside of the box and creative problem solving is a must. We’re looking for professionals who are thirsty for diverse experiences, who are eager to learn and who are confident they can uphold the Disney quality that our quests expect. If this sounds like you, please apply today!

Responsibilities:

  • Possess the skills necessary to execute the design of audio/video systems in accordance with accepted engineering practices, published codes and regulations
  • Works as a member of the design team.
  • Limited judgment on details of work and in making preliminary selections or adaptations of engineering alternatives
  • Produce engineering drawings based on Disney standards
  • Participate in all aspects of system testing
  • Provide production support to manufacturing entity for clarification of drawing or part substitution
  • Provide as-built documentation and technical manual input
  • Assist in complex engineering designs
  • Make decisions within established guidelines and provide, under supervision, engineering design and analysis in support of the production of engineering documents
  • Attend Design and Peer Reviews
  • Produce weekly status reports detailing project activities
  • Track personal progress on assignments comparing budget/schedule to actuals.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Comprehensive knowledge of audio source and reproduction/exhibition technology.
  • Understanding of sound system design, architectural acoustic requirements, test and measurement.
  • Experience in interfacing both PC and MAC based computers to audio hardware.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of video systems, encoding and reproduction/exhibition technology
  • Familiarity with industry audio and video standards
  • Familiarity with audio amplifier design types, direct drive and 70v distribution systems
  • Familiarity with video formats, such as hi-def and cinema standards and distribution
  • Familiarity with technical grounding systems
  • Strong working knowledge of theatrical design and technical knowledge of specific discipline, including methods of construction.
  • A/V systems design and troubleshooting
  • Understanding of the creative process and the development of a creative design.
  • Ability to present technical concepts in manner understandable by non-technical people

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Scheduling methods / Experience
  • Estimating methods / Experience
  • AutoCAD
  • Creative translator - clean sheet design
  • Field integration experience (Test & Adjust)
  • Engineering analysis & simulation
  • Engineering specifications & requirements
  • UL/NEC

Required Education

  • BSEE, Technical Theater with a concentration in audio and or video system design or 5 years related work experience post college.

The Imagineering Technology Studio is looking for a BIM Project Manager with 3-4 years’ experience managing BIM and VDC project strategies. This individual will be key to the stakeholder engagement, templates, standards and production team success for our key products for BIM and VDC delivery.

Responsibilities:

  • Work directly with the Senior Project BIM-VDC Manager to engage the project production teams in advancing technology innovations

description:
Job Summary:

It’s the magic of immersing yourself in a motion picture masterpiece, or a new track from your favorite band, or the spectacle of a live Broadway show. It’s hard to define and even harder to create, but that’s what we do at The Walt Disney Studios. Ours is a culture of innovation, collaboration and creativity. We raise the bar, then step over it, blazing trails through the production and distribution of world-class entertainment around the globe. If you want to help tell compelling, enduring stories through movies, music or stage plays, then we want to hear from you.

The Walt Disney Company

Imagine a career with an organization that brings smiles to millions every day. Imagine working with people whose passion for what they do is simply indescribable. We are The Walt Disney Company, live with a rich legacy of innovation, entertainment, and lifelong memories. With our vast array of both businesses and professionals, you’ll have the opportunity to join a team that’s beloved around the world, and to find out how it feels to love what you do. We invite you to discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you‘ve been looking for.

The Manager, Creative Marketing Partnerships will be responsible for the management, strategic alignment and creative development for the global promotions division of the Walt Disney Studios. The manager will be the department resource to illustrate creative ideas in order to secure new partners and help improve and manage current partner creative for upfront pitching presentations and campaign execution for our largest franchises: Walt Disney Animation Studios, Pixar, Disney Live Action, Lucasfilm, Hulu Originals, Disney + and 20th Century Studios. The role requires a high level of skill in visual creative thinking and technical expertise to bring these multi-million-dollar promotional campaigns to life. Ability to generate pitch ideas and activation strategies are also key to this role. The manager will directly engage with top-tier brands, agencies, and senior creative executives at the Walt Disney Studios.

This role is ideal for a candidate with a strong eye for visual design and a passion for the Disney brands, is able to conceptualize and enhance high-level partnerships with major partners across retail, auto, tech, etc. and is looking to grow their career in creative marketing or advertising.

This is a Contract Position (6 months)

Responsibilities:

  • Illustrate creative through graphic design for sales and execution teams
    • Be able to create expanded pitches from limited assets
      • Problem-solve solutions when there is a lack of assets for early pitches and early partner creative
    • Create visual art for partner campaigns
  • Work with brand leads on proactive creative ideas and opportunities that to tap into pop culture trends, creativity, executional approaches & techniques to share with partners
    • Produce concepts to pitch new and returning partners
    • Create visual layouts to showcase how brands can be integrated with Disney IP
    • Work on proactive concepts for TV commercial scripts
  • Work directly with brand teams to facilitate creative approval process along with the execution team
    • Create layouts to illustrate notes from brand teams back to the partner
    • Generate and illustrate solutions for creative challenges between internal and external partners
  • Brainstorm incremental business opportunities and pitches to new and existing promotional partners
  • Ability to build strong internal organization and external relationships, be a team player, and proactively provide assistance whenever/wherever needed. The desire to learn and grow is a must.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Proficient using any of the following: Photoshop, Keynote, InDesign, Illustrator, Acrobat and PowerPoint
  • Strong attention to detail when it comes to visual design
  • Ability to build and enhance strong partnerships
  • Previous industry experience in media, entertainment
  • Experience working with outside agencies

This Director, Enterprise Architecture role will report to the VP, Architecture & Standards. This role will be part of the newly created Architecture & Standards team that is supporting the transformation of Enterprise Technology through the establishment & application of Enterprise Architecture practices including standards, roadmaps, and architectural design for complex projects

Responsibilities:

Leadership:
  • Leads a team of enterprise architects across multiple technical domains in the development of roadmaps, standards, and patterns.
  • Manage the allocation of resources across different projects and deliverables
  • Create career, development and succession plans for each member of the team to ensure broad skills coverage and capability
  • Develop & coach team to execute against Architecture & Standards strategy
  • Define objectives & key results and manage the performance of individuals and the team to achieve them
  • Act as technical subject matter expert, supporting architects in the resolution of complex technical problems
  • Promote diversity, equity, and inclusion within the team as well as the broader Architecture & Standards organization
  • Mentor other potential technical leaders across the organization
  • Influence & negotiate with other leaders and technical experts to achieve key objectives and outcomes that align with the overall strategy
Strategy:
  • Collaborate with the VP, Architecture & Standards in establishing the vision, goals, and implementation plan for the Architecture & Standards function and effectively driving the realization of that vision and goals
  • Develop relationships with business and technology leadership and teams, and establish feedback loops that enable the Architecture organization’s continuous improvement.
  • Interface with key IT leaders for the purpose of setting strategic direction for the Enterprise Architecture.
Enterprise Architecture:
  • Lead building the Architecture & Standards team from its current state to a fully formed practice and team capable of defining the overall modernization strategy and supporting the company’s on-going roadmap delivery.
  • Lead the effective application of enterprise architecture principles through a deep understanding of the architecture discipline, processes, concepts and best practices.
  • Lead the establishment of architecture processes, principles, standards, and measurements to drive consistency and efficiency.
  • Serve as the expert for enterprise architecture tools and technology and provide architectural and strategic consulting in the areas of external trends, best practices and adherence to standards.

Basic Qualifications:

  • 15 years in IT/IS
  • Experience building and leading geographically distributed teams in a complex working environment
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to influence engineers, peers, and senior stakeholders to consensus decisions
  • Experience in establishing and advocating for an Enterprise Architecture practice/capability
  • Possess a thorough understanding of modern work practices such as DevOps, Continuous Delivery, Lean Enterprise/Lean Startup and Enterprise Agile.
  • Experience in most of the following technical domains:
  1. Network
  2. Hosting/Cloud
  3. Business Applications
  4. Data Management
  5. Client Computing
  6. Voice/Video/Collaboration
  7. Information Security

Required Education

  • BA/BS in computer science/technology or business, or equivalent work experience

Preferred Education

  • TOGAF certification

About The Walt Disney Company (Corporate):

At Disney Corporate you can see how the businesses behind the Company’s powerful brands come together to create the most innovative, far-reaching and admired entertainment company in the world. As a member of a corporate team, you’ll work with world-class leaders driving the strategies that keep The Walt Disney Company at the leading edge of entertainment. See and be seen by other innovative thinkers as you enable the greatest storytellers in the world to create memories for millions of families around the globe.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Disney Worldwide Services, Inc., which is part of a business we call The Walt Disney Company (Corporate).

Disney Worldwide Services, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

    • Partner with The Hive leadership, Producers, Finance and HR to strategically manage team resourcing and asset needs.

  • Oversee Hive submissions to various industry award ceremonies.
  • Process non-union voiceover artist paperwork with producers/legal/VO agency.
  • Plan office events/team building activities for 40+ person team.
  • Manage special projects as needed.
  • Establish relationships with various levels of the organization to understand unique needs and challenges.

  • Exhibit a creative mind with strong interpersonal skills and proven ability to build relationships, influence decisions, and drive results through internal partnerships
  • Expert project management skills with a track record of driving results—well-organized with the ability to manage multiple projects and demonstrate resilience, adjusting quickly to shifting priorities and ambiguity
  • Strong, concise oral and written communication skills, with the ability to interface with senior leadership and team members
  • Demonstrate problem solving and decision making skills
  • Self-directed with proven leadership and team development skills
  • Ability to maintain the highest standards of strict confidentiality with respect to all matters, documents, and verbal and written correspondence

  • Proficiency in the following software: Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and Zoom

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge and experience working with trailer houses or creative agencies

description:
Job Summary:


Overview – Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research arm of The Walt Disney Company’s (TWDC) Parks and Resorts business segment. Representing more than 150 disciplines, the talented corps of Imagineers are responsible for the creation of Disney resorts, theme parks and attractions, hotels, water parks, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, cruise ships and new media technology projects.

The WDI Technology Studio is looking for talented software developers to create and deploy the next generation of show technologies that will drive our guest experiences in upcoming attractions and venues.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with project teams to define technical requirements necessary to achieve project goals.
  • Software estimation, scheduling, planning, design, implementation, and closeout activities for assigned project scope. Must work closely with other technical divisions of work to ensure constructed systems (inclusive of both hardware and software) operate cooperatively and reliably over the expected usable life of the project.
  • Must balance evolving technical requirements with fixed budgets and schedules, and communicate risks and options to both Studio and Project leadership in a timely fashion.
  • Partner with both Studio and Project leadership to execute project goals while employing best software development practices and adhering to relevant company and industry standards.
  • Develop (and lead/oversee development teams) and/or maintain multiple complex whole projects or entire pieces of software both guest facing and internal WDI facing. This includes architecture, design, and implementation.
  • Work with and manage other software developers and software project leads to provide incremental and overall updates to status and condition of software product progress.
  • Lead code review initiatives and help define department wide standards and processes
  • Mentor peer and junior developers and provide leadership for implementing best practices and standards for development

Basic Qualifications:

  • Knowledge and experience with modern software development practices, including version control and workflow management tools including JIRA, Github, Gitlab, Jenkins, etc.
  • Demonstrable technical writing, documentation, and communication skills.
  • Willing to travel on behalf of company to project destinations for the purposes of business trips and installs (between overnight and 3 months stay).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Expertise in C, C++, JavaScript, C# or Python.
  • Experience with building interactive installations into physical spaces.
  • Experience with Unreal and/or Unity and game engine development
  • Familiarity with software processes such as unit testing and/or automated testing
  • Familiarity and/or experience with: Touch Designer, MS Visual Studio, RSLogix, Matlab, Robot OS (ROS), AutoDesk Maya, Motion Builder, AutoCAD
  • Proven ability to learn new programming languages and work within complicated systems.
  • Have shipped at least one software product in a professional setting internally or externally.

Required Education

  • Bachelor degree in computer science, computer engineering, or equivalent experience. Advanced degrees preferred.

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits


About Walt Disney Imagineering:

Founded in 1952 as WED Enterprises to design and build the world’s first theme park — Disneyland — Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is where imagination and creativity combine with cutting-edge technology to create unforgettable experiences. WDI is the creative force that imagines, designs and builds all Disney theme parks, resorts, attractions and cruise ships worldwide. Imagineering’s unique strength comes from its diverse global team of creative and technical professionals, who build on Disney’s legacy of storytelling to pioneer new forms of entertainment. The Imagineers who practice this unique blend of art and science work in more than 100 disciplines to shepherd an idea all the way from “blue sky” concept phase to opening day.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc., which is part of a business we call Walt Disney Imagineering.

Representing more than 150 disciplines, the talented corps of Imagineers are responsible for the creation of Disney resorts, theme parks and attractions, hotels, water parks, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, cruise ships and new media technology projects.

The WDI Technology Studio is looking for talented software developers to create and deploy the next generation of show technologies that will drive our guest experiences in upcoming attractions and venues.

Partner with project teams to define technical requirements necessary to achieve project goals.
* Software estimation, scheduling, planning, design, implementation, and closeout activities for assigned project scope. Must work closely with other technical divisions of work to ensure constructed systems (inclusive of both hardware and software) operate cooperatively and reliably over the expected usable life of the project.
* Must balance evolving technical requirements with fixed budgets and schedules, and communicate risks and options to both Studio and Project leadership in a timely fashion.
* Partner with both Studio and Project leadership to execute project goals while employing best software development practices and adhering to relevant company and industry standards.
* Develop (and lead/oversee development teams) and/or maintain multiple complex whole projects or entire pieces of software both guest facing and internal WDI facing. This includes architecture, design, and implementation.
* Work with and manage other software developers and software project leads to provide incremental and overall updates to status and condition of software product progress.
* Lead code review initiatives and help define department wide standards and processes
* Mentor peer and junior developers and provide leadership for implementing best practices and standards for development

Knowledge and experience with modern software development practices, including version control and workflow management tools including JIRA, Github, Gitlab, Jenkins, etc.
* Demonstrable technical writing, documentation, and communication skills.
* Willing to travel on behalf of company to project destinations for the purposes of business trips and installs (between overnight and 3 months stay).

Expertise in C, C++, JavaScript, C# or Python.
* Experience with building interactive installations into physical spaces.
* Experience with Unreal and/or Unity and game engine development
* Familiarity with software processes such as unit testing and/or automated testing
* Familiarity and/or experience with: Touch Designer, MS Visual Studio, RSLogix, Matlab, Robot OS (ROS), AutoDesk Maya, Motion Builder, AutoCAD
* Proven ability to learn new programming languages and work within complicated systems.
* Have shipped at least one software product in a professional setting internally or externally.
Bachelor degree in computer science, computer engineering, or equivalent experience. Advanced degrees preferred.

description:
Job Summary:

Imagine a career with an organization that brings smiles to millions every day. Imagine working with people whose passion for what they do is simply indescribable. We are The Walt Disney Company, live with a rich legacy of innovation, entertainment, and lifelong memories. With our vast array of both businesses and professionals, you’ll have the opportunity to join a team that’s beloved around the world, and to find out how it feels to love what you do. We invite you to discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you‘ve been looking for.

Marketing Science is an applied science team within The Walt Disney Studios Marketing organization. The team is interdisciplinary and cross-functional. Members of the team draw on knowledge and expertise from a wide range of academic disciplines, but primarily in areas related to applied mathematics and the social sciences, in order to advance data-driven marketing at The Walt Disney Studios. Depending on their backgrounds and interests, they may engage in market research, experimentation, forecasting, causal measurement, optimization, or data-related automation. Marketing Science is a part of The Walt Disney Studios Performance Marketing and is closely integrated with Performance Marketing operations. Members of the Marketing Science team generally learn about the advertising and marketing technologies that connect these operations in order to find opportunities to improve marketing effectiveness.

Responsibilities:

  • Oversee or carry out all aspects of quality market research, including oversee proper sampling, assign sample weights, participate in survey / research design, and validate survey programming.
  • Design innovative research studies that uncover not only consumer trends and behavior but also the beliefs, values and motivations of consumers
  • Use discrete choice models and other advanced analytic techniques to better understand the way consumers make decisions
  • Use unsupervised learning models and other advanced analytic techniques to produce and evaluate data-driven customer segmentations for various marketing purposes
  • Synthesize audience and consumer insights into compelling narratives for business stakeholders in The Walt Disney Studios Marketing organization
  • Coordinate work with other research teams at The Walt Disney Company

Basic Qualifications:

  • 7+ years of related experience/training—can be combined between professional experience and graduate-level academic training
  • 4+ years of professional experience
  • Demonstrated knowledge of media and marketing as well as a desire to learn more
  • Demonstrated knowledge of the entertainment / media industries
  • Outstanding business acumen in addition to strong technical skills
  • Proven creative problem-solving, decision-making and critical thinking skills
  • Demonstrated outstanding interpersonal skills, including ability to partner with others to handle multiple priorities in a rapidly changing environment
  • Demonstrated strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong ability to simplify complex analytics into clear recommendations that are easily understood and executable
  • Ability to work independently as well as across teams in a diverse, international, collaborative environment
  • Demonstrated strong leadership skills
  • Proven ability to organize, prioritize, and balance concurrent projects and sustainment activities
  • Proficiency in performing exploratory quantitative analysis
  • Proficiency in fitting, evaluating, and interpreting relevant statistical or machine learning models
  • Proficiency with R or Python
  • Demonstrated experience with SQL, would be an asset
  • Demonstrated experience with Tableau or other data visualization tool

Required Education

  • Bachelor's degree with significant academic exposure to formal or quantitative methods
  • Graduate degree (Master’s or Doctorate)—with significant graduate-level academic exposure to formal or quantitative methods is a strong asset
  • Demonstrated academic achievement in statistics and probability—typically involving graduate-level coursework
  • Further demonstrated academic achievement in areas related to specialization. For the market research specialization, areas might include psychology, sociology, cognitive science, or marketing. For the data science specialization, areas might include applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or computer science

Job Summary:

The WDI Apps team is an embedded product development team within the WDI Technology Studio. We are looking for Associate Product Managers to grow-with and support our various product domains. Associate PMs balance both product operations with product management. For operations, Associate PMs play an integral role in our go-to-market success, driving adoption, change management and creating a healthy product feedback loop. For product management, our Associate PMs will oversee product lanes of varying degrees within our large product initiatives.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in the research, definition, prioritization, and planning of Imagineer-facing software applications.

  • Drive communication, training, and documentation for product rollouts, updates and go-to-market success.

  • Analyze business processes, working with stakeholders to define workflows around software that we will buy or build.

  • Develop user and business metrics to evaluate success of applications, using measurements to inform product decisions.

  • Construct mockups or prototypes to test and communicate product direction.

  • Participate in purchasing, customizing, and integrating third-party systems and with existing applications internally.

  • Work with vendors and consultants in software development engagements.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Entry-level software product management acumen.

  • Direct or second-hand experience within the crossroads of entertainment and technology.

  • Strong communication skills: written, verbal, and presentational.

  • Strong passion for excellence in software development and product rigor.

Preferred Qualifications:

Familiarity and/or experience within a specific domain: content/media management, architecture and design, gaming, or mechanical engineering.

Required Education

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, and/or business administration.

About Walt Disney Imagineering:

Founded in 1952 as WED Enterprises to design and build the world’s first theme park — Disneyland — Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is where imagination and creativity combine with cutting-edge technology to create unforgettable experiences. WDI is the creative force that imagines, designs and builds all Disney theme parks, resorts, attractions and cruise ships worldwide. Imagineering’s unique strength comes from its diverse global team of creative and technical professionals, who build on Disney’s legacy of storytelling to pioneer new forms of entertainment. The Imagineers who practice this unique blend of art and science work in more than 100 disciplines to shepherd an idea all the way from “blue sky” concept phase to opening day.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc., which is part of a business we call Walt Disney Imagineering.

Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

Job Summary:

Welcome to Disney TV Animation − where imagination meets innovation! We’re home to some of the biggest animated hits on television today for Disney Channel and Disney Junior, including Big City Greens, Proud Family, and Monsters at Work; and the premiere animation studio for the Disney + streaming service. Whatever the show, our job is always about creating exciting entertainment!

Responsibilities:

Disney TV Animation is looking for a production accountant that will be responsible for managing and controlling the accounting functions of multiple animated series. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Work closely with production executives and line producers to create budget scenarios and forecasting throughout the series.

  • Animation experience a plus
  • Familiarity with IATSE 839 & SAG union payroll a plus
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills, and familiarity with Microsoft Office
  • SAP experience a plus
  • Handles confidential and sensitive information with a high degree of discretion and good judgment
  • Ability to multitask
  • Demonstrates excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Self-motivated; team player


Required Education

  • Bachelor's degree

Job Summary:

OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY

Star

Star India has defined the Indian media landscape for more than 30 years, and today is one of the country’s leading media conglomerates, reaching around 700 million viewers a month on TV across India and over 100 other countries. Star India’s channel portfolio cuts across general entertainment, films, sports, infotainment, kids, and lifestyle content across eight languages. The network generates over 20,000 hours of content every year and broadcasts 70+ channels, reaching 9 out of 10 C&S TV homes in India. The Star Sports network is one of the leading sports networks with 17 channels in its bouquet. It is home to a number of leading domestic and international sports and is making quantum leaps in transforming sports in the country, helping India become a multi-sporting nation. Disney+ Hotstar, India’s largest premium streaming platform has changed the way Indians watch their entertainment - from their favourite TV shows and movies to sporting extravaganzas. With the widest range of content in India, Disney+ Hotstar offers more than 100,000 hours of TV Shows and Movies in 8 languages, regional and national News, and coverage of every major global sporting event, including the IPL. The company is present in the Indian movie production and distribution space through Fox Star Studios. The studios is also responsible for the marketing and distribution of its Hollywood slate in the country. For more details visit us at http://www.startv.com/

JOB DESCRIPTION

CONTEXT

Responsible for making creative interventions in shows by asking for, identifying, and fleshing out sharp storytelling opportunities which will engage consumers, increase ratings and time spent on shows.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Analyze on-air and in-development shows and combine data, consumer speak and creative to sharply identify and articulate the problem statement
  • To work pre-launch under Development along with Editors (who are dealing w Producer/ Writer/ Director) on pitch, story, script, and insights of shows
  • To work with closely with Editorial and creative teams character development/ journey and reviewing conflict/ inflexion points
  • To be deeply involved in episodic story feedback for ~8-12 weeks pre-launch
  • To be continuously involved in the show post launch and intervene as and when required
  • To research templates around story character and inflexion points as needed
  • To project manage show launch timelines and red-flag interventions, as needed

PERFORMANCE MEASURES

  • Show launch TVR & TSV for the first 6-8 weeks
  • Performance on shows that they work on – TVR, TSV of shows
  • Number of break-through characters created
  • Adherence to development & launch milestones

QUALIFICATION

  • Graduate/ P.G. in any stream. Preferably Mass Media
  • Consulting/Marketing background preferred – a read of data/strategy or consumer

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Good communication: can articulate, take others along in their vision
  • Avid content consumer across platforms- books, OTT, TV, Films
  • Ability to multitask
  • Expertise and experience in content creation and/or writing; Social and political awareness – understands India deeply, soulfully; Creative imagination: ability to bring a concept alive in script/ telling

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES

  • High commitment to excellence: deep ambition to bring riveting stories, tracks, characters to life
  • Learning mindset – applying, morphing, re-applying tools & concepts
  • Dependable: Ability to marshal support & garner trust by Editors, Production Houses & external content creators

This position will support the Shanghai Disney Resort Marketing, Sales, Finance, Revenue Management & Analysis, Operations, Food and Beverage, Merchandise, Entertainment, and Walt Disney Imagineering departments by conducting consumer research.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage all phases of the market research process including identifying research needs, project design, research methodology design, analysis, and presentation of results;

Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or above;
  • 3 to 5+ years of hands-on experience in the field of consumer insights;
  • Proficiency in a variety of qualitative and quantitative research methods, with experience in future research and product innovation workshops preferred;
  • Good critical thinker able to identify core issues and design research solutions in a complex business environment;
  • Ability to apply innovative research methods to solve problems；
  • Ability to extract consumer insights from data and interviews as a means of generating business insights and recommendations, and to present research findings clearly;
  • Skilled at team communication and collaboration and able to manage conflicts of interest between parties;
  • Outstanding problem-solving skills;
  • Possessing good presentation skills;
  • Fluency in spoken and written English and Mandarin.

description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research arm of The Walt Disney Company’s (TWDC) Parks and Resorts business segment. Representing more than 150 disciplines, the talented corps of Imagineers are responsible for the creation of Disney resorts, theme parks and attractions, hotels, water parks, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, cruise ships and new media technology projects.

WDI is looking for an administrative support professional (Project Hire) to assist the WDI Project Team.

Responsibilities:

Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
  • Think ahead about little things that can turn into big problems and be proactive in finding a solution;
  • Prioritize workload according to Project deadlines and handle interruptions through-out the day with an approachable attitude and assist Project Team when an emergency arises;
  • Use teamwork to do the job better, faster, smarter;
  • Plan events like birthdays, service anniversary recognition parties, lunch-and-learns and team-building activities;
  • Assist with on-boarding new employees – you’ll be the “friendly face” that newbies count on to answer all their questions;
  • Schedule meetings, along with reserving a conference room, for the Project Team. In most cases (given the bi-coastal nature of the project), set-up meeting with Zoom video calls;
  • Develop working knowledge of conference room systems and assist Project Team when needed;
  • Order food for breakfast/lunch meetings and assist with set-up/clean-up;
  • Assist in planning Team events, including in-office functions, virtual gatherings (via Zoom), and remote events (at/near Disneyland Resort, at/near Glendale offices, etc);
  • Via Concur and American Express, book travel for Project Team as well as RSR requests for contractors and vendors as needed. Prior to booking any travel, ensure Travel Authorization has been signed and approved by the Project Team Leadership and Finance. Also secure required job number for expensing;
  • Via Concur, complete expense reports on behalf of Team members;
  • Enter backstage gate clearances into EZ Lobby as requested by Project Team;
  • If requested, take meeting notes for any Project Team meeting;
  • Work with Direct Leader to incorporate additions, changes, or deletions within the Project Team into seating arrangements and tap access into the building;
  • Obtain Green Badges for Project Contractors, Independent Contractors, and Vendors;
  • Generate Purchase Orders and check requests, as needed, in SAP;
  • Make an inventory of the office supplies, then devise a more efficient way to keep things in stock for your specific Project Team;
  • Adhere to Project Intellectual Protection Guidelines by watermarking confidential documents, posting onto Project Team BOX sites, as needed, and securing/shredding documents left at printers, plotters, or conference rooms;
  • Enter your time into required system (SAP or IQN) on a weekly basis by following the company’s guideline for Accurate Time Recording; and
  • Complete all required Computer Based Training in D-Learn in a timely manner.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum two years in a Secretary role;
  • Strong organizational and follow-through skills, orderly and detail-oriented with ability to handle multiple work streams simultaneously, prioritize work and accurately and efficiently archive documents and work products Ability to appropriately respond to and resolve issues with little direction;
  • Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills to assure professional interaction with senior executives, internal partners, and external contacts;
  • Strong command of English grammar skills with an ability to prepare correspondence from notes, meetings and author documents and reports;
  • Ability to work effectively in a team environment;
  • Ability to manage time wisely and prioritize effectively;
  • Ability to anticipate needs, take initiative, proactively solve problems and use sound judgment;
  • Demonstrated ability to handle confidential and sensitive information;
  • Enthusiastic attitude and strong work ethic; and
  • Strong computer/technology skills, including but not limited to Microsoft Outlook, Concur, SAP (T&E, Life Events, Time Processor, Employee ESS, Casual Buyer), Internet Explorer and internet-based research, and video teleconferencing systems and services.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Administrative experience in a corporate environment with proven success interacting, partnering and networking with all levels of management in a fast-paced dynamic environment.

Required Education

High school diploma or equivalent

Preferred Education

Bachelor's degree or equivalent

Additional Information:

This is a temporary assignment with no guarantee of placement.
