description:
Job Summary:

Disney Streaming Services is changing how people watch movies, shows, sports and live events. Our mission is to create the best entertainment experience and push the envelope of what’s possible. It’s an incredibly exciting time to work in streaming media as more content creators seek how to engage their audience with compelling user experiences. The design team has a pivotal role in giving form to those ideas and continually improving these apps that people use every day.

The DSS design team is a growing practice of multi-disciplinary creators and storytellers. We are passionate about building high-quality, innovative and authentic experiences that connect people with the content they love. We work where art meets science, exploring ideas by using the power of design to make the invisible visible. We believe in doing things that matter, cultivating a culture of diverse perspectives and collaboration. We celebrate our wins, but never settle.

We are looking for a Product Design Manager, Globalization to join our expanding International team. This is an opportunity to collaborate with the very best in design, product and technology to help shape industry-leading products used by millions across the world.

Responsibilities:

As a Product Design Manager, Globalization, you will:
● Lead a team of 2-4 designers, ranging from mid- to principal-level
● Coach the team through product ideation and development using a mature, modern design process
● Contribute to execution of hands-on design work as-needed, while balancing people management duties
● Facilitate the successful delivery of design from concept to deployment
● Design complex, multi-platform interfaces using tools like Sketch, Abstract, Zeplin, Invision, and Figma
● Demonstrate full stack expertise in UX/UI design
● Domain expert for all designs owned by your team, able to speak to all aspects of your team’s projects in a crisp and comprehensive manner
● Demonstrate deep knowledge of device platform best practices and guidelines
● Represent the team and their work to stakeholders and external collaborators
● Collaborate with peers in research, product, engineering, and marketing on cross-functional projects from start to finish
● Lead your team in mapping out their career development path, and course correct their development, using regular 1:1 meetings and semi-annual reviews
● Keeping up with industry trends, you’ll identify areas for improvement for the overall product design team covering people, process, and practice.
● Partner with the DesignOps team in creating an action plan

Basic Qualifications:

● 8+ years of experience as a designer working on consumer products, including 2+ years of managing a team
● Experience leading and managing a team of designers through at least one full product development cycle
● Experience designing global products, with knowledge of localization, regional and cultural considerations
● A high level of creative craftsmanship, translating strategies, theories and Design principles into inspiring concepts and successful executions
● A strong interest in visual storytelling, and an innate curiosity about people and their relationship to entertainment
● The discipline to prioritize work and resources across engagements based on short and long-term needs, adept at removing roadblocks and rebalancing as needed
● A growth mindset - you see opportunity in ambiguity
● Comfort in scaling and as needed, ability to recruit talent that meet and exceed the DSS talent bar
● A sense of determination - leading product development with new ideas based on a strong sense of our customers, their goals, our content, and our value proposition
● An ease in presenting design work to a variety of audiences
● A passion for evolving the design practice – its people, processes, and tools
● Experience with various design tools - Sketch, Abstract, Invision, Figma, prototyping tools

Preferred Qualifications:

● Bonus: Experience designing for and/or fluency in Hebrew, Arabic, or CJK (Chinese, Japanese, Korean)

Additional Information:

About Disney Streaming Services
Disney Streaming Services is a business unit within The Walt Disney Company’s Direct-to-Consumer and International (DTCI) segment that oversees all consumer-facing digital video subscription services across the company. Disney Streaming is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including the ESPN+ premium sports streaming service, programmed in conjunction with ESPN; the upcoming Disney SVOD service (which will include content from Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic, and Fox); and other popular services. Its core mission is to
deliver global audiences the freedom to access their favorite content on their terms across any connected device, time or location.

About The Walt Disney Company
The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.
This position is with Disney Streaming Technology, LLC, which is part of a business segment we call Disney Streaming Services.

Imagine a career with an organization that brings smiles to millions every day. Imagine working with people whose passion for what they do is simply indescribable. We are The Walt Disney Company, live with a rich legacy of innovation, entertainment, and lifelong memories. With our vast array of both businesses and professionals, you’ll have the opportunity to join a team that’s beloved around the world, and to find out how it feels to love what you do. We invite you to discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you‘ve been looking for.

Disney Streaming Services is an equal opportunity employer –
Female/Minority/Veteran/Disability. Our goal is to create an inclusive workplace for all.

description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of The Walt Disney Company. Its talented corps of Imagineers is responsible for the creation - from concept initiation through installation - of all Disney Resorts, theme parks and attractions, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, and new media projects.

What we’re looking for…
A Set Decoration Intern who will work within the department that provides set decoration services for all areas our guests see when they enter our parks. This includes attractions, retail spaces, restaurant spaces, display areas, landscape, facades and area development. The staff of the Set Decoration Department interfaces and supports other WDI divisions as well as departments within our parks including Creative, Architectural, Engineering, Show Art, Show Ride, Park Operations and Park Maintenance. The Set Decorator amplifies and embellishes the story. It is the mission of the Set Decoration Department to create highly entertaining environments in which the magic of each Disney story is possible.

Responsibilities:

You will…
  • Support the design, production and installation effort as directed by the Principal and Senior Set Decorator Leads for the project
  • Interface and coordinate with other show related disciplines
  • Support design development and communicate design concepts
  • Maintain paperwork associated with the design effort
  • Interface with other disciplines to ensure placement of props and decorations
  • Assist in field installation of props and dressings when required
  • Research historical information and design technologies in support of design effort
  • Work with manager in order to adhere to budget and schedule
  • Support mock-ups and presentations including set-ups and strikes
  • Document the implemented design

Basic Qualifications:

What you bring to the role…
  • Ability to work within a team environment and at the direction of Senior and Principal Designers
  • A working knowledge of props or set decoration for theatre, film or television
  • Knowledge of storytelling with objects
  • Ability to work at heights above 30’ if needed
  • Ability to lift 15 to 20 pounds
  • Experience working with hand tools
  • Ability to periodically work third shift after the park closes
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word
  • Previous experience in the technical aspects of Theater Arts and its associated skills
  • Must be able to read architectural drawing packages
  • Working knowledge of construction materials, hardware, and tools
  • **Valid Driver’s License required**

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Working knowledge of Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Previous WDI internship or other Disney experience
  • Working knowledge of SketchUp

Required Education

  • Currently enrolled as a Junior or higher, or must have graduated from an accredited college/university within the past 6 months, earning a degree in in Interior/Retail Design, Technical Theater, Dimensional Design, Architectural modelling, Applied Media Arts or a closely related field

Additional Information:

Internship Eligibility:
  • At the time of application, must be enrolled in an accredited college/university taking at least one class in the semester/quarter (spring/fall) prior to participation in the internship program OR must have graduated from a college/university within 6 months OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Professional Internship
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must not have completed one year of continual employment on a Disney internship or program
  • Must possess unrestricted work authorization
  • Must provide full work availability
  • Must provide own transportation to/from work location
  • Must be able to provide own housing for the duration of the internship
  • Must have valid US driver's license.
  • Current Active Disney cast members must meet Professional Internship transfer guidelines (for Walt Disney World cast members this is no more than four points and one reprimand in the last six months; for Disneyland cast members this is six months of consecutive service and a performance record clear of any disciplinary issues (warnings, suspensions, etc.) for at least six months)

Program Length:
  • The approximate dates of this internship are June/July 2022 through early January 2023. Interns must be fully available for the duration of the internship.
Required Materials:
  • A portfolio review is required for this position. For full consideration, please include a link to your portfolio on your résumé. Applicants without a portfolio link on their résumé, will not be considered a completed application packet and may not be fully considered for the position.

We are The Walt Disney Company, live with a rich legacy of innovation, entertainment, and lifelong memories. With our vast array of both businesses and professionals, you’ll have the opportunity to join a team that’s beloved around the world, and to find out how it feels to love what you do. We invite you to discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you‘ve been looking for.

The rapidly growing Consumer Identity team is seeking an experienced and passionate product leader. The Consumer Profiles and Identity team is responsible for identity creation and identity management experiences that power Disney+, ESPN+, Hulu and hundreds of other digital products across The Walt Disney Company.

You will be responsible for painting the long-term Identity vision for Disney customers, while also driving tactical needs and projects that move our experiences forward, unlocking business value. You are seen as a thought leader that the team and cross-functional partners seek for guidance, delivering a global experience that creates the new benchmark in the industry that others will look to emulate.

You will inform the direction and represent the Global Identity products used across The Walt Disney Company. You are a proven leader in Product Identity, tenacious in driving a vision that delights and unlocks the hidden values and increases business metrics. You lead by being authentic, looking at data to find truths, setting clear priorities and encouraging accountability. Collaborative skills come naturally allowing you to engage across the organization bringing stakeholders together.

Responsibilities:

  • Define and deliver the ongoing product strategy for a global Identity product that reaches across all Disney experiences
  • Be single minded in the delivery of experiences that balance the need to securely Identify users while being seamless, secure and simple
  • Ensure Disney services provide a safe and secure experiences for users, delivering innovative ways for sign-up and authentication that remove barriers for all stakeholders
  • Create the Northstar while factoring in user experiences, opportunities and solving business unit pains
  • Translate long term goals into short term tactical features
  • Collaborate with internal partners and stakeholders to delivery the vision and drive at continually moving the Identity strategy forward
  • Capture and help solve stakeholders needs, fears, and directions from across the organization and distill them into a roadmap of winning features and products.
  • Get lost in the data and research and emerge with best practice and identify new opportunities to support the ongoing vision and innovation in Identity
  • Continue to build the global team of Identity product specialists, that others envy and lead them to success
  • Define the team and organizational benchmarks that help inform the direction and set the standard by which you will measure success
  • Don’t follow the crowd in the industry; innovation for the user is what drives you in setting the future for Identity at Disney

Basic Qualifications:

  • High leadership EQ, looks to empower and support other leading to shared success
  • Removes barriers to support the culture of share ownership balanced with accountability
  • Subject matter expert in the field of Identity Product, Digital Identity or Authentication Products

It’s hard to define and even harder to create, but that’s what we do at The Walt Disney Studios. Ours is a culture of innovation, collaboration and creativity. We raise the bar, then step over it, blazing trails through the production and distribution of world-class entertainment around the globe. If you want to help tell compelling, enduring stories through movies, music or stage plays, then we want to hear from you.

The Walt Disney Company

Imagine a career with an organization that brings smiles to millions every day. Imagine working with people whose passion for what they do is simply indescribable. We are The Walt Disney Company, live with a rich legacy of innovation, entertainment, and lifelong memories. With our vast array of both businesses and professionals, you’ll have the opportunity to join a team that’s beloved around the world, and to find out how it feels to love what you do. Studio Operations is comprised of multiple disciplines related to the postproduction of our films. This includes localizing formats for global theatrical release, ensuring consistency and continuity in the voice and representation of our characters in media formats worldwide, ensuring secure delivery of films to exhibitors, retailers, and homes worldwide, converting of classic film content into digital formats, and managing of all Walt Disney Studios production and postproduction facilities (including sound stages and the Digital Studio).

The Health & Safety Supervisor will collaborate and partner with Studio Publicity and Marketing teams to ensure that COVID-19 requirements are incorporated and implemented for all marketing & publicity events and creative content marketing productions. The individual will report to the Health & Safety Director, Marketing & Publicity Events.

Responsibilities:

  • Point of contact for marketing & publicity events and/or creative content marketing productions (i.e. EPKs, Photoshoots, etc.) COVID protocols, including reviewing and advising on event plans (to include, but not limited to, venue set up, capacity, test scheduling, etc.).
  • Review day-of event processes to ensure required social distancing procedures are in place
  • Work with marketing and publicity teams on scheduling and management of COVID testing. This includes organizing travel related and event related testing.
  • Schedule and track testing in partnership with regional testing teams
  • Implement The Walt Disney Studio’s on site COVID protocols for marketing and publicity events.
  • Manage, in partnership with Disney Employee Relations, the management of all positive COVID cases of all employees and crew.
  • Establish plans to distribute protective equipment for events and travel
  • Work closely with the Health & Safety team to research new trends, technology, and best practices in production health and wellness
  • Enforce Studio policies and protocols on-set and during planned events, in conjunction with leadership
  • Provide reports to management regarding concerns, violations, and compliance

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience working on set with feature or television production or event management (events of various size and level of complexity)
  • Ability to adapt to varying work environments and responsibilities with a strong proactive work ethic
  • Ability to assess and escalate issues to avoid safety concerns
  • Ability to work well in a team environment, communicating in a professional manner under all circumstances
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Proven strong organizational skills including logistics, time management and scheduling
  • Must be a people person who can manage with confidence, and maintain policy/protocol
  • Must be comfortable speaking to groups and provide health & safety training
  • Highly creative and driven to problem solve
  • Have a willingness to travel and keep a flexible schedule (work on a production/event schedule)

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Basic knowledge of safety and health standards and regulations.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office Software: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.
  • Desire to continue development of technical skills and industry knowledge.

The Associate Project Manager, Repurposing, is a full time position which involves working with a fast-paced team delivering Walt Disney Pictures content as versions mainly to broadcast distribution models such as network, cable, & syndication. With incredible content and the high quality brand of Walt Disney products, we deliver a high volume of 400-750 TV versions a year to clients like USA, F/X, Turner, CNG Networks, A&E, IFC, etc. This role is responsible for supervising and executing the assessment & preparation of editorial bandwidth requirements and overseeing asset management, internal and external communications, and assists in scheduling.

Responsibilities:

  • Top notch organizational skills, ability to take direction and give orders as needed and collaborate to meet specific client needs, budgets, and timelines.
  • Ensure all elements / materials are located and delivered to appropriate vendors.
  • Research Inventory and ensure appropriate elements are located, selected, and moved to the appropriate vendors.
  • Serve as liaison to inventory management to assure proper retention of all elements.
  • Scheduling and tracking of show deliverables from start to finish with the ability to report any title status at any time for delivery timing and evaluation.
  • Notification to directors, producers, etc. of any changes, estimated cuts, or BS&P requirements.
  • As needed scheduling of stages, talent / hiring of additional weekly editors and rental equipment to meet the demands of the clients.
  • Coordinate and oversee Dubbing Orders including transfers, creation and delivery of various titles, screeners, promos, air clones, captioning, etc.
  • Working collaboratively with the post production team, editors, outside vendors and internal and external clients to ensure projects are completed as expected.
  • Work independently and with teams, able to decipher problems and create solutions.
  • Interface with legal regarding talent rights and ability to confirm with editorial talent all cuts and changes for proper approvals and future tracking.
  • Manage time effectively and learn quickly, stay calm under pressure and excel in fast-paced project timeframes.
  • Assist in responding to content delivery requests by maintaining familiarity with various technologies.
  • Receive, evaluate and approve Purchase Orders/ invoices from vendors.
  • Coordinate ordering of television end credits per legal.
  • Partner with Mastering and Airline / Non-theatrical (and all other pertinent departments) to ensure that future alternative footage is available to TV editorial in the future.

Basic Qualifications:

  • 3+ years combined post-production coordination experience, and TV Editorial / digital.
  • Self-driven and able to complete tasks with minimal guidance if necessary. Demonstrates ability to multitask, prioritize, and hit deadlines with superior organization skills and communication.
  • Background in film and television production, and / or in digital content with a working knowledge of Network acceptable standards and practices.
  • Ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities in a deadline-driven / changing environment.
  • Productivity-focused and proven to be a quick problem solver, with ability to overcome technical challenges as necessary.
  • Knowledge with a variety of post-production formats & software including: AVID, Final Cut, Quicktime, FTP knowledge, and a variety of video codecs and distribution specifications a plus.
  • Experience with Excel, Word, SAP, FileMaker. Any other scheduling software not necessary but may be necessary.
  • Understanding of mastering and localization.
  • Understanding of basic formats, frame rates, etc.

Our business is responsible for the creative advertising, research, media, publicity and promotion of every movie released theatrically by the Walt Disney Studios – Disney Live Action, Marvel, Lucasfilm, Disney Animation, Pixar, Disneynature, and 20thCentury Fox. And we’re now excited to add to our portfolio, support of our new streaming service, Disney+.

Creative Advertising is responsible for the development, creation and execution of all creative audiovisual marketing materials for theatrically released live-action and animated films and streaming content. We determine how to strategically position and market each film within the U.S. as well as assist the International team in creating materials for territories abroad. We also serve as a creative and strategic conduit through which many departments/divisions within the company come for assistance in creating materials, creative direction or approval. These special relationships are crucial to ensure that one unified campaign is communicated to the public. We work closely with every department within WDSMP and WDSMPI – including creative content, publicity, media, synergy, national promotions, online marketing, and distribution; Disney divisions include Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution, Parks, Experiences & Products, Walt Disney Records, Disney Channel, etc. We also maintain collaborative relationships with our partners in Walt Disney Animation Studios, Pixar Animation Studios, Marvel, Lucas Film, Disney+, and 20thCentury Fox.

This Manager, Creative Advertising role will report directly to the SVP and work across our varied slate of titles.

Responsibilities:

  • Support the SVP and their team with the strategic planning, development and creative execution of worldwide audiovisual advertising campaigns as well as management of creative and finishing processes.
  • Lead creative special projects with various partners and stakeholders.
  • Demonstrate a creative point of view and perspective.
  • Collaborate with & manage A/V agencies on creation of materials (trailers, tv ads, radio, out-of-home A/V, digital creative, clips, internal presentation reels, etc.) for theatrical and Disney+ titles.
  • Oversee the A/V finishing process (creative, music, legal, and clearances), providing final asset approvals and monitoring final delivery.
  • Serve as a connector amongst the leadership team and stakeholders, providing real-time updates and proactive communication.
  • Effectively manage and track work-streams to ensure progress towards deadlines and deliverables.
  • Attend meetings and partner with relevant stakeholders to obtain, organize and equip the SVP with timely and pertinent information to drive informed decision-making.
  • Assist in campaign presentations to filmmakers, showrunners, studio executives, internal teams, external partners, etc., including meeting prep and running A/V during meetings.
  • Effectively track and organize a high volume of incoming and outgoing materials (both rough and finished A/V, strategy decks, scripts, promotional partnership material, assets etc.) in a timely and secure manner.
  • Primary contact for all incoming requests from Marketing and other LOB/segments both within the company and externally using best practices to communicate clearly and effectively, exercising good judgement and discretion, and problem solving when required.
  • Point person for vendor communication/asset management, including but not limited to, managing all aspects of vendor onboarding, asset sharing (footage, music, graphics, etc.), accounts payable set-up, and asset delivery methods.
  • When required, oversee transfer of sensitive and confidential materials (including materials for filmmaker approval & legal clearances) enforcing security protocols.
  • Handle all invoice approvals and allocations and keep track of budget spend.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of marketing/advertising experience preferred
  • 5+ years of experience in the creation of audiovisual materials – preferably within the entertainment industry
  • Audiovisual production and finishing experience/knowledge required
  • Experience interfacing with high level executives and filmmakers
  • Advanced experience in project management, understanding of financials and vendor management
  • Passion for advertising, creativity, design and storytelling
  • Extremely creative with an eye for details
  • Expert project management skills with a track record of driving results—well-organized with the ability to manage multiple projects and demonstrate resilience, adjusting quickly to shifting priorities and ambiguity
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the proven ability to build relationships, influence decisions, and drive results through partnerships
  • Effective problem solving and communication skills, leveraging resources available to achieve end result.
  • Demonstrated ability to be proactive and resourceful
  • Team player who can discern when to act independently
  • Strong understanding of copywriting
  • Represents the team in a professional manner when working with other offices, executives, and filmmakers, as well as business unit contacts and external partners
  • Ability to maintain the highest standards of strict confidentiality with respect to all matters, documents, and verbal and written correspondence
  • Comfortable with working extended hours and sometimes weekends

Marketing Science - a subset of marketing analytics - at Disney Streaming Services (Hulu, Disney+, ESPN+ and Star) is in search of an executive director to lead the advanced analytics practice in support of our marketing and finance departments. This position is responsible for analytic / econometric modeling efforts, as well as ancillary downstream practices used to inform marketing spend, such as budget allocation, simulation, channel experimentation and forecasting.

The executive director will lead a team focused on building and scaling the media mix modeling (MMM) practice in coordination with data science, data engineering and data product, with a goal toward implementing a scalable, productionalized model that helps efficiently maximize subscriber growth across platforms. The ideal candidate has a strong quantitative background with direct experience with marketing science practices (MMM, attribution modeling, testing / experimentation, etc.), while being a strong collaborator and partner to business operators and internal teams across the data department.

Responsibilities:

  • Define and and evolve the roadmap for MMM across streaming services in close partnership with marketing and finance leadership (including regional leads), and with close consult with data engineering and data product teams
  • Run and oversee modeling efforts for individual streaming services and their applications to mix optimization, attribution, targeting and experimentation
  • Partner with finance and marketing executives to determine the ROI of marketing spend and optimal spend levels, identify hurdle rates by channel, set budget amounts and inform subscriber acquisition forecasts
  • Provide direct leadership and mentorship to analysts carrying out modeling and other analytics efforts to foster upward internal mobility and expansion of skills
  • Conduct ad hoc strategic analysis to provide recommendations that help drive increased return on spend through shifts in mix, flighting, messaging and tactics, and that help reinforce MMM results
  • Partner with other data teams as well as marketing and finance to design and execute experiments to move recommendations forward based on company goals (e.g., subscriber growth, LTV, etc)
  • Develop plans for long-term MMM (et.al.) automation, productionalization and scale with support from data engineering and product
  • Build out front-end reporting and dashboarding in partnership with data product managers and data engineers to communicate performance metrics across services, markets, channels and subscriber types

Basic Qualifications:

  • 10+ years of experience in a marketing science / analytics role with a deep understanding of measurement and optimization, with direct analytics leadership experience
  • Deep understanding of econometric modeling and how to apply models to measure marketing efficiency and optimize spend, flighting and mix to maximize return on ad spend (i.e., MMM)
  • Hands-on experience building out measurement frameworks combining descriptive analytics, modeled insights and causal inference to make tactical recommendations for media optimization
  • Experience with attribution platforms for both digital and linear media, the data required to power them and methodologies for measurement
  • Understanding of how to design and execute incrementality experiments to validate model recommendations and gain learnings on channel/publisher efficacy
  • Strategic mindset with a strong understanding of utilizing data to solve high-stakes problems in the marketing space
  • Familiarity with BI/data concepts and experience building out self-service marketing data solutions
  • Familiarity with marketing technology concepts and tools (e.g., DMP, CDP, web analytics, identity resolution, programmatic ad serving, data integration) a plus

Its core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access their favorite content on their terms across any connected device, time or location.

As the Director of Product Management, Partner Growth, your job is to build and lead a team of experts within the D&D product organization focused on growth through B2B2C partnerships.

This role is a part of the Devices and Distribution (D&D) team, a growing product organization within Disney Streaming Services that is focused on leveraging and shaping the rapidly growing landscape of consumer devices and services.

The D&D charter is to:
  • Deliver broad subscriber reach on existing and new consumer devices
  • Accelerate international growth for our services by leveraging global distribution partnerships and integrated marketing, promotion and payment opportunities.
  • Drive a quality, localized experience for international users.
  • Innovate on the user, device and partner lifecycle to drive incremental discovery, signup, engagement and retention.
  • Influence the evolution of partner platform roadmaps to benefit and support our rich user experiences
In success, you would have stood up a team, north star, goals and a roadmap that ensures we maximize our customer reach via distribution partners, with a quality experience spanning marketing, sign-up, payment, sign-in, content discovery and viewing. Altogether this would result in material positive business impact, as measured in incremental subscribers and revenue.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute a multi-year north star, goals and product roadmap for integrating Disney streaming services into devices, and service offerings from TV, Internet and Mobile operators worldwide.
  • Connect partner product operations with global and regional Disney teams and help streamline partner lifecycle management across all teams in the company.
  • Operate a suite of self-service tools to enable external distribution partners to rapidly bring a multitude of offers to market with our streaming products fully integrated into their devices, billing, payments, promotions and marketing.
  • Ensure a consistent user experience by validating that product requirements are satisfied, primarily through automated and self-service workflows.
  • Enable centralized device source-of-truth, lifecycle management, and reporting systems.
  • Support a global partner and device lifecycle management system and leverage process automation for business rules and to monitor exceptions.

Basic Qualifications:

  • You have defined growth initiatives, product vision, goals and roadmaps at Director-level scope.
  • You have worked with device or service providers to deliver integrated consumer experiences (B2B2C). Pay TV or Wireless/wired operator integration experience is a plus.
  • You are adept at user-centric and data-driven design and navigating trade-offs.
  • You are experienced at negotiating global product requirements and integrations with Mobile, TV, and MSO operators and their vendors.
  • You have collaborated effectively with engineering and have defined technical requirements.
  • Ideally you have previously worked on streaming video, music, or entertainment products.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Driving subscription growth through B2B2C partners/resellers for bundles and add-on products
  • Negotiating and growing partner product integrations globally
  • Managing device partner ecosystems, app stores or digital marketplaces
  • Operational excellence in defining and delivering projects end-to-end across:
  1. Partner segments, e.g. Cable, Satellite, Telcos, ISPs
  2. Platform roadmaps, e.g. new launches, SKU extensions, and optimizations
  3. Business verticals, e.g. Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+ and Star+
  4. Markets and regions, e.g. commercial and marketing local/regional teams

Required Education

  • Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent

Additional Information:

Disney Streaming Services is an equal opportunity employer – Female/Minority/Veteran/Disability. Our goal is to create an inclusive workplace for all.

description:
Job Summary:

Disney Parks, Experiences and Products (DPEP) brings stories and characters to life through innovative and engaging physical products and digital experiences across more than 100 categories, from toys and t-shirts to apps, books, console games and much more. The business is home to world-class teams of app and game developers, licensing and retail experts, leading retail and e-commerce businesses – Disney store and shopDisney.com – as well as renowned artists, storytellers and technologists who inspire imaginations around the world.

Disney Publishing Worldwide develops original, award-winning Learning and Storytelling content for Disney, Marvel, Lucas and own-created brands, which fuels both DPEP and TWDC. It is considered the largest children’s publishing brand in the world.
We are seeking an experienced Senior Manager of Finance to lead the FP&A and ad hoc analysis functions of the Vertical businesses within Disney Publishing Worldwide.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead planning across key business cycles: Long-Term Strategic Plan, Annual Operating Plan, Monthly Forecasts and Quarter Close
  • Drive business performance presentations to Publishing and Consumer Products/DPEP Executive teams
  • Oversee all aspects of the P&L, including revenues, costs, and managed operating income
  • Collaborate closely with Controllership in understanding cost drivers and balance sheet activities, including inventory management
  • Review title/program profitability and NPV analysis in support of greenlighting process
  • Provide decision support through value-added analysis, and insights into planning and risk analysis
  • Be the key finance partner to Vertical Leadership team across Hyperion, Disney Presses, and Nat Geo
  • Identify opportunities and drive ad hoc projects to support business growth strategies
  • Oversee implementation of new processes, systems and structures to meet the growing needs of the business
  • Build key relationships across lines of business to coordinate best practice sharing and roll-up of financial deliverables for key cycles
  • Lead a team of 5, including 3 managers
  • Report directly to Director of Finance

Basic Qualifications:

  • 8+ years of Financial, Planning & Analysis work experience; MBA a plus
  • Experience in managing and developing high performance team
  • Demonstrate professional excellence, integrity and dependability
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills applying strategic thinking as well as an understanding of execution needs
  • Intellectually curious and able to diplomatically challenge the status quo
  • Advance proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, COGNOS and SAP
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Understanding of balance sheet, income statement and cash flow drivers
  • Ability to work effectively with all levels of management, including partnering with Senior Executives and be a trusted and reliable source of information, analysis and support
  • Able to work autonomously, take directions and inputs from partners locally and remotely
  • Willingness to take on initiatives and learn new systems and applications

description:
Job Summary:

The Superintendent supervises and coordinates all on-site construction activities through installation on a project or multiple projects. The Superintendent monitors quality and safety in the field and provides technical expertise and ensures work meets quality requirements of contract documents, applicable codes and Disney standards. The Superintendent will coordinate work with contractors, operations, vendors and governmental agencies.

You will report to the Senior Manager, Construction

Responsibilities:

  • Supervise and coordinate on-site construction activities.
  • Take the lead on ensuring Walt Disney Attractions quality in the field.
  • Manage the safety program in close coordination with Walt Disney Attractions Safety.
  • Arbitrates on-site conflicts between contractors
  • Provide constructability analysis and value engineering recommendations
  • Identify applicable points of coordination at multiple levels
  • Assure contractor compliance and contract drawings/specifications and review/approve contractor's project schedule
  • Prepare site logistics plan
  • Set up staging field location, coordinate with Walt Disney Attractions operations as applicable
  • Verify existing site conditions against design documents
  • Ensure work in place meets quality requirements of contract documents, applicable codes and Disney standards
  • Review and monitor project schedule including 3-week look ahead schedules. Provide evaluation to the appropriate person
  • Prepare daily log of contractor work activities and compare against contractor's daily reports. Track personnel on site, equipment used and progress
  • Coordinate site access and work with contractor(s), operations, vendors and governmental agencies. Discuss issues with Construction Manager
  • Monitor "testing agency" activities and ensure coverage on site
  • Coordinate with Construction Manager and design team, review submittals and site delivered materials for compliance to contract documents.
  • Ensure coordination between facility departments (Walt Disney Imagineering & Walt Disney Attractions).

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 7 years job related field experience in applicable site development (attractions, commercial, residential, retail, or resort development projects). Emphasis in mechanical, electrical and plumbing.
  • Communicate effectively with management, contractors and field personnel, consultants and operator.
  • Manage competing priorities on a complex construction site.
  • Provide technical expertise in construction activities to ensure adherence to quality standards.
  • Build working relationships with contractors, sub-contractors, consultants, to achieve successful completion of projects, on time, under budget, and to client quality expectations.
  • Conflict management ability.
  • Manage multiple relationships and personalities.
  • Project environment is extremely diverse and requires a depth of character and social excellence. Projects are dynamic and require daily partnership with WDW Operations, WDW Engineering Services, & Regulatory Agencies, etc.

Required Education

  • High school degree or equivalent

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

description:
Job Summary:

Disney Streaming is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company's direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including the ESPN+ premium sports streaming service; Star+ which brings live sports and general entertainment exclusively to the Latin America region; and Disney+, the dedicated streaming home for entertainment from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic. Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. We serve consumers by bringing the world's most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. We strive daily to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives consumers the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location.

The Media Operations Department at Disney Streaming Services consists of agile and responsive teams of technicians that perform the daily processes and procedures of our live and on-demand streaming video products. The department's responsibilities consist of round-the-clock support for these products, ensuring proper functionality across all platforms.

The Streaming Media Assistant is part of a streaming Media Operations team staffed 24/7. SMA's routinely provide live, hands-on operational and procedural support for our partner products, including system health monitoring and incident management, in addition to live and VOD streaming media orchestration using proprietary software.

Responsibilities:

  • Must be available to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends, and holidays.
  • Strong understanding of computers and applications.
  • Must have an exemplary attention to detail.
  • Must possess strong communication skills, including written and verbal.
  • Must possess solid organizational skills.
  • Must be able to learn quickly and adapt to new situations.
  • Must have a strong ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced, time-sensitive environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • A solid computer and technical background, with experience working in digital media and online organizations.
  • Familiarity with streaming and broadcast media, particularly HTTP Live Streaming (HLS)
  • A team player who is enthusiastic with a strong work ethic.
  • Ability to troubleshoot efficiently.
  • 1-2 years of relevant working experience.

description:
Job Summary:

The vision of the Walt Disney World Marketing Strategy organization is to be the most imaginative marketers of immersive entertainment, inspiring people worldwide to make their Disney dreams come true. Our ultimate objective is to create consumer demand, visitation, and revenue goals for the Walt Disney World Resort by developing strategies and communication plans to reach and influence the consumer mindset and behavior. As the Multicultural Marketing Strategy Associate, you will work with multiples teams to determine needs. Diversity and inclusion are top priorities for us, and you will play an important role in this area by supporting the development of the consumer strategies, creative campaigns, and communication plans that support the Disney consumer needs.


You will report to Sr. Manager - Marketing Strategy.

Responsibilities:

  • Support a team of multicultural marketers in developing marketing strategies to achieve our goals
  • Assist in developing strategic input to guide the marketing plan development
  • Support the planning and execution of direct-to-consumer experiential activations for multicultural audiences
  • Champion communication plan development with a cross-functional team
  • Help evaluate campaign creative
  • Monitor and optimize campaign performance
  • Work with Consumer Insight team to understand audience opportunities, trends, motivators and barriers
  • Develop after action reviews
  • Keep a pulse on multicultural audience segment sentiments while maintaining awareness of current events and trends relevant to the segment

Basic Qualifications:

  • 3–5years of relevant work experience
  • Understanding of new media landscape and capabilities, with partners reaching the multicultural audiences
  • Demonstrated marketing skills to develop strategic input, business cases and marketing communication plans
  • Experience in strategic planning and project management
  • Partnership and relationship building skills and handling multiple projects
  • Work with Consumer Insight team to understand multicultural audience opportunities, motivators, and barriers
  • Work with Revenue Management & Analytics, Consumer Insight and Marketing Analytics, Commercial Strategy and Operations to identify needs
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and presentation development

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in multicultural marketing, marketing strategy, consumer packaged goods (CPG), advertising agency and/or brand management
  • Experience with National level campaigns and marketing target audience expertise, specifically multicultural audiences
  • Previous experience marketing entertainment brands or experiences
  • Previous experience with product development and new product launches
  • Experience leading and implementing strategic roadmaps
  • Previous work experience in planning and executing live experiential marketing activations
  • Spanish language proficiency

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s in Marketing, Communications, or related field

Preferred Education

  • MBA, or Master’s in Marketing, Communications, or related field

Additional Information:

Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

description:
Job Summary:

Welcome to Disney Branded Television / Freeform / Onyx Collective − where imagination meets innovation! We’re home to Freeform, Disney Channel, Disney XD, and Disney Junior which encompass many of the hottest, hippest shows on television. Disney Channel alone has produced some of the biggest hits on television today, including the phenomenal Descendants franchise and the hit series, Bunk’d. Whatever the show, our job is always about creating exciting entertainment!

The Disney Branded Television / Freeform Production Finance Department is responsible for the financial management of all of our television series, MOW’s, pilots and specials. We interact with many other Disney Television departments on a daily basis.

Responsibilities:

• Responsible for processing various prep, and post accounting payments related to various projects.
• Process and manage all development payments including overall deals.
• Ensure payments have appropriate fringe applied.
• Manage payments with third party accounting team, as applicable.
• Produce requested production finance deliverables including: ledger bibles, cost reports, balance sheets, check registers, and purchase orders, to ensure accuracy and strict policy adherence.
• Ensure payments are correctly recorded in SAP. Ensure discrepancies are resolved.
• Ensure that production cost information is properly reflected on payment recaps and compile proper reporting materials.
• Moderate the completion of various Start forms including the I9.
• Setup the new development projects with corresponding accounting software system.
• Ensure adherence to all production accounting policies and procedures.
• Ensure production advances and studio paid costs are properly recorded in the production general ledger.
• Provide guidance with accounting database systems and administration.
• Provide WGA weekly worklist.
• Work with Salesforce team to ensure Blast is working properly for development desk duties.
• Plan and perform ad hoc projects as needed.

Basic Qualifications:

• Minimum 3 years’ experience in accounting is required.
• In depth understanding of motion picture industry accounting and financial practice.
• Knowledge and experience with union/guild agreements.
• Ability to communicate with Studio counterparts and external representation.
• Passionate about television programming with a keen interest in and aptitude for learning the business.
• Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects simultaneously, demonstrate strong analytical skills, and work well under pressure.
• Pragmatic, highly organized and high attention to detail.
• Demonstrated ability to work in a corporate environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

• Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, SAP
• Willing to learn production accounting software programs (PSL3, Movie Magic, and Vista/GV).
• Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Required Education

• Bachelor’s degree is preferred.

description:
Job Summary:

Disney Streaming is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company's direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including the ESPN+ premium sports streaming service; Star+ which brings live sports and general entertainment exclusively to the Latin America region; and Disney+, the dedicated streaming home for entertainment from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic. Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. We serve consumers by bringing the world's most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. We strive daily to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives consumers the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location.

The Media Operations Department at Disney Streaming Services consists of agile and responsive teams of technicians that perform the daily processes and procedures of our live and on-demand streaming video products. The department's responsibilities consist of round-the-clock support for these products, ensuring proper functionality across all platforms.

The Streaming Media Assistant is part of a streaming Media Operations team staffed 24/7. SMA's routinely provide live, hands-on operational and procedural support for our partner products, including system health monitoring and incident management, in addition to live and VOD streaming media orchestration using proprietary software.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Must be available to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends, and holidays.
  • Strong understanding of computers and applications.
  • Must have an exemplary attention to detail.
  • Must possess strong communication skills, including written and verbal.
  • Must possess solid organizational skills.
  • Must be able to learn quickly and adapt to new situations.
  • Must have a strong ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced, time-sensitive environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • A solid computer and technical background, with experience working in digital media and online organizations.
  • Familiarity with streaming and broadcast media, particularly HTTP Live Streaming (HLS)
  • A team player who is enthusiastic with a strong work ethic.
  • Ability to troubleshoot efficiently.
  • 1-2 years of relevant working experience.

description:
Job Summary:

Imagine continuing a legacy of Surveying at the most magical place on earth. As a Land Surveyor with Infrastructure Program Development, you will interface with engineers, architects, and Project Management teams across the Walt Disney World Resort. You will work with regulatory agencies, Disney Leadership, and fellow Cast Members, to keep up to date with the technology, equipment, and materials used to design, maintain, and construct current and future Walt Disney World Resort projects.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with engineers, architects, and project management teams to help complete field survey scope of work for varying types of land surveys
  • Perform QA/QC reviews of survey and mapping deliverables to ensure data is processed at a high-level of geometric accuracy according to Standards of Practice in Chapter 5j-17 of the Florida Administrative Code
  • Plan the development, management, and maintenance of a GIS asset management system using ArcGIS for mapping and asset data inventory
  • Provide subject matter expertise for Professional Land Surveying associated codes and regulations
  • Work with outside vendors, local regulatory agencies, Disney leaders, and fellow cast members
  • Keep up-to-date on the latest developments in technology, equipment and materials

Basic Qualifications:

  • 6+ years diverse experience in Land Surveying including Topographic, Utility, Wetland, Boundary (Property Lines), Bathymetric, 3DScanning, and Construction Stakeout Survey
  • Registered Professional Land Surveyor (PLS) in State of Florida, or ability to obtain within 3-months of hire
  • Expertise with industry codes and standards associated with new development and re-development
  • Proficient in Autodesk Civil 3D
  • Familiarity with ArcGIS applications
  • Understanding of latest technology related to aerial, mobile and terrestrial LiDAR
  • Experience using LiDAR processing and/or extraction software
  • Experience performing peer reviews
  • Experience managing outside consultants/vendors

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s or Associate degree in Geomatics, Land Surveying or related fields

Preferred Education

  • Registered Professional Land Surveyor License (PLS) from any United States State Survey Board of Licensure or Professional surveyor and mapper (PSM) Florida license

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

Culinary Cast Members at the Walt Disney World® Resort have the opportunity to provide first-rate dining experiences while working for one of the world’s leading entertainment and hospitality companies. Culinary cast members experience a world of options in our Hotels and Theme Parks, from quick service to Five-Diamond dining.

Culinary Cook 2 roles receive a starting rate of $16.40/hourly.


Responsibilities

The Walt Disney World® Resort is seeking Full Time (Prep Cook) Cook 2 looking to start their culinary career with an award-winning, industry leader.

Imagine being a Cook 2 where you would have the opportunity to:
  • Cook and prepare dishes for our Guests
  • Grow in your craft through continual learning and development alongside our exceptional Chefs and experienced culinary team with years of experience in the industry
  • Work in fast-paced, environments serving up delicious cuisines using the freshest and highest quality ingredients available from around the world

Basic Qualifications

Recipe for Success
  • Perform consistent production and presentation of well-prepared, flavorful food while ensuring the highest sanitation standards (HACCP – Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points) and exceptional Guest service
  • Able to understand the importance of and follow a recipe, including identify various food products, dairy, meats and produce
  • Demonstrate good judgment of quantity, quality and production
  • Knowledge and basic understanding of basic temperatures, food safety and proper food handling
  • Display proficient knife skills and knowledge of basic cuts
  • Possess passion for the culinary arts and desire to learn more in the Food & Beverage industry
  • Additional Personal Protective Equipment (face shields, goggles, refillable hand sanitizers, etc.) may be required.
  • Cast Members will be required to handle cleaning chemicals and supplies
  • Able to stand/walk for the entire shift, lift up to 50 lbs. and work in a variety of locations including indoors and outdoors
  • Full Time requires full availability for any shift, seven (7) days per week, including nights, weekends, and holidays

Preferred Qualifications

How to Stand Out
  • Bilingual preferred
  • Serve Safe Certified
  • Previous experience in full-service restaurants

Additional Information:

SCHEDULE AVAILABILTY Our Theme Parks and Resort Hotels operate 24 hours a day, 365 days a year and some shifts may start as early as 5:00am while some may end as late as 3:00am, 4:00am or 5:00am. Please note that the principles of seniority are used to schedule all roles.

description:
Job Summary:

At Disney, we‘re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life through our movies, products, Parks & Resorts, and media networks. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.

Are you curious, creative, and love data and process improvement? Do you love to learn new things and collaborate with colleagues to solve hard and interesting problems? Imagine yourself as a HR Data & Process Analyst at Disney Studio Content where your natural passion for working and analyzing data, project management, and process documentation and improvement will ensure the company is enabled to make smart business decisions with the best possible human resources data.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with business partners, vendors, and technical team to gather requirements and translate into data integration specifications
  • Document and maintain updates to data values, definitions and structures, partnering with functional and business data owners to communicate impacts to existing HR data structures and usage
  • Perform detailed user acceptance testing to confirm data is available and structured as expected
  • Drive process improvement initiatives to optimize data and reporting efficiencies, including data audits, translation, and automation.
  • Translate complex data from multiple sources to cleanly and accurately support the development of simple, relatable, and actionable insights
  • Evaluate and document current process and data flows for efficiency, accuracy and consistency

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum 2+ years experience in data management, data governance, Human Resources, or similar role
  • Ability to understand business challenges, identify workable solutions and recommendations, and effectively communicate the conditions needed for a successful outcome
  • Ability to effectively manage agreed upon work deliverables and timelines, agility to adapt to fluid project timelines and business needs
  • Skilled at translating complex data and information into simple summaries and insights
  • Ability to take high-level partner feedback and implement into detailed data logic
  • Strong attention to detail and commitment to effectively handle and maintain confidential information
  • Passion for continuous improvement with a strong desire to continue learning in order to stay relevant to business changes and industry trends
  • Desire to work in a collaborative environment, proactively seeking opportunities to connect people and information
  • Understanding of systems and data logic and ability to apply learnings across contexts to problem solve
  • Ability to follow a problem through to root cause

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity and ability to leverage data programs such as: Microsoft, SQL, and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI)

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business, Data, IT or related field, or equivalent experience

description:
Job Summary:

Welcome to Disney TV Animation − where imagination meets innovation! We’re home to some of the biggest animated hits on television today for Disney Channel and Disney Junior, including Big City Greens, Proud Family, and Monsters at Work; and the premiere animation studio for the Disney + streaming service. Whatever the show, our job is always about creating exciting entertainment!
Disney Branded Television / Freeform Production Finance Department is responsible for the financial management of all of our television series, MOW’s, pilots and specials. We interact with many other Disney Television departments on a daily basis.
This newly created position will oversee the financial management of several animated series produced by third-party production companies

Responsibilities:

  • Review budgets in Movie Magic and Excel for accuracy prior to project greenlight.
  • Review monthly reporting from third party production partners and help highlight potential issues early.
  • Establish and maintain cash flow funding to third party studios.
  • Update monthly third-party summary report for executive team.
  • Monitor all third-party tax credits (foreign and domestic).
  • Review/evaluate third party studios for credit worthiness and viability.
  • Attend third party, executive, staff, and other pertinent meetings.
  • Perform ad hoc reporting as requested.
  • Perform miscellaneous production accounting duties as directed.

Basic Qualifications:

  • A passion for animation and be confident working in a dynamic team environment that offers inclusivity and exposure to executives in Disney TV Animation.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in television or feature film production accounting is required. Animation experience a plus.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience working with production budgeting, cost reporting, and EFC preparation is required.
  • Familiarity with IATSE 839 & SAG union fringe preferred.
  • Familiarity with production tax credits.
  • Good business & production sense.
  • Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office, SAP, and Movie Magic budgeting.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Self-motivated, team player with positive/friendly attitude.
  • Ability to multitask.
  • Have high quality organization, prioritizing, and accuracy skills.
  • Bachelor’s degree is required.

Preferred Qualifications:

B.A. or Degree in Finance, Accounting or a related field

Required Education

Bachelor’s degree is required.

Additional Information:

Equal opportunity employer – Female/Minority/Veteran/Disability

description:
Job Summary:

OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY

Star

Star India has defined the Indian media landscape for more than 30 years, and today is one of the country’s leading media conglomerates, reaching around 700 million viewers a month on TV across India and over 100 other countries. Star India’s channel portfolio cuts across general entertainment, films, sports, infotainment, kids, and lifestyle content across eight languages. The network generates over 20,000 hours of content every year and broadcasts 70+ channels, reaching 9 out of 10 C&S TV homes in India. The Star Sports network is one of the leading sports networks with 17 channels in its bouquet. It is home to a number of leading domestic and international sports and is making quantum leaps in transforming sports in the country, helping India become a multi-sporting nation. Disney+ Hotstar, India’s largest premium streaming platform has changed the way Indians watch their entertainment - from their favourite TV shows and movies to sporting extravaganzas. With the widest range of content in India, Disney+ Hotstar offers more than 100,000 hours of TV Shows and Movies in 8 languages, regional and national News, and coverage of every major global sporting event, including the IPL. The company is present in the Indian movie production and distribution space through Fox Star Studios. The studios is also responsible for the marketing and distribution of its Hollywood slate in the country. For more details visit us at http://www.startv.com/

JOB DESCRIPTION

CONTEXT

The Start-up ecosystem in India is booming with record numbers acquiring unicorn status in the past few years. VC funds flush with cash are fueling this boom led by founders with imaginative problem-solving ideas. Multiple brands in e-commerce, D2C, Fintech, Edtech space have been able to scale up their businesses by creating new categories or challenging established players. There exists a huge pool of early-stage startups that can rapidly scale up with the right kind of brand building and marketing partnership. Intuitively, the founders and business team of such startups rely on social media and Digital marketing to reach out to early consumers. TV as a medium, we believe, can help accelerate such brands’ journey to reach mass consumers and help brands achieve critical mass and help ring fence from competitive risks.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Disney-Star India is looking for a dynamic professional with an entrepreneurial mindset to lead this category development initiative and is expected to be the to be a key link between Digital –first brands and our network. You will lead a team of passionate professionals and help drive our brand philosophy and advertising sales revenue for the network. You will be responsible for

  • Ad Revenue business planning, forecasting and delivery by on-boarding New-Age startup businesses and help them grow in their brand journey.
  • Mentoring and grooming talent within the team by identifying learning opportunities, recognizing, and rewarding high performance
  • Build a shared culture of innovation and execution excellence to drive business growth

PERFORMANCE MEASURES

  • Achievement of the assigned revenue targets
  • Gathering market intelligence with respect to Competition, Clients, Agencies and overall business landscape to further our business objectives
  • Developing preferred channel partnerships with market

QUALIFICATION

  • Minimum Qualification: MBA
  • Total 15-18 years of experience
  • Client facing lead roles with experience in business development, consulting, business strategy /creation within a media/internet company is preferable
  • Experience of sales/ marketing with digital first brands is desirable

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

  • Deep understanding of consumer brands, Categories, and their business objectives
  • Understanding of media mix in the context of TV and Digital
  • Strong quantitative and analytical ability
  • Demonstrated ability to research and think strategically basis the insights
  • Powerful communication and presentation skills

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES

  • Superlative networking skills
  • Business orientation
  • Ability to engage with founders and VC funders of new age businesses
  • Ability to drive and deliver revenue targets

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.



About Star:

Star India has defined the Indian media landscape for over two decades and today is one of the country’s leading media conglomerates, reaching approximately 650 million viewers a month across India and more than 100 other countries. Star generates 20,000 hours of content every year and broadcasts 40+ channels in 8 different languages, reaching 9 out of 10 C&S TV homes in India. The network’s entertainment channel portfolio includes Star Gold, Channel V, Star World, Star Movies, Star Utsav, Life OK, Movies OK and Star Plus, India's No. 1 Hindi General Entertainment Channel. It has a leading presence in regional broadcasting as well, through a bouquet of affiliate channels which includes Star Jalsha, Jalsha Movies, Star Pravah, Asianet, Asianet Plus, Suvarna, Suvarna Plus, Vijay and now Maa. It is also present in the Indian movie production and distribution space through Fox Star Studios, an affiliate joint venture company.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Asianet Star Communications Private Limited, which is part of a business we call Star.

description:
Job Summary:

Are you curious, creative, and love data? Do you love to learn new things and collaborate with colleagues to solve hard and interesting problems? Imagine yourself as a Decision Science Engineer in People Insights where your curiosity for discovering insights and trends will help ensure we are making data-driven decisions. In this role, you will be able to blaze new paths in this data rich environment through Machine Learning, Data Engineering and Analytics. You will have the chance to leverage your expertise and knowledge to maximize the Company’s investment in our employees through complex models, data, and engineering solutions.

You have a curiosity that leads you to always ask, “What’s possible?” and you have the ability to bring those concepts to reality in everything you touch from analysis to actionable insights to provide decision support for workforce related issues.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyze, design, build and maintain machine learning models, data pipelines and automated insights.
  • Build and work with large and complex data sets and measures to be used in analyses that drive business decisions.
  • Proactively identify opportunities and build solutions for optimization of machine Learning and Analytical models, forecast and insights.
  • Manage and sustain analytical infrastructure/platform, technologies and solutions working across teams such as IT, Decision Scientists and Analytics Partners.
  • Consult within a team of analyst, translating analytical needs into repeatable solutions.
  • Proactively identify emerging trends in ML, data engineering, processing and public/external/third-party data usage and integration.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Applied knowledge in ML development workflow and algorithms including choosing/developing ML algorithms, hyper parameters, tuning, understanding bias and variance, model monitoring and deploying ML models.
  • Strong programming skills in R/Python and SQL.
  • Experience in building solutions on the cloud using AWS or Google cloud.
  • Proficiency in data visualization / presentation skills, including the ability to simplify ML outputs, statistical concepts into simple and actionable insights.
  • Ability to consult with non-technical teams and convert that to technical requirements.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or a related field.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in any of the following: Deep-Learning, NLP, parallel and distributed programming, HR / employee data (Workday).
  • Working knowledge with analytics software such as Dataiku.
  • Experience with leading and developing others.
  • Contribution to Open-Source ML/Data projects.
  • Advanced degree (Master’s or above) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or a related field.

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or a related field.

description:
Job Summary:

Disney Streaming is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+, and Star+. We serve consumers by bringing the world’s most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. Our core mission is to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time, or location.

The Edge Operations team’s mission is to provide resiliency and availability of critical infrastructure in our various data centers and co-locations that power the media distribution of all of Disney Streaming’s world-class products.

For the role of Senior Network Operator, Disney Streaming is looking for a candidate specializing in caching technology and distributed networking, and operational experience in CDN edge services. This role will join the Media Systems Operations organization as part of a team working alongside our Operations, Infrastructure, and Media Distribution teams in managing our growing caching infrastructure. Areas of focus include:
  • Provide senior tier-1 on call evaluation, escalation and support
  • Actively monitor performance metrics across our caching infrastructure for issues
  • Work to solve caching issues in concert with our edge engineering organization
  • Participate in tooling development to automate and improve lifecycle and operational management of caching environment
  • Point of contact for CDN edge services operations; collaborating with operations and infrastructure organizations as needed
  • Design and develop procedures to make preemptive and immediate corrective actions that minimize risk

Responsibilities:

  • Monitor for and react to alerts within the CDN edge services environment providing senior tier-1 support
  • Provide clear communication/escalation/follow up/closure of alerts and maintenances to teams within the organization
  • Collaborate with engineering and internal teams involved with maintaining our server infrastructure
  • Write and improve team knowledgebase
  • Support high profile content releases and events

Basic Qualifications:

  • At least 5 years of related experience
  • In-depth knowledge of HTTP/DNS/Internet architecture
  • Understanding of HLS streaming video protocol and how it interacts with caching
  • Experience in CDN operations environments
  • Familiarity with web servers, preferably NGINX and HAProxy
  • Experience working with Varnish Cache
  • Experience with open-source software Apache HTTP Server, Tomcat, and Traffic Control
  • Knowledge of video players and impact on cache logic
  • Experience with monitoring tools, preferably Grafana, Datadog
  • Strong operational experience
  • Passion for troubleshooting and debugging
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and effective verbal/written communication skills with both business and technical teams
  • Experience using JIRA, Confluence, and GitHub

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with cloud technologies AWS, GCP
  • Experience working with ELK Stack for log analysis
  • Familiarity with DevOps/CI/CD and automation software Ansible
  • Familiarity with Python scripting language

Preferred Education

  • BS/BA
