description:
At the Disneyland® Resort, dream jobs do exist. After all, a company built on imagination and wonder means the work will definitely be interesting. The job of Lifeguard Cast Members at the Disneyland® Resort is to ensure the well being of our Guests, keeping pool areas clean, answering Guest questions, providing information and assistance.

New higher wage rate!
The starting rate for Lifeguards is $17.85 per hour.

Responsibilities

Lifeguard responsibilities include ensuring the well-being of our Guests, keeping pool areas clean, answering Guest questions, enforcing policies, rules and regulations of Recreation locations. Other Responsibilities include:
  • Recognize and respond effectively in emergency situations
  • Enforce policies, rules and regulations of the Recreation locations
  • Participate in regular in-service training
  • Dispatch Guests at various Slide Locations
  • Clearing pool deck of used towels, lifejackets, and trash
  • Switching out used and clean towel bins
  • Meeting and Greeting Pool Guests
  • Report writing when responding to Guest safety and first aid situations

Basic Qualifications

  • Strong swimming experience and ability to swim 200 yards continuously.
  • Ability to detect and respond to noises and distress signals in an aquatic environment, including in the water and anywhere around the zone of responsibility
  • Must be able to observe all sections of an assigned zone or area of responsibility
  • Ability to pass a vision screening with at least 20/25 vision, corrected or uncorrected
  • Ability to hear and respond to a Fox 40 whistle
  • This role is Part Time and requires full availability for any shift, a MINIMUM of three (3) days per week, including nights and holidays.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Previous Lifeguarding or Swimming Instructor experience preferred
  • CPR/AED certified
  • Casual Regular Cast Members must be available to work Friday/Saturday/Sunday
  • Casual Temporary Cast Members must be available to work all peak seasons and holidays
  • Hours range from 5 AM and closes as late as 11 PM
  • Seven (7) days of full availability, including nights and weekends and holidays is preferred.
  • Bilingual preferred

Additional Information:

SCHEDULE AVAILABILTY
Our Theme Parks and Resort Hotels operate 24 hours a day, 365 days a year and some shifts may start as early as 5:00am while some may end as late as 3:00am, 4:00am or 5:00am. Please note that the principles of seniority are used to schedule all roles.

description:
Job Summary:

For the last century, Walt Disney Animation Studios has been combining the best in artistry and storytelling with cutting-edge technology to bring wonderful new characters and visual spectacle
to the big screen for audiences around the world. We currently have an exciting opportunity for Effects Animators to join our world class award winning team at our Burbank, CA studio.

Effects Animators create a wide variety of visual effects that range from hyper-realistic
simulations of natural phenomena, to realizing the futuristic and the completely fantastical. They
are expected to exercise their technical and artistic talents in collaboration with other artists from
all disciplines to create the appealing, compelling and unexpected images that support the
emotional beats of the film.

Responsibilities
  • Bring a strong sense of personal authorship and art direction to visuals, while meeting the artistic vision of the Director and Production Designer.
  • Ability to execute on a range of visuals, from the photoreal to the wholly imagined.
  • Collaborate with other artistic departments to achieve desired look for effects elements.
  • Communicate regularly with the production team to establish and meet expectations and deadlines.
  • Develop innovative tools and workflows necessary to achieve technical and visual goals.
  • Generate effects with an awareness of how they will be received and used by other departments, with a mind towards data efficiency and consumability.
  • Participate in team discussions and critiques, to give feedback on visuals or technical solutions in an effort to push artistry and efficiency.
  • Work with Effects department leadership to develop and enforce artistic and technical goals for projects and/or teams.

Requirements
  • Experience in CG visual effects production for animation, live-action film, television or games.
  • Proficiency with SideFX’s Houdini.
  • Comfortable using, or willingness and ability to learn, various effects animation techniques including procedural animation, keyframing and simulations such as rigid bodies, soft bodies, fluids, particle dynamics, etc.
  • Open to taking technical and artistic direction, as well as receiving and addressing notes and feedback from peers and leadership.
  • Attentive to detail and quality in work.
  • Intrinsic drive to improve technical and artistic skills and embrace a studio culture that strives to innovate and change.
  • Ability to clearly convey artistic and technical concepts, challenges and processes.
  • Keen understanding of animation and film making fundamentals, including timing, silhouette, appeal, light, color, composition, etc.
  • Familiarity with Linux and Python scripting is a plus.

Visual examples of images exemplifying work in this area are requested for review.

Please include a resume and reel breakdown with your online profile.

The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description:
Job Summary:

Disney Streaming is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+, and Star+. We serve consumers by bringing the world’s most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. Our core mission is to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time, or location.

The Edge Operations team’s mission is to provide resiliency and availability of critical infrastructure in our various data centers and co-locations that power the media distribution of all of Disney Streaming’s world-class products.

For the role of Senior Network Operator, Disney Streaming is looking for a candidate specializing in caching technology and distributed networking, and operational experience in CDN edge services. This role will join the Media Systems Operations organization as part of a team working alongside our Operations, Infrastructure, and Media Distribution teams in managing our growing caching infrastructure. Areas of focus include:
  • Provide senior tier-1 on call evaluation, escalation and support
  • Actively monitor performance metrics across our caching infrastructure for issues
  • Work to solve caching issues in concert with our edge engineering organization
  • Participate in tooling development to automate and improve lifecycle and operational management of caching environment
  • Point of contact for CDN edge services operations; collaborating with operations and infrastructure organizations as needed
  • Design and develop procedures to make preemptive and immediate corrective actions that minimize risk

Responsibilities:

  • Monitor for and react to alerts within the CDN edge services environment providing senior tier-1 support
  • Provide clear communication/escalation/follow up/closure of alerts and maintenances to teams within the organization
  • Collaborate with engineering and internal teams involved with maintaining our server infrastructure
  • Write and improve team knowledgebase
  • Support high profile content releases and events

Basic Qualifications:

  • At least 5 years of related experience
  • In-depth knowledge of HTTP/DNS/Internet architecture
  • Understanding of HLS streaming video protocol and how it interacts with caching
  • Experience in CDN operations environments
  • Familiarity with web servers, preferably NGINX and HAProxy
  • Experience working with Varnish Cache
  • Experience with open-source software Apache HTTP Server, Tomcat, and Traffic Control
  • Knowledge of video players and impact on cache logic
  • Experience with monitoring tools, preferably Grafana, Datadog
  • Strong operational experience
  • Passion for troubleshooting and debugging
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and effective verbal/written communication skills with both business and technical teams
  • Experience using JIRA, Confluence, and GitHub

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with cloud technologies AWS, GCP
  • Experience working with ELK Stack for log analysis
  • Familiarity with DevOps/CI/CD and automation software Ansible
  • Familiarity with Python scripting language

Preferred Education

  • BS/BA

description:
Job Summary:

At Disney, we‘re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.

Imagine yourself as a Data Integration Specialist for People Insights Data Operations where your natural passion for working with data will allow you to be part of a team that enables insights to drive the enterprise HR strategy of The Walt Disney Company. In this role, you will have the chance to leverage your expertise and knowledge to assist in management, governance and integration of workforce data in service of analytics and decision science needs. You will bring skills and experience to increase capability and ease of use of our complex datasets and you’ll develop a deep understanding of our priorities and envision how Snowflake can be best utilized to deliver insights to our organization. You will have the opportunity to inspire data analysts of varying levels of experience while building data expertise across the greater team.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner within and across People Insights as well as Enterprise Business Systems to translate functional requirements into data and reporting needs
  • Partner with data developers to implement and test data infrastructure enhancements
  • Design integrations and table structures for reliable and scalable reporting use
  • Document enhancements and create audits for data quality validations
  • Research ad-hoc data questions and tune SQL queries to support partners as required
  • Communicate data updates to technical and non-technical partners

Basic Qualifications:

  • 3+ years’ of relevant experience
  • You are proficient in SQL with a thorough understanding of data and systems' infrastructures
  • You are a solutions-oriented critical thinker
  • You have deep technical knowledge and experience in data integration or management
  • You demonstrate the ability to translate business issues and requirements into actionable plans, and to deliver against those plans
  • You are passionate about the benefits of accurate and actionable data, you drive consistency and enjoy partnering with others to accomplish the task
  • You have the capability to work autonomously and make independent decisions to meet deliverables with minimal oversight
  • You can effectively handle and maintain confidential information

Required Education

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and SQL expertise, Snowflake/AWS, ELT/ETL design experience preferred

HR and/or Talent Acquisition Data experience also preffered

description:
Job Summary:

Front Desk Cast Members help ensure guests have a memorable stay at our hotels, whether through a speedy check-in process, excellent guest service, or assistance with various guest inquiries. With the support and development from our professional management team, you will be providing outstanding service to guests from all around the world; make them feel at home; and create magical moments throughout their stay. You will embrace and spread Disney culture, and bring the Disney stories to life in our immersive hotels.

Responsibilities:

  • Proactively interact with guests and solve guests’ challenges
  • Be familiar with hotel room configurations, different room rates, and promotions
  • Communicate overall room status current overall room status
  • Perform additional duties as directed by leaders

Basic Qualifications:

  • The position will be required to work a flexible working schedule including work shifts on weekends and holidays as well as late hours
  • Flexible/adaptable (may work in various areas and under various conditions, and adapt to flexible working time), available to work for three days per week (Friday to Sunday). 24 hours at most per week
  • Should be able to work for more than six consecutive months.
  • Fluent Mandarin and English language abilities, both oral and written
  • Good communication skills and willing to offer assistance to guests
  • Understands privacy policies protecting Guests’ personal information
  • You shall obtain certificate and qualification(s) required for performing the job, and complete and pass all post-employment training and assessments (including but not limited to On-Job-Training

Additional Information:

As one of the worldwide leaders in family entertainment, Shanghai Disney Resort delivers legendary service and a lifetime of memories for our guests. Joining us in a new world of fantasy, imagination, creativity and adventure involves creating happiness for the millions of guests who visit our Resort each year. Whether your career journey here is onstage or backstage, there are almost unlimited opportunities for growth and personal development at Shanghai Disney.
* We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities.
* Specific benefits vary between different roles and may be adjusted according to company policy.
* Shanghai Disney Resort does not charge a fee to submit job applications and has not authorized any individual or company to charge to do so. Please always check our official channels or platforms for the most relevant recruitment information.

We are taking a responsible approach to creating environments that allow us to do what we do best – welcome and entertain millions of guests each year from across the country and around the world. As part of our commitment to health and safety, we require all newly-hired employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their onboarding dates.

Employment Benefits:
  • Salary: your salary consists of hourly pay and your actual working hours.
  • Overtime and allowances: In addition to statutory overtime (depending on your position) you may be entitled to a high temperature allowance.
  • Catering subsidy: You are entitled to one free meal per day on days that you are working
  • Insurance: You are entitled to Risk Insurance for Employee
  • Free Park Entry: While you work for Shanghai Disney Resort you will have the opportunity to enter the park with your family and friends for free
Application Process:

Apply online -> Interview over email -> Accept Employment -> Onboard
Please note: You may only apply for this position once in a six-month period. If you have applied within the last six months, please log in to your account to view your current application status.

Work Location:

You will be working at Shanghai Disney Resort in Pudong, Shanghai. You can take metro Line 11 to Shanghai Disney Resort station or take one of our many shuttle buses. The shuttle buses can be taken from one of several central areas across the city every day. You can find out more information during your onboarding process.

description:
Job Summary:

With 55 restaurants/outlets and 13 cafés and bars, Disneyland®Paris is the largest grouping of single-site restaurants in Europe. Each year, approximately 20 million meals are served. By joining us, you will participate in our ongoing quest for excellence, whether it be in our menus - fresh products, innovative recipes, gastronomy - or in the impeccable quality of service that we aim to offer our visitors, whether it be table service, buffet, quick service or snack.

Reporting to the Catering Product Director you will participate in the development of the culinary strategy at Disneyland Paris (DLP). You will define, direct and steer the culinary Research and Development policy, managing and controlling all the parameters.

You will create and implement new products in close collaboration with the operational teams and the segment, and ensure that customer satisfaction is optimized by respecting the quality standards that DLP has decided to offer its visitors.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop new lines of research on new products or adaptations of existing products, in order to meet the catering strategy at DLP.
  • Monitor the progress of the Food Department's projects and initiatives by keeping an internal and external watch in order to think about and build new concepts and/or develop culinary production methods in line with market expectations.
  • Plan and validate the implementation of new menus and catering concepts, according to the previously defined strategy, taking into account market developments and demonstrating creativity in line with DLP and segment standards in order to ensure the optimization of customer satisfaction and the expected financial results,
  • Define a policy in line with environmental standards, food balance, customer traceability, while respecting the rules of hygiene and food safety,
  • Collaborate with the Purchasing department and other support services to optimize the quality, cost and rationalization of new products,
  • Coordinate, participate and validate new Corporate Alliance partners and products
  • Drive creative development of new projects from Blue Sky to project delivery, including Blue Sky, concepts, presentations, specifications, design and delivery of the Food concept in collaboration with the Projects, Facilities Assets Management (FAM), Walt Disney Imagineers (WDI) and Food Safety teams
  • Organize the activity of the Product Executive Managers, evaluate their actions and performance, encourage their professional development and develop a team dynamic.
  • Foster relationships and communication with all business lines or official DLP partners to understand the evolving needs of customers and transform them into strategic directions.
  • Participate in the elaboration and construction of the budget, control the objectives allocated to your business line by implementing the product strategy within the division, monitor the results of the activity

Basic Qualifications:

You have a diploma in hotel restaurant/kitchen background, you have 10 years of professional culinary experience in the restaurant industry with team management. International experience is desired.
You are used to managing several varieties of cuisine as well as a large volume of catering.
You are known for your creativity, leadership and interpersonal skills. You are a very good listener, collaborative and a good decision maker.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French are required (C1 level spoken and written).

description:
Job Summary:

As the Senior Mechanical Engineer, you will help ensure reliable HVAC, compressed air, kitchen, laundry, and other mechanical systems throughout the Disneyland Resort. You will be working with the operating engineers and maintenance teams to resolve mechanical issues and supporting energy efficiency projects including energy management, system configuration management and master planning of facilities and distribution systems. You will also assist with master planning the Resort's mechanical utilities and the development of GIS applications for the mechanical distribution systems. You will partner with teams in the development of mechanical standards and processes and will be the "Owner's Representative" for compliance to applicable codes, standards and interface, as directed, with regulatory agencies, while providing "day of" response to mechanical issues relating to maintenance questions and issues from the lines of business (LOB's). You will collaborate with Imagineering and Resort partners for system expansion, special events, and the addition of new venues.

You will report to the Manager of Utility & Sustaining Engineering

Responsibilities:

  • Support diverse lines of business such as Operations, Maintenance, Entertainment, Merchandise, Broadcast Services, and others, with answers to mechanical questions, code interpretation, and engineering and design solutions.
  • Review maintenance and testing reports and provides technical guidance to the Facility Support Services (FSS) and the Attraction Engineering Services (ES) teams.
  • Performance / management of HVAC system assessments, and inspections to evaluate conditions, operations and maintenance requirements of mechanical systems, engineer mechanical and piping systems to comply with different project scopes of work following applicable standards and regulations.
  • Sustainability and energy efficient program development, implementation and system designs.
  • Develop and maintain system models and review mechanical /piping system designs created by in-house and outside designers for accuracy, adequacy, quality, and completeness.
  • Provide recommendations for mechanical /piping system improvements, enhancements, and replacements and ensure mechanical / piping projects comply with codes, e.g. CMC, CPC, NFPA, ASTM, EPA, CAL-OSHA, applicable insurance underwriter requirements, CGMP, Industrial Ventilation Standards, ASHRAE Standards, and Disneyland Resort standards.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of seven years of experience in the engineering design and repair of mechanical systems.
  • Experience in chiller, boiler, HVAC and compressed air systems equipment, pumps, meters valves, and distribution systems.
  • Proficiency in the use of Email applications, AutoCAD, Revit, MS Office, Energy Pro, Trace, HAP.
  • Working knowledge of CBC, CMC, CPC, OSHA, California Energy Code (Title 24), Thermal Load Calculations, energy modeling
  • Ability to explain complex issues to non-technical peers and to management.
  • Understanding of how engineering decisions relate to and affect the business

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Working knowledge of Carrier Comfort Works and IVue
  • Experience implementing mechanical systems in the ESRI ArcGIS software

Required Education

  • BS Mechanical Engineering
  • Professional Engineering License (PE) in the State of California

Preferred Education

  • Masters Mechanical Engineering

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

As the Staff Mechanical Engineer, you will help ensure reliable Central Plants, HVAC, compressed air, kitchen, laundry, and other mechanical systems throughout the Disneyland Resort. The mechanical systems include central chiller plants, boiler plants, compressed air plants, and associated distribution systems. You will work with the operating engineers and maintenance teams to resolve mechanical issues and supporting energy efficiency projects including energy management, system configuration management and master planning of facilities and distribution systems. You will also assist with master planning the Resort's mechanical utilities and the development of GIS applications for the mechanical distribution systems. Work with business partners in the development of mechanical standards and processes and will be the "Owner's Representative" for compliance to applicable codes, standards and interface, as directed, with regulatory agencies. Provide "day of" response to mechanical issues relating to maintenance, repair, questions and issues from the lines of business (LOB's). You will collaborate with Imagineering and Resort partners for system expansion, special events, and the addition of new venues.

You will report to the Manager of Utility & Sustaining Engineering.

Responsibilities:

  • Support diverse lines of business such as Operations, Maintenance, Entertainment, Merchandise, Broadcast Services, and others, with answers to mechanical questions, code interpretation, and engineering and/or design solutions.
  • Review maintenance and testing reports and provides technical guidance to the Facility Support Services (FSS) and the Attraction Engineering Services (ES) teams.
  • Performance / management of central plants, HVAC system assessments, and inspections to evaluate conditions, operations and maintenance requirements of mechanical systems, engineer mechanical and piping systems to comply with different project scopes of work observing applicable standards and regulations.
  • Sustainability and energy efficient program development, implementation and system designs.
  • Develop and maintain system models and review mechanical /piping system designs created by in-house and outside designers for accuracy, adequacy, quality, and completeness.
  • Provide recommendations for mechanical /piping system improvements, enhancements, and replacements and ensure mechanical / piping projects comply with codes, e.g. CMC, CPC, NFPA, ASTM, EPA, CAL-OSHA, applicable insurance underwriter requirements, CGMP, Industrial Ventilation Standards, ASHRAE Standards, and Disneyland Resort standards.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of ten years of experience in the engineering design and repair of mechanical systems.
  • Background in chiller, boiler, HVAC and compressed air systems equipment, pumps, meters valves, and distribution systems.
  • Proficiency in the use of Email applications, AutoCAD, Revit, MS Office, Energy Pro, Trace, HAP.
  • Knowledge of CBC, CMC, CPC, OSHA, and California Energy Code (Title 24), Thermal Load Calculations, energy modeling
  • Explain complex issues to non-technical peers and to management.
  • Understand how engineering decisions relate to and affect the business.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Working knowledge of Carrier Comfort Works and IVue,
  • Experience implementing mechanical systems in the ESRI ArcGIS software and systems.

Required Education

  • BS Mechanical Engineering
  • Professional Engineering License (PE) in the State of California

Preferred Education

  • Masters Mechanical Engineering

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

description:
Job Summary:

Design and build the digital destinations that connect audiences around the world with Disney Parks, Experiences and Products. Every week is different as you collaborate with editorial, creative, and technology teams to create a magical user experience and accessible content across websites, mobile, digital signage, social, email, and more. Bring your creativity and expertise to support everything from major business announcements and global engagement campaigns to new content platforms.

As the Communications Technology Specialist, you will wear multiple hats as a full-stack designer (UX/UI/HTML/CSS), project manager, and consultant. You will report to the Manager of Communications Technology as part of a specialized team of digital experts amplifying the impact of PR, Public Affairs, and Internal Communications.

This role is the perfect opportunity to combine your passions for Disney, digital inclusion, and UX/UI design. Your portfolio, skillset, and network will grow as you work across the business to help Disney reimagine the future of external and internal communications. This is a hybrid role with offices at Walt Disney World in Orlando, providing you the flexible scheduling to work both remotely and on-site to stay connected to the magic.

Responsibilities:

  • Design: Create a magical and inclusive user experience across Communications by translating Disney design frameworks and digital accessibility best practices into wireframes, high-fidelity comps, prototypes, and front-end HTML for a variety of digital platforms and products. Work with developers and technology partners to implement and validate designs.
  • Build: Lead project teams or guide content owners in building digital communications, including WordPress websites and HTML emails. For select projects, independently handle content build-out and management.
  • Adapt: Continuously grow your knowledge of the global business and stay flexible to deliver on new Communications priorities, including confidential and time-sensitive projects.
  • Empower: Build and maintain reusable content templates and building blocks in content creation tools.
  • Support: Guide content owners and creators in effective digital communications via project consultation, training, and documentation.
  • Innovate: Research new standards, design frameworks, and products as technology evolves to provide forward-thinking solutions.
  • Imagine: As a member of the larger DPEP Content Creation and Digital Integration team, be part of the team dreaming up and pitching new ways to engage audiences.

Basic Qualifications:

  • An online portfolio of digital design and production.
  • 3+ years’ experience in web design.
  • Expertise with industry-standard design and prototyping applications, such as Photoshop, Illustrator, XD, Sketch, InVision, or Figma.
  • Expertise building and editing HTML and CSS.
  • Fluency with Adobe Creative Cloud applications for media editing and optimization, including Photoshop, Illustrator, and Media Encoder.
  • Passion for digital accessibility and inclusion (WCAG, WAI-ARIA, ADA, multi-language)
  • Flexible, organized, and motivated to independently manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to deliver projects.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Passion for the brands and offerings of Disney Parks, Experiences and Products.
  • Experience incorporating internal style guides or design frameworks into digital content or platforms.
  • Experience building and managing sites on WordPress CMS.
  • Understanding of website performance, analytics, and SEO.
  • Written proficiency in one or more languages in addition to English, such as Spanish, Haitian Creole, or French.
  • Familiarity with existing Disney external communication platforms, including DPEP.disney.com, disneyconnect.com/Disney World, Disney Newsrooms, Disney Park Blog, etc.
  • Familiarity with existing Disney internal communication platforms, including HUB, Cast Life, CastTV, Inside Disney, etc.

description:
Job Summary:

Design at Disney is at the forefront of creating intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that our fans love and crave. We strive to design high-quality end-to-end experiences while maintaining an inclusive and collaborative culture. To us, team-fit and attitude are as important as hard design skills.

We are the storytellers responsible for adding “something special” to our consumers’ experience every day through exciting design, artwork, branding and UX globally. We are responsible for driving the product design, user experiences, creative direction, production design, motion design, service design, UX copywriting, UX research and UX engineering. It is our job to create a framework that delivers consistent, creative and innovative user experiences for people – whether they are using Disney’s consumer-facing products, or the platforms, products and tools that help power our business. Crucially, how we do that work must be both imaginative and efficient, allowing us to also free our team devote energy to using design to drive innovation.

A User Experience Engineer at Disney is a creative problem solver who looks to collaborate with the Design and Technology teams to create high-fidelity prototypes, proofs-of-concept, and MVPs for web, mobile, and OTT. We expect UX Engineers to work on multiple prototypes simultaneously, both from the ground up and optimizing existing solutions, with in-depth knowledge about the latest design trends and technologies.

The Senior UX Engineer plays a critical role on a cross-functional team tasked with creating a career-centered, educational platform that facilitates engagement with DMED’s diversity, equity and inclusion resources throughout employee lifecycle. This is a high impact opportunity to design and build web-based user interfaces for creative storytelling and media creation in partnership with our Design and Technology teams.

The Walt Disney Company strives to get things done quickly, and at high quality. We’re looking for a collaborative technologist who seeks to bring out best in themselves and those around them. A passionate, impactful, experienced technical contributor who is eager to lead, wants to come here to do their very best work, make their mark, and add their chapter to The Walt Disney Company story.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and develop high fidelity prototypes for mobile responsive web applications
  • Execute artistic design and layout solutions
  • Leverage or develop icon sets, color schemes and visual design where needed
  • Work with design and technical partners to assess needs and advise on solutions
  • Provide design knowledge and technical expertise across the proof-of-concept lifecycle
  • Identify and execute opportunities for end-user testing and feedback in partnership with UX Research
  • Present prototype progress and ideas to partners and stakeholders
  • Contribute to production front-end applications as needed

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 5 years of relevant industry experiences
  • Experience crafting high quality experiences for web
  • Expert knowledge of HTML, CSS, Javascript
  • Expert understanding of user-centered design principles and best practices
  • Self-motivated, problem solver with the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously
  • Hungry for innovation, eager to challenge the status quo
  • Expert understanding of adaptive, responsive, and fluid UI layout concepts
  • Expert in knowledge in UI Development best practices
  • Experience with UI motion and animation best practices
  • Strong interest in and aptitude for learning the new platforms, software languages, and concepts as trends shift in the industry
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Passion for the Design and Technology crafts
  • Have the ability to collaborate with a diverse set of partners

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with React or other Javascript frameworks
  • Knowledge and experience working with design tools including Figma, Sketch, and Adobe CS

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s Degree, or equivalent training or work experience

Additional Information:

#DISNEYTECH

About Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution:

Comprised of the Company’s international business units and various direct-to-consumer streaming services, Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) aligns technology, media distribution and advertising sales into a single business segment to create and deliver personalized entertainment experiences to consumers around the world.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Disney Streaming Technology LLC, which is part of a business we call Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution.

Disney Streaming Technology LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

description:
Job Summary:

We, at Yellow Shoes, are looking for a Sr. Art Director to work on our CPGP Business (Consumer Products Gaming and Publishing). Your #1 responsibility is to bring your unique self and perspective to our team and culture.
But make no mistake, as a Sr. Art Director, you'll have other responsibilities too. You will create fresh conceptual ideas for Disney Parks alongside talented team members. You will show your problem-solving skills and think creatively for a range of advertising media while mentoring Jr. Creatives. Social and digital by design, we expect every Yellow Shoes creative team member to grasp the importance of thinking creatively in a tech-inspired world. Solid, imaginative design ability and expert understanding of the creative production process are expected. As part of our team, curiosity and a passion to learn will take you very far.
You will report to a Group Creative Strategy Director.

Responsibilities:

• Think creatively and build storytelling solutions that bring magic to Disney's retail and eCommerce experience.
• Flex your creative muscle across a portfolio of renowned franchises including Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic, etc., and identify strategic and creative opportunities.
• Consider many perspectives and can also operate at the lowest level of detail in service of marketable solutions for advertising problems.
• Work with cross-functional teams and build relationships with business and creative partners.
• Work well with a Sr. Copywriter partner to achieve remarkable 360 campaign concepts.
• Mentor Jr. Creatives, guides their daily creative work and offers feedback.
• Construct and present with assurance a cohesive creative presentation.
• Operate with a high degree of ownership & deliver projects according to timelines and deadlines.

Basic Qualifications:

• 7 years of experience as a conceptual art director at a creative agency or in-house.
• Expertise in retail/eCommerce, including current industry trends & creative work.
• A love for ideas – both big and small.
• A unique voice and point of view.
• Retail expertise and champion ideas led by strategy.
• Experience working within quick timelines and deadlines.
• High on talent, low on ego.
• Eye for design, typography and photography with an emphasis on details.
• Experience presenting to all levels - senior to executive.
• Turn around detailed comps/mockups promptly in an iterative environment.
• Knowledge and genuine interest in the Walt Disney Company history – including films, animation, television, theme parks and products.
• Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator).

Preferred Qualifications:

• Flash and other editing software.
• After Effects and 3D experience.

Required Education

A minimum of an associates (2 year) in advertising, art, graphic art or design.

Preferred Education

An ad school or liberal arts (4 year) degree

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

Job Summary:

Disney’s Consumer Products, Games & Publishing (CPGP) division is the business of The Walt Disney Company that brings stories and characters to life through innovative and engaging physical products and digital experiences across more than 100 categories, from toys and t-shirts, to apps, books and console games; as well as multiple franchise brands including Disney, Pixar, Star Wars, Marvel, and National Geographic. CPGP comprises four main lines of business: Licensing, Retail, Games and Publishing. It is home to world-class teams of app and game developers, licensing and retail experts, a leading retail/ecommerce business (Disney Store & shopDisney), artists and storytellers, and technologists who inspire imaginations around the world.

The CPGP Division Finance team is a fast-paced, dynamic team with responsibilities for division-wide financial planning, including forecasts, annual plan and long range plan; monitoring of division/business unit operating performance; franchise planning and various special projects. The group is also charged with developing presentations to inform division Senior Management regarding forecasted financial performance and business trends.

Responsibilities:

This position is ideal for a finance professional who possesses strong strategic, analytical, managerial and interpersonal skills. Across all responsibilities, the Manager, Finance will be challenged to support high level decision making by overseeing the development and improvement processes of financial models, and working effectively with analysts, various lines of business and international partners.

Responsibilities include supporting the following key functions:
  • Help lead the financial strategy and management for the Marvel team and the cross-brand Softlines team. Pull and analyze big data to form and present professional recommendation to senior management
  • Support forecasting, budgeting, and short & long term business planning
  • Support the completion of ad-hoc analysis
  • Create detailed analysis for presentations and reporting packages to CPGP and DPEP Senior Management teams
  • Consolidation, analysis, and review of Domestic and International financial submissions. Built relationships and ask necessary questions to fully understand the content of the submission
  • Collaborate with international finance teams outside of Consumer Products to develop deep understanding of allocations sent to CP
  • Support process efficiencies by leveraging tools such as Excel, Cognos and other tools

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 5 years of robust financial analysis in fast-paced environment
  • Strong attention to detail, demonstrated ability to create executive level deliverables
  • Extensive experience in Excel and PowerPoint required (Experience with data consolidation tools (Cognos, SAP preferred)
  • At least one year experience managing a team of analysts
  • Effective communicator. Excellent oral/written communication and presentation skills, experienced in building relationships with teams, and strong organizational skills
  • Proven ability to solve problems creatively and lead a team
  • Service oriented individual who wants to help and push the team forward
  • Self-starter who excels in a team environment and who challenges the status quo by continually searching for opportunities to improve internal processes

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in an analytical discipline

description:
Job Summary:

The Director of Graphic Design leads the Graphic Designers to develop design elements and art that extend the story of our Theme Parks, Stores and Licensing businesses. The Graphic Designers will utilize key strategies driven through our Franchises to develop art that articulates the direction defined through the consumer lens and on a global scale. The Director will report to the VP, Visual Design & Branding.

Disney Parks, Experiences and Product (DPEP) is the business segment of The Walt Disney Company that brings stories to life through global product assortments and services featuring characters from Walt Disney Animation Studios, Pixar, Marvel, Lucasfilm, Media Networks, and the Walt Disney Studios. This includes a broad assortment of merchandise ranging from toys, apparel, accessories, home décor, electronics, consumables, health & beauty and collectible art.

The Global Merchandise Creative team develops the global creative direction and assets for all of Disney Consumer Products core properties. Following the Brand Strategy, this team develops the brand identity that appears at retail, designs and establishes the look and feel of each property, generates and fulfills character art needs, and works in partnership with lines of business and product development teams.

The Director of Graphic Design will provide leadership in the design, coordination, and development of Product Development style guides for all Pixar and Walt Disney Animation films in addition to new Media content from Disney Channel and Disney+. Must be adept at partnering with internal stakeholders and navigating relationships with filmmaker teams from the various studios. This position requires being a hands-on designer and managing a team to create and deliver innovative global design solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the Graphic Design team and direction to execute creative strategies in art for programs and product defined with final approval of art and Design concepts
  • Responsible for the creative output of the Graphic Designers from creative vision to execution
  • Responsible for elevating Centers of Excellence in Design development to deliver a world class brand experience through storytelling
  • Design integrity and brand ambassador. Protecting the TWDC IP and Brand through governance and guidance on quality and innovation
  • Evaluate, challenge and coach all aspects of the Graphic Designers professional development creating succession planning and career paths for each individual
  • Partner closely with creative team across the globe, Franchise Strategy and Product Design to create powerhouse creative that meets creative and financial goals
  • Work closely with WDI and all of the Studios to extend the stories through Graphic Design in Brand Experiences, Attraction Development, Live Action and Animated movies. Extend the design elements with story on all creative development
  • Work closely with Character Artists to create elevated relevant art that encompasses trend, consumer insights, Studio initiatives and Franchise focused
  • Work with executive creative partners in Walt Disney Animation, Pixar, Disney Channel, Disney +, Corporate Brand Management, Yellow Shoes, Walt Disney Imagineering and Walt Disney Entertainment

Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Art, Illustration and/or Graphic Design
  • Minimum 12-15+ years of senior level leadership experience in graphic or merchandise design
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills
  • Outstanding organizational skills
  • Proven success managing and inspiring teams
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to influence a diverse audience
  • Successful experience working, and thriving, in a highly matrixed company structure
  • Proven leadership and talent development abilities and a collaborative and effective management style
  • Ability to build and foster strong collaborative partnerships across functions and departments
  • Proven ability to think creatively and disruptively to bring and infuse new ideas into graphic design
  • Demonstrated ability to be flexible and detail oriented
  • Strong influencing abilities
  • Strong creative computer skills

Additional Information:

KEY RELATIONSHIPS:
All Graphic Designers and Character Artists on the team. Director of Character Art and Story, VP of Graphic Design, Executive Director of Character Art and Story, Executive level leaders at Pixar Studios, Walt Disney Animation Studios the Disney Channel, WDI, Entertainment, Operations, Product Design, Brand Merchandising, Franchise, Commercialization, Packaging, Production and Retail teams.

description:
Job Summary:

Yellow Shoes is the award-winning, in-house agency that develops creative strategies and solutions to support Walt Disney's DPEP (Disney Parks, Products and Experiences). Yellow Shoes is dedicated to helping support the business and building the Disney brand. Our competitive advantage is an intimate knowledge of, and unique integration within, our Parks & Resorts business. Business Affairs serves as the bridge between Yellow Shoes and Legal/Brand partners.

The Business Affairs Manager is an essential team member of the Disney Parks, Experiences and Products team. This Business Affairs Manager is an agency expert and daily contact on all SAG-AFTRA and non-union production contracts, vendor and talent estimates, talent residual agreements, music licensing, contracts, rights and trademark clearances for proposed branding, taglines, signage and design in partnership with TWDC legal counsel.

The Business Affairs Manager has a hybrid responsibility that includes reviewing and advising YS creative and production teams on creative materials. The Business Affairs Manager will manage broadcast content, digital, social media, print and photography across lines of business and IP. This includes talent, copyright and intellectual property issues as well as advise on next steps for scripts, rough-cuts and final creative accounting for risk and clearance concerns. The Business Affairs Manager is the first line of review and counsel, followed by TWDC legal counsel as the final arbiter.

Responsibilities:

Our Business Affairs Manager will work highly collaborative and integrated fashion across other Business Affairs and Legal Affairs members of The Walt Disney Company (TWDC) and members of DPEP's creative, marketing, production, and franchise management groups.

Key Responsibilities Include:

  • Brand Stewardship
  • Contract Negotiation
  • Rights and Clearance
  • Talent Agreements and Contracting Expert
  • Music Licensing
  • You will advocate on behalf of Yellow Shoes creative work.
  • Exhibit proficiency in advertising law and communications guidelines with evolving legal/contractual, talent residual, brand nomenclature issues and regulations
    Ensure Yellow Shoes is following corporate and regulatory guidelines in specified areas
  • Coordinate and review all Yellow Shoes creative output for legal/compliance issues (third-party rights, copyright notification, claim substantiation)
  • Synchronizes with internal Business Affairs partners to oversee scripts/usage approvals, rights clearances and character integrity with Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) and Disney Character Voices
  • Prioritize items for further review/consultation with Disney lawyers, Safety and Brand
  • Stewardship when warranted
  • Consult on service agreements with outside agencies, photographers/videographers and manage wage/labor payments through payment companies
  • Maintain clear and succinct notes/comments in Work-Front project management system as applicable
  • Establish client relationships with frequent communications concerning deal negotiations, timelines and any potential contingencies
  • Contribute to drafting contracts/agreements (together with Legal/Procurement) for production, illustration services and other services the Yellow Shoes team procures.
    In collaboration with other Business Affairs partners maintains database of completed contract/agreements

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 5 years of marketing, advertising, business affairs or legal affairs experience
  • Negotiating skills, drafting abilities
  • Prioritization and time management skills with the ability to execute against multiple, high-priority projects
  • Maintain high level of respect from others within the agency (including leadership), TWDC legal counsel and across the broader Marketing and Sales organization
  • Understanding of variety of communication mediums including video, print, digital, email, collateral, OOH, and the production process supporting each
  • Judgment, analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills
  • Familiar with applications/systems for project management (e.g. Excel, Workfront, SharePoint)

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with SAG-AFTRA Talent Residual parameters
  • Knowledge of music rights/usage
  • Spanish and/or Portuguese language fluency

Required Education

  • 4-year Bachelor's degree, or equivalent experience

Preferred Education

  • Paralegal Certificate
  • Legal/Law (JD) Degree

Additional Information:

This role is located in Celebration, FL.
Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

description:
Job Summary:

Consumer Products, Games and Publishing (CPGP) is the division of Disney Parks, Experiences and Products (DPEP) that brings beloved brands and franchises into the daily lives of families and fans through products – from toys to t-shirts, apps, books, console games and more – and experiences that can be found around the world, including on the shopDisney e-commerce platform and at Disney Parks, local and international retailers, as well as Disney store locations globally. The business is home to world-class teams of product, licensing and retail experts, artists and storytellers, and technologists who inspire imaginations around the world.

The Assistant Manager, Communications (CPGP) supports the business communications team with CPGP activations and product launches tied to sustainability, cultural celebrations and heritage months, as well as licensing and retail partner communications and industry events. The Assistant Manager, Communications (CPGP) manages all content updates tied to DisneyLicensing.com throughout the year and leading up to key events. In this role you would drive the development of earnings presentation messaging, fact sheets, daily industry news updates and weekly briefings for leadership. You would also supporting the development of presentations, scripts, and invitations. Using a strategic mindset, collaboration with various stakeholders domestically and internationally, strong writing abilities and excellent project management skills are all part of this position.

Responsibilities:

Every day as the Assistant Manager, Communications is different. On any given day you may:
  • Drive the creation of website copy and assist with crafting communications plans and copyediting for various launches tied to Sustainability and Diversity, Equity & Inclusion.
  • Manage all communication needs tied to CPGP presence at industry events to drive key business priorities, including project timelines, scripts, key messaging, invitations, post-event surveys, executive briefs and beyond.
  • Craft key messages to business partners throughout the year and manage content updates to DisneyLicensing.com to ensure partners understand business priorities.
  • Support all business communications efforts tied to competitive insight analysis, including earnings recaps and daily industry news updates.
  • Manage a team calendar and project archive and serve as the team resource for compiling fact sheets and talking points related to earnings presentations.
  • Collaborate with the internal communications team to identify relevant storytelling opportunities for local and global teams.
  • Conduct ad hoc research, develop media audits and provide recommendations as necessary tied to storytelling opportunities and key program launches.
  • Create external communications plans and story briefs tied to key reputation drivers, as needed.

Basic Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience in communications, preferably corporate communications
  • Excellent writing skills, knowledge of AP style guide
  • Ability to clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiences
  • Strategic thinking mindset
  • Experience conducting research and executing communications with purpose
  • Organized, creative, flexible, and a multi-tasker
  • Curiosity about tech, retail and entertainment industries
  • Desire to help foster an inclusive team culture

Required Education

  • Bachelor's degree in communications, journalism, or marketing or equivalent work experience

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

description:
Job Summary:

What we’re looking for…
A Project Management Intern to work within the department responsible for tactical project management of small to large projects from blue sky to close out. Working under leadership at Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI), we are seeking a passionate individual fueled by curiosity, energized by relationships and motivated to drive continuous improvement that matters. Our Project Management team regularly interfaces with creative, technical, engineering and construction disciplines in the delivery of show/ride design and systems throughout the life of the project.


Responsibilities:

You will…
  • Assist in developing the scope of a large project while maintaining budget and schedule objectives
  • Assist in managing design development, including issue resolution and cross-functional input coordination
  • Assist in scheduling, estimating, budgeting within project scope
  • Coordinate information by collecting and verifying document change information for presentation of solutions
  • Assist in presentations to executive management on project status
  • Facilitate relationships; communicate verbally and in written correspondence for presentations to the project team, vendors, and consultants

Basic Qualifications:

What you bring to the role…
  • Proven ability to manage the project design development process and documentation
  • Full understanding of scheduling, budgeting and quality
  • Exposure to and experience with procurement methodologies, including hiring of outside vendors, and developing professional bid packages
  • Thorough understanding of the contract administration process (contacts, professional fees)
  • Ability to manage through conflict, complexity and to problem-solve issues to resolution
  • Ability to understand the needs of the client and to manage relationships between the owner/operator
  • Computer literacy (Word, Excel, Keynote, Powerpoint, E-Mail)
  • Ability to take direction, adapt to change, establish relationships, and work in a team environment

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 1-2 years relevant Project Management experience

Required Education

  • Currently enrolled as a Junior or higher, or graduated within the past 6 months, from an accredited college/university, earning a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Construction Management, Project Management, Engineering, Architecture, advanced business degree, or related field

Additional Information:


Internship Eligibility:
  • Must be enrolled in an accredited college/university taking at least one class in the semester/quarter (spring/fall) prior to participation in the internship program OR must have graduated from a college/university within the past 6 months OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Professional Internship
  • Must not have completed one year of continual employment on a Disney internship or program.
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must possess unrestricted work authorization
  • Must provide full work availability
  • Must provide own transportation to/from work
  • Current Active Disney cast members must meet Professional Internship transfer guidelines (for Walt Disney World cast members this is no more than four points and one reprimand in the last six months; for Disneyland cast members this is six months of consecutive service and a performance record clear of any disciplinary issues (warnings, suspensions, etc.) for at least six months)
Program Length: The approximate dates of this internship are May/June 2022 through August/September 2022. Interns must be fully available for the duration of the internship.

Housing: This internship is located in Glendale, CA. The selected candidate must be receptive to providing their own housing and transportation.

description:
Job Summary:

Imagine yourself as a Sr. Workforce Analyst in People Insights where your natural curiosity for problem solving will help ensure we are leveraging data effectively to drive decisions within Human Resources. In this role, you will be able to blaze new paths in this data rich environment through reporting and analysis that support functions within HR and the business. You will have the chance to leverage your expertise and knowledge to maximize the Company’s investment in our employees through complex analysis, creative resolutions and impactful solutions.

You have a curiosity that leads you to always ask, “What's possible?” and you have the ability to bring those concepts to reality in everything you touch from operational reporting to strategic analytics.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with organizational leaders, analysts and subject matter experts to understand business processes, evaluate needs and analyze data
  • Identify areas of opportunity to increase operational efficiency and influence clients, across job levels and business units, towards the optimal solutions
  • Provide consultative support for clients across the organization to truly understand core questions and current priorities to ensure reporting and analysis align with business objectives
  • Work collaboratively with other team members to ensure internal alignment and efficiency
  • Empower stakeholders to self-serve, interpret, and apply insights through training and consultation
  • Effectively articulate actionable information to help make informed business decisions.
  • Translate high-level business objectives into consistent, accurate, efficient and effective reporting and analysis
  • Evaluate business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions
  • Provide subject matter expertise regarding data, systems and the business, advising on how to best utilize the data
  • Connect to and transform data using a consistent, sustainable approach leveraging our suite of BI tools and data.

Basic Qualifications:

description:
Job Summary:

Disney Parks, Experiences and Products (DPEP) brings stories and characters to life through innovative and engaging physical products and digital experiences across more than 100 categories, from toys and t-shirts to apps, books, console games and much more. The business is home to world-class teams of app and game developers, licensing and retail experts, leading retail and e-commerce businesses – Disney store and shopDisney.com – as well as renowned artists, storytellers and technologists who inspire imaginations around the world.

Do you have deep experience supporting a high-level executive? Are you known for keeping your cool under pressure? Can you interact with the most senior levels of management? If you’re nodding your head, then a senior executive support professional position in Disney Parks, Experiences and Products (DPEP) might be right for you.

Our Senior Executive Assistants are highly-respected and use their skills to keep the wheels turning so that our guests and consumers can enjoy the legendary Disney Magic. You will be a key member of a dynamic, fast-paced team that does its part to bring smiles to millions, and you will learn about your industry from some of the most creative, intelligent and innovative people in the field.

This Senior Executive Assistant is responsible for supporting the EVP – Chief Digital & Technology Officer (CDTO) within Disney Parks, Experiences and Products. In this role you must demonstrate strong interpersonal skills with the ability to anticipate needs, take initiative, prioritize, meet deadlines, and be resourceful and flexible, while maintaining absolute professionalism and confidentiality. In addition to understanding your executive’s business -- and business needs -- inside and out, you’ll also need to develop deep knowledge of the leadership and workings of Disney Parks, Experiences and Products and of related departments across the Disney enterprise.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform administrative duties including, but not limited to, screening and routing phone calls, managing calendars, processing invoices, scheduling meetings requiring significant coordination and follow up, and ensuring timely and effective communications
  • Prepare expense reports in SAP and ensure they are submitted in a timely manner
  • Prepare for meetings including setup for large presentations/video conferences with multiple sites
  • Manage the planning, coordination, and execution of business travel, including trip logistics and itinerary, meeting coordination, and remote support for when the executive is out of the office
  • Interface directly with other senior executives, their support teams, and external organizations
  • Proactively manage the leader’s schedule to build in travel and buffer time, align against key priorities, and flex as urgent issues arise
  • Handle confidential, sensitive information
  • Draft letters and emails on behalf of your leader
  • Provide additional office support such as ordering supplies, processing purchase orders and approvals processes
  • Mentor and train other support professionals
  • Coordinate department off-sites and events as needed
  • Assist with any special projects and other related duties as needed

Basic Qualifications:

  • At least 7 years supporting a Senior or Executive Vice President and/or equivalent top-level executive experience
  • Fluent in collaboration and productivity tools
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Desire to immerse yourself fully and learn all aspects of the business
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize deadlines and deliverables
  • Thrives in a fast-paced and agile environment
  • Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office programs, SAP, Confluence, Concur, VTC, Slack, Zoom, and working in both Windows and Apple environments
  • Ability to flex your schedule as needed
  • Very strong organizational skills and extreme attention to detail
  • Displays a highly professional demeanor, maintains a positive outlook, and exhibits a solution-oriented approach

Required Education

  • High school diploma

Preferred Education

  • Associates degree or related certification

description:
Job Summary:

At Disney, we’re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life through our movies, television programs, parks and resorts, and consumer products. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.
This Management Audit (MA) position is primarily responsible for assisting the Managers and Directors of MA with the execution of annual audit plan, including performing information technology and operational audits across the Disney Media Entertainment Distribution, including Studio, General Entertainment, Sports and Direct to Consumer, and Parks, Experiences and Products segments, as well as International Operations and our Corporate functions.
Stories are better when the storytellers represent the vast experiences of the people who will hear them. At Disney, we have the opportunity and the responsibility to create authentic, unforgettable stories, experiences, and products that capture the imagination of generations of people around the world. We are committed to doing that in a way that counts everybody in.
Our Benefits: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities, and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

Responsibilities:

  • Assist the Managers and Directors in high quality execution of the annual audit plan in accordance with the MA methodology
    • Perform audit planning activities such as the development of risk and control matrices, data analytics within key processes under audit, drafting of key communications to audit stakeholders and preparation of document request lists
    • Execute fieldwork by performing audit testing through inquiry, data analytics, observation and re-performance and documenting results in working papers
    • Prioritize audit procedures by thinking strategically and understanding business processes within the broader context of the Company operations
  • Identify the impact of audit findings (e.g. control weaknesses) on financial statements, operations and brand
  • Formulate well-written, concise and clear audit findings and assist the Managers and Directors in the operation of audit reports
  • Build effective relationships and work closely with audit stakeholders across all business units of the Company
  • Support the Managers and Directors in department initiatives related to the MA Project Management Office, annual audit planning, audit quality review and department budget
  • Quickly develop and understanding of Disney’s culture and company structures
    • Gain and apply historical knowledge of the department’s audit work in order to leverage internal department experience in future audits

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum 3 years work experience in IT auditing and/or information security
  • Willingness to travel up to 25-40% (domestic and international) upon business travel resumption
  • Excellent team player, who possesses solid interpersonal and organizational skills
  • Possess high energy level, decisiveness and strong work ethic
  • Able to work in a flexible team environment and handle multiple assignment simultaneously
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills and the ability to adapt quickly in a fast paced environment

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience at a top accounting firm or the internal audit function of a reputable public company
  • Experience with spreadsheets, databases, Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI, ACL, SAS or other data / analytical tools
  • Knowledge of scripting languages
  • Entertainment industry experience

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Information Systems, Accounting, Finance, or related business field

Preferred Education

  • CIA, CISA, CISSP or other relevant professional certifications

description:
Job Summary:

The Junior Designer works in the Creative and Production team, under the Design Manager, on projects from conceptualisation through to creative executions for all brands throughout The Walt Disney Company AUNZ with a focus on Marvel, Lucasfilm, Pixar and Disney+ and Star, in collaboration with internal and external partners, against key business objectives. This is an initial 12 month fixed term contract.

The Junior Designer role is responsible for providing creative solutions across multiple business areas but primarily Integrated Studio Marketing/Franchise, Branded Experience and Disney+ focussing on creativity and innovation on outputs across the business that are aligned to brand integrity and brand guidelines.

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for design and production of digital, social and print solutions across a wide range of formats and outputs across Disney brands, franchises and LOBs requests and projects.
  • Support the creative vision and direction of Head of Creative and Production, Design Manager and senior Marvel, Lucasfilm, Pixar designer.
  • Work closely with the Disney+ Brand, Performance Marketing and Partnerships teams partnering to create great creative solutions to brief, responsible for key deliverables and timelines.
  • Participate in creative ideation/thinking sessions for brands, franchises and projects
  • Support a highly positive team culture.
  • Be accountable for creating and managing asset outputs under the direction of Design Manager and senior Marvel, Lucasfilm, Pixar designer.
  • Uphold a collaborative pragmatic approach, acting as an enabling partner with the key business to influence best-practice creative.
  • Source and select appropriate imagery and graphic assets and work within creative guidelines to ensure consistency with brand and wider brand strategy.
  • Partner with brand leads in the creative team to deliver key projects and outputs and ensure brand alignment and consistency.
  • Effectively manage own personal workload.
  • Ensure quality, compliance, and integrity across all work delivered

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience working in a creative agency, or large brand in a creative capacity, ideally completing major projects in the entertainment or media space
  • In-depth understanding of design, branding, marketing, consumer journey is required
  • Experience with designs for entertainment or media brands, ideally with retail components
  • The ability to work to tight deadlines and adapt to changing business demands at short notice
  • Able to multi-task across a number of work streams and deliver to deadlines.
  • Delivers within brand and service creative guidelines
  • Educated to degree level or equivalent

Preferred Qualifications:

  • A relentless drive and passion for innovation and new ideas, and true understanding of what the Walt Disney Company brands and franchises represent
  • Committed to creating and supporting positive relationships and culture
  • Know how to engage and tell a story through creative
  • Technical ability in Adobe Creative Suite; Photoshop, Illustrator, Indesign is mandatory. Digital design (HTML5), motion (After Effects) and video software knowledge an advantage.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, and to prioritise and allocate work in order to meet delivery deadlines
  • Strong team player, able to work in a busy and demanding environment

Additional Information:

This is unique opportunity to join the talented team that develops and delivers unparalleled entertainment across Australia and New Zealand so if this role captures your imagination then apply now!

The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse and inclusive workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. We are committed to building a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

The Walt Disney Company and its subsidiary and affiliated companies depend on accurate and complete records to support daily business operations, to satisfy compliance with legal and regulatory recordkeeping requirements, and to protect the interests of the Company, its shareholders, employees, and Cast Members. Accordingly, the Company’s records are valuable resources that must be managed effectively and consistently throughout their lifecycle, from creation to their final disposition.

The enterprise Records & Information Management (“RIM”) organization is responsible for the Company-wide RIM program, including oversight of compliance with RIM program policies, procedures, and initiatives.

  • Partner with Enterprise RIM to develop a segment-specific annual and long-term implementation plan for assigned business with scope, timeline, communication strategy and executive approval
  • Project manage the segment/content group RIM program to keep the project goals focused and on track
  • Collaborate with learning and development partners to effectively ensure employees receive required online courses and/or acknowledgements
  • Collaborate with communications partners to ensure RIM employee/cast member awareness and adoption of initiatives
  • Develop tools and processes to ensure consistent and effective implementation and sustainment of RIM policies and standards in accordance with Enterprise RIM
  • Inform and guide executives regarding RIM implementation plans
  • Provide personalized support, training, and guidance to employees/cast members
  • Provide technical guidance and direction to clients in partnership with technology partners
  • Prepare project reports for steering committee, management, Enteprise RIM as requested

  • Provide RIM subject matter expertise to Enterprise RIM Program on an ad-hoc basis as needed
  • Knowledge share with peers regarding best practices, lessons learned, tools, templates, etc.
  • Work with clients, technical resources, and all levels of management to implement policy compliance

  • Strong presentation skills
