description:
Job Summary:

The Enterprise Sourcing & Procurement function has been established to support the business Segments Sourcing and Procurement requirements. The Enterprise Sourcing team is responsible for developing and executing global, regional and local category management strategies and provides commercial support and insights to the numerous stakeholders across the various Disney businesses.

The Source to Pay Transformation Project involves reviewing all processes and policies associated with Source to Pay as well as implementing Coupa (currently we use Ariba.) The Procurement Spend Analyst will be a part of the Enterprise Sourcing Finance and Operations team and be responsible for project work associated with the Source to Pay Transformation Project, with a focus on improving our Spend and Vendor Reporting.

This is an initial 12 month fixed term contract opportunity.

Responsibilities:

Validate the Spend Categorization in Ariba
    • Review how the current spend is categorized in Ariba.
      • High Value Vendors – validate with Sourcing team
      • Lower Value Vendors – research and then validate with Sourcing team.
    • Where required build system rules to ensure the spend is categorized correctly.
Link contracts to spend:
    • Complete template to manually link spend to contracts in Ariba.
Reporting:
    • Run spend analysis reports for nominated Region / Category as requested to validate categorization.
Preparation for Guided Buying:
    • Identify key vendors by sub category.
    • Understand the nature of the spend e.g. Goods or Services, one off or repeatable to help determine appropriate buying channel in Coupa.
    • Understand how the spend category is assigned for each of the procurement channels in Coupa and what we can do to ensure the accuracy of the categorization.
Other Project tasks
  • Complete project related tasks as requested. Examples include:
    • Compare existing RFP templates used by different Regions and Categories and look for standardization opportunities.
    • Testing of new system functionality
    • Data migration
    • Documentation of processes

Basic Qualifications:

  • University degree or equivalent work experience.
  • 3 - 5 years’ experience in Finance, Sourcing or Procurement department.
  • Experience working on projects.
  • Experience dealing with large volumes of data.
  • Experience with Coupa or Ariba advantageous

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong analytical skills
  • Strong Reporting Skills
  • Ability to interact with and establish relationships with employees at all levels
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to collaborate in a team environment
  • Internal customer focus – ability to identify/solicit key stakeholder needs and develop solutions to address their needs

* Understand the nature of the spend e.g. Goods or Services, one off or repeatable to help determine appropriate buying channel in Coupa.
* Understand how the spend category is assigned for each of the procurement channels in Coupa and what we can do to ensure the accuracy of the categorization.


Other Project tasks
* Complete project related tasks as requested. Examples include:

* Compare existing RFP templates used by different Regions and Categories and look for standardization opportunities.
* Testing of new system functionality
* Data migration
* Documentation of processes

* University degree or equivalent work experience.
* 3 - 5 years’ experience in Finance, Sourcing or Procurement department.
* Experience working on projects.
* Experience dealing with large volumes of data. 
* Experience with Coupa or Ariba advantageous

* Strong analytical skills
* Strong Reporting Skills
* Ability to interact with and establish relationships with employees at all levels
* Strong written and oral communication skills
* Ability to collaborate in a team environment
* Internal customer focus – ability to identify/solicit key stakeholder needs and develop solutions to address their needs

description:
Job Summary:

Job Title: Senior Finance Analyst, FMCG
Location: Hammersmith, London

Job & LOB Summary

Walt Disney set the standard for character licensing in the entertainment industry when he licensed the image of Mickey Mouse for a children's notebook. Today, Disney Consumer Products is the world's largest licensor of intellectual property, bringing Disney magic to the heart of the home through compelling products and experiences. Working here, you will translate Disney's beloved brand, stories and characters into a broad range of consumer products that feed the imagination, create fashion, encourage healthy eating habits, and add the excitement to celebrations.

Join a company passionate about great products. From fashion, toys and home décor to books and magazines, furniture and food, Disney-branded products capture hearts and inspire lifelong memories.

As a key member of the Consumer Products, Games & Publishing (CPGP) EMEA FP&A team, the teams’ main responsibilities are:
  • Assist in the smooth running of FP&A processes within team and across local markets.
  • Provide day to day commercial support, reporting and analytics to Business leads.

Responsibilities:

FP&A:
  • Support the Senior Finance Manager in the smooth running of key FP&A cycles and ad hoc requests (Forecast, Accrual, AOP, 5YP) for Global/ Regional & Local FMCG partners.
  • Ensure licensee forecasts are received, checked for accuracy and discussed with the relevant Category teams. Drive forecast loads and system validations.
  • Partner with the Senior Finance Manager and the rest of the team to improve efficiency in processes and share best practice.
  • Assist in the preparation of the Forecast/ AOP and Accrual presentations to support Senior Management and Commercial Leads
Commercial Support
  • Support FMCG Category Directors/ Managers on overarching and category specific strategies to grow key accounts and streamline tail.
  • Provide analytics and support to assist the wider commercial teams with business plan finalisation, contract renewals, other revenue opportunities (e.g shortfall situations and audit issues).
  • Assist business leads with timely and relevant reporting on the performance of the business / franchise and licensees.
  • Share insights on FMCG market & competitor performance to identify scalable opportunities and influence strategic decisions.
  • Support on project work and lead on ad hoc requests where required.
Team Management
  • Assist in the management and development of Intern through mentoring.
  • Lead by example to ensure collaborative approach with other teams including FP&A, Softlines/ Hardlines, Credit Collection, Revenue Accounting & Controllership, Legal and Contracts team.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Accounting qualification e.g. CIMA/ACCA/ACA
  • Knowledge and understanding of Consumer Products business along with firm grasp of CPC / FP&A systems, policies and processes.
  • Demonstrable track record of providing commercial support and analysis to business partners that’s insightful, timely and responsive
  • Excellent communication skills both verbal and written, tailored to all levels of the organisation
  • Numerate and analytical with a desire to think through and resolve problems.
  • Results focused and outcome driven.

Additional Information:

The Perks:
  • 25 days annual leave
  • Private medical insurance & dental care
  • Free Park Entry: You will have the opportunity to enter any of our parks with your family and friends for free
  • Disney Discounts: you are entitled to discounts on designated Disney products, resort F&B and ticketing
  • Flexible working hours are available
  • Excellent maternity & paternity leave
  • Business Resource Groups – Women @ Disney, Diversity @ Disney, Pride @ Disney etc.
The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. We are committed to building a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

description:
Job Summary:

Disneyland Paris adapte sa stratégie commerciale pour toujours proposer une expérience inoubliable à ses guests (visiteurs). Notre équipe e-Commerce lance plusieurs initiatives de transformation des plateformes pour concevoir et offrir des parcours plus fluides, plus immersifs et répondant mieux aux attentes de nos guests. Dans ce contexte de forte transformation digitale, nous renforçons nos équipes et sommes à la recherche d’un.e Lead Product Designer UI/User Interface pour manager les UI Designers et ainsi contribuer à l’atteinte d’ambitieux objectifs.


Vos Missions ?
  • Animer une équipe d’environ 5 UI Designers
  • Contribuer à définir la vision UI e-Commerce
  • Réaliser des travaux de UI Design

En tant que Lead, vous serez amené. à :
  • Co-créer la vision Design avec le Head of Product Design
  • Porter la vision dans le département & au-delà
  • Apporter l’expertise UI et assurer une veille
  • Définir & appliquer des modes de collaboration avec les principaux partenaires & parties prenantes : Product Designers, Product Managers, Product Owners, développeurs, testeurs et l’ensemble des parties prenantes pour imaginer l'expérience de demain
  • Participer au suivi du plan de charge (à coordonner avec les Product Managers qui leadent le sujet)
  • Animer l’équipe de UI Designers
  • Coacher les Designers sur leur métier
  • Challenger les productions
  • Assurer l'application des bonnes pratiques
  • Contribuer à la transformation digitale en étant force de proposition & en supportant le changement

En tant que Designer, vous serez amené. à :
  • Créer des maquettes (Figma)
  • Créer des prototypes interactifs (Figma)
  • Participer à la transformation digitale, en travaillant notamment sur le Design system de Disneyland Paris avec les autres designers
  • Faciliter l'intégration des visuels sur le site en redimensionnant les images aux différents formats


Vos atouts pour réussir ?
  • Idéalement titulaire d'un Bac+5, vous avez une expérience de 7 ans minimum dans un poste similaire dans une agence digitale, cabinet de conseil, en entreprise ou startup
  • Les techniques « Design Thinking » n’ont pas de secret pour vous
  • Vous travaillez avec des développeurs dans des méthodologies de type Scrum/Kanban (en d’autres termes, toute la conception n’est pas réalisée en amont, un produit évolue dans le temps)
  • Vous maîtrisez parfaitement les logiciels de création graphique utilisés pour la modélisation d’interfaces (Figma)
  • Vous faites preuve de persuasion pour porter la vision de votre produit et facilitez la communication et la collaboration entre l’ensemble des parties prenantes
  • Vos qualités de leader, votre esprit d'initiative et vos qualités relationnelles vous permettront d'assurer avec succès les missions qui vous seront confiées, et de vous adapter rapidement à un environnement international dynamique
  • Vous maîtrisez l'anglais, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral


La différence Disneyland Paris ?
  • Un environnement exceptionnel, international et multiculturel concentré sur un site unique
  • Un programme d‘intégration complet sur votre poste et l’accès à de nombreuses formations
  • Des opportunités de développement de votre carrière
  • Télétravail et d’autres avantages dont prise en charge partielle des frais de transports
  • Contribuer à la transformation digitale & travailler sur des projets stratégiques et ambitieux


Prêt(e) à participer à une formidable aventure humaine ? A rejoindre nos collaborateurs (Cast Members) partageant la même ambition professionnelle : celle de faire vivre la magie Disneyland Paris pour les millions de visiteurs qui viennent dans nos parcs tous les ans ?
Il ne vous reste plus qu’à postuler car nous sommes prêts à vous donner les moyens de faire rayonner vos talents !


‘Disneyland Paris est soucieux d’offrir à ses Cast Members les conditions de travail les plus favorables à leur épanouissement professionnel. Dans ce cadre et pour garantir une flexibilité optimale, les emplois qui ne nécessitent pas une intervention ou l’accès à des installations ou applications sur site et/ou des interactions physiques peuvent s’exercer en télétravail, avec un minimum de présence requis de cinq jours par mois sur site.

description:
Job Summary:

We, at Yellow Shoes, are looking for a Sr. Copywriter to work on our CPGP Business (Consumer Products Gaming and Publishing). Your #1 responsibility is to bring your unique self and perspective to our team and culture. But make no mistake, as a Sr. Copywriter, you'll have other responsibilities too. Like creating fresh, new and conceptual ideas alongside talented team members, while mentoring Jr. creatives. You will show your problem-solving skills for a range of advertising media. Social and digital by design, we expect every Yellow Shoes creative team member to grasp the importance of thinking creatively in a tech-inspired world. Solid, imaginative copywriting ability and expert understanding of the creative production process are expected. As part of our team, curiosity and a passion to learn will take you very far.

You will report to the Group Creative Strategy Director.

Responsibilities:

  • Think conceptually and breathe life to ideas that bring magic to Disney's retail / eCommerce experience.
  • Flex creative muscles across our renowned Franchises including Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic and others.
  • Build relationships with business and creative partners.
  • Help lead creative campaigns – develop from concept to execution.
  • Balances multiple projects at a time, works with cross-functional teams, and reacts to feedback with thoughtful creative solutions.
  • Partner well with a Sr. Art Director to provide compelling, 360 campaign concepts.
  • Mentor Jr. Creatives, guiding their daily creative work and offering feedback.
  • Present projects according to timelines and deadlines.
  • High level of craft in all facets of writing – from long form to short-form.
  • Decipher briefs and blend goals into compelling concepts and creative storytelling.
  • "Boil down" to the "essence" of the main message with accuracy.

Basic Qualifications:

  • A love for ideas – both big and small.
  • Your unique voice and perspective by showcasing creativity and inspiration.
  • Expertise in retail/eCommerce, including current industry trends & creative work.
  • High on talent, low on ego.
  • Your portfolio that shows inventive, conceptual thinking to execution, versatile creative solutions, originality and storytelling with a type A-level attention to wordsmithing.
  • Experience presenting skills to all levels - senior to executive.
  • Knowledge and genuine interest in the Walt Disney Company history – including films, animation, television, theme parks and products.
  • 7 years of experience as a conceptual copywriter at a creative agency or in-house.
  • Proficiency in creative software (Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign), GSuite).

Preferred Qualifications:

5+ years in an agency setting, or related experience

Required Education

An associates (2 year) degree in Advertising, English, Journalism, or any other related writing discipline.

Preferred Education

A bachelor's (4 year) degree in liberal arts or from an ad school.

Additional Information:

Our Benefits: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

description:
Job Summary:

Disney+ Hotstar is the fastest growing entertainment brand in India with one of the largest subscription services in the country, and millions more accessing quality entertainment that’s available free. Over the past six years, Disney+ Hotstar has been instrumental in shaping how Indians consume their favourite content, migrating audiences at scale from television to a device of their choice.

ABOUT THE TEAM

We serve high quality content to millions of customers across millions of devices, all of which are constantly evolving and changing. As we increase our scale, we plan to add to our existing user base through highly personalized and targeted marketing initiatives.

YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Track projects on a daily basis, keeping goals in sight
  • Assist in setting up new projects and provide progress updates
  • Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure smooth and timely functioning of all ongoing initiative from marketing to analytics and so on
  • Work with different teams to identify and coordinate for market research studies, competitive studies, culture studies, etc
  • Prepare dashboards and presentations for regular project updates and meetings
  • Contribute towards content acquisition efforts including watching content screeners and maintaining contact with external partners from time to time
  • Build and maintain a content repository of active content in consideration and track the next steps in the process
  • Liaise with the Legal department & Commercial department on all contracts that need to be executed with partners and vendors, including media houses for content catalogues, talent onboarding for projects

WHAT TO BRING

  • MBA (Premier or Tier 1 management institute) with at least 3-5 years of post-qualification experience
  • Previous experience in new age digital media/creator economy ecosystem will be an added advantage
  • Avid content consumer across platforms- books, OTT, TV, Films
  • Ability to multitask
  • Expertise and experience in content creation and/or writing; Social and political awareness – understands India deeply, soulfully; Creative imagination: ability to bring a concept alive in script/ telling
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Relationship building skills, collaborative approach to work
  • Good communication: can articulate, take others along in their vision
  • A roll-up-the-sleeves and get things done attitude
  • Conversational in the regional (Telugu) language
  • Affinity for entertainment, either creating or viewing, is an advantage

OUR VALUES

  • We are customer obsessed
  • We are audacious in vision and action
  • We encourage honesty and open dialogue
  • We respect everyone and every point of view
  • We make objective and data-driven decisions
  • We believe trust and accountability go hand-in-hand
  • We invest in each other's growth
  • We bring our A-game and nothing else
  • We take charge and get it done

THE PERKS

  • The glory. Almost too much responsibility
  • No dress code. Unlimited leave. A fun-life balance
  • A ticket on our rocket ship to the moon
WHO WE ARE AS AN EMPLOYER

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.

WHO WE ARE AS A COMPANY

Disney+ Hotstar is one of the fastest growing video-on-demand services. Scratch that. We’re Disney+ Hotstar. The go-to destination for over 300 million active users who seek anything from award-winning English shows and movies to regional content to live sports. Basically, those that seek everything. Our mission is to revolutionize internet entertainment through smart personalization, and by building a global video platform that takes over the world wide web and the whole wide world.

#Non-tech


About Disney+ Hotstar:

Hotstar is one of the fastest growing video-on-demand services. Scratch that. We’re Hotstar. The go-to destination for over 100mn active users who seek anything from award-winning English shows and movies to regional content to live sports. Our mission is to revolutionize internet entertainment through smart personalization, and by building a global video platform - talk about taking over the world wide web and the whole wide world. Job Summary:

Disney Streaming is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including the ESPN+ premium sports streaming service; Disney+, the dedicated streaming home for entertainment from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic. Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. We serve consumers by bringing the world’s most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. We strive daily to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives consumers the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location.

The Media Operations Department at Disney Streaming Services consists of agile and responsive teams of technicians that perform the daily processes and procedures of our live and on-demand streaming video products. The department’s responsibilities consist of round-the-clock support for these products, ensuring proper functionality across all platforms.

Quality of Experience, at its core, is a measure of the end-to-end performance at the service level from the user’s perspective. The QE team strives to quantify the overall acceptability and service experience of an application that is live, in-store, in-market, in production. Leveraging online video analytics, proxy, and automation tools is key to this end goal.

Focusing on web, mobile and connected device clients - across a large suite of media products - the DSS QE Operator is responsible for troubleshooting live (and VOD) audio/video playback and data issues. They will work hand in hand with Media Operations teams to deliver quality control of live in app video streaming and data to front end users.

The team provides 24/7 operational support for all live events and works to help diagnose issues across platforms in the production environment. Escalating client and application issues/bugs to development teams as well as intense issue tracking and daily reporting are required tasks.

The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, have a great work ethic and strong communication skills. They must have an extreme dedication to detail. A strong knowledge of mobile and connected devices and some technical knowledge of the video streaming process is preferred.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete knowledge of DTD SOP & fundamental principles of QE
  • Responsible for updating app builds across clients and new build release checklists
  • Responsible for issue discovery, initial and deep dive troubleshooting, escalation communication, documentation and providing key data points for debugging
  • Responsible for confirming playback of live and VOD assets, including ad playback across relevant platforms
  • Takes ownership of live events and ensures that entry level and remote operator checks are being done
  • Responsible for sanity checks, or any other ad-hoc requests from team leads/senior level operators
  • Responsible for running proxy tools as needed
  • Responsible for JIRA ticket creation and classification

Basic Qualifications:

  • Flexible hours, but must be available to work nights, weekends, and holidays.
  • Availability and willingness to work up to 28 hours per week.
  • Strong understanding of computer programs and applications.
  • Strong understanding of mobile/connected device platforms and applications and device troubleshooting/debugging.
  • Strong communication skills and attention to detail.
  • Interest in OTT content and digital networks (preferably in sports) and a desire to work in the digital media industry.
  • A team player, with an enthusiastic, congenial, and committed performance as an employee.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • A solid computer and technical background with experience working in new media and online organizations.
  • Familiarity with proxy tools such as Charles and Fiddler for data capture and client/product debugging in real-time. Familiarity with online video analytics tools such as Conviva software.
  • Familiarity with automation tools and Jenkins automation server
  • Familiarity with JSON, XML, and other data files

description:
Job Summary:

The Disney Streaming Content Analytics team is seeking a Data Analyst who will be an exceptional addition to our team focusing on ESPN+. You will be responsible for turning data into information, information into insights, and insights into key business decisions that steer the strategic direction of The Walt Disney Company. The right person for this role has exceptional analytical capabilities, thrives in a fast-paced environment, loves problem-solving, is a good communicator, and is passionate about high quality sports content.

You will play a key role in the future of TWDC’s streaming business by being a go-to resource for all things related to content performance on ESPN+, delivering impactful insights to both content creators and operational decision-makers across The Walt Disney Company by telling powerful stories with data.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct analyses to drive valuable business insights, using internal analytics tools and SQL to access and manipulate multivariate data
  • Build data visualizations and multi-faceted dashboards that convey key performance metrics, significant trends, and relationships across multiple data sources within the content domain
  • Ideate and develop new metrics and analytical approaches, measuring content performance for both tactical and strategic decision-making
  • Take projects and requests from end-to-end, defining business needs, developing strategies, and socializing insights to the business
  • Effectively communicate results through compelling data storytelling across the organization
  • Provide ad-hoc analysis support to identify trends that drive business performance

Basic Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of relevant work experience in analytics and/or business intelligence
  • Strong analytical skills – with a proficient ability to read/write complex SQL queries to analyze data
  • Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.) coupled with strong storytelling skills for technical and non-technical audiences
  • Experience taking vague requirements and manipulating them into polished final products
  • Strong and effective communication and presentation skills

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in statistical analysis tools like R or Python
  • Understanding of data warehousing concepts and design
  • Prior experience in Media/Entertainment is a plus
  • Passion for sports content

Required Education

  • Degree in an analytical area such as Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science or equivalent

Additional Information:

Disney Streaming Services is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including Disney+, Hulu and ESPN+. Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. We strive daily to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives consumers the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location.

description:
Job Summary:

Are you curious, creative, and love data? Do you love to learn new things and collaborate with colleagues to solve hard and interesting problems? Imagine yourself as a Decision Scientist in People Insights where your natural curiosity for discovering analytical insights and trends will help ensure we are making data-driven decisions within Human Resources (HR) and across The Walt Disney Company. In this role, you will be able to blaze new paths in this data rich environment through statistical modeling, forecasting and employee research. You will have the chance to leverage your expertise and knowledge to maximize the Company’s investment in our employees through advanced analysis, data visualization, and compelling storytelling.

You have a curiosity that leads you to always ask, “What’s possible?” and you have the ability to bring those concepts to reality in everything you touch from analysis to actionable insights to provide decision support for workforce related issues.

Responsibilities:

  • Proactively identify analytical opportunities to answer business questions and drive action through clear actionable insights and storytelling
  • Create accurate, sustainable statistical algorithms and machine learning processes that support HR business processes, tools, or products
  • Conduct in-depth analysis to identify drivers of employee behaviors, forecast aggregated employee movements and actions, forecast and analyze cost of labor, programs, and return on investments
  • Build and work with large and complex data sets and measures to be used in analyses that drive business decisions
  • Consult within clients and a team of analyst, translating business objectives and analytical needs into repeatable analytical solutions

Basic Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated proficiency with database/statistical languages such as R, Python, and SQL analytics or software such as Dataiku
  • Strong knowledge of statistical methods, forecasting, and model building (e.g. Cluster Analysis, PCA, Regression, Decision Trees/Random Forests, Structural Equation Modeling)
  • Proven experience working in survey data (Item analysis, Scale Reliability, Key Drivers) but an appetite to combine with other data to take those analyses/insights to the next level (e.g. creating personas)
  • Experience with financial analysis including Return on Investment, Return on Expectations, Break-even Analysis, Program Evaluation, and forecasting of labor spend
  • Exceptional storytelling / presentation-building skills, including the ability to translate complex statistical concepts into simple and actionable insights
  • Bachelor’s degree in Organizational Psychology, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Analytics / Business Analytics or a related field

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with leading and developing others
  • Experience with HR / employee data (Workday), visualization tools, such as Tableau and/or Cognos, or large database environments (e.g. Snowflake, RedShift)
  • Proven experience leveraging NLP/ML to understand social media trends/sentiment
  • Advanced degree (Master’s or above) in Organizational Psychology, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Analytics / Business Analytics, or a related field

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Organizational Psychology, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Analytics / Business Analytics or a related field

Preferred Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Organizational Psychology, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Analytics / Business Analytics or a related field

description:
Job Summary:

Description

Position at Industrial Light & Magic

This posting is an opportunity to submit your resume for future consideration; this is not a role that is open at this time. We anticipate this role may be open in the future, but we are not actively hiring for the position. If you would like to be considered for this potential role, please submit your resume. If the role becomes available, you may receive an email or call from a recruiter.

We are looking for an Asset Artist who reflects the innovative spirit, creative talent, collaborative mindset and passion for great filmmaking that defines ILM.

The Asset Artist is responsible for models, textures and doing a 1st pass lookdev on all types of assets using a range of scans, art and photography as reference, plus their own imagination. Assets created are for use on ILM's Stagecraft LED walls, previs and in production.

What You’ll Do

  • Model and texture three-dimensional hard surface assets as either polygon or subdivision geometry, like mechanical objects, environments and props
  • Process, edit and use scans and photogrammetry to rapidly create environments and set extensions
  • Work closely with a team of artists, leads and supervisors to determine the aesthetic and technical needs of an asset
  • 1st pass lookdev and shader assignment for assets
  • Partner with supervision and production team to generate assets within the time frames required
  • As part of a team, create larger environments and sets including the creation of assets, layout and dressing sets with props and other elements. Work with multiple departments, use different workflows and pipelines based on the project's needs.

What We’re Looking For

  • Portfolio of work demonstrating model and texture skill set on a variety of assets
  • Strong communication skill set and a great attitude to get stuck in on any task
  • Flexible team player
  • Hungry to learn and pick up new tools
  • Knowledge of the VFX pipeline, how your work relates to and affects the other team members around you.
  • Ability to approach the same asset differently when given different time lines and levels of expectation
  • Knowledge of Maya, Zbrush, Reality capture (or other photogrammetry software), Mari, Substance Painter, and Substance Designer
  • Nice to have:
    • Lookdev experience
    • Experience in VFX, commercials, previs or pre production and/or an ability to use Houdini, 3Ds Max, Unreal
    • Experience modeling and texturing digital doubles and creatures

description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Parks and Resorts are where dreams come true. More than sixty years ago, Walt Disney created a new kind of entertainment families could experience together, immersed in detailed atmospheres and vibrant storytelling. His vision now includes a collection of six of the world’s leading family vacation destinations – Disneyland Resort, Anaheim, Calif.; Walt Disney World Resort, Lake Buena Vista, Fla.; Tokyo Disney Resort, Urayasu, Chiba, Japan; Disneyland Paris, Marne-la-Vallée, France; Hong Kong Disneyland Resort, located on Lantau Island; and Shanghai Disney Resort, Pudong New District, Shanghai, China. In addition, Walt Disney Parks and Resorts includes the world-class Disney Cruise Line; Disney Vacation Club; Aulani, A Disney Resort and Spa; Adventures by Disney, a guided group vacation experience to some of the world’s most popular destinations; and Walt Disney Imagineering, which creates and designs all Disney parks, resorts and attractions.

This role will be a part of the Site Reliability Engineering team in Disney Parks, Experience & Products, Tech and digital. The team supports several cloud-based infrastructure initiatives to improve dev ops efficiency and application developers’ productivity. As part of the team, the role will be responsible for leading the delivery of new infrastructure capabilities, enhancements to existing capabilities and opportunity to innovate for modernizing internal tools that support platform-wide operational activities.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage a team of highly talented Service Reliability Engineers located locally and abroad while still providing direct, on-keyboard impact
  • Build software and systems to manage infrastructure and customer-facing applications through automation
  • Identify opportunities to automate platform builds and processes
  • Collaborate and partner closely with Dev Ops teams and application development teams to design, build, deploy, support, and monitor new and existing services
  • Demonstrate leadership in executing a short/long-term strategic vision with the ability to explore and recommend technology investment
  • Measure and optimize service performance and availability
  • Balance resources, requirements, and complexity

Basic Qualifications:

  • Advanced experience with programming languages (GoLang, Python, Java, C++)
  • Experience building and managing mission critical systems on top of modern cloud services
  • Deep systems and infrastructure knowledge
  • Experience with dev ops platform tools like Gitlab.
  • Experience in systems configuration management and deployment with automation tools such as, Chef, Ansible, or Kubernetes
  • Experience with SRE goals, processes, and culture
  • Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills - lead by example to motivate and challenge the team to deliver their best.
  • Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills. The position requires frequent communication with senior leaders, technical colleagues and partners across several different geographic locations and time zones
  • Proven ability to work with all members of an extended and diverse project team
  • Must be detail-oriented, self-organized, be committed to quality and be capable of tracking, and managing multiple efforts simultaneously

Required Education

  • BS/MS in Computer Science or Equivalent

About Parks, Experiences and Products:

The Parks, Experiences and Products segment includes Disney’s iconic travel and leisure businesses, which include six resort destinations in the United States, Europe and Asia, a top-rated cruise line, a popular vacation ownership program, and an award-winning guided family adventure business. Disney’s global consumer products operations include the world’s leading licensing business across toys, apparel, home goods, digital games and apps; the world’s largest children’s publisher; Disney store locations around the world; and the shopDisney e-commerce platform.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Disney Parks Technology Services Co., LLC, which is part of a business we call Parks, Experiences and Products.

Disney Parks Technology Services Co., LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

description:
Job Summary:

We seek a motivated and experienced product manager to drive a new suite of video player test tools and automation capabilities for the Disney Streaming platform that powers Disney+, Hulu, Star+, ESPN+ and other services. Video players are the heart of the streaming experience and it is critical to ensure every viewer, on every device, on every continent, enjoys a magical experience.

The ideal candidate is highly analytical, resourceful, creative, team-oriented, and will have an ability to work independently under time constraints to achieve goals and fulfill requirements. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record for taking ownership of green-field technology initiatives, providing structure and organization for a broad matrix of stakeholders, and delivering measurable results for short-term and long-term goals. The ideal candidate seeks and receives input from a wide range of sources, makes data-driven decisions, obsesses over details, and forms strong yet loosely held opinions to build consensus. We value passionate product leadership that drives with discipline and attention to detail.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with counterparts across the company, including engineering, QA, QE, and product management, to build and maintain a roadmap of Video Player Test Tools and Automation capabilities that will be used to improve the video experience for all Disney Streaming services.
  • Work with individuals and/or teams to provide bespoke tools and test content.
  • Provide regular updates to stakeholders for new or updated capabilities.
  • Stay apprised of infield analytics/QoE data and take a data-driven approach to identifying areas of improvement.
  • Work with device and distribution partner teams to improve certification of players on third-party devices.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to translate requirements into actionable stories using an Agile product development process.
  • Generally serve as a champion for test tools and test automation across the company

Basic Qualifications:

  • You have minimum of (4) years video streaming experience as a technical product manager, or equivalent hands-on experience with video as a Dev/QA lead
  • You have experience working with streaming video, video players, and related capabilities for content protection, ad insertion, instrumentation, analytics, etc..
  • You understand quality assurance test methodologies, test cases, and the challenges associated with testing software for tight release schedules.
  • You have knowledge of various consumer device ecosystems and associated development lifecycles.
  • You have demonstrated an ability to assimilate information from a wide variety of sources to build new domain knowledge in order to solve problems.
  • You are scrappy and resourceful, with no fear of getting your hands dirty.
  • You have equal appreciation for elegant design and the expedient hack.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong technical understanding of modern video streaming technology, such as HLS/DASH, CMAF, DRM/encryption, HDR, audio/video standards, etc..
  • Experience writing and/or managing test cases and test suites.
  • Knowledge of HTTP, REST APIs, networking, web servers, CDNs, etc..

Additional Information:

Disney Streaming Services is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including the ESPN+ premium sports streaming service; the upcoming Disney subscription video service; and BAMTECH Media, a global leader in direct-to-consumer video streaming products and solutions. Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. We serve consumers by bringing the world’s most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. We strive daily to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives consumers the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location.

description:
Job Summary:

Are you curious, creative, and love data? Do you love to learn new things and collaborate with colleagues to solve hard and interesting problems? Imagine yourself as a Decision Scientist in People Insights where your natural curiosity for discovering analytical insights and trends will help ensure we are making data-driven decisions within Human Resources (HR) and across The Walt Disney Company. In this role, you will be able to blaze new paths in this data rich environment through statistical modeling, forecasting and employee research. You will have the chance to leverage your expertise and knowledge to maximize the Company’s investment in our employees through advanced analysis, data visualization, and compelling storytelling.

You have a curiosity that leads you to always ask, “What’s possible?” and you have the ability to bring those concepts to reality in everything you touch from analysis to actionable insights to provide decision support for workforce related issues.

Responsibilities:

  • Proactively identify analytical opportunities to answer business questions and drive action through clear actionable insights and storytelling.
  • Create accurate, sustainable statistical algorithms and machine learning processes that support HR business processes, tools, or products.
  • Conduct in-depth analysis to identify drivers of employee behaviors, forecast aggregated employee movements and actions, forecast and analyze cost of labor, programs, and return on investments.
  • Build and work with large and complex data sets and measures to be used in analyses that drive business decisions.
  • Consult within clients and a team of analyst, translating business objectives and analytical needs into repeatable analytical solutions.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated proficiency with database/statistical languages such as R, Python, and SQL analytics or software such as Dataiku.
  • Strong knowledge of statistical methods, forecasting, and model building (e.g. Cluster Analysis, PCA, Regression, Decision Trees/Random Forests, Structural Equation Modeling).
  • Proven experience working in survey data (Item analysis, Scale Reliability, Key Drivers) but an appetite to combine with other data to take those analyses/insights to the next level (e.g. creating personas).
  • Experience with financial analysis including Return on Investment, Return on Expectations, Break-even Analysis, Program Evaluation, and forecasting of labor spend.
  • Exceptional storytelling / presentation-building skills, including the ability to translate complex statistical concepts into simple and actionable insights.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Organizational Psychology, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Analytics / Business Analytics or a related field.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with leading and developing others.
  • Experience with HR / employee data (Workday), visualization tools, such as Tableau and/or Cognos, or large database environments (e.g. Snowflake, RedShift).
  • Proven experience leveraging NLP/ML to understand social media trends/sentiment.
  • Advanced degree (Master’s or above) in Organizational Psychology, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Analytics / Business Analytics, or a related field.

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Organizational Psychology, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Analytics / Business Analytics or a related field.

About The Walt Disney Company (Corporate):

At Disney Corporate you can see how the businesses behind the Company’s powerful brands come together to create the most innovative, far-reaching and admired entertainment company in the world. As a member of a corporate team, you’ll work with world-class leaders driving the strategies that keep The Walt Disney Company at the leading edge of entertainment. See and be seen by other innovative thinkers as you enable the greatest storytellers in the world to create memories for millions of families around the globe.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Disney Human Resources Services Co., LLC, which is part of a business we call The Walt Disney Company (Corporate).

Disney Human Resources Services Co., LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

description:
Job Summary:

Disney Streaming Services is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses. This includes the ESPN+ premium sports streaming service; Disney+, the dedicated streaming home for entertainment from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, and National Geographic; and Star+, the International consumer offering which combines the former services for the Latin American market.

Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time, or location. We serve consumers by bringing the world’s most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. We strive daily to imaginatively achieve operational excellence, and deliver the best end user experience for our customers.

The Media Operations Department at Disney Streaming Services consists of agile and responsive teams of analysts that perform the daily processes and procedures of our live and on-demand streaming video products. The department’s responsibilities consist of round-the-clock support for these products, ensuring proper functionality across all platforms.

The Technical Operations team serves to shape the technical procedures to be employed in day-to-day business. They accomplish this by working alongside engineers and software developers to gain insight into how backend services and infrastructure are built and the details of their workflows. This allows them to better understand how to monitor and support vital workflows that deliver our products to our customers. In addition, we function as the DevOps for these services teams and carry out certain roles and responsibilities on their behalf such as scaling, triaging, building dashboards and being the Tier 1 on-call support for selected teams.

Responsibilities:

  • Work day-to-day with Media Operations to ensure data, services, media, and distribution mechanics function properly to serve all streaming media properties.
  • Design, build, implement, and support monitoring tools to gauge streaming media performance and enable early identification of anomalies.
  • Provide detailed explanations to Production Service Operations and Customer Service with technical knowledge and understanding of Incident Management.
  • Lead engagement efforts between Technical Ops and back-end services engineers and developers with the goal of constantly improving performance, stability, and observability.
  • Monitor, analyze, and comprehend data analytics to quantify, anticipate, and resolve day-to-day technical problems in multiple toolsets – Kibana, Grafana, Cloudwatch, DataDog, NewRelic, and other data aggregation and log analysis tools.
  • Must be able to creatively solve complex data and media issues proactively, in-flight and posthumously.
  • Execute and monitor production deployments (planned and unplanned) across various back end systems in a fast-paced environment.
  • Follow Agile development cycles and collaborate with Technical Project Management leads.
  • Be a liason between dev/engineering teams to the Media Operations team
  • Pro-actively support Media Operations workflows before, during and after live events
  • Improve knowledge around Media/User services workflows

Basic Qualifications:

  • Typically has 6-8 years of experience in a technical field
  • Extensive experience with live streaming media workflows from both a technical and operational perspective
  • Thorough understanding of data synthesis and processing across origination, normalization, presentation, and storage
  • Confident understanding of programming languages and microservices
  • Ability to apply programming knowledge to the development of data-driven operational tools and applications
  • Certified or has exhibited equivalent competency in cloud computing or analytical discipline
  • Experience with live event based workflows

description:
Job Summary:

Disney Streaming Service is looking for a Sr. Manager, Product Marketing for Combo+. This person will develop and optimize product marketing strategies to drive growth of Combo+ internationally. The ideal candidate has experience driving full funnel marketing strategies for a large brand, and has worked extensively with product and engineering teams to bring marketing experience to life across the user journey. This candidate also has acquisition experience across platforms for a subscription service, and will be expected to develop and drive forward multi-platform strategies so as to optimize subscriptions. As a result, a successful candidate has a passion for the digital landscape and understands the intricacies and unique attributes of every step in the marketing funnel. They are highly analytical, creative, and have an in-depth understanding of promotional messaging and brand & product positioning to scale a digital product, all while simultaneously being able to understand and optimize product user experiences and nuances.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute marketing strategies that drive growth of Combo+, including both acquisition-focused work as well as retention & churn mitigation strategies.
  • Develop and optimize marketing strategies that impact product roadmaps so as to drive user acquisition, conversion and engagement across all relevant products included within Combo+.
  • Lead a team of Product Marketers to drive Combo+ product marketing optimization and expansion
  • Partner closely with regional teams to bring relevant, audience insight driven strategies to life across localized touchpoints
  • Collaborate with leaders across creative, product, engineering, media, and other Combo+ brands (Disney+ and Star+) to create innovative and impactful programs that deliver against KPIs.
  • Balance Product & Content priorities across products, studios, and other stakeholders. Partner with Product, Sports & Studio Marketing, Brand, Paid, Lifecycle, Analytics, and Design teams to identify key growth areas, feature prioritization, user experience, and marketing strategy
  • Imagine, test, and iterate new promotional tactics across owned platforms, existing third-party platforms, and emerging channels
  • Define KPIs to measure campaign success and forecast performance to inform accurate planning
  • Drive optimizations based on analytical insights and data to show positive return on marketing efforts, continuously improving user lifetime value and reducing churn
  • Excellent decision-making skills with the ability to identify, prioritize, and articulate high impact marketing initiatives
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic working environment, supporting new products/businesses supported by a proven large-scale media property

Basic Qualifications:

  • 7+ years marketing experience, with at least 2 years working on a DTC service.

description:
Job Summary:

At Disney, we‘re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.

Imagine yourself as a Manager, Data Integration where your natural passion for working with data will allow you to be part of a team that enables insights to drive the enterprise HR strategy of The Walt Disney Company. In this role, you will have the chance to leverage your expertise and knowledge to assist in management, governance and integration of workforce data in service of analytics and decision science needs. You will bring skills and experience to increase capability and ease of use of our complex datasets and you’ll develop a deep understanding of our priorities and envision how Snowflake can be best utilized to deliver insights to our organization. You will have the opportunity to inspire data analysts of varying levels of experience while building data expertise across the greater team.

Responsibilities:

A Day in the Life
  • Manage a team of analysts integrating disparate data sources into a single source of workforce data, creating data structures to meet reporting and analytic needs and governing the usage and quality of the data
  • Develop team proficiency in consultation, research and documentation on enhancements to data values, definitions and structures, partnering with functional and business data owners to communicate impacts to existing HR products
  • Partner within and across People Insights as well as our technical team to ensure the accurate translation of business requirements and into SQL logic and validate data infrastructure enhancements are built efficiently and scalable in Snowflake architecture platform
  • Partner with development team lead to understand agile development timelines and manage the deliverable roadmap ensuring highest priority business needs are being met
  • Provide consultative support for HR clients on questions regarding data and relationships along with delivering creative solutions to data related problems.

Basic Qualifications:

Your Story
  • You are passionate about building high quality data solutions while providing excellent customer service to our clients.
  • You understand the benefits of accurate and actionable data, you drive consistency and enjoy working with others to accomplish the task
  • You are able to query and identify gaps and inconsistencies in complex data and provide solutions
  • You have a thorough understanding of data architecture, warehouses and database infrastructure
  • You are a critical thinker with the ability to look at issues unconventionally and devise innovative solutions
  • You have deep technical knowledge and at least 5 years of experience in data management, data quality, and/or data governance along with experience being a leader of a data operations or integration team.
  • You have the capability to work autonomously and manage multiple priorities to guide your team to meet fluid deadlines and deliver with minimal oversight
  • You have excellent communication skills providing effective and timely updates to both business and technical teams Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and SQL expertise, Snowflake/AWS, ELT/ETL design, Workday experience preferred

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and SQL expertise, Snowflake/AWS, ELT/ETL design, Workday experience preferred

About The Walt Disney Company (Corporate):

At Disney Corporate you can see how the businesses behind the Company’s powerful brands come together to create the most innovative, far-reaching and admired entertainment company in the world. As a member of a corporate team, you’ll work with world-class leaders driving the strategies that keep The Walt Disney Company at the leading edge of entertainment. See and be seen by other innovative thinkers as you enable the greatest storytellers in the world to create memories for millions of families around the globe.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Disney Human Resources Services Co., LLC, which is part of a business we call The Walt Disney Company (Corporate).

Disney Human Resources Services Co., LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

description:
Job Summary:

Disney Streaming Services is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including the ESPN+ premium sports streaming service; Disney+, the dedicated streaming home for entertainment from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic and BAMTECH Media, a global leader in direct-to-consumer video streaming products and solutions. Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. We serve consumers by bringing the world’s most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. We strive daily to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives consumers the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location.

The Technical Operations Department at Disney Streaming Services consists of agile and responsive teams of analysts that perform the daily processes and procedures of our live and on-demand streaming video products. The department’s responsibilities consist of round-the-clock support for these products, ensuring proper functionality across all platforms.

The Technical Operations Distribution team works alongside delivery and infrastructure engineers to gain insight and knowledge on how the distribution of media works. This includes what they monitor and how the environment is built, in an effort to gain deeper operational knowledge that can be documented and handed off to the day-to-day Media Operations team. In addition, we function as the DevOps for these teams and carry out certain roles and responsibilities on their behalf such as weighing traffic distribution, triaging, cache maintenance and being Tier 1 on-call support.

Responsibilities:

  • Adopt new procedural changes across backend services via documentation for day to day operations
  • Identifying and diagnosing issues while monitoring front end product performance
  • In depth Analysis of delivery path health (Vendor, Region, Host)
  • Creation and Management of Performance Alerts and Dashboards
  • Involvement in the planning and development of distribution expansion
  • Point of contact for issue discussion and troubleshooting with CDN Vendors
  • Gain knowledge of backend services by working directly with respective team members on a daily basis
  • Support the foundational knowledge growth of Entry Level Technical Analysts
  • Communicate with internal teams to identify and implement creative and technical requirements of new campaigns.
Live Support - Read services dashboards to identify issues and trends impacting customers
Capture data for internal planning and after major events to provide postmortem analysis.
Assist Delivery Engineers in day to day tasks

Basic Qualifications:

  • 2 or more years of progressively complex related experience within Streaming/Digital Media.
  • Basic understanding of http
  • Experience in an operations setting either live or on demand
  • Prior Involvement with CDN Vendors and media delivery encouraged
  • BA/BS or equivalent experience required.
  • Operates within the context of defined procedures.
  • Effectively resolves problems and roadblocks as they occur.

description:
Job Summary:

The Walt Disney Company is home to some of the world's best known brands! As the Digital Ad Operations Executive, you will get the rare opportunity to work with two of the most iconic - Disney and ESPN! This position will be responsible for managing Digital Ad Sales accounts from booking to deal completion. You will also support the sales team to provide account maintenance and client service. This is an initial 12 month fixed term contract opportunity.

Responsibilities:

  • Proactive account management of key advertisers and media agencies
  • Ownership of managing campaigns, including booking and monitoring deals to ensure full delivery and meeting client objectives.
  • Provide best in class customer support, encouraging repeat and increased business.
  • Develop and maintain excellent external relationships; acting as the primary day to day contact for clients, advertising agencies, and creative agencies throughout a campaign.
  • Responsible for pre-sale avails, including any technical questions from advertisers about ESPN’s properties and organizing creative delivery from agencies.
  • Responsible for campaign stewardship, including reporting, billing, and screen shot requests.
  • Responsible ad trafficking to ensure campaigns run as booked and are optimised accordingly.
  • Responsible for ensuring full delivery and analysing performance in end of campaign reports.
  • Responsible for consistently monitoring and reviewing all live media campaigns to ensure adherence to ESPN/Disney policies and general product integrity.
  • Work closely with Sales, Creative Solutions, Editorial, and Product teams to create innovative sponsorship solutions focusing on company goals and client KPI’s.
  • Work with teams across departments and offices on the execution of sponsorship deal points.
  • Work with Finance team to generate campaign invoices and resolve any billing discrepancies in a timely manner.
  • Participate in inter-department efforts to grow the ESPN brand and business

Basic Qualifications:

  • 1-2+ years digital campaign management experience
  • Previous experience in planning or campaign management with a large publisher, media owner, or media agency.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge and interest in digital media, especially advertising across platforms and devices.
  • Experience working with digital advertising tools EG Google Ad Manager, Operative, MOAT
  • Comfortable working with emerging technologies.
  • Demonstrable passion for sport preferred.
  • Highly organized, with a strong focus on attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Strong numeric and analytical abilities.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Desire to troubleshoot and solve problems.
  • Customer and user advocate.
  • Knowledge of web design and digital technologies preferred.
  • Computer programs: Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

Additional Information:

This is unique opportunity to join the talented team that develops and delivers unparalleled entertainment across Australia and New Zealand so if this role captures your imagination then apply now!

The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse and inclusive workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. We are committed to building a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

description:
Job Summary:

As Sr Ride/Ride/Technician, you will execution the hands-on maintenance work for the troubleshooting, repair, refurbishment, and show the quality of Shanghai Disney Resort Facility Assets (Attractions, Equipment, etc.). Having good teamwork and cooperation spirit while understanding safety, regulatory compliance and productivity are important.

Responsibilities:

  • Execute test, preventative and corrective maintenance, troubleshooting, major rehab, or installation on a wide variety of equipment, including electrical and mechanical systems for the ride and show elements, and apply specific craft skills to accomplish the assigned tasks
  • Able to learn and use company-provided technology systems and equipment, to finish the maintenance tasks under other senior technicians’ instruction
  • Initiate the request of the workshop applied tools and spares, and help the team to coordinate training plans
  • Attend job training sessions and knowledge and performance assessment training, then pass examinations
  • Perform workshop housekeeping, inventory control, and attend the shift briefing

Basic Qualifications:

  • Have technical competence and achieved proficiency in one or more aspects of electrical, control PLC logic, engine, mechanical fitting, hydraulic and pneumatic assemblies
  • Have statutory licenses such as registered electrical worker, boiler operator, and special vehicle driving license preferred
  • Can take flexible work shifts that cover the attraction operating hours and third shift, including public holidays
  • Able to learn and understand both Chinese and English technical job plans and using the maintenance system, ability to read engineering drawings independently
  • Excellent team spirit, good communication skills, and a positive attitude
  • Strong sense of ownership on the maintenance equipment and work
  • Able to work in the industrial and backstage type of environment. Frequently work in an outdoor, hot, and humid environment. Work at height, underwater, confined space when required

Additional Information:

As one of the worldwide leaders in family entertainment, Shanghai Disney Resort delivers legendary service and a lifetime of memories for our guests. Joining us in a new world of fantasy, imagination, creativity and adventure involves creating happiness for the millions of guests who visit our Resort each year. Whether your career journey here is onstage or backstage, there are almost unlimited opportunities for growth and personal development at Shanghai Disney.
* We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities.
* Specific benefits vary between different roles and may be adjusted according to company policy.
* Shanghai Disney Resort does not charge a fee to submit job applications and has not authorized any individual or company to charge to do so. Please always check our official channels or platforms for the most relevant recruitment information.

We are taking a responsible approach to creating environments that allow us to do what we do best – welcome and entertain millions of guests each year from across the country and around the world. As part of our commitment to health and safety, we require all newly-hired employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their onboarding dates.

Employment Benefits:

Salary: your salary consists of a base salary + service bonus + floating year-end bonus
Social Insurance: You are entitled to five social insurances and one housing fund
Overtime and allowances: In addition to statutory overtime (depending on your position) you may be entitled to a high temperature allowance and a night shift subsidy
Catering subsidy: You are entitled to one free meal per day on days that you are working
Accommodation: You have the opportunity to live in a dorm with Wi-Fi and air conditioning or to receive a living allowance
Vacation: You are entitled to paid annual leave and paid sick leave
Insurance: We buy supplementary medical insurance for you and your children. You can also enjoy group life insurance
Free Park Entry: While you work for Shanghai Disney Resort you will have the opportunity to enter the park with your family and friends for free
Disney Discounts: you are entitled to discounts on designated Disney products, resort F&B and ticketing
Health checkup: You are entitled to a free health checkup once a year

Learning and development opportunities:

Learning: you will be taught a range of international professional skills, including corporate culture, service skills, and more.
Career Development: Promotion opportunities are transparent and are dependent on your own efforts. You can also apply for internal transfers should you wish to develop yourself in another part of the company. With Hotel, Food and Beverage, Fire Safety, Security, Merchandise, Park Operations, Disney University and Operations training opportunities across multiple industries, there will always be development opportunities for those who want them at Disney.
Activities: Disney provides Cast Member with a range of volunteering opportunities as well as fun clubs for basketball, tennis, yoga, Disney Run, Music, Drama, DIY and more as a way to help you connect with your colleagues and network in a fun environment.

Application Process:

Apply online -> Interview over email -> Accept Employment -> Onboard
Please note: You may only apply for this position once in a six-month period. If you have applied within the last six months, please log in to your account to view your current application status.

Work Location:

You will be working at Shanghai Disney Resort in Pudong, Shanghai. You can take metro Line 11 to Shanghai Disney Resort station or take one of our many shuttle buses. The shuttle buses can be taken from one of several central areas across the city every day. You can find out more information during your onboarding process.
