description:
Job Summary:

Yellow Shoes Creative Art Direction Internship, Fall 2022

963414BR

Be a part of a transformative team and culture…
Do you love uncovering the Big Idea? Do you enjoy the world of design and making memorable art that people connect with? Do you understand the craft of executing flawless design and photography? Do you have a hard-core PASSION for type? Do you “geek out” about logos, color theory, typography, font trends, design systems, brand identity and how to use them to connect with audiences in engaging ways? If this sounds like you, then you are who we want.

Disney Yellow Shoes, is the award-winning, in-house creative agency for all of the Disney Destinations Division lines of business. Every day, we have fun creating compelling, memorable work for one of the greatest brands on the planet, and we’re looking for a very talented, ambitious Creative Art Direction Intern to join us!

Responsibilities:

Make an Impact by...
As a Creative Art Direction Intern with Disney’s Yellow Shoes, you will create innovative and conceptual ideas for Disney Theme Parks and Resorts alongside talented team members and Senior Leaders. You will participate in ideation sessions with members of the Creative Department. You will take part in photo/video shoots, editorial sessions; collaborate with illustrators, photographers, designers, videographers and directors. You will have the opportunity to show your problem-solving skills and creative thinking skills for a range of advertising mediums. Social and digital by design, we expect EVERY intern to fully grasp the importance of thinking creatively in a tech-inspired world. You will also work in broadcast, print, and collateral. Solid, imaginative design skills and some understanding of the production process is expected. To be successful as part of our team, strong conceptual ability, an open mind and a passion to learn will take you very far.
  • Create concepts for the Disneyland Resort, Walt Disney World, Disney Cruise Line, Aulani, Adventures by Disney and more
  • Do creative research – you’ll identify and share the latest trends in digital, photography, design, typography and other emerging media
  • Assist in developing materials for creative/strategic presentations
  • Soup to nuts, tactical ideation. From the big idea to emails, to the smallest mobile banner ads
  • Maintain and create content for all digital and social channels associated with the Disney Destinations Group
  • Be proactive and participate

Basic Qualifications:

What you Bring to the Role...
  • Portfolio (must be included as a URL link on your resume; any other portfolio submissions will not be considered)
  • An excellent student portfolio filled with smart, innovative work across all advertising mediums (broadcast, digital, print, social, radio, OOH, direct)
  • A demonstrated and strong strategic sense and a proven ability to turn deep consumer insights into great advertising
  • An obsession with craft, great design, typography, photography, cinematography and music
  • Passion about technology and storytelling
  • Courage to champion big ideas and collaborate effectively with others to make them a reality
  • Proficiency in Adobe C-Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)
  • Knowledge and comfort working in Social Media and digital asset creation software (Live Canvas, HTML 5)
  • Ability to work in presentation creation software (Keynote, iMovie)
  • Working knowledge of an Advertising Agency and its processes or similar creative environment
  • Ability to multitask and work against a deadline
  • Ability to collaborate as part of a team or ideate independently
  • Ability to deliver presentations to senior leadership
  • Whip–smart with a hunger to dive in and absorb as much information as possible.
  • Reliable, with a positive “can-do” attitude
  • Readiness to be mentored and groomed for professional success
  • Basic knowledge and interest in The Walt Disney Company history – including films, animation, television and theme parks

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of Motion Graphics and After Effects

Required Education

Currently enrolled as a junior or higher, or graduated within six months of application submission, in an accredited college/university earning a degree in Advertising, Design, or closely related field

Additional Information:

Required Materials:
  • Resume (outlining all of your required qualifications)
  • Portfolio (must be included as a URL link on your resume; any other portfolio submissions will not be considered)

Internship Eligibility:

  • Must be enrolled in an accredited college/university taking at least one class in the semester/quarter (spring/fall) prior to participation in the internship program OR must have graduated from a college/university within 6 months OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Professional Internship
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must not have completed one year of continual employment on a Disney internship or program.
  • Must possess unrestricted work authorization
  • Must provide full work availability
  • All candidates must be able to have a consistent, reliable work schedule throughout the session
  • Must provide own transportation to/from work
  • Current Active Disney cast members must meet Professional Internship transfer guidelines (for Walt Disney World cast members this is no more than four points and one reprimand in the last six months; for Disneyland cast members this is six months of consecutive service and a performance record clear of any disciplinary issues (warnings, suspensions, etc.) for at least six months)
Program Length:
  • The approximate dates of this internship are June 2022 - January 2023. Interns must be fully available for the duration of the internship.

Job Summary:

Franchise management : gestion de la bonne intégration des Franchises MARVEL (incluant Avengers, Spider-Man et les Gardiens de la Galaxie…) et National Geographic à Disneyland Paris. Rôle de garant de l'identité des franchises au sein de la destination. Faire respecter les guidelines, s'assurer des validations et du développement stratégique pour chaque franchise.

Planning Intégré : Vision d'ensemble des activations de toutes les entités de The Walt Disney Company : Studios (les films), Consumer Product, Disney+ et les autres parcs Disney dans le monde. Point de contact privilégié et porte-paroles de Disneyland Paris auprès des partenaires. L'un des rôles de l'équipe est de s'assurer de la cohérence entre le contenu franchise des Studios et leur intégration au sein du parc.

Vos missions ?
Au sein de l’équipe Franchise Management & Planning Intégré, vous serez notamment amené à :
  • Recherche d’assets créatifs et d'éléments visuels (images, vidéos, musiques) en réponse aux demandes des différentes équipes partenaires de Disneyland Paris : Marketing,Advertising, Service créatif, Communication, Food & Beverage, Merchandise, Imagineering, Entertainment, Event et Produit Hotels.
  • Participation aux sessions de brainstorm pour renforcer l'expérience immersive des Guests.
  • Rangement et organisation de la blibliothèque de contenus de l'équipe.
  • Prise de note et récap des meetings. Aide au suivi des projets franchises (ex : saison d’Halloween, saison de Noël, 30th anniversaire de Disneyland Paris, Avengers Campus, Disney Hotel New York – The Art of Marvel).
  • Organisation de séances de partage des contenus en avant-première Studios et Disney+ aux équipes de Disneyland Paris.
  • Appuie de la tutrice dans la mise en place d'évènements spéciaux en lien avec les franchises à Disneyland Paris et d'activations ponctuelles en synergie avec la sortie de films (Sneak Peek, Meet & Greet exclusifs, Magic shots...)
  • Développement et adaptation des présentations stratégiques internes et externes et mise à jour régulière des documents stratégiques de l'équipe comme par exemple le calendrier des sorties de contenus.
  • Travail de recherche et création de Benchmarks à destination des équipes de Disneyland Paris (principalement équipe Food & Beverage, marketing strat & produits Hôtel
  • Responsable des différentes étapes de validation des projets de Disneyland Paris auprès de nos contacts internationaux Studios film et Corporate Brand Management (EMEA et US).
Vos atouts pour réussir ?
  • Vous vous orientez vers un Master 1 ou un Master 2 spécialisé en Marketing ou Communication
  • Vous êtes à la recherche d'un stage de fin d'étude de 6 mois ou en année de césure,
  • Vous possédez idéalement une première expérience (stage ou alternance) dans le divertissement, les médias ou le tourisme (ex: assistant projet)
  • Vous maîtrisez l’anglais (C1-C2) comme le français (C1-C2)
  • Vous avez une connaissance avancée du Pack Office
  • Vous avez une forte appétence pour l’univers des parcs à thème et/ ou l’univers de Disney en général
  • Vous faites preuve de rigueur et avez le goût du détail
  • Bon communicant, vous saurez entretenir les nombreuses interactions avec les partenaires internes et externes
  • Vous êtes force de proposition et possédez une bonne capacité d’analyse
  • L'utilisation de la suite Adobe est un plus​​​​​​​
La différence Disney :
  • Passionnés par nos franchises ce stage est une opportunité incroyable de participer à des projets ambitieux mettant en valeur des franchises aussi connues qu'aimées que sont Spider-Man, Avengers, les Gardiens de la Galaxie.
  • Rejoindre notre équipe est l'occasion de donner vie aux histoires Disney et de participer à la magie que procurent nos expériences à nos Guests que ce soit la joie de savourer un repas aux couleurs du Cowboy Woody que le bonheur de dormir dans une chambre de princesse ou l'émotion de rencontrer leur personnage préféré dans le parc.
Nos petits + :
  • Se déplacer : prise en charge de 80% du Pass Navigo
  • Se restaurer : restaurants d’entreprise sur place
  • Télétravail possible (5 jours de présence sur site minimum par mois) lorsque la fonction ne nécessite pas une présence sur site.
Prêt à participer à une formidable aventure humaine ? Il ne vous reste plus qu’à postuler, car nous sommes prêts à vous donner les moyens de faire rayonner vos talents !
Pour plus d’informations sur l’emploi à Disneyland Paris, rendez-vous sur careers.disneylandparis.com

description:
Job Summary:

Tens of thousands of guests visit Shanghai Disneyland and Disneytown every day. Park Greeters and Ticket Sellers are some of the first Cast Members that our guests encounter, and they open the door to the magical world of Disney. You will according to their needs and ensure an efficient ticket purchasing experience. You will also help guests enter and exit the park via turnstiles. Your guest service skills and professionalism will be developed through daily interaction with guests from all over the world.

Responsibilities:

  • Keep safety as the priority focus
  • Greet and help all guests enter and exit the park via turnstiles. Provide ticket issuance and redemption services for each guest entering the park
  • Provide luggage storage service to guests
  • Handle ticket related issues according to guests’ needs
  • Be proactive with guests to answer questions and be flexible in resolving guest situations
  • Constantly interact with guests and Cast Members to create Disney memories for our guests
  • Perform additional duties as directed by leaders

Based on business need and Cast Members’ credentials, below tasks will be assigned from time to time.
Support guest flow in general, including in different locations
  • Assist guests with directions, answer questions, provide information and solutions as needed
  • Support cleaning work areas and guest areas
  • Assist logistics and stocking
  • Keep Shanghai Disney Resort clean by picking trash
  • Handle cash or process POS in other LOBs ( * applicable to cash-handling/POS related jobs only)

Basic Qualifications:

  • Provide courtesy to our Guests with good communication skills and a service mindset
  • A team player and be able to solve problems individually
  • Energetic, patient, positive, proactive
  • Conversational English skills
  • Physically be able to carry and move products
  • Flexible/adaptable (Working in an outdoor environment with varying shift times is required)
  • Strong computer skills
  • Be able to handle challenging situations and be able to perform multiple tasks at one time
  • Cashier experience is preferred
  • Good psychological quality and stress management skills
  • You will obtain certificate/qualification(s) required for performing the job, and complete and pass all post-employment training and assessments (including but not limited to On-Job-Training)

Additional Information:

As one of the worldwide leaders in family entertainment, Shanghai Disney Resort delivers legendary service and a lifetime of memories for our guests. Joining us in a new world of fantasy, imagination, creativity and adventure involves creating happiness for the millions of guests who visit our Resort each year. Whether your career journey here is onstage or backstage, there are almost unlimited opportunities for growth and personal development at Shanghai Disney.
* We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities.
* Specific benefits vary between different roles and may be adjusted according to company policy.
* Shanghai Disney Resort does not charge a fee to submit job applications and has not authorized any individual or company to charge to do so. Please always check our official channels or platforms for the most relevant recruitment information.

We are taking a responsible approach to creating environments that allow us to do what we do best – welcome and entertain millions of guests each year from across the country and around the world. As part of our commitment to health and safety, we require all newly-hired employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their onboarding dates.

Employment Benefits:
  • Salary: your salary consists of a base salary + service bonus + floating year-end bonus
  • Social Insurance: You are entitled to five social insurances and one housing fund
  • Overtime and allowances: In addition to statutory overtime (depending on your position) you may be entitled to a high temperature allowance and a night shift subsidy
  • Catering subsidy: You are entitled to one free meal per day on days that you are working
  • Accommodation: You have the opportunity to live in a dorm with Wi-Fi and air conditioning or to receive a living allowance
  • Vacation: You are entitled to paid annual leave and paid sick leave
  • Insurance: We buy supplementary medical insurance for you and your children. You can also enjoy group life insurance
  • Free Park Entry: While you work for Shanghai Disney Resort you will have the opportunity to enter the park with your family and friends for free
  • Disney Discounts: you are entitled to discounts on designated Disney products, resort F&B and ticketing
  • Health checkup: You are entitled to a free health checkup once a year

Learning and development opportunities:
  • Learning: you will be taught a range of international professional skills, including corporate culture, service skills, and more.
  • Career Development: Promotion opportunities are transparent and are dependent on your own efforts. You can also apply for internal transfers should you wish to develop yourself in another part of the company. With Hotel, Food and Beverage, Fire Safety, Security, Merchandise, Park Operations, Disney University and Operations training opportunities across multiple industries, there will always be development opportunities for those who want them at Disney.
  • Activities: Disney provides Cast Member with a range of volunteering opportunities as well as fun clubs for basketball, tennis, yoga, Disney Run, Music, Drama, DIY and more as a way to help you connect with your colleagues and network in a fun environment.

Application Process:

Apply online -> Interview over email -> Accept Employment -> Onboard
Please note: You may only apply for this position once in a six-month period. If you have applied within the last six months, please log in to your account to view your current application status.

Work Location:

You will be working at Shanghai Disney Resort in Pudong, Shanghai. You can take metro Line 11 to Shanghai Disney Resort station or take one of our many shuttle buses. The shuttle buses can be taken from one of several central areas across the city every day. You can find out more information during your onboarding process.

* We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities.
* Specific benefits vary between different roles and may be adjusted according to company policy.

We are taking a responsible approach to creating environments that allow us to do what we do best – welcome and entertain millions of guests each year from across the country and around the world. As part of our commitment to health and safety, we require all newly-hired employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their onboarding dates.

Employment Benefits:
  • Salary: your salary consists of a base salary + service bonus + floating year-end bonus
  • Social Insurance: You are entitled to five social insurances and one housing fund
  • Overtime and allowances: In addition to statutory overtime (depending on your position) you may be entitled to a high temperature allowance and a night shift subsidy
  • Catering subsidy: You are entitled to one free meal per day on days that you are working
  • Accommodation: You have the opportunity to live in a dorm with Wi-Fi and air conditioning or to receive a living allowance
  • Vacation: You are entitled to paid annual leave and paid sick leave
  • Insurance: We buy supplementary medical insurance for you and your children. You can also enjoy group life insurance
  • Free Park Entry: While you work for Shanghai Disney Resort you will have the opportunity to enter the park with your family and friends for free
  • Disney Discounts: you are entitled to discounts on designated Disney products, resort F&B and ticketing
  • Health checkup: You are entitled to a free health checkup once a year

Learning and development opportunities:
  • Learning: you will be taught a range of international professional skills, including corporate culture, service skills, and more.
  • Career Development: Promotion opportunities are transparent and are dependent on your own efforts. You can also apply for internal transfers should you wish to develop yourself in another part of the company. With Hotel, Food and Beverage, Fire Safety, Security, Merchandise, Park Operations, Disney University and Operations training opportunities across multiple industries, there will always be development opportunities for those who want them at Disney.
  • Activities: Disney provides Cast Member with a range of volunteering opportunities as well as fun clubs for basketball, tennis, yoga, Disney Run, Music, Drama, DIY and more as a way to help you connect with your colleagues and network in a fun environment.

Application Process:

Apply online -> Interview over email -> Accept Employment -> Onboard
Please note: You may only apply for this position once in a six-month period. If you have applied within the last six months, please log in to your account to view your current application status.

Work Location:

You will be working at Shanghai Disney Resort in Pudong, Shanghai. You can take metro Line 11 to Shanghai Disney Resort station or take one of our many shuttle buses. The shuttle buses can be taken from one of several central areas across the city every day. You can find out more information during your onboarding process.

sections.text: As Host/Hostess, Custodial, you will create memorable experiences for guests by maintaining the highest quality of cleanliness that guests expect from a Disney Park. You will not only keep the park clean, but also interact with guests and answer questions at the same time. Through your efforts and hard work, guests will seamlessly be immersed in the storytelling atmosphere and enjoy the experience.

* Perform cleaning tasks including sweeping, restroom cleaning, trash collection, etc.
* Able to use all custodial chemicals and equipment
* Replenish custodial cart supplies before going to the assigned area
* Clean equipment, clean and restock supply room(s) and ensure that the custodial closets are tidy and locked at the end of a shift
* Assist Guests and Cast Members with directions, event schedules, and other assistance as needed


Based on business need and Cast Members’ credentials, below tasks will be assigned from time to time.* Support guest flow in general, including in different locations
* Assist guests with directions, answer questions, provide information and solutions as needed
* Support cleaning work areas and guest areas
* Assist logistics and stocking
* Keep Shanghai Disney Resort clean by picking trash
* Handle cash or process POS in other LOBs ( * applicable to cash-handling/POS related jobs only)

* Basic knowledge of custodial equipment and chemicals is preferred
* Courteous to our Guests with good communication skill and service mindset
* A team player and be able to solve problems individually
* Energetic, patient, positive, proactive
* Flexible/adaptable (Working outdoors and shifts duty are required)

description:
Job Summary:

At Shanghai Disney Resort, we have a young and energetic team. This is a diverse team with a multicultural convergence of more than 7 different countries and regions. This team uses its own professional technology skills to bring digitalization solutions to Shanghai Disney Resort. By providing online and offline digital business solutions, it accelerates technological innovation, empowers business growth, and enhances guest experience. This is our technology and digital team.

We conduct development or automated testing by researching advanced technologies such as artificial intelligence, face recognition, NTF, Robotic Process Automation, IoT, etc., supported by technologies such as Java, JavaScript, Kotlin or Swift, and cooperate with teams around the world to bring a high standard of Disney immersive digital experience to our internal customers and guests.

By joining this team, you will have the opportunity to experience the latest digital technologies and related industry trends in various industries on a broad platform, analyze business needs with different teams, participate in discussions on product vision and roadmap, and create solutions and jointly create the industry's leading digital products. At the same time, in the process of cooperating with different teams, enhance your acumen in business analysis, data integration and professional skills, improve communication skills, coordination skills and your own influence, and lay a solid foundation for future career development.

Responsibilities:

Product and Design interns will have opportunities to have internship in Digital Product Management, Enterprise Technology, Innovation & Integration or Project Management Office. You will not only learn Disney's legendary culture, collaborate with amazing Cast Members, experience professional on-job training and career development guidance.

• You will use data to understand guest behaviors and performance of features;
• You will support execution of commercial tasks or initiative in relation to digital platforms;
• You will collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams (Engineering, Design, Data, etc.) in the development of project timeline;
• You will participate in innovation programs from grounds-up;
• You will work with designers, product owners, and engineers to build high-quality and user-friendly products following Disney brand guidelines;
• You will participate in a cross-functional communication and design presentation to different lines-of-business;
• You will look for innovation in program execution from promotional tactic to the graphic and creative approach;
• You will reflects the guest's voice, determine guest pain points and needs;
• You will define the vision of new products and develop the product roadmap, solutions, requirements;
• You will collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams (Engineering, Design, Data, etc.) to bring ideas to life;
• You will participate in translating functions and information into emotionally compelling experiences that fulfill our guests’ needs and drive business goals.

Basic Qualifications:

• Students of Bachelor's degree in Design, Marketing or equivalent practical experience, who are going to graduate between May and September, 2023; student of Master's degree would be a plus;
• Commit to work for at least 3days per week for a minimum of 6 consecutive months;
• With mobile product design or E-commerce or related internship experience preferred;
• Passionate about the technologies, mobile, internet, and e-commerce;
• Software tool: Skills in Excel, Word, PowerPoint;
• For design role, proficiency in Sketch, Figma (or other prototyping tools), Adobe C-Suite (After Effect, Photoshop, Illustrator), specifically with mobile app design and multimedia presentation;
• For design role, Knowledge of typography, color theory, layout design, and design process;
• For design role, a portfolio of your work exhibiting design knowledge and skills;
• Innate passion for Disney and learning product design technologies and trends;
• Understand China markets as well as mobile & internet trends;
• Ability to embrace and adapt to changes and learn quickly in a fast-paced environment;
• Ability to collaborate as part of a team or ideate independently;
• Ability to think creatively, logically and structurally;
• Good team work and learning attitude；
• Good communication and presentation skills in both Mandarin and English.

Shanghai Disney Resort, the first Disney resort in Mainland China, is a place where friends and families can escape together to a whole new world of fantasy, imagination, creativity and adventure. The resort is home to the Shanghai Disneyland theme park; two themed hotels; Disneytown, a large shopping, dining and entertainment district; a Broadway-style theatre; Wishing Star Park and other outdoor recreation areas. Shanghai Disney Resort Cast Members provide world-class service to guests, and the resort brings classic Disney stories and characters to life with authentic cultural touches and themes tailored specifically for the people of China. Shanghai Disney Resort offers something for everyone – thrilling adventures, lush gardens where guests can relax together and enriching interactive experiences.

Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Shanghai International Theme Park Company Limited, which is part of a business we call Shanghai Disney Resort.

description:
Job Summary:

Do you have the gift of making quick, easy connections with people? Do you instinctively know how to sell in a way that’s as friendly as it is persuasive? And do you have a true passion for the Disney legacy and brand? If you’re nodding your head yes, then a Vacation Club Guide position at Disneyland might be the opportunity you’ve been looking for.

The Disney Vacation Club is a vacation ownership/timeshare that gives our Guests the chance to enjoy Disney experiences around the country for years to come. Selling the Disney Vacation Club is a true team effort, but it all comes down to the Vacation Club Guide, who helps our Guests understand why ownership makes sense for their future. Vacation Club Guides earn a guaranteed salary -- plus commission -- so if you think you have the skills and personality to unleash unlimited earning potential, please apply today!

Responsibilities:

Imagine creating magic through Disney. As a leading brand in entertainment and timeshare, your commitment will be to deliver a guest experience defined by quality and excellence. As a Disney Vacation Club (DVC) Guide, you would be in an exceptional position of selling the essence of Disney and all the emotion, nostalgia and joy that comes with the name by engaging with prospects and Members in-person, via phone, or by email and on-line chat. By joining us, you will become a part of an innovative team and take a step towards the next level of your career success.

Every single day as a Vacation Club Guide is different! On any given day you might:
  • Capture high interest leads through various sales and marketing tactics, including in-person and virtual opportunities
  • Interact with people in Hawaii, the U.S. mainland and from around the world
  • Display sales versatility by being able to offer program overview by phone, chat, webinar, and in-person
  • Exercise your acumen and knowledge of the Disney Vacation Club products and relevant information on the Disney Brand
  • Develop referrals and leads through guest contact and consistent follow up activities
  • Give descriptive details on features of Disney Vacation Club properties, as well as articulate the benefits of vacationing with the Disney Vacation Club
  • Advocate the allocation of appropriate amounts of points to accommodate both prospects and Members
  • Work alongside your fellow Disney Vacation Club team members at various locations, including the resort model rooms and off-site destinations to service guests and DVC Members
  • Generate sales through the utilization of proper sales closing techniques and initiate transactions in the contract system
  • Have access to sales specific training and ongoing professional development opportunities unique to the Disney brand

Basic Qualifications:

  • Excellent telephone skills, computer proficiency, guest service and relationship building skills
  • Have impeccable follow up skills to nurture pipeline opportunities that contribute to growth of individual prospect and member base
  • Have a dynamic win-win attitude and the ability to communicate with people effectively
  • Ability to handle multiple lead opportunities on a daily basis
  • Proven success working in a competitive sales environment
  • Excellent people skills and a friendly attitude
  • Demonstrated history of taking the initiative and being a self-starter
  • Exceptional verbal and writing skills
  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
  • Experience shifting from a single location to multi-site environment and from in-person to telephone sales
  • Possess a true passion for Guest service and for Disney
  • Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced business
  • Proficiency with computers and with Windows-based systems like Microsoft Office programs
  • Full time availability required including nights, weekends and holidays
  • • Reliable transportation to work at the DVC Sales Center at the Disneyland Resort

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with sales consultation
  • Knowledge of the timeshare industry programs

Required Education

  • High school degree or equivalent
  • Current, active and in good-standing California Real Estate License

Additional Information:

Our Benefits: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

description:
At the Disneyland® Resort, dream jobs do exist. After all, a company built on imagination and wonder means the work will definitely be interesting. Cashier Hosts and Hostesses provide food and beverage and merchandise offerings to Guests throughout our Theme Parks and Resort Hotels in a fast-paced environment, interacting with Guests everyday by sharing information, answering questions and providing great Guest Service.

The starting pay for Food & Beverage Cashier and Food Service Worker is $15.95/Hour

Responsibilities

  • Responsible for welcoming and interacting with all Guests
  • Works at a variety of both indoor and outdoor locations
  • Requires constant interaction with Guests including answering questions, providing directions, event information and other services to help create a magical experience
  • May assemble orders and present to Guests according to recipe guidelines
  • Knowledge and understanding of safety and sanitation guidelines including temperature requirements
  • Has good judgment of food quality and production, understands the impact of spoilage
  • Responsible for maintaining work area-restocking and cleaning
  • Ensures that food presentation is fresh and up to quality standards
Food & Beverage Cashier:
  • Responsible for greeting Guests and taking their order, entering into POS system and verifying order by repeating back to Guest and suggests additional items as appropriate.
  • Receives and processes payment.
  • Responsible for maintaining work area-restocking and cleaning.
  • Portions back-up items.
  • May ensure freezers are maintained at the appropriate temperature.
  • May require equipment operation, including working near equipment that generates heat.

Food & Beverage Food Service Worker:
  • Food Service Worker Cast Members work at a variety of both indoor and outdoor locations.
  • Stocks serving line with food and serving supplies, and portions food that may not be dished-up on the serving line.
  • Ensures that the food is fresh and adheres to quality standards.
  • Responsible for the sanitation and cleanliness of the area.
  • Interacting with Guests and answering questions, supplying directions and providing exceptional Guest Service.

Basic Qualifications

  • Must be 18 years of age
  • Able to effectively work independently or as part of a team
  • Should have cash handling capabilities and be able to count back proper change (Food & Beverage Cashier)
  • Excellent Hospitality skills
  • Ability to multi task and work in a very fast paced environment
  • Speed, accuracy and efficiency are required and ability to work well under pressure
  • Demonstrated ability to own and resolve Guest situations
  • Receptive to special requests
  • Enthusiastic about interacting and helping Guests
  • Able to make independent decisions for our Guests
  • Self-directed (can complete tasks with minimal supervision)
  • Willing to follow instructions & take direction
  • Flexible/adaptable
  • Supportive of other cast working on your team
  • Can complete repetitious tasks while maintaining quality
  • Strong verbal communication skills
  • Willing to work outdoors even in inclement weather
  • Must be flexible and able to work a variety of shifts, including days, nights, weekends, holidays and special events
  • Perform all job related functions in a cordial friendly manner, committed to exceeding Guests’ expectations
  • This role is Part Time and requires full availability for any shift, a MINIMUM of three (3) days per week, including nights and holidays.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Previous restaurant experience; understanding of Quick Service environment
  • Bilingual preferred
  • Full availability for any shift, seven (7) days per week, including nights, weekends, and holidays is preferred

Additional Information:

SCHEDULE AVAILABILTY
Our Theme Parks and Resort Hotels operate 24 hours a day, 365 days a year and some shifts may start as early as 5:00am while some may end as late as 3:00am, 4:00am or 5:00am. Please note that the principles of seniority are used to schedule all roles.

SUBMITTING YOUR APPLICATION
After clicking “Apply for this job” below, the employment application will open in a new window. Please complete ALL pages of the application by clicking “Next” on each page, then “Submit” on the final page.

IMPORTANT:
You may only apply once in a four month period. If you have applied within the last four months, please log in to your account to view your current application status.

About Disneyland Resort:

When Walt Disney opened Disneyland on July 17, 1955, he said he hoped it would be “a source of joy and inspiration to all the world.” Since then, the Disneyland Resort has welcomed more than 800 million guests, expanding to become an approximately 500- acre, multifaceted, world-class family resort destination, complete with two renowned Disney theme parks, three hotels and the exciting shopping, dining and entertainment area known as Downtown Disney District. Through a combination of creativity, technology and innovation, the resort brings storytelling to new heights, and Disneyland Resort cast members play an integral part in bringing that Disney magic to life for thousands of guests every day.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc., which is part of a business we call Disneyland Resort.

Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

description:
Job Summary:

Vous avez envie d’intégrer une entreprise qui valorise la curiosité et l'imagination ? Comme le disait Walt Disney : "Si vous pouvez le visualiser, si vous pouvez le rêver, il y a un moyen de le faire." Alors n'hésitez pas à postuler à nos offres de stage à pourvoir dès la rentrée prochaine !
Ce que nous recherchons ? Une personnalité avant tout, des candidats passionnés par nos contenus et nos univers pour mettre en valeur nos marques Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic, et FOX. Nous souhaitons que vous soyez le reflet de la diversité de notre catalogue.
Une appétence forte pour le cinéma, les médias ou encore l’audiovisuel sera essentielle pour nous rejoindre et faire partie de l’histoire. Votre effet magique : vous parlez anglais couramment, un véritable plus pour un stage réussi.
En résumé, postulez, soyez créatifs et surtout restez vous-même !

Intégré(e) au service communication, vous êtes rattaché(e) à la Direction de la Communication et de la RSE, vous serez amené(e) à travailler en transverse sur l’ensemble des actualités corporate et RSE de la Walt Disney Company France.

Vous participerez à la réalisation des missions suivantes :
  1. Veille / curation / coordination :
    • Veille et curation de l’ensemble des thèmes pouvant venir nourrir les missions ci-dessous, à la fois auprès des équipes internes pour se tenir au courant des activités des différents segments, mais également en externe (partenaires, réseaux sociaux, …)
    • La coordination avec les différentes agences (digital, event, RP…) et experts (suivi des projets – newsletter, communications partenaires, participation aux réunions)
  1. Créations de contenus
    • Animation des réseaux sociaux institutionnels (site Corporate, page Facebook, pages LinkedIn Corporate et RH) : tenue du calendrier éditorial des publications, rédaction d’articles, développement d’outils (infographies, headers…), relai sur l’intranet, veille…
    • Rédaction de d’éléments de communication pour alimenter les différents canaux de communication interne et externe, (newsletter, articles interne, interviews, proposition de format d’interviews, mise en avant des collaborateurs de l’entreprise à travers des portraits)
    • Relations presse : rédaction de communiqués de presse, alerte presse, gestion des fichiers presse
  1. Reporting
    • Analyse des différentes actions de communication internes et externe : (réseaux sociaux, diffusion de newsletter, retombées presse, analyse des messages…)
  1. Evènementiel
    • Aide à l’organisation d’événements internes (semaine des femmes, journée bien-être, santé, journée des enfants, avant-première, …)
    • Aide à l’organisation d’évènements institutionnels et RSE (gestion des listes, suivi de l’organisation, présence le jour J, relances des équipes, participation à la rédaction des documents, suivi des prestataires)
  1. Reporting


Description du profil recherché
Etudiant(e) en école de commerce ou en Master Communication, vous souhaitez vous investir à travers un stage professionnalisant, dans une mission formatrice sur le métier de la communication.
Nous apprécierons un profil qui combine soft & hard skills, savoir-faire et savoir être !
Reconnu(e) pour vos qualités rédactionnelles, et une bonne connaissance de l’orthographe, vous avez également un très bon relationnel et l’esprit d’équipe. Très autonome, vous êtes organisé(e), curieux-se, enthousiaste, dynamique, vous avez l’esprit de synthèse et d’analyse, et savez être force de proposition.
Vous maîtrisez parfaitement les réseaux sociaux et vous avez un niveau d’anglais bilingue ou excellent.
Vous avez de par vos stages précédents une bonne connaissance des media et de la presse en France.
  • 4ème ou 5ème année d'étude (niveau Master)
  • Première expérience en communication nécessaire
  • Excellent niveau d’anglais (oral / écrit)
  • Créativité, imagination
  • Bonne connaissance de la presse française (online et offline) et du PAF
  • Bonne connaissance des médias digitaux et réseaux sociaux
  • Intérêt pour les nouvelles technologies et les nouveaux modes de consommation de la télévision (replay, EST, VOD, Social TV)
  • Gestion de son temps (urgence, priorité)
  • À l’aise en groupe, capacité à travailler avec différentes équipes
  • Maîtrise du pack office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Une connaissance des outils Adobe et des outils de design (Canva, RIPL,…) serait un plus


Stage de 4 à 6 mois à pourvoir immédiatement
Temps de travail réparti entre travail à domicile et travail dans les locaux à Paris 13e

description:
Job Summary:

We are hiring a Senior Manager, Digital Accounts Management to join the Content Sales and Distribution team on a 12 month parental leave cover contract. A key player in the development of The Walt Disney Company’s (TWDC) digital business – this role is responsible for managing the transactional digital sector (EHV and TVOD) across Australia and New Zealand.

The primary objective of the role will be to work with our digital clients, to build and maintain relationships, negotiate deals, and deliver against TWDC’s overall corporate strategy for a dynamic digital home entertainment business.

The role also includes overseeing a suite of content encompassing Movies and Television across a myriad of different brands.

The candidate must be highly adaptable and be able to manage a broad range of stakeholders across the AUNZ business and US home office.

Responsibilities:

Client Negotiation & Account Management
  • Develop and cultivate relationships across key stakeholders at all accounts, and negotiate deals aligned with TWDC overall strategy – delivering against account specific plans and commercial goals.
  • Managing the deal process: includes working with legal on the drafting of deal memos and contracts, communicating agreed terms in a timely manner with clients, senior management, finance teams, sales support and administration, etc.
  • Regular touchpoints with clients to ensure appropriate exposure of Disney content in accordance with deal terms, and to achieve financial objectives.
  • Working alongside global and local teams to align shared client objectives and streamline approach.
  • Ensure alignment, commitment and support from internal stakeholders: finance, marketing, legal, sales admin and operations, as well as broader TWDC teams (Studio and Disney Streaming Services).
  • Collaborate with marketing to develop compelling campaigns against key titles/promotional offers to drive awareness of Disney content within the transactional channel.
Financial Delivery
  • Deliver and exceed annual company revenue targets.
  • Working with the finance team to ensure accurate budgeting and forecast process.
  • Working alongside the finance and marketing teams to develop annual business strategy plans by client, taking into consideration annual revenue targets, analysis of historical performance and market trends.
  • Monitoring performance throughout the year (overall, by business strand, and individual client performance) to identify areas for exploitation or improvement. Ensuring the broader business is kept up to date with transactional performance.
  • Formulate and present business reviews across accounts
Content Management
  • Oversee the Disney portfolio of content available for transactional license (EHV/TVOD).
  • Work with key stakeholders to determine release date, strategies and pricing across New Release content.
  • Work alongside sales admin teams to distribute confirm and distribute content across clients.
  • Monitor performance of content, and identify areas for exploitation or concern.
Cross Company Collaboration & Stakeholder Management
  • Communicate effectively across all Disney lines of business to ensure overall territory business objectives are met (particularly Studio and Disney Streaming Service teams)
  • Work collaboratively across the wider Disney group
  • Act as key regional liaison between AUNZ and international sales and marketing teams.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Significant commercial experience, preferably within a media business environment.
  • A proven track record in meeting and exceeding sales forecasts
  • Experience in negotiation, with the ability to collaborate as well as display influence to overcome obstacles
  • A background in relationships building and stakeholder management
  • Excellent project management skills
  • Experience in strategic analysis
  • Graduate from accredited university

Preferred Qualifications:

  • In-depth understanding of the global digital media landscape
  • High level interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Strong presentation, negotiation, collaboration and influencing skills at all levels are key to success
  • Commercial experience and budget management.
  • Excellent proven interpersonal skills and a passion for media, film and the television industry.
  • Hands on approach, willing and able to embrace change and pivot as the business and/or market requires.
  • Senior stakeholder management, as well as the ability to manage multiple stakeholders in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong organisational and planning skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks and to prioritise successfully
  • Demonstrated strategic and creative thinking – solutions orientated performer.
  • A strong team player who contributes to an environment that embraces innovation and

Additional Information:

This is unique opportunity to join the talented team that develops and delivers unparalleled entertainment across Australia and New Zealand so if this role captures your imagination then apply now!

The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse and inclusive workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. We are committed to building a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

description:
Job Summary:

Stories are better when the storytellers represent the vast experiences of the people who will hear them. At Disney, we have the opportunity and the responsibility to create authentic, unforgettable stories, experiences, and products that capture the imagination of generations of people around the world. We are committed to doing that in a way that counts everybody in.

The Enterprise Reporting team is responsible for The Walt Disney Company’s 10K/10Q filing process and other SEC and non-SEC financial statement deliverables for various reporting requirements. This team also prepares analyses for internal reporting requirements, including balance sheet, income statement, and cash flow analyses for the Company’s two distinct business segments (Media, Entertainment & Distribution and Parks, Experiences & Products). In responding to executives, analysts or press inquiries concerning the Company, there is significant interaction between Enterprise Reporting and several key corporate departments, including Investor Relations, Corporate Communications, Financial Planning and Analysis, Treasury, and the office of the CFO. This position offers multiple opportunities to showcase analytical skills.

The Senior Financial Reporting Analyst position reports to the Manager in Enterprise Reporting and will be responsible for key functions that support the quarterly cash flow consolidation and close process for the enterprise. The person in this role will also actively participate in the preparation of Form 10-K/10-Q and internal financial reporting that is provided to senior executives of the Company and, as such, will involve interaction with a broad array of corporate and segment management personnel, including the senior executive level. In addition, this position provides a unique opportunity to demonstrate accounting, reporting, and financial system expertise, often within a team of other functional experts, on key business initiatives and special projects within the Company or specific to Enterprise Reporting.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist in completion of the Enterprise Cash Flow consolidation process
  • Prepare detailed support for the quarterly Enterprise GAAP Cash Flow statement
  • Assist in preparation of the quarterly Cash Flow Deck and related analysis for submission to senior management (the Cash Flow Deck is an internal report of segment cash flow results with detailed analysis)
  • Actively engage in the identification of potential cash flow adjustments and resolution of issues/problems related to Enterprise Cash Flow with business partners
  • Actively participate in Enterprise Cash Flow meetings, including
    • System enhancements with Disney Financial Systems team
    • Post close after action review meetings
  • Assist in the preparation of external reporting including quarterly earnings releases, Form 10-Qs, and Form 10-Ks
  • Prepare Corporate cash flow Annual Operating Plan and quarterly cash flow forecasts via the following:
    • Engage in collaborative planning discussions with Treasury, Financial Planning & Analysis, and segment business partners
    • Communicate forecast-to-actual results to key business partners
    • Lead/execute various ad hoc analyses
  • Assist in the preparation of internal reporting, senior management reports, and specialized reporting on an ad-hoc basis;
  • Prepare consolidated balance sheet analyses on certain accounts
  • Support the implementation of process improvement initiatives
Key stakeholders:
  • Coordination and interaction with segment teams and executives in Controllership and Investor Relations, including preparing deliverables, ad hoc questions, and analysis

Basic Qualifications:

  • Two+ years in accounting, auditing, or finance positions of increasing responsibility (including public accounting)
  • Strong knowledge of general accounting and close process
  • Must possess strong quantitative and analytical skills combined with solid business and financial acumen
  • A passion for accuracy and a desire to understand the “why”
  • Strong relationship building skills and a highly professional “client service orientation”
  • Must be able to interact with all levels of management
  • Flexible, “special-projects” orientation coupled with solid multi-tasking abilities
  • Demonstrated track record of process improvements and desire to implement best practices
  • Ability to meet tight/competing reporting deadlines

description:
Job Summary:

At Disney Financial Systems, you will team with the best in the business to create and build in one of the most innovative teams in any industry. Uniquely positioned at the center of The Walt Disney Company, the forward-thinkers at Financial Systems constantly pursue new ideas and cutting-edge technologies to help The Walt Disney Company’s many businesses drive value, all the while gaining something valuable from the experience themselves. An opportunity exists to support this dynamic organization as a Senior Manager, Financial Systems in the Disney Financial Systems team within the Enterprise Financial Services organization.

The Senior Manager, Financial Systems, will be the strategic financial systems partner working with key finance and business stakeholders, process owners, technology partners to drive finance systems and process transformation that help re-imagine the way the organization manages its financial functions. This role will address specific functional issues / requirements that support Enterprise-wide and Segment-specific levels as well as global and local complexities. This includes evaluating business objectives and needs, current operational procedures and financial systems used to formulate and successfully execute the roadmap for finance and systems transformation into the future. This role will also lead medium to large projects in partnership with business clients including but not limited to new business integration, continuous improvements in systems and processes, and finance transformation initiatives that may include SAP data strategy and harmonization and S4/HANA planning. This role includes partnering with the businesses to gather requirements, manage overall testing of enterprise & segment initiatives and identifies segment specific impacts resulting from system changes/ enhancements. This partnership ensures projects are coordinated to complement each other and leverage synergies where possible.

The ideal candidate must have a strong accounting/finance and project management background. Have extensive experience in SAP and will operate as a subject matter expert for SAP ECC and/or S4/HANA and other financial systems. Financial system implementations at an Enterprise, Segment or Business Unit level is a plus. This candidate should be familiar with current best practices and new technological trends to be able to work with various teams to streamline existing processes. The candidate should have proven history of building and maintaining excellent client service relationships, interact and partner with all levels of management to help drive collaborative business decisions, strong leadership experience to direct and mentor teams to meet goals, excellent communication skills, work in a fast-paced environment, and adaptable to business priority changes with ease.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 10 years work experience with financial or accounting, preferably in a large SAP installation
  • Minimum 5 years of staff management experience
  • Experience working for large company and within a matrix organization
  • Experience in using SAP or other large scale ERP systems
  • Experience in S4/HANA usage or implementation
Project Estimation
  • Facilitate scope definition, and high-level planning, discovery, and estimation workshops for projects with cross-functional teams
  • Quantify cost factors to deliver project deliverables including resources, project oversight, objective risk and related contingency
  • Document key assumptions and dependencies established through estimation activities
Project Planning
  • Create project schedule and communication plans
  • Ensure proactive scheduling of key deliverables, milestones and deliverable tasks
  • Establish project financial forecasts including resource plans and other expense plans
  • Develop the project plan and schedule with cross discipline functional leads
  • Ensure necessary steps and dependencies to deliver projects and components are established
  • Validate that scope can be completed within timeline and budget
Project Delivery
  • Lead functional projects, and single project tracks of large programs through full delivery life-cycle ensuring project is delivered on-time and on-budget
  • Manage resource assignment, budget, scheduling, and scope prioritization, and change control
  • Work with cross discipline team members to validate project assumptions and review project plans
  • Ensure proper documentation of scope of work
  • Serve as primary liaison among multiple teams, including DFS, Technology, vendors and key functional/business teams
  • Communicate regular updates to project and executive team on delivery progress, plan updates and budget spend and forecast, including status report updates, financial/budget/variance reports, and other reporting as required
  • Monitor adherence to schedule and milestone commitments
  • Escalate key issues and risks to ensure timely resolution and mitigation
  • Prevent scope creep, record causes of change, and facilitate change requests to ensure impacts to schedule or budget, as well as forecasts, are approved and communicated in a timely manner
  • Use metrics, including burn-down charts, to drive performance, efficiency and forecast improvements
  • Ensure proper project closure including lessons learned, transition and hand-off to ongoing maintenance support, and final financial reporting

Preferred Qualifications:

  • CPA or CMA license, or equivalent
  • PMP or other professional project management certification
  • Six Sigma certification
  • Experienced in using the Microsoft Office applications (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project)
  • Experience in using Business Intelligence reporting tools

Required Education

Minimum
Bachelor's Degree
Accounting, Finance, Information Technology, Business, or a related field

Preferred Education

Graduate Degree
Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, Information Systems, or a related field (e.g., MAC, MBA, MIS),

description:
Job Summary:

The Creative Services Executive works in the Creative and Production team, under the Design Manager and will be responsible for the day-to-day creative deliverables within the team.

With the Design Manager and input from senior creatives this person will ensure accuracy of briefs, will help with planning and allocation of resources for projects, will brief overflow work to external agencies, will manage project timelines and deliver campaign assets and content to the requested channels and outputs.

The role will work in collaboration with key stakeholders such as the Integrated Marketing team across all lines of business for the Walt Disney Company AUNZ including Disney+ and Star, Marvel, Lucasfilm, Pixar, Disney, National Geographic, ESPN and Parks & Resorts.

This person is strategic, proactive, extremely organised, detail-oriented and can manage multiple campaigns and projects simultaneously. The ideal candidate is passionate about supporting the team to help deliver artwork in a timely, accurate and collaborative manner.

Responsibilities:

Planning
  • Assess all incoming briefs with the help of the Design Manager for planning and allocation of resources using traffic and resource management tools to support short term and long term deliverables for the team based upon capacity and alignment to the project/brand
  • Planning of deliverables with alignment to campaign calendars and traffic management software
  • Liaise with and support Creative team members on capacity and timelines for daily, weekly and longer term deliverables.
  • Engage with stakeholders from across the business on their content and deliverables plans
  • Facilitate cross-company communication and alignment
  • Contribute to regular WIPs to go over items/tasks assigned and due for the day and determine if there are any roadblocks
Operations and Asset Management
  • Collaborate with the creative team and external parties to deliver creative assets for all media channels
  • Have a detailed knowledge of asset specs, formats, deliverables and deadlines and liaise closely with the Integrated Marketing team to ensure timely delivery
  • Ongoing management of resourcing and deadlines to ensure milestones are communicated clearly to Creative and Production team and related LOB team
  • Help to prepare accurate and detailed creative briefs with all specs and timelines provided and inputted into traffic and job management tools such as Monday.com
  • Assist with managing jobs to external suppliers and overflow agencies
  • Provide consistent and timely communication to key stakeholders
  • Content management and archiving of assets
  • Be reactive and work with agility to accommodate for global and local announcements
  • Identify areas of opportunity and intiatives to support resourcing, capacity, planning and workflow
  • Ensure local marketing team has local and global asset approvals including meeting legal requirements
  • Liaise with external vendors such as printers, paid media channels, media agencies to ensure output is to spec and is delivered to deadline.
  • Ensure quality control of assets according to production output specs
Brand management
  • Uphold the reputation of Disney brands at all times ensuring content sits within global brand and visual guidelines
  • Act as a brand custodian and ensures brand compliance
Stakeholder management
  • Manage stakeholders and work proactively with departments, teams or external agencies to drive best practice

Basic Qualifications:

  • 3-4+ years experience in a traffic/asset management, creative production management, project management or account management roles within a business environment
  • Tertiary degree qualification or equilavelent industry experience in project management , production, design or similar
  • Experience in managing internal and external agencies and internal cross lines of business
  • Understanding the importance and implementation of Corporate Brand Guidelines and approvals
  • Experience in project, asset and resource management and reporting software.
  • Experience in the Adobe Creative Suite including Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign and Acrobat
  • Advanced Microsoft Office skills
  • Presentation skills including the Google Suite, Keynote and Powerpoint

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Proactive self starter with a high level of energy and drive
  • Superior organisational and time management skills with the ability to manage multiple, diverse relationships and projects
  • Exceptional attention to detail
  • Results focused – strong sense of urgency and ability to work in deadline driven environment
  • Outstanding presentation, communication, written and negotiation skills in order to engage, influence and drive results
  • Willingness to contribute and work within a team environment and always consider as a priority “what is best for the business”
  • Dependable, timely, punctual, flexible and adaptable.

Additional Information:

This is unique opportunity to join the talented team that develops and delivers unparalleled entertainment across Australia and New Zealand so if this role captures your imagination then apply now!

The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse and inclusive workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. We are committed to building a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

description:
At the Disneyland® Resort, dream jobs do exist. After all, a company built on imagination and wonder means the work will definitely be interesting. General Food Prep Cast Members provide food and beverage services to Guests throughout our Theme Parks and Resort Hotels in a fast-paced environment, interacting with Guests everyday by sharing information, answering questions and providing great Guest Service. General Food Prep Cast Members perform various duties including preparing menu items from recipes.

The starting pay for General Food Prep is $17.15/Hour

$1,000 New Hire Bonus Incentive for General Food Prep

$1,000 Hiring Bonus (First payment after 90 days = $250 and Second payment after 150 days = $750)

To be eligible for the sign-on bonus, cast members must be in the position continuously for at least 90 days after hire and be employed by The Walt Disney Company at time of payment. A cast member is hired after the successful completion of Disney Traditions or one full day of employment. To be eligible for an incentive bonus after 150 days, cast members must remain employed in the position continuously for at least 150 days and be employed by The Walt Disney Company at the time of payment. Payments will be made approximately two weeks after the 90 and 150-day milestones, respectively. Bonus payments are subject to applicable taxes and other legal withholding. Disputes concerning eligibility to a bonus payment shall be resolved by Disneyland Recruitment in its sole and absolute discretion. The incentives offered herein are subject to change at any time, with or without notice. Cast Members hired prior to April 3, 2022 or after May 28, 2022 will not be eligible for an incentive award.

Responsibilities

  • Prepares, seasons and cooks to order menu items for all meals throughout the day
  • Portions and arranges food on serving dishes and is responsible for portion control and plate presentation
  • May cook, mix, and/or season ingredients to make dressings, sauces, gravies, batters, fillings and spreads
  • Work with food products, including but not limited to eggs, gluten, yeast, tree nuts, etc.
  • May wash, peel, slice, scoop, dice and julienne vegetables and fruits
  • Prepares, measures, mixes (following recipes) and/or cooks and garnishes basic appetizers (hot or cold), salads, pastas, sandwich fillings, Waffles and other food items
  • Some knowledge of cooking equipment such as grill, gas range, electric range, broiler, deep fat fryer, serving table, waffle iron, griddle, skillets and other standard kitchen equipment
  • May work in, but not limited to, the following stations: pantry prep station, cold prep station, assembler station, hot prep stations
  • Ability to prepare products according to recipe guidelines
  • Knowledge and understanding of kitchen safety and sanitation including temperature requirements
  • Has good judgment of food quality and production, understands the impact of spoilage
  • Ability to assist Chef in preparing items for Guests with special dietary needs
  • Cleans kitchen equipment and practices HACCP (Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points) Procedures
  • May carve and slice meat and cheese
  • Produces garde manger work for restaurants
  • May prepare sandwiches to individual order or on a production line basis
  • May bake, broil, cook, fry or steam food items as required to complete assigned production

Basic Qualifications

  • Constantly walking/standing
  • Occasionally pushing/pulling up to 50 lbs frequently up to 75 lbs
  • Constantly lifting up to 10 lbs, frequently up to 25 lbs, occasionally up to 50-75 lbs (when retrieving bulk items from storage)
  • Frequently bending/twisting/kneeling (cooking at different stations, reaching for utensils)
  • Frequent use of hands, wrist motion, grasping
  • Frequent use of knives, slicers and kitchen mixers
  • Works primarily indoors, but may be exposed to outdoors (special events
  • when needed)
  • Experience in culinary field/high volume restaurant 3-6 months
  • Ability to multi task and work in a very fast paced team environment
  • Demonstrates a desire to work in a Guest service and team environment
  • Demonstrates passion and enthusiasm for working in the kitchen
  • Strong listening skills and ability to follow direction
  • Must be flexible and able to work a variety of shifts, including days, nights, weekends, holidays and special events
  • You must be at least 18 years of age to be considered for this role
  • This role is Part Time and requires full availability for any shift, a MINIMUM of three (3) days per week, including nights and holidays

Preferred Qualifications

  • Enrolled in a culinary education program or equivalent
  • Recommendation from school
  • Bilingual preferred
  • Full availability SEVEN (7) days a week is preferred

Additional Information:

SCHEDULE AVAILABILTY
Our Theme Parks and Resort Hotels operate 24 hours a day, 365 days a year and some shifts may start as early as 5:00am while some may end as late as 3:00am, 4:00am or 5:00am. Please note that the principles of seniority are used to schedule all roles.

SUBMITTING YOUR APPLICATION
After clicking “Apply for this job” below, the employment application will open in a new window. Please complete ALL pages of the application by clicking “Next” on each page, then “Submit” on the final page.

About Disneyland Resort:

When Walt Disney opened Disneyland on July 17, 1955, he said he hoped it would be “a source of joy and inspiration to all the world.” Since then, the Disneyland Resort has welcomed more than 800 million guests, expanding to become an approximately 500- acre, multifaceted, world-class family resort destination, complete with two renowned Disney theme parks, three hotels and the exciting shopping, dining and entertainment area known as Downtown Disney District. Through a combination of creativity, technology and innovation, the resort brings storytelling to new heights, and Disneyland Resort cast members play an integral part in bringing that Disney magic to life for thousands of guests every day.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc., which is part of a business we call Disneyland Resort.

Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

To be eligible for the sign-on bonus, cast members must be in the position continuously for at least 90 days after hire and be employed by The Walt Disney Company at time of payment. A cast member is hired after the successful completion of Disney Traditions or one full day of employment. To be eligible for an incentive bonus after 150 days, cast members must remain employed in the position continuously for at least 150 days and be employed by The Walt Disney Company at the time of payment. Payments will be made approximately two weeks after the 90 and 150-day milestones, respectively. Bonus payments are subject to applicable taxes and other legal withholding. Disputes concerning eligibility to a bonus payment shall be resolved by Disneyland Recruitment in its sole and absolute discretion. The incentives offered herein are subject to change at any time, with or without notice. Cast Members hired prior to April 3, 2022 or after May 28, 2022 will not be eligible for an incentive award.

Responsibilities

  • Responsible for welcoming and interacting with all Guests
  • Requires constant interaction with Guests including answering questions, providing directions, event information and other services to help create a magical experience
  • May assemble orders and present to Guests according to recipe guidelines
  • Knowledge and understanding of safety and sanitation guidelines including temperature requirements
  • Has good judgment of food quality and production, understands the impact of spoilage
  • Responsible for maintaining work area-restocking and cleaning
  • Ensures that food presentation is fresh and up to quality standard
  • Daily responsibilities may include greeting Guests, pre-busses tables, gathers and transports dirty trays, silverware, and plates to the dish room area.
  • Arranges, cleans, sanitizes, and maintains tables, chairs, trash cans, liners and umbrellas.

Basic Qualifications

  • Must be 18 years of age
  • Able to effectively work independently or as part of a team
  • Excellent Hospitality skills
  • Ability to multi task and work in a very fast paced environment
  • Speed, accuracy and efficiency are required and ability to work well under pressure
  • Demonstrated ability to own and resolve Guest situations
  • Receptive to special requests
  • Enthusiastic about interacting and helping Guests
  • Able to make independent decisions for our Guests
  • Self-directed (can complete tasks with minimal supervision)
  • Willing to follow instructions & take direction
  • Flexible/adaptable
  • Supportive of other cast working on your team
  • Can complete repetitious tasks while maintaining quality
  • Strong verbal communication skills
  • Willing to work outdoors even in inclement weather
  • Must be flexible and able to work a variety of shifts, including days, nights, weekends, holidays and special events
  • Perform all job related functions in a cordial friendly manner, committed to exceeding Guests’ expectations
  • This role is Part Time and requires full availability for any shift, a MINIMUM of three (3) days per week, including nights and holidays.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Previous restaurant experience; understanding of Quick Service environment
  • Bilingual preferred
  • Full availability for any shift, seven (7) days per week, including nights, weekends, and holidays is preferred

Our Theme Parks and Resort Hotels operate 24 hours a day, 365 days a year and some shifts may start as early as 5:00am while some may end as late as 3:00am, 4:00am or 5:00am. Please note that the principles of seniority are used to schedule all roles.
