description:
Job Summary:

As a Stage Technician, you will support the safe conduct of live stage performances, including indoor, outdoor and special events. You will operate lighting, sound, video, rigging, props, automation equipment, etc. as directed by the Stage Supervisor, timecode or self-cued events. Your responsibilities will also include various checks before and after show.

Responsibilities:

  • Operate designated stage and other live performances within the defined creative parameters
  • Hands-on operation and programming of entertainment lighting/audio/video/rigging/props/automation equipment
  • Proper checks before and after the show to ensure correct and smooth running of the events
  • Operate all required safety checks before, during and after performances
  • Report and assist with maintenance of equipment
  • Equipment installation
  • Maintain a clean working environment
  • Equipment staging
  • Loading/unloading of stage equipment
  • Manage show reporting and tracking through the “Esqwire” software application
  • Other work assigned by managers

Basic Qualifications:

Working experience of below one or more entertainment equipment, including audio, visual and lighting equipment:
  • Audio – 32-channel+ audio consoles, passive and active speaker systems, crossovers, EQ’s, wired and wireless microphone systems
  • Lighting – 2 DMX Universe+ lighting control consoles, automated lighting fixtures, conventional lighting fixtures, dimmer systems, DMX distribution systems, LED, gel, focusing
  • Video – 1080p video projectors, 15,000 lumen+ projectors, video playback servers, video editings
  • Controls – MIDI, DMX, TCP/IP, RS422, RS482, RS232 protocols, ability to define and program control sets for entertainment equipment
  • Stage machinery and automation: winches, actor flight equipment, hydraulics, car tables, lift tables, electric booms, ProfiNET, and automatic console operation
  • Rigging: Stunt or climbing rope, suspension system operation
  • Props: understand the principle of the production and maintenance of props and puppets, have some experience in the production and maintenance of props and puppets, be familiar with the execution of props and puppets in performances, and have some problem-solving ability.
  • Experience with SMPTE timecode preferred
  • More than 3 years stage equipment management experiences
  • Working may require an aerial work permit (individual positions)
  • Conversational English skills
  • Available to work all peak seasons, and holidays
  • Available to work nights and flexible shift times

Additional Information:

As one of the worldwide leaders in family entertainment, Shanghai Disney Resort delivers legendary service and a lifetime of memories for our guests. Joining us in a new world of fantasy, imagination, creativity and adventure involves creating happiness for the millions of guests who visit our Resort each year. Whether your career journey here is onstage or backstage, there are almost unlimited opportunities for growth and personal development at Shanghai Disney.
* We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities.
* Specific benefits vary between different roles and may be adjusted according to company policy.
* Shanghai Disney Resort does not charge a fee to submit job applications and has not authorized any individual or company to charge to do so. Please always check our official channels or platforms for the most relevant recruitment information.

We are taking a responsible approach to creating environments that allow us to do what we do best – welcome and entertain millions of guests each year from across the country and around the world. As part of our commitment to health and safety, we require all newly-hired employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their onboarding dates.

Employment Benefits:
  • Salary: your salary consists of a base salary + service bonus + floating year-end bonus
  • Social Insurance: You are entitled to five social insurances and one housing fund
  • Overtime and allowances: In addition to statutory overtime (depending on your position) you may be entitled to a high temperature allowance and a night shift subsidy
  • Catering subsidy: You are entitled to one free meal per day on days that you are working
  • Accommodation: You have the opportunity to live in a dorm with Wi-Fi and air conditioning or to receive a living allowance
  • Vacation: You are entitled to paid annual leave and paid sick leave
  • Insurance: We buy supplementary medical insurance for you and your children. You can also enjoy group life insurance
  • Free Park Entry: While you work for Shanghai Disney Resort you will have the opportunity to enter the park with your family and friends for free
  • Disney Discounts: you are entitled to discounts on designated Disney products, resort F&B and ticketing
  • Health checkup: You are entitled to a free health checkup once a year

Learning and development opportunities:
  • Learning: you will be taught a range of international professional skills, including corporate culture, service skills, and more.
  • Career Development: Promotion opportunities are transparent and are dependent on your own efforts. You can also apply for internal transfers should you wish to develop yourself in another part of the company. With Hotel, Food and Beverage, Fire Safety, Security, Merchandise, Park Operations, Disney University and Operations training opportunities across multiple industries, there will always be development opportunities for those who want them at Disney.
  • Activities: Disney provides Cast Member with a range of volunteering opportunities as well as fun clubs for basketball, tennis, yoga, Disney Run, Music, Drama, DIY and more as a way to help you connect with your colleagues and network in a fun environment.
Application Process:

Apply online -> Interview over email -> Accept Employment -> Onboard
Please note: You may only apply for this position once in a six-month period. If you have applied within the last six months, please log in to your account to view your current application status.

Work Location:

You will be working at Shanghai Disney Resort in Pudong, Shanghai. You can take metro Line 11 to Shanghai Disney Resort station or take one of our many shuttle buses. The shuttle buses can be taken from one of several central areas across the city every day. You can find out more information during your onboarding process.

description:
Job Summary:

Disneyland Paris adapte sa stratégie commerciale pour toujours proposer une expérience inoubliable à ses guests (visiteurs). Notre équipe e-Commerce lance plusieurs initiatives de transformation des plateformes pour concevoir et offrir des parcours plus fluides, plus immersifs et répondant mieux aux attentes de nos guests. Dans ce contexte de forte transformation digitale, nous renforçons nos équipes et sommes à la recherche d’un.e Lead Product Designer UX/User eXperience pour manager les product designers et ainsi contribuer à l’atteinte d’ambitieux objectifs.


Vos Missions ?
  • Animer une équipe d’environ 5 Product Designers
  • Contribuer à définir la vision UX e-Commerce
  • Etre responsable de l’expérience e-Commerce
  • Appliquer des méthodes de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur afin de traduire les besoins utilisateur, les objectifs métier et les capacités technologiques en expériences utilisateur de premier ordre

En tant que Lead, vous serez amené. à :
  • Co-créer la vision Design avec le Head of Product Design
  • Porter la vision dans le département & au-delà
  • Apporter l’expertise UX et assurer une veille
  • Définir & appliquer des modes de collaboration avec les principaux partenaires & parties prenantes : Product Managers, Product Owners, développeurs, testeurs et l’ensemble des parties prenantes pour imaginer l'expérience de demain
  • Participer au suivi du plan de charge (à coordonner avec les Product Managers qui leadent le sujet)
  • Animer l’équipe de Product Designers : organisation de rituels et suivi de l'état d'esprit du groupe
  • Coacher les Designers sur leur métier
  • Challenger les productions
  • Assurer l'application des bonnes pratiques
  • Contribuer à la transformation digitale en étant force de proposition & en supportant le changement

En tant que Designer, vous serez amené. à :
  • Recueillir et analyser les avis des utilisateurs, les besoins existants et identifier les opportunités
  • Concevoir, planifier et animer des test utilisateurs
  • Traduire les résultats des recherches en experience map, empathy map, user journeys, etc.
  • Concevoir les personas et les cas d’usage correspondants
  • Animer des workshops dédiés d’idéation / de co-création
  • Proposer des A/B tests, analyser les résultats des lancements produits et proposer des pistes d’améliorations et d’innovation
  • Définir l’architecture de l’information, les principes de navigation, de guidage et de structuration tout en expliquant les choix de conception
  • Matérialiser les solutions permettant d’optimiser l’expérience, en particulier en situation de mobilité ; concevoir des wireframes et prototypes des interfaces web et mobile
  • Développer le modèle et la structure de navigation primaire et secondaire
  • Créer des prototypes
  • Travailler en collaboration avec la squad et les différents services techniques, expliquer vos partis-pris à l’ensemble de l’équipe et collaborer avec l’UI designer
  • Collaborer et échanger au sein d’équipes projet pluridisciplinaires (directeurs artistiques, webdesigners, développeur, consultants métiers…).
  • Tenir compte de la faisabilité avec les équipes techniques et créatives

Vos atouts pour réussir ?
  • Idéalement titulaire d'un Bac+5, vous avez une expérience de 7 ans minimum dans l’UX et la recherche utilisateur dans une agence digitale, cabinet de conseil, en entreprise ou startup
  • Les techniques « Design Thinking » n’ont pas de secret pour vous
  • Vous maitrisez les outils et les méthodes les plus innovantes et faites parfaitement la différence entre culture Produit vs culture Projet
  • Vous êtes familier avec les approches Agiles et les démarches collaboratives basées sur la co-construction
  • Vous faites preuve de persuasion pour porter la vision de votre produit et facilitez la communication et la collaboration entre l’ensemble des parties prenantes
  • Votre leadership, votre esprit d'initiative et vos qualités relationnelles vous permettront d'assurer avec succès les missions qui vous seront confiées, et de vous adapter rapidement à un environnement international dynamique
  • Vous parlez et écrivez couramment l'anglais


La différence Disneyland Paris ?
  • Un environnement exceptionnel, international et multiculturel concentré sur un site unique
  • Un programme d‘intégration complet sur votre poste et l’accès à de nombreuses formations
  • Des opportunités de développement de votre carrière
  • Télétravail et d’autres avantages dont prise en charge partielle des frais de transports
  • Contribuer à la transformation digitale & travailler sur des projets stratégiques et ambitieux


Prêt(e) à participer à une formidable aventure humaine ? A rejoindre nos collaborateurs (Cast Members) partageant la même ambition professionnelle : celle de faire vivre la magie Disneyland Paris pour les millions de visiteurs qui viennent dans nos parcs tous les ans ?
Il ne vous reste plus qu’à postuler car nous sommes prêts à vous donner les moyens de faire rayonner vos talents !


‘Disneyland Paris est soucieux d’offrir à ses Cast Members les conditions de travail les plus favorables à leur épanouissement professionnel. Dans ce cadre et pour garantir une flexibilité optimale, les emplois qui ne nécessitent pas une intervention ou l’accès à des installations ou applications sur site et/ou des interactions physiques peuvent s’exercer en télétravail, avec un minimum de présence requis de cinq jours par mois sur site.

description:
Job Summary:

A Chef de Partie in a Western / Chinese kitchen is one who cooks a specified range of soups, meat, poultry, vegetable, fish, mollusks and seafood dishes, including cold food and breakfast items, according to the requirements of the menu, recipe and guests. He/she is also in charge to manage and lead a section under their responsibility.
He / she should be willing to learn and adapt well to new challenges; be motivated and lead a small team of cooks to get along with fellow cast members.
He / she is responsible for his/her work entrusted with, lead a small team of motivated culinary staff, will be supervised by Chef de Cuisine or Sous Chef; be able to work in a fast paced and ever-changing environment and control cost, quality and quantity.


Responsibilities:

  • Lead a small team of culinary staff
  • Prepares high quality and safe food and ingredients for cooking
  • Prepares basic stocks, gravies, sauces, starches
  • Cooks soups, vegetable, meat, poultry, fish mollusk and seafood items
  • Serves guests at buffet table
  • Performs and shows good housekeeping / Able to handle accidents and emergencies
  • Performs butchery preparation
  • Completed other F&B tasks assigned by line manager to support LOB’s operations

Basic Qualifications:

  • High school or relevant education
  • 5 years and above of experiences in culinary
  • Fluent Chinese and basic English
  • Should know HACCP and follow the basic hygiene & sanitations regulation
  • Has to be able to communicate well, written and orally with cast members
  • Should have a good knowledge and compassion for food

  • Computer Skills and able to learn new software for inventory control and ordering
  • You shall obtain certificate/qualification(s) required for performing the job, and complete and pass all post-employment trainings and assessments (including but not limited to On-Job-Training

description:
Job Summary:

This is an exciting opportunity to join the Disney+ AUNZ team, in a role responsible for contributing to ongoing subscriber growth and retention through measurement, analysis and insight generation, with a particular focus on marketing performance.

This role partners with local strategy, insights, marketing, content and finance teams, and collaborates with colleagues within a regional and global analytics structure, to improve business results through statistical rigor, data analysis and reporting, and fast-paced execution, with an emphasis on the timely, clear communication of results, insights and actionable recommendations.

Based in Melbourne, this role will play a critical role in supporting awareness and acquisition media channels including Paid Search, Display, Social, Video, Audio and Affiliate. This role analyzes complex data from both internal and external sources to help identify opportunities, inform media buying, optimize conversion funnels and ensure media dollars are optimally invested.

The successful candidate will demonstrate acute attention to detail, a strong sense of accountability, and solid hands-on experience with large datasets, a passion for digital and linear media landscapes, and a good understanding of the intricacies and unique attributes of each step in the marketing funnel.

Responsibilities:

  • Marketing Performance Reporting, Visualization, and Regression Management: Be a primary partner for awareness and acquisition marketing stakeholders, focused on reporting and optimizing digital and linear marketing channel performance (across social, display, search, audio, video and affiliate channels), and marketing budget optimization.
  • Deep-Dive Analysis: Analyze marketing performance data across channels, tactics, partners and individual ad networks to identify patterns, uncover opportunities, and optimize budget / drive marketing spend efficiencies through the funnel.
  • Build automated reporting, and present results to the broader organization.
  • Experimentation and Tracking: Develop test and learn strategies related to targeting, creative and other variables to improve end-to-end conversion throughout the funnel. Support data tracking integrations both internally and with third parties to ensure global best practices are deployed for the Disney+ AUNZ business.
  • Data-Driven Culture: Be an approachable team member who enhances the data culture within Disney, and collaborate with senior stakeholders to co-design and communicate a strategic roadmap and backlog for marketing data analytics. Be a data ambassador to cross-functional teams, coaching best practice in use of reporting tools, data enrichment, and governance.
  • Metric Alignment and Code Development: Work with colleagues regionally and globally to align metric definitions, and update and maintain the code base in line with regional and global team best practices.

Basic Qualifications:

  • 2+ years work experience developing in SQL, especially in an ETL processing pipeline
  • 1+ years of analytical experience
  • Familiarity with Python/R or other statistical programming languages
  • Familiarity with data exploration and data visualization tools like Tableau, Looker etc.
  • Strong communication skills, as well as written and verbal presentation skills
  • Degree in an analytical field
Qualifications:
  • Experience in the technology industry, knowledge of data products preferred.
  • Experience in the streaming media industry or other subscription-based service an advantage.
  • Bachelor’s degree in relevant focus (i.e., Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics or Machine Learning)

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong Technical Skills (SQL, Python, R or other statistical programming language)
  • Strong Microsoft Office skills including Excel, Word and PowerPoint
  • High attention to detail and accuracy
  • Ability to examines issues from a broad perspective while considering impact beyond immediate scope
  • Logical and lateral thinker
  • Excellent time management and organisation skills to ensure all priorities and multiple deadlines are met
  • A strong team player who contributes to an environment that embraces innovation
  • Strong communication skills including written, verbal and interpersonal

Additional Information:

This is unique opportunity to join the talented team that develops and delivers unparalleled entertainment across Australia and New Zealand so if this role captures your imagination then apply now!

The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse and inclusive workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. We are committed to building a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

description:
Job Summary:

At Shanghai Disney Resort, we offer a great variety of merchandise with distinctive Disney elements that attracts thousands of guests each day and brings guests into a carefree world for a magical experience. As a Merchandise Host/Hostess, you welcome guests to our stores with a smile and friendly interaction, enriching their shopping experience. As a Heart of House Host/Hostess, you will serve as a receiver, floor stocker, runner and inventory control specialist to ensure successful daily store operations.

Responsibilities:

  • As greeter, cashier, host/hostess for customization service, stock helper, visual merchandise assistant and others in Front of House. Offer additional merchandise to go with their selection to enrich guests’ shopping experience. Rotate in different roles according to scheduling within one day
  • As a part of the core product team you could be a receiver, floor stocker, runner, ICS (inventory controlling specialist) and guest-facing Cast in Back of House
Based on business need and Cast Members’ credentials, below tasks will be assigned from time to time.
  • Support guest flow in general, including in different locations
  • Assist guests with directions, answer questions, provide information and solutions as needed
  • Support cleaning work areas and guest areas
  • Assist logistics and stocking
  • Keep Shanghai Disney Resort clean by picking trash
  • Handle cash or process POS in other LOBs ( * applicable to cash-handling/POS related jobs only)

Basic Qualifications:

  • At least one year of experience in a guest-facing role (retail, F&B, hotels, etc.)
  • Must be able to work in multiple store locations throughout the Resort, indoor or outdoor, sometimes in hot or cold environment
  • Strong verbal communication skills (able to positively engage with Guests, team members and management)
  • Excellent service awareness and ability to proactively fix problems for guests
  • As a front-line Cast member at Shanghai Disney Resort you might be scheduled to work shifts on nights, weekends and holidays. Flexible/adaptable (be able to work at variable time, including early morning, late evening, weekends and holidays)

Additional Information:

As one of the worldwide leaders in family entertainment, Shanghai Disney Resort delivers legendary service and a lifetime of memories for our guests. Joining us in a new world of fantasy, imagination, creativity and adventure involves creating happiness for the millions of guests who visit our Resort each year. Whether your career journey here is onstage or backstage, there are almost unlimited opportunities for growth and personal development at Shanghai Disney.
* We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities.
* Specific benefits vary between different roles and may be adjusted according to company policy.
* Shanghai Disney Resort does not charge a fee to submit job applications and has not authorized any individual or company to charge to do so. Please always check our official channels or platforms for the most relevant recruitment information.

We are taking a responsible approach to creating environments that allow us to do what we do best – welcome and entertain millions of guests each year from across the country and around the world. As part of our commitment to health and safety, we require all newly-hired employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their onboarding dates.

Employment Benefits:
  • Salary: your salary consists of a base salary + service bonus + floating year-end bonus
  • Social Insurance: You are entitled to five social insurances and one housing fund
  • Overtime and allowances: In addition to statutory overtime (depending on your position) you may be entitled to a high temperature allowance and a night shift subsidy
  • Catering subsidy: You are entitled to one free meal per day on days that you are working
  • Accommodation: You have the opportunity to live in a dorm with Wi-Fi and air conditioning or to receive a living allowance
  • Vacation: You are entitled to paid annual leave and paid sick leave
  • Insurance: We buy supplementary medical insurance for you and your children. You can also enjoy group life insurance
  • Free Park Entry: While you work for Shanghai Disney Resort you will have the opportunity to enter the park with your family and friends for free
  • Disney Discounts: you are entitled to discounts on designated Disney products, resort F&B and ticketing
  • Health checkup: You are entitled to a free health checkup once a year

Learning and development opportunities:
  • Learning: you will be taught a range of international professional skills, including corporate culture, service skills, and more.
  • Career Development: Promotion opportunities are transparent and are dependent on your own efforts. You can also apply for internal transfers should you wish to develop yourself in another part of the company. With Hotel, Food and Beverage, Fire Safety, Security, Merchandise, Park Operations, Disney University and Operations training opportunities across multiple industries, there will always be development opportunities for those who want them at Disney.
  • Activities: Disney provides Cast Member with a range of volunteering opportunities as well as fun clubs for basketball, tennis, yoga, Disney Run, Music, Drama, DIY and more as a way to help you connect with your colleagues and network in a fun environment.

Application Process:
Apply online -> Interview over email -> Accept Employment -> Onboard
Please note: You may only apply for this position once in a six-month period. If you have applied within the last six months, please log in to your account to view your current application status.

Work Location:
You will be working at Shanghai Disney Resort in Pudong, Shanghai. You can take metro Line 11 to Shanghai Disney Resort station or take one of our many shuttle buses. The shuttle buses can be taken from one of several central areas across the city every day. You can find out more information during your onboarding process.

description:
Job Summary:

Disney Streaming Services is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including the ESPN+ premium sports streaming service; Disney+, the dedicated streaming home for entertainment from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic and BAMTECH Media, a global leader in direct-to-consumer video streaming products and solutions. Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. We serve consumers by bringing the world’s most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. We strive daily to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives consumers the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location.

The Technical Program Manager will help drive business-critical initiatives across the enterprise landscape. This role will be responsible for planning, and executing complex programs with a goal of delivering a unified experience for data at Hulu. Primary goal will be to enable senior management, leadership teams, and individual contributors to achieve predictable planning, execution, and reporting quality with expertise in project tools and appropriate methodologies. Key aspects of this role will be to establish goals, metrics, build roadmaps, coordinate platform upgrades, and work with governance-architecture-quality on policy implementation and training. By working with software engineers, data engineers, data scientists, Technical Program Managers and other managers in the spaces of Data Governance and Data Quality, you will help build data products that allow the valuable data to be translated into actionable insights! In addition, this involves exposure and engagement with owning cutting-edge initiatives in areas of Enterprise Data, Analytics and A.I.

Responsibilities:

  • Accountable for driving execution and delivery of multiple high-profile technical, product or software development projects from start to finish. Projects assigned to this level tend to be highly complex and strategically prioritized
  • Performs all other responsibilities of a Project Manager at a proficient level, plus:
  • Identifies project risks; analyzes and communicates prioritized mitigation plans to stakeholders
  • Understands most project domain components, including architecture, tools and deployment practices that development team is employing
  • Accountable for driving execution and delivery of technical programs from start to finish
  • Develops a program plan comprised of parallel projects and multiple project managers that collectively produce work that has significant business impact
  • Monitors & adjusts program plan to respond to unplanned changes, ensuring program is progressing to meet business goals
  • Creates governance practices and provides senior-level leadership oversight and control for the program
  • Implements fiscal practices and controls, authorizing, recording, and reporting on program expenditures & ROI
  • Work closely with software developers, product managers and UX designers to craft best-of-class data exploration experience
  • Map milestones with Product, UX , Architecture & Engineering to enable product launches
  • Set up the release process and access control management in order to comply with governance regulations.
  • Lead Tool Vendor onboarding and relationship and evaluate need for consultant resources on an ongoing basis.
  • Develop strong partnerships with engineering, product management and analytics leaders to drive focus on strategic and tactical program objectives
  • Build strategic relationships with key technology and business leaders to ensure program success

Basic Qualifications:

  • 5 years of experience in program management, preferably with a focus on data architecture, business intelligence, relational databases or big-data technology
  • Experience with large-scale organizational change efforts
  • Experience building broad, large-scale communications plans
  • Love for Data and taking chaos and turning it into something actionable
  • High sense of ownership and a focus on building fast without sacrificing quality
  • Experience in Agile software development with expertise in Scrum methodology and practices.
  • Good understanding of ETL processing, Web Application development cycle
  • Working knowledge of modern program management, analysis, and reporting tools such as Wrike, Trello, Jira/Confluence, and MS Office

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in business management, computer science, or another related field.

description:
Job Summary:

We seek an enthusiastic and experienced product manager to lead our efforts in evolving the world-class native video player used by Disney+ and other Disney brand partners. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Media Product, and part of the rapidly growing Media Product team, the job location is open to these locations: Seattle, New York City, San Francisco, Santa Monica, Burbank.

The video player is the heart of the streaming experience for our users, and Disney’s aggressive growth strategy means we are extending our reach to more customers, on more devices, world-wide, every day. Keeping that experience compelling, satisfying, and familiar, regardless of what device is in use, is the highest priority. You will work closely with counterparts in engineering and product management, as well as with executive teams, to ensure the product roadmap fulfills business, technical, and consumer priorities for target platforms, such as set-top boxes, game consoles, and other consumer devices supported by the native video player.
The ideal candidate is highly analytical, resourceful, team oriented, and will have an ability to work independently under time constraints to meet deadlines. You will have a proven track record in taking on end-to-end ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced and dynamic business environment. The ideal candidate seeks and receives input from a wide range of sources, makes data-driven decisions, obsesses about our customers, forms strong yet loosely held opinions, and builds trust with all areas of the business. We value passionate product leadership that drives with discipline and attention to detail.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with stakeholders to identify product goals, define the product roadmap, and maintain open lines of communication with related teams
  • Successfully achieve product objectives by managing through challenges and removing roadblocks for the team
  • Take a data-driven approach to constantly improve the product
  • Refine measurement and reporting frameworks to communicate status to neighbors and stakeholders, as appropriate
  • Ensure player KPIs meet/exceed service targets
  • Work with device and distribution partner teams to coordinate uses of the player SDK in partner-led development projects
  • Collaborate with engineering teams to translate product requirements into actionable stories using an Agile product development process
  • Collaborate with quality assurance teams to translate acceptance criteria and ensure maximum test coverage
  • Generally serve as product championWork with stakeholders to identify product goals, define the product roadmap, and maintain open lines of communication with related teams
  • Successfully achieve product objectives by managing through challenges and removing roadblocks for the team
  • Take a data-driven approach to constantly improve the product
  • Refine measurement and reporting frameworks to communicate status to neighbors and stakeholders, as appropriate
  • Ensure player KPIs meet/exceed service targets
  • Work with device and distribution partner teams to coordinate uses of the player SDK in partner-led development projects
  • Collaborate with engineering teams to translate product requirements into actionable stories using an Agile product development process
  • Collaborate with quality assurance teams to translate acceptance criteria and ensure maximum test coverage
  • Generally serve as product champion

Basic Qualifications:

  • You have a minimum of 3 years experience in product management within video streaming or related industries
  • You have a strong high-level technical understanding of video player components, including content protection, ad insertion, instrumentation, and analytics
  • You have demonstrated an ability to assimilate information from a wide variety of sources, to build new domain knowledge
  • You demonstrate strong strategic aptitude, clear thinking and communicating, and great decision making
  • You have an obsession with making customers happy, and strong opinions about good customer experience
  • You have demonstrated ability to use data to drive decisions and back up assumptions and recommendations
  • You have a strong attention to detail, yet with the ability to take a step back and understand the bigger picture
  • You’ve demonstrated successful experience building and executing product roadmaps aligned with business requirements and technology capabilities in global businesses
  • You have excellent written and oral communication skills
  • You’re scrappy and resourceful, with no fear of getting your hands dirty and an impulse to be the first to tackle any challenge.
  • You’ve demonstrated ability to work with engineering teams to discuss technical concepts, make tradeoffs to remove roadblocks, and evaluate new ideas
  • You know when to escalate issues expediently and accurately when blockers arise

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Video player product management experience
  • Experience with streaming media protocols such as HLS or DASH
  • Knowledge of relevant audio and video standards
  • Experience working on C/C++, Rust, or embedded system software projects
  • Knowledge of SoC/STB ecosystem and associated development lifecycles

Additional Information:

Disney Streaming Services is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including the ESPN+ premium sports streaming service; the upcoming Disney subscription video service; and BAMTECH Media, a global leader in direct-to-consumer video streaming products and solutions. description:
Job Summary:

Shanghai Disney Resort provides spectacular shows to guests every day. As a Costuming Service Attendant, you will ensure smooth operation of daily shows and create magical experiences for guests. Responsibilities include managing inventory of costumes and costume store rooms; assisting Cast Members in dressing before and during the show; ensuring quick changes; repair and care for costumes; and making sure costumes are in perfect condition.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide costume services to Shanghai Disney Resort Cast Members and assist with any costume related issue.
  • Make sure all Cast Members can find their costumes and accessories easily and quickly; make sure that Issue Floor and Locker Area are always tidy and clean to meet Cast Members’ satisfaction.
  • Provide a variety of apparel-related services to cast members, such as fitting, size checking, costumes borrowing process enquiry, costume look-up and repair, locker look-up and repair, nametag production, costume account look-up and other costume related service.
  • Timely cleaning and return of costumes; laundry, including (but not limited to) sorting, scrubbing, hand-washing costume items, placing into dryer, ironing, folding, placing all costumes and under-dressings on hangers.
  • Receiving goods from factories and warehouse, check quantity and quality, pre-wash, scan into system and make sure types and sizes are correct for Cast Members.
  • Housekeeping and other assigned tasks.

Based on business need and Cast Members’ credentials, below tasks will be assigned from time to time.
  • Support cleaning work areas and guest areas
  • Assist logistics and stocking
  • Keep Shanghai Disney Resort clean by picking trash

Basic Qualifications:

  • Available to work for three full days continuously per week (Thursday to Saturday or Friday to Sunday). 24 hours at most per week
  • Excellent communication skills, ability to maintain a positive attitude and work well in a team setting
  • Fluent in Mandarin, basic oral English is a plus
  • Proficient with computers and office software
  • Flexible/adaptable (may work in a variety of areas, conditions need to accept shift rotation)
  • Must provide full availability for ongoing training throughout a two-month period
  • Should be able to work for more than six consecutive months

Additional Information:

As one of the worldwide leaders in family entertainment, Shanghai Disney Resort delivers legendary service and a lifetime of memories for our guests. Joining us in a new world of fantasy, imagination, creativity and adventure involves creating happiness for the millions of guests who visit our Resort each year. Whether your career journey here is onstage or backstage, there are almost unlimited opportunities for growth and personal development at Shanghai Disney.
* We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities.
* Specific benefits vary between different roles and may be adjusted according to company policy.
* Shanghai Disney Resort does not charge a fee to submit job applications and has not authorized any individual or company to charge to do so. Please always check our official channels or platforms for the most relevant recruitment information.

We are taking a responsible approach to creating environments that allow us to do what we do best – welcome and entertain millions of guests each year from across the country and around the world. As part of our commitment to health and safety, we require all newly-hired employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their onboarding dates.

Employment Benefits:
  • Salary: your salary consists of a base salary + service bonus + floating year-end bonus
  • Social Insurance: You are entitled to five social insurances and one housing fund
  • Overtime and allowances: In addition to statutory overtime (depending on your position) you may be entitled to a high temperature allowance and a night shift subsidy
  • Catering subsidy: You are entitled to one free meal per day on days that you are working
  • Accommodation: You have the opportunity to live in a dorm with Wi-Fi and air conditioning or to receive a living allowance
  • Vacation: You are entitled to paid annual leave and paid sick leave
  • Insurance: We buy supplementary medical insurance for you and your children. You can also enjoy group life insurance
  • Free Park Entry: While you work for Shanghai Disney Resort you will have the opportunity to enter the park with your family and friends for free
  • Disney Discounts: you are entitled to discounts on designated Disney products, resort F&B and ticketing
  • Health checkup: You are entitled to a free health checkup once a year

Learning and development opportunities:
  • Learning: you will be taught a range of international professional skills, including corporate culture, service skills, and more.
  • Career Development: Promotion opportunities are transparent and are dependent on your own efforts. You can also apply for internal transfers should you wish to develop yourself in another part of the company. With Hotel, Food and Beverage, Fire Safety, Security, Merchandise, Park Operations, Disney University and Operations training opportunities across multiple industries, there will always be development opportunities for those who want them at Disney.
  • Activities: Disney provides Cast Member with a range of volunteering opportunities as well as fun clubs for basketball, tennis, yoga, Disney Run, Music, Drama, DIY and more as a way to help you connect with your colleagues and network in a fun environment.

Application Process:

Apply online -> Interview over email -> Accept Employment -> Onboard
Please note: You may only apply for this position once in a six-month period. If you have applied within the last six months, please log in to your account to view your current application status.

Work Location:

You will be working at Shanghai Disney Resort in Pudong, Shanghai. You can take metro Line 11 to Shanghai Disney Resort station or take one of our many shuttle buses. The shuttle buses can be taken from one of several central areas across the city every day. You can find out more information during your onboarding process.

description:
Job Summary:

We seek an enthusiastic and experienced product manager to lead our efforts in evolving the world-class video player used by Disney+ and other Disney brand partners. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Media Product, and part of the rapidly growing Media Product team, the job location is open to these locations: Seattle, New York City, San Francisco, Santa Monica, Burbank.

The video player is the heart of the streaming experience for our users, and we continually evolve it in order to keep that experience compelling, satisfying, and familiar, regardless of what device is in use. You will work closely with counterparts in design, engineering, and product management, as well as with executive teams, to ensure the product fulfills business, technical, and consumer priorities. You will define and drive the video player product roadmap. The ideal candidate is highly analytical, resourceful, team oriented, and will have an ability to work independently under time constraints to meet deadlines. You will have a proven track record in taking on end-to-end ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced and dynamic business environment.
The ideal candidate makes data-driven decisions, obsesses about the customer, forms strong yet loosely held opinions, and can build trust with all areas of the business. We value passionate product leadership that drives with discipline and attention to detail.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with stakeholders to establish and identify product goals and define product roadmap and KPIs
  • Successfully achieve product objectives, managing through challenges
  • Partner with Disney Streaming Services UX and engineering teams to identify new product and process opportunities to drive the best possible player experience for viewers, within the constraints of devices, consumer environments, and available technology
  • Take a data driven approach to constantly improve the product - devise measurement and reporting frameworks and processes to communicate status to neighbors and stakeholders, as appropriate to each
  • Collaborate with engineering teams to translate product requirements into actionable stories using an Agile product development process
  • Maintain strategic insight into the industry-wide video player landscape and an understanding of current trends

Basic Qualifications:

  • You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in product management within video streaming or related industries
  • You have a strong high-level technical understanding of video player components
  • You demonstrate strong strategic aptitude, clear thinking and communicating, and great decision making
  • You have an obsession with making customers happy, and strong opinions about good customer experience
  • You have demonstrated ability to use data to drive decisions and back up assumptions and recommendations
  • You have a strong attention to detail, yet with the ability to take a step back and understand the bigger picture
  • You’ve demonstrated successful experience building and executing product roadmaps aligned with business requirements and technology capabilities in global businesses
  • You have excellent written and oral communication skills
  • You’re scrappy and resourceful, with no fear of getting your hands dirty and an impulse to be the first to tackle any challenge.
  • You’ve demonstrated ability to work with engineering teams to discuss technical concepts, make tradeoffs to remove roadblocks, and evaluate new ideas

Preferred Qualifications:

  • You know when to escalate issues expediently and accurately when blockers arise
  • Direct video player product management experience
  • A technical background in media

Additional Information:

Disney Streaming Services is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including the Disney+ subscription video service; the Hulu premium streaming service for live and on-demand TV, and ESPN+ premium sports streaming service. Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. We serve consumers by bringing the world’s most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. We strive daily to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives consumers the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location.

description:
Job Summary:

Disney’s Marketing Partnerships, Alliances, and Card Services team develops and holistically manages complex, long-term, multi-dimensional relationships with select brands and companies. This team is dedicated to creating incremental value to The Walt Disney Company and its partners through creative development of marketing and sponsorship programs, management of partner relationships across all business units at The Walt Disney Company and the creation of new partnerships aligned with The Walt Disney Company’s businesses and strategic goals. The Marketing Partnerships, Alliances, and Card Services organization leverages company and partner assets to create value globally for The Walt Disney Company.

The Corporate Alliance Strategy team is seeking a highly qualified individual to help lead strategy, financial analysis, and recommendation development for the Corporate Alliance organization. A role on this team provides a unique opportunity to learn about business units across Disney (e.g., studio, direct-to-consumer, parks, experiences, & products, media networks), and make a significant and lasting impact!

The ideal candidate will have a natural curiosity to pressure-test assumptions and drive strategic thinking and execution, always pushing to understand “why” and question “how can we improve.” The ideal candidate is a proactive leader and problem solver, equally comfortable with complex financial analyses as they are building relationships and interfacing with partners of all levels across the organization. A team-oriented attitude, sense of fun, and eagerness to tackle challenging business problems are all essential.

Responsibilities:

Strategy Development
  • Identify, structure, lead and complete strategic and operationally-focused projects, interfacing across the team and cross-functionally to ensure stakeholder buy-in and alignment throughout the process
  • Serve as thought partner to Strategy Director and Marketing Partnerships, Alliances, and Card Services Directors/VPs
  • Explore new approaches and frameworks to address team and Partner needs, always challenging the status quo and elevating the greater Marketing Partnerships, Alliances, and Card Services team in the process
  • Structure, lead and distill market research projects to enable ROI measurement, with the support of Disney and/or third party research teams
  • Synthesize financial and consumer insight data to help inform Marketing Partnerships, Alliances, and Card Services strategic direction and priorities

Financial Analysis
  • Structure, lead and distill financial analyses, collaborating closely with Disney Finance teams
  • Proactively surface & mine key data sources to help support strategic and operational objectives
  • Synthesize financial data along with internal and external consumer insights to understand drivers of financial performance and to inform broader team strategy

General Responsibilities
  • Create compelling, persuasive presentation materials to communicate key learnings and recommendations to senior level executives globally
  • Actively contribute to discussions with senior leadership (VP, SVP, EVP, CFO) and all levels of Marketing Partnerships, Alliances, and Card Services team
  • Work closely with other Walt Disney Company segments (e.g., studio, direct-to-consumer, parks, experiences, & products, media networks) and stakeholders within those segments (e.g., Finance, Research, Industrial Engineering, Imagineering)


Technical skills and requirements:
  • Advanced analytical skills (forecasting, opportunity/market sizing, trend analysis, etc.)
  • Significant experience in developing financial models, forecasts and operating plans
  • Ability to independently craft executive-ready presentations
  • Significant experience independently managing complex, cross-functional projects

Additional skills and requirements:
  • Advanced written and verbal communication skills
  • Professionalism to work directly with Disney senior leadership and present findings in formal settings
  • Self-starter with ability to structure ambiguous problems and break down large scale projections into actionable workstreams
  • Comfort with uncertainty and ability to drive to an answer (e.g., if leadership poses a general question, Senior Manager is able to determine areas for analysis and data required to conduct this analysis, is able to realize areas for further review vs. ‘dead ends’, and is able to adapt their answer and analysis as they work toward finding the answer)
  • Advanced interpersonal skills to build relationships within and external to Marketing Partnerships, Alliances, and Card Services department, gather data, and gain consensus
  • Ability to embody confidence without attitude in order to respectfully lead teams of varying levels in data discovery and analysis and strategy development
  • Advanced time management skills to oversee a number of simultaneous projects across areas of the company. Able to conduct own work, work with existing Manager, and assist Director as needed.
  • Survey writing / analysis experience a plus
  • Familiarity with and passion for Disney business units

Required Education

  • 6-8 Years work experience with demonstrated progression in leadership
  • 2-3 Years minimum in top tier strategy consulting, investment banking, corporate strategy, brand management and/or product management
  • 4-year degree in business / quantitative field (business, engineering, sciences etc.) strongly preferred
  • Prior experience in an analytically heavy role strongly preferred
  • MBA preferred

description:
Can you imagine walking around Disneyland, knowing you help the fun stay up and running? If you’re interested in doing work that makes people feel happy and safe, keep reading…

We’re looking for skilled, confident Electronic Technicians who have experience maintaining and repairing equipment like the rides and attractions at Disneyland and Disney California Adventure. If this sounds like a challenge you’re ready to undertake, apply today to join the team!

This position currently reports to the Reliability Manager.

The starting pay rate for this position is $28.98 per hour.

Responsibilities

You would join a unit whose mission is to keep everything working perfectly – it’s all about minimizing downtime and maximizing Guest experience. Your skills will help keep the kids smiling and the parents feeling relaxed and secure.

Every day as an Electronic Technician is different. On any given day or night, you might:
  • Be called to repair circuits/assemblies at Pirates of the Caribbean;
  • Troubleshoot high-efficiency laser lighting systems for one of the Main Street parades;
  • Re-set breakers on the Haunted Mansion;
  • Perform preventive maintenance on the rides in Toy Story Land;
  • Repair and maintain electrical/electronic systems/assemblies on It’s A Small World;
  • Replace/install lamps and switches to keep the parks light and bright;
  • Insure the Monorail hums along with PLC preventive maintenance;
  • Work on animations like the Yeti on the Matterhorn, on R2D2, and on the Little Mermaid;
  • Use your experience and know-how to spot problems before they happen;
  • Experience the Parks at night, when the Guests have left and it’s just you and the rides; and
  • Enjoy Disney with your exclusive Cast Member perks, including steep discounts on things people like you

Basic Qualifications

We proudly and enthusiastically welcome Electronic Technicians with experience in the US Military.

To be successful in this role, you will need:
  • Technical competence, the ability to read and understand detailed instructions, blueprints, flowcharts, schematics and engineering documents, and pass all compliance necessary for technical and safety training;
  • Knowledge of control and repair of circuits and motor;
  • Sharp troubleshooting skills and comfort working alone or as part of a team;
  • Ability to evaluate the scope of a job, determine needed parts/materials, and order through authorized vendors.
  • Expertise using common hand tools, meters, gauges and other associated test and measurement equipment, as well as ability to measure current, voltage and amperage;
  • Mastery of the basic math skills needed to do the job, the ability to differentiate colors, computer literacy, and full understanding of the National Electric Code;
  • Familiarity with CCTV systems, audio/public address systems, theatrical lighting fixtures, video projectors and wireless networks;
  • Reliable on-time behavior and the flexibility to work at night as well as on weekends/holidays;
  • Good communication skills with outside vendors as well as fellow Cast Members, a Guest/customer focus, high energy, respect for diversity, reliability, and a can-do, team-first attitude;
  • Stamina and the physical ability to undertake the job. You might walk, bicycle, bend, kneel, climb, push vehicles to re-position them for repair, work with arms/hands above shoulder level for an extended period of time, climb (sometimes as high as 200 ft.) and more, all on a regular basis.
  • Ability to use 2-way radios, learn CMMS (MAXIMO work order system), and attend/pass compliance and other training sessions to ensure correct maintenance documentation.

Electronic Technicians may work outdoors in all weather conditions, in an industrial workshop, in kitchens with wet/slippery surfaces, and may have occasional exposure to high temperatures, noise levels and fumes. In addition to the physical tasks listed above, Electronic Technicians may need to push/pull and/or lift up to 10 lbs. constantly, up to 25 lbs. frequently, up to 75 lbs. occasionally, and rarely up to/over 100 lbs.

Preferred Qualifications

  • 2 – 5 years of experience;
  • Ideal backgrounds include trade school, apprenticeship and related experience.

Preferred Education

We’re more interested in your years of experience – and your mastery of the skills needed to do the job well – than a degree, but education in the field is always welcome.

We proudly and enthusiastically welcome Electronic Technicians with experience in the US Military.

Additional Information:

KEYWORD: DLR Casting, dlrcasting, Disneyland Resort Casting Hourly Jobs , DLRResortRoles, DLR Resort Roles, electronic, electronic technician, component-level troubleshooting, soldering

About Disneyland Resort:

When Walt Disney opened Disneyland on July 17, 1955, he said he hoped it would be “a source of joy and inspiration to all the world.” Since then, the Disneyland Resort has welcomed more than 800 million guests, expanding to become an approximately 500- acre, multifaceted, world-class family resort destination, complete with two renowned Disney theme parks, three hotels and the exciting shopping, dining and entertainment area known as Downtown Disney District. Through a combination of creativity, technology and innovation, the resort brings storytelling to new heights, and Disneyland Resort cast members play an integral part in bringing that Disney magic to life for thousands of guests every day.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc., which is part of a business we call Disneyland Resort.

Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

description:
Job Summary:

The Operating Participants team develops and implements strategies related to the 3rd party operating relationships within the Disney theme park, resort and Disneytown. This function also develops and implements any other third party operational agreements for the resort.

Within the Shanghai Disney Resort Operating Participants team, the primary role of the Associate Manager, Operating Participants is to provide analytical support for executing and managing tenant agreements specifically with third party operators for Disneytown and for other supporting resort facilities. The Associate Manager, Operating Participants will also be responsible for supporting the on-going servicing of these lease arrangements. The Associate Manager, Operating Participants is expected to assist developing sound strategic and financial analyses from current tenant performance analyses, industry and consumer insights research and by partnering with internal lines of business within the Shanghai Disney Resort to develop actionable recommendations to Operating Participants and Shanghai Disney Resort executive management. The Associate Manager, Operating Participants will report directly to the Operating Participants Director at Shanghai Disney Resort but will also partner closely with Disney’s Operating Participant team in the US.

Responsibilities:

We are seeking candidates with accomplished professional experience and demonstrated leadership, real estate development and operational skills to fill the position of Associate Manager, Operating Participants, with specific expertise working with retail operators in China.
The Associate Manager, Operating Participants should be able to demonstrate experience doing the following:
  • Research & Development: Monitoring industry activity, conducting trend analysis and maintaining an active database of prospective retail tenants
  • Analytics & Due Diligence: providing financial and lease valuation models; conducting tenant and deal due diligence; offering creative business solutions; assist develop the overall negotiation and deal strategy for the projects based on business targets and financial analysis; negotiating service agreements and package plans
  • Develop new potential tenants & Sign Lease: Identifying qualified potential tenants, preparing the documents for correspondence with potential tenants, establishing relationship with potential tenants, able to negotiate and execute Letter of Intent and leases under guidance (and potentially renewal of existing leases). Lead the negotiation of supplementary agreements (eg: perk agreement, outdoor agreement, etc)
After lease signing, the Associate Manager, Operating Participants will partner with Operations and Walt Disney Imagineering to do the following:
  • Lease Management: Act as contractor administrator by overseeing approvals, adherence to Shanghai Disney Resort standards, and ensuring routine audits are conducted; acting as owner’s representative on construction and tenant improvement projects; contribute to drive internal alignment and coordination; assisting with the implementation of global qualitative measures and processes.
  • Analysis and Business Plan: closely monitor Disneytown business performance, provide analysis report and recommendations to maximize tenant utilization of assets; provide recommendation for tenant mix adjustment
  • Guest/Client Satisfaction: Nurture business relationships at the corporate executive and local levels; developing, driving and managing Operating Participants; providing guidance and support to Shanghai Disney Resort Leadership.

Basic Qualifications:

  • 4 – 8 years of relevant work experience in leasing, asset management, real estate development, operations or other related field in China
  • Knowledge of retail industry, development, and operations
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business or other related field
  • Experience with contractual arrangements and ability to interpret legal contracts/agreements
  • Able to read behind data, strategic thinking
  • Demonstrated success as an effective leader/partner/collaborator/influencer
  • Ability to scope, create and analyze financial and valuation models
  • Detailed knowledge of Chinese retail markets and Chinese business practices
  • Ability to prioritize and multi-task work flows
  • Refined bilingual written and verbal communication skills
  • Advanced proficiency in MS Office suite
  • Bi-lingual: English / Mandarin

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working in multinational corporate environments
  • Enthusiasm for and knowledge of theme park, branded consumer product, and/or media entertainment businesses
  • Strong secondary research skills with knowledge of business and industry research resources
  • Proven track record with project management tools and techniques
  • Knowledge of Disney products, service lines and processes as well as an understanding of Disney brand drivers and attributes

The Operating Participants team develops and implements strategies related to the 3rd party operating relationships within the Disney theme park, resort and Disneytown. This function also develops and implements any other third party operational agreements for the resort.

Within the Shanghai Disney Resort Operating Participants team, the primary role of the Associate Manager, Operating Participants is to provide analytical support for executing and managing tenant agreements specifically with third party operators for Disneytown and for other supporting resort facilities. The Associate Manager, Operating Participants will also be responsible for supporting the on-going servicing of these lease arrangements. The Associate Manager, Operating Participants is expected to assist developing sound strategic and financial analyses from current tenant performance analyses, industry and consumer insights research and by partnering with internal lines of business within the Shanghai Disney Resort to develop actionable recommendations to Operating Participants and Shanghai Disney Resort executive management. The Associate Manager, Operating Participants will report directly to the Operating Participants Director at Shanghai Disney Resort but will also partner closely with Disney’s Operating Participant team in the US.

We are seeking candidates with accomplished professional experience and demonstrated leadership, real estate development and operational skills to fill the position of Associate Manager, Operating Participants, with specific expertise working with retail operators in China. 
The Associate Manager, Operating Participants should be able to demonstrate experience doing the following:
* Research & Development: Monitoring industry activity, conducting trend analysis and maintaining an active database of prospective retail tenants 
* Analytics & Due Diligence: providing financial and lease valuation models; conducting tenant and deal due diligence; offering creative business solutions; assist develop the overall negotiation and deal strategy for the projects based on business targets and financial analysis; negotiating service agreements and package plans
* Develop new potential tenants & Sign Lease: Identifying qualified potential tenants, preparing the documents for correspondence with potential tenants, establishing relationship with potential tenants, able to negotiate and execute Letter of Intent and leases under guidance (and potentially renewal of existing leases). Lead the negotiation of supplementary agreements (eg: perk agreement, outdoor agreement, etc)

After lease signing, the Associate Manager, Operating Participants will partner with Operations and Walt Disney Imagineering to do the following:
* Lease Management: Act as contractor administrator by overseeing approvals, adherence to Shanghai Disney Resort standards, and ensuring routine audits are conducted; acting as owner’s representative on construction and tenant improvement projects; contribute to drive internal alignment and coordination; assisting with the implementation of global qualitative measures and processes.
* Analysis and Business Plan: closely monitor Disneytown business performance, provide analysis report and recommendations to maximize tenant utilization of assets; provide recommendation for tenant mix adjustment
* Guest/Client Satisfaction: Nurture business relationships at the corporate executive and local levels; developing, driving and managing Operating Participants; providing guidance and support to Shanghai Disney Resort Leadership.

* 4 – 8 years of relevant work experience in leasing, asset management, real estate development, operations or other related field in China
* Knowledge of retail industry, development, and operations
* Bachelor’s Degree in Business or other related field
* Experience with contractual arrangements and ability to interpret legal contracts/agreements
* Able to read behind data, strategic thinking
* Demonstrated success as an effective leader/partner/collaborator/influencer
* Ability to scope, create and analyze financial and valuation models
* Detailed knowledge of Chinese retail markets and Chinese business practices
* Ability to prioritize and multi-task work flows
* Refined bilingual written and verbal communication skills
* Advanced proficiency in MS Office suite 
* Bi-lingual: English / Mandarin

* Experience working in multinational corporate environments 
* Enthusiasm for and knowledge of theme park, branded consumer product, and/or media entertainment businesses
* Strong secondary research skills with knowledge of business and industry research resources 
* Proven track record with project management tools and techniques
* Knowledge of Disney products, service lines and processes as well as an understanding of Disney brand drivers and attributes

Job Summary:

Host/Hostess, Table Service Restaurants is responsible for greeting and interacting with our guests in a positive and friendly manner following the guest service model. This role assists guests and cast members with directions, entertainment, show event schedules, and other information or assistance as needed to provide excellent guest and cast services. This role involves working in one or more of the following positions: Greeter, Assignor, Seater, and Cashier.

Responsibilities:

  • Greeter – Assist Guests with directions, event schedules and other information and assistance as needed to provide excellent Guest service. Record Guest information, quote accurate times based on dining room status and staffing levels, check in guests into the restaurant
  • Assignor - Assign open tables to Guests, remain aware of dining room status at all times (necessary to quote accurate estimated wait times, communicate with podium staff, management, photo pass, etc.)
  • Seater - Escort Guests to their tables, maintain menu cleanliness, monitor restaurant lobby. Retrieves high chairs and boosters for little Guests.
  • Cashier – Greets and takes the Guest’s order, enters the order into the system, verifies the Guest’s order by repeating the total order back to the Guest. Assembles the Guest’s order and receives monies for payment. Should have cash handling capabilities and be able to count back change. Read POS tickets to fill guest’s orders for take-out and dine in. Responsible of maintaining accurate cashier’s fund and complete end-of-day administrative duties
Based on business need and Cast Members’ credentials, below tasks will be assigned from time to time.
  • Support guest flow in general, including in different locations
  • Assist guests with directions, answer questions, provide information and solutions as needed
  • Support cleaning work areas and guest areas
  • Assist logistics and stocking
  • Keep Shanghai Disney Resort clean by picking trash
  • Handle cash or process POS in other LOBs ( * applicable to cash-handling/POS related jobs only)

Basic Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated excellent Guest Service and service recovery abilities
  • Able to make independent decisions for our Guests
  • Good computer skills and excellent handling with cash

Preferred Qualifications:

  • High school or above required. College degree preferred

Additional Information:

As one of the worldwide leaders in family entertainment, Shanghai Disney Resort delivers legendary service and a lifetime of memories for our guests. Joining us in a new world of fantasy, imagination, creativity and adventure involves creating happiness for the millions of guests who visit our Resort each year. Whether your career journey here is onstage or backstage, there are almost unlimited opportunities for growth and personal development at Shanghai Disney.
* We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities.
* Specific benefits vary between different roles and may be adjusted according to company policy.
* Shanghai Disney Resort does not charge a fee to submit job applications and has not authorized any individual or company to charge to do so. Please always check our official channels or platforms for the most relevant recruitment information.

We are taking a responsible approach to creating environments that allow us to do what we do best – welcome and entertain millions of guests each year from across the country and around the world. As part of our commitment to health and safety, we require all newly-hired employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their onboarding dates.

Employment Benefits:
  • Salary: your salary consists of a base salary + service bonus + floating year-end bonus
  • Social Insurance: You are entitled to five social insurances and one housing fund
  • Overtime and allowances: In addition to statutory overtime (depending on your position) you may be entitled to a high temperature allowance and a night shift subsidy
  • Catering subsidy: You are entitled to one free meal per day on days that you are working
  • Accommodation: You have the opportunity to live in a dorm with Wi-Fi and air conditioning or to receive a living allowance
  • Vacation: You are entitled to paid annual leave and paid sick leave
  • Insurance: We buy supplementary medical insurance for you and your children. You can also enjoy group life insurance
  • Free Park Entry: While you work for Shanghai Disney Resort you will have the opportunity to enter the park with your family and friends for free
  • Disney Discounts: you are entitled to discounts on designated Disney products, resort F&B and ticketing
  • Health checkup: You are entitled to a free health checkup once a year

Learning and development opportunities:
  • Learning: you will be taught a range of international professional skills, including corporate culture, service skills, and more.
  • Career Development: Promotion opportunities are transparent and are dependent on your own efforts. You can also apply for internal transfers should you wish to develop yourself in another part of the company. With Hotel, Food and Beverage, Fire Safety, Security, Merchandise, Park Operations, Disney University and Operations training opportunities across multiple industries, there will always be development opportunities for those who want them at Disney.
  • Activities: Disney provides Cast Member with a range of volunteering opportunities as well as fun clubs for basketball, tennis, yoga, Disney Run, Music, Drama, DIY and more as a way to help you connect with your colleagues and network in a fun environment.

Application Process:

Apply online -> Interview over email -> Accept Employment -> Onboard
Please note: You may only apply for this position once in a six-month period. If you have applied within the last six months, please log in to your account to view your current application status.

Work Location:

You will be working at Shanghai Disney Resort in Pudong, Shanghai. You can take metro Line 11 to Shanghai Disney Resort station or take one of our many shuttle buses. The shuttle buses can be taken from one of several central areas across the city every day. You can find out more information during your onboarding process.
