description:
Job Summary:

At Disney, we are storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life through our movies, products, interactive games, parks and resorts, and media networks. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world

Consumer Products, Games and Publishing (CPGP) is the division of Disney Parks, Experiences and Products (DPEP) that brings beloved brands and franchises into the daily lives of families and fans through products – from toys to t-shirts, apps, books, console games and more – and experiences that can be found around the world, including on the shopDisney e-commerce platform and at Disney Parks, local and international retailers, as well as Disney store locations globally. The business is home to world-class teams of product, licensing and retail experts, artists and storytellers, and technologists who inspire imaginations around the world.

When we grow and develop our people, we’re investing in our future. As forward-looking Human Resources professionals, we are the champions of this investment. The Walt Disney Company’s Human Resources team does so much more than just support our employees…we engage our people, drive change and help our businesses achieve results. How do we do this? By shaping the employee experience on all levels. By partnering with our clients to create and implement innovative business strategies. By being a true thought partner and proactively anticipating business cycles. By fostering leadership success and being experts in change management. By enabling smart decisions by leveraging business data, metrics and external market insights. As a forward-looking HR professional supporting our creative organization, you will serve as a strategic business partner to senior leadership by developing and delivering integrated and inclusive HR Services such as: Strategy Development, Organization Design, Talent Management, Organization & Cast Effectiveness, Change & Transition Management and Functional HR Integration. This role reports to the Director, HR Business Partner.

Responsibilities:

  • Establishes and maintains an intimate understanding of the client organizations and the business, in the interest of building effective and productive working relationships with internal stakeholders and clients, at all levels of the organization
  • Plans and supports organization design to implement new structures, roles and/or processes that create speed and efficiency and support rapidly shifting business demands
  • Develops and executes a lifecycle approach to talent management focused on forecasting, staffing, on-boarding, development, performance management, career / succession planning, talent movement and retention, leveraging rigorous workforce analytics and insights.
  • Develops thoughtful, integrated approaches to promote diversity and inclusion in talent attraction, development and retention
  • Proactively assesses business and organizational performance to recommend and drive action through a consultative, “influence without authority” approach
  • Coaches business leaders on HR policies and processes, including talent planning, learning and development, and performance management to promote engagement and a culture of continuous growth and development
  • Assesses organizational performance systemically, defining talent gaps and proposing HR solutions that support client business objectives
  • Coaches business leaders on key organizational and management issues
  • Plans and facilitates work sessions to develop business strategies that help support organizational focus, efficiency, speed, and business results
  • Assesses employee training and development needs based on business strategy in order to help close gaps between current and future skill sets

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 4+ years human resources generalist experience in progressively responsible roles supporting a diversity of functional groups including executive level employees
  • Strong business acumen with a keen aptitude to quickly assimilate new information, including involvement in budget and variable labor mix headcount planning
  • Proven ability to effectively interact with all organizational levels in a multicultural environment and build strong, trusted relationships
  • Excellent consulting and conflict management skills
  • Experience working with senior executives in an “influence-without-authority” role
  • Experience, exposure, and comfort with a variety of HR facets including organization development, employee relations, talent acquisition, learning & development, and compensation
  • Ability to function independently, with minimal supervision, and thrive within a fast-paced and sometimes ambiguous environment
  • Demonstrated experience working as a trusted advisor
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Strong use of independent judgment to identify and anticipate client needs and make recommendations for implementation
  • Excellent analytical skills and the ability to quickly interpret data, identify trends, and recommend multiple solutions
  • Strong organizational, motivational, and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to manage multiple conflicting priorities
  • Strong team player and ability to function in a matrixed environment
  • Working knowledge and application of federal and state employment laws

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience directly supporting clients in an HRBP capacity
  • SAP experience
  • Project management experience
  • Experience working in a large, corporate, matrixed environment

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in Human Resources, Business Administration or related field or combination equivalent work experience

description:
Job Summary:

Summary:

Devices and Distribution (D&D) is a product organization within Disney Streaming Services focused on addressing the exciting and rapidly evolving landscape of consumer devices and distribution platforms. We are on a mission to expand subscriber reach and viewer engagement by delivering innovative products that scale purchase and viewing opportunities via a global partner ecosystem.

The D&D charter is to:

  • Deliver broad subscriber reach on existing and new consumer devices.
  • Accelerate international growth for our services by leveraging global distribution. partnerships and integrated marketing, promotion, and payment opportunities.
  • Drive a quality, localized experience for international users.
  • Innovate on the user, device, and partner lifecycle to drive incremental discovery, signup, engagement, and retention.
  • Influence the evolution of partner platform roadmaps to benefit and support our rich user experiences.

Responsibilities:

As a Senior Product Manager, you will be joining our Partner Journey team focused on growing subscribers for Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+ and Star+ through a global network of distribution partners. You will perform discovery of the current partner ecosystem, analyse partner health and identify opportunities for growth. You will work with a cross functional team to develop and test hypotheses using data, experimentation, user research and technology to increase accessibility and retention of B2B2C Disney offers in the market.

  • Think strategically and creatively to gather product and process insights from key internal and external stakeholders
  • Identify opportunities for growth and prioritize them to achieve high impact
  • Negotiate with partners on product requirements to ensure alignment on short- and long-term growth initiatives.
  • Develop detailed product requirements working with cross-functional teams (business, program managers, product, development, UX, engineering) for features and capabilities that help drive growth/retention.
  • Test and optimize specific parts of the customer journey that will drive partner health KPIs for acquisition, activation and retention
  • Build trust and effective relationships with peers/cross-functional teams

Requirements:

  • You have led large-scale consumer product roadmaps as a Senior Product Manager (or as a Product Manager for 5+ years).
  • You have led innovation/growth initiatives and are adept at user-centric and data-driven product management.
  • You have worked with device manufacturers and/or service operators to deliver consumer devices or products (B2B2C).
  • You are experienced at negotiating product requirements and integrations with partners.
  • You have collaborated effectively with engineering and have defined technical requirements.
  • Driven self-starter with excellent organizational skills to deliver content projects from inception to launch
  • Ability to present your ideas and build consensus using excellent written and verbal communication and presentations

About Disney Streaming Services:

Disney Streaming Services is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including the ESPN+ premium sports streaming service; Disney+, the dedicated streaming home for entertainment from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic and BAMTECH Media, a global leader in direct-to-consumer video streaming products and solutions. Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. We serve consumers by bringing the world’s most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. We strive daily to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives consumers the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Disney Streaming Services LLC, which is part of a business segment we call Disney Streaming Services.

Disney Streaming Services LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

We are on a mission to expand subscriber reach and viewer engagement by delivering innovative products that scale purchase and viewing opportunities via a global partner ecosystem. The D&D charter is to:
Deliver broad subscriber reach on existing and new consumer devices.
Accelerate international growth for our services by leveraging global distribution. partnerships and integrated marketing, promotion, and payment opportunities.
Drive a quality, localized experience for international users.
Innovate on the user, device, and partner lifecycle to drive incremental discovery, signup, engagement, and retention.
Influence the evolution of partner platform roadmaps to benefit and support our rich user experiences.

Responsibilities:As a Senior Product Manager, you will be joining our Partner Journey team focused on growing subscribers for Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+ and Star+ through a global network of distribution partners. You will perform discovery of the current partner ecosystem, analyse partner health and identify opportunities for growth. You will work with a cross functional team to develop and test hypotheses using data, experimentation, user research and technology to increase accessibility and retention of B2B2C Disney offers in the market. 
Think strategically and creatively to gather product and process insights from key internal and external stakeholders
Identify opportunities for growth and prioritize them to achieve high impact
Negotiate with partners on product requirements to ensure alignment on short- and long-term growth initiatives.
Develop detailed product requirements working with cross-functional teams (business, program managers, product, development, UX, engineering) for features and capabilities that help drive growth/retention.
Test and optimize specific parts of the customer journey that will drive partner health KPIs for acquisition, activation and retention
Build trust and effective relationships with peers/cross-functional teams

Requirements:
You have led large-scale consumer product roadmaps as a Senior Product Manager (or as a Product Manager for 5+ years).
You have led innovation/growth initiatives and are adept at user-centric and data-driven product management.
You have worked with device manufacturers and/or service operators to deliver consumer devices or products (B2B2C).
You are experienced at negotiating product requirements and integrations with partners.
You have collaborated effectively with engineering and have defined technical requirements.
Driven self-starter with excellent organizational skills to deliver content projects from inception to launch
Ability to present your ideas and build consensus using excellent written and verbal communication and presentations

About Disney Streaming Services:Disney Streaming Services is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including the ESPN+ premium sports streaming service; Disney+, the dedicated streaming home for entertainment from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic and BAMTECH Media, a global leader in direct-to-consumer video streaming products and solutions. Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. We serve consumers by bringing the world’s most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. We strive daily to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives consumers the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. About The Walt Disney Company:The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.This position is with Disney Streaming Services LLC, which is part of a business segment we call Disney Streaming Services.Disney Streaming Services LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

Imagine being part of a Call Center team that brings magical vacation to life. By sharing Disney product and service knowledge, our cast members plan extraordinary experiences for our guests. We are looking for candidates with reservation experience in a detail and service-oriented environment who are passionate about exceeding guest expectations through strong guest services and skills.

The Walt Disney World Resort invites you to be our Guest and explore Resort Sales Associate and Sales & Solutions Specialist role opportunities at our upcoming Job Fair on Monday, May 9, 2022 from 9:00AM - 3:00PM. Come meet our Recruitment Team and our talented Hiring Leaders to learn more about our dynamic teams that provide unparalleled Guest Service experiences!

This event is open to the public and will focus on finding talent for our Disney Central Resort Sales Associate and Sales & Solutions Specialist roles. Qualified candidates will have the opportunity to apply and interview on site. Some candidates may even be hired on-the-spot!

Don’t miss this unique opportunity to learn more about what it’s like to make unforgettable memories for our Guests! Candidates are encouraged to apply online prior to the event, however computers will be available at the event to complete applications. Be sure to bring a copy of your resume!

Full Time requires full availability, seven (7) days per week, including nights, weekends, and holidays.

Resort Sales Associate role is an hourly position with an incentive program based on sales performance with a starting rate of $15.75 an hour.

Sales & Solutions Specialist is an hourly position with a starting rate of $16.95 an hour.

With our Disney Aspire program, eligible hourly Cast Members receive 100% of tuition paid upfront for partner institutions!

When: Monday, May 9 2022 from 9:00AM – 3:00PM
Where: Disney Central - Orlando
7100 Municipal Drive
Orlando, FL 32819

  • We encourage you to bring your updated resume to the interview

$1500 Hiring Bonus (First payment after 90 days = $500 and Second payment after 150 days = $1000.)

A cast member is hired after the successful completion of Disney Traditions or one full day of employment. description:
Job Summary:

Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) brings together the Company’s best-in-class product, technology, and commercialization teams into one global organization. DMED is responsible for all distribution, networking, engineering operations, sales, advertising, P&L management, data, and key technology functions for the Company's worldwide content engines. DMED manages operations of the Company's streaming services including Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+, and Disney+ HotStar as well as domestic broadcast and cable television networks. DMED Technology delivers Disney content to users, viewers, and fans worldwide with more choice, personalization, and convenience than ever before. We do this for the DMED segment and for The Walt Disney Company by driving strategic development and use of technology; innovating scalable systems, platforms, and products that empower our businesses and engage our consumers. With global scale, local presence, and deep technological excellence DMED Technology optimizes DMED and The Walt Disney Company’s technology, platforms, and resources while bringing creative ideas to life through industry-shaping approaches. This role is a part of the DMED Media Software Engineering team - which drives design and engineering for DMED Technology’s global infrastructure and production facilities. Areas of focus include content creation systems and the distribution of digital and linear networks worldwide; our private global fiber network; linear content protection and security infrastructure; linear production and content management systems and services; radio stations; video encoding; media processing; interactive graphics and animation technologies; and leading all testing-to-adoption of video formats and standards. We strive to be a diverse team, passionate about great technology applied in imaginative ways to solve complex business challenges. We are a motivated team committed to lifelong learning and improvement both in and out of the office. We position ourselves to be flexible and adaptable to change both in how we execute projects and through the technologies used to deliver our solutions. We care about detail because every pixel, every line of code, and every consumer interaction with our products will determine whether we are delivering on our commitment to producing the absolute best. You will be joining a talented team that works interdependently toward aggressive goals delivering technically sound solutions. We work to ensure we share both accountability and credit as a team. We often include our clients as part of our team and we work to connect on a human level, understanding their world so we can best deliver software they will love to use.

As a Senior Software Engineer, the candidate will focus on engineering efficient and reusable front-end systems that drive complex web applications. They will use deep and creative UI engineering skills to take an influential role in iteration and continuous deployment of new features, functionality, and products to our customers. They will drive an agile and automation culture where collaboration with backend and product teams to drive UI architecture, champion UI code quality, and build optimized experiences for end-users. The candidate is someone who has risen through web software development ranks - possessing 4+ years' experience in design and architecture of highly scalable and performant web applications, with a proven ability to identify and implement improvements across codebases, product areas and systems. The candidate must be fluent in ES6+ JavaScript, while also combining expertise with modern asynchronous programming, libraries, tools, and runtimes to engineer abstract, secure, reusable, and testable UI components and applications; having collaborated tightly with creative teams to champion and influence component reusability, maintainability, and configurability across a diverse UI portfolio. The right person will blend their engineering abilities while collaborating with Product Designers, Product Managers, and Software Engineers to deliver compelling client-facing products. The Walt Disney Company is a large company, ideally the candidate will have previous experience working in multiple roles. We strive to for tasks to be completed quickly, at high quality, and are committed to the agile methodology. Our work is guided by lean principles. We are looking for a passionate, impactful, technical leader who wants to do their absolute best work and make their mark every day, to add their chapter to the long and storied history of The Walt Disney Company. Someone who holds themselves and their teammates accountable in a professional, collaborative manner. A collaborative technologist who seeks to bring the best out in themselves and those around them. Someone who can bring fresh perspective and innovative insight to our initiatives.

Responsibilities:

•Provide hands on UI engineering leadership across various product teams
•Collaborate with leads to design and architect cloud native and service-oriented UI components and applications •Collaborate with team and peers to design complex applications. Review code for design, testability, and clear usability
•Enable continuous improvement by identifying opportunities to improve the system/product/service with each iteration.
•Enable continuous deployment by championing quality engineering practices: linting, unit testing, web UI testing, pipeline automation
•Exercises judgment in selecting methods and techniques to resolve issues.
•Identify problems and opportunities and recommend the development of solutions.
•Collaborate with and influence product teams to design, build and maintain system standards, processes, and adoption
•Check-in valuable, clean code daily adding new features and capabilities.
•Create reference implementations for the purpose of mentoring and leading more junior staff.
•Investigate and resolve production issues from end user (UI) to persistence layer.
•Work with the project management team to ensure that all deliverables are on time and of high quality •Assist in rapid prototyping of design concepts to prove and test ideas with end-users

Basic Qualifications:

•Have 5+ years of experience in web application development or software engineering in a large enterprise environment using modern frameworks
•Have expertise with ES6+ JavaScript, native DOM interfaces, modern JavaScript libraries, REST/SOA patterns, WebSocket protocol.
•High-level of fluency with and experience using technologies and frameworks like (but not limited to) some of our most-used languages – JavaScript, Node.js, TypeScript, React, jQuery - or experience with similar technologies. •Have a record of accomplishment championing quality engineering; be adamant that all UI code is written in a way that can be tested both with unit tests and automated UI tests.
•Experience with deployment tools to package and deploy components using webpack or similar tools. •Have a strong understanding of browsers, devices, OS, and other user agent interoperability and compatibility concerns •Have experience working with high-performing teams using Agile and Lean methodologies and frameworks •Have excellent verbal and written communication skills
•A passion for efficiency and collaboration, with a history of establishing great relationships with UX and Product Management teams across time zones

Preferred Qualifications:

•Hands on experience with reactive programming using React/React Native, Redux, TypeScript, SCSS, Jest, Enzyme, Selenium/Nightwatch, Sauce Labs, Webpack, Babel, Node/Express, oAuth 2.0/JWT
•Working knowledge of GitLab CI/D pipelines, Docker, Kubernetes/Helm.
•Previous work experience in media production, broadcast and/or distribution.
•Experience working with vendor teams to ensure quality, timeliness, and alignment with project goals.
•Strong curiosity about how Disney delivers Magic and a desire to be a part of it

Required Education

•A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Engineering, or another technical field

Preferred Education

•A Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related technical discipline is highly desirable.

About Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution:

Comprised of the Company’s international business units and various direct-to-consumer streaming services, Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) aligns technology, media distribution and advertising sales into a single business segment to create and deliver personalized entertainment experiences to consumers around the world.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Disney Streaming Technology LLC, which is part of a business we call Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution.

Disney Streaming Technology LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

description:
Job Summary:

Job Description: Executive Director/ Director of Product
About Disney+ Hotstar
Disney+ Hotstar is the fastest-growing entertainment brand in India with one of the largest subscription services in the country, and millions more accessing quality entertainment that’s available free. Over the past six years, Disney+ Hotstar has been instrumental in shaping how Indians consume their favorite content, migrating audiences at scale from television to a device of their choice. Our mission and purpose at Disney+ Hotstar is to make entertainment accessible and delightful to all our people, through seamless and intuitive technology and deliver an experience that expands interests and enables deeper connections. Our ultimate goal is to establish Disney+ Hotstar as a daily habit at scale, catering to all consumer segments.
About the Team
As we continue the acceleration of Disney+ Hotstar, we are looking for a product leader that enjoys working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and can meet opportunities and challenges head-on.
As an executive leader in our Product organization, you will be instrumental in driving the growth and success of Disney+ Hotstar’s business in India as well as powering our international expansion over the next two years. In this highly impactful role, you'll be directly managing a team of senior product managers, while providing leadership to a cross-functional team of engineers, designers, data scientists, and other specialists. You will be leading the product roadmap of customer experience
● Set product strategy and vision for the squad
● Define product excellence roadmap
● Build, lead and develop a world-class product organization

In this role, you will:
Think big in re-imagining customer experience for the new and emerging customers to make it easy, intuitive and inspiring to fulfill all their online consumption needs whether it be entertainment or payments, and become an integral part of their everyday lives. The partner works closely with other Product leadership and stakeholders within the company.

Product Strategy & Vision

  • Vision and Roadmap: Define a vision and high-quality product roadmap based on the voice of the customer. Manage a cross-functional process to translate the desired customer experience into a logically sequenced and optimized product roadmap. Create buy-in for the product roadmap with internal and external stakeholders
  • The key responsibilities include drafting a long-term vision, strategy, and roadmap, envisioning experiences that will delight new customers, and partnering with key stakeholders across business & technology teams to execute the product roadmap. The role is also expected to influence global partner teams to build the envisioned experiences and launch them globally across emerging customers/countries
  • In this role, you will champion the voice of product engineers to deliver a set of products that are not just reliable, scalable, and secure, but focus on improving time to market and development velocity for our product teams
  • Our ideal candidate has led technical products or large-scale platforms, has extreme attention to detail, can concisely communicate complex concepts, and is excited by solving difficult challenges. This role requires a creative thinker, problem-solver, and great product leader to build a strong team of product managers and create a strategic vision for the future of one of Disney+ Hotstar's most critical components
  • Combine vision, creativity, and domain expertise to transform TV advertising with ground-breaking product innovation
  • Ensure world-class and modern technology, architecture, governance, and operations
  • Driving the ‘working backward’ approach to building innovative, customer-focused end-to-end product solutions
  • Incorporates the existing development backlog and makes priorities as determined by the business, consumer, and market needs.

Team management & people leadership

  • Lead and facilitate the Product Managers, Engineers, and Designers in their definition of product requirements
  • Participate in the team definition, hiring, retention, and growth, and evangelize and inspire the team to execute and deliver high-quality products with speed
  • Provide leadership, mentorship, and product management best practices to a dynamic team of Product Managers
  • Collaborate with sales, technology, content, marketing, and other key teams to evangelize and influence the product roadmap

Job Summary:

Reporting to the Manager, Walt Disney Imagineering Communications, the Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) Communications Manager helps identify and manage communication opportunities across The Walt Disney Company to ensure proper positioning of people and content, in addition to supporting media training, asset requests and all necessary approvals.

The role of the WDI Communications Manager includes:
  • Identify key opportunities with mutual interest to partners
  • Review requests to ensure business value for WDI engagement
  • Prepare communication materials and interview subjects
  • Aid in the development of key messaging and FAQs
  • Conduct media/presentation training for WDI participants
  • Staff WDI participants during interviews and/or on location
  • Review and approval of marketing or promotional materials
  • Oversee collection of assets and ensure proper usage
  • Identify and plan comms opportunities in support of WDI business
The WDI Communications Manager will also prioritize requests to ensure those with mutual benefit and significant companywide value have the support and resources needed to see the project through.

This role largely depends on intercompany relationships and familiarity with various business communication priorities and processes. The WDI Communications Manager will provide regular updates to keep all relevant parties well-informed. In addition, strong collaboration skills will be necessary as this position will work with DPEP and TWDC Communication teams to ensure alignement with overarching business strategies.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute communications strategies and plans that leverage content being created by DPEP and businesses within TWDC
  • Amplify efforts by integrating with / leveraging other Disney-owned channels and platforms
  • Create forums where opportunities to expand visibility of reputation-driving efforts can be explored
  • Develop compelling presentations and pitches to showcase new opportunities and gain buy-in to catapult ideas and efforts
  • Assist with development and review of partner content that includes WDI/Imagineers.

Basic Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of communications, public affairs or relevant experience
  • Proven experience building effective relationships and managing stakeholders
  • Strong project management skills
  • Excellent written, verbal communications and presentation skills crucial to effective interaction with all levels of the organization

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with Walt Disney Imagineering
  • Understanding of the WDI creative development process and knowledge of The Walt Disney Company
  • Technical acumen, and an interest in/understanding of tech and innovation
  • Understanding of graphic design and video editing programs
  • Experience with media

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent work experience

description:
Do you have the knack for decorating for the holidays? Would you love knowing that your work will bring oohs, aahs and smiles to millions of Guests at Walt Disney Parks & Resorts? If you have a good eye for all things visual, aren’t afraid of working on a ladder and know your way around a tool chest, becoming a Holiday Services Craft Support Decorator might be right for you!

Disney is admired around the world for our imaginative, over-the-top holiday decorations. Join the team that makes it all happen at Walt Disney Parks & Resorts!

Starting pay rate for this role is $15.25 per hour

Responsibilities

You would join a team of seasonal workers (September 2021 – January 2022) who transform our Parks and Resorts into wonderlands representing major holidays celebrated around the world, and would get the incredible satisfaction of seeing your work turn a venue into a wondrous, imaginative, truly unique vision of holiday splendor.

Every day as a Holiday Services Craft Support Decorator is different. On any given day or night, you might:
  • Climb a ladder to festoon the lobby of a resort with holiday-inspired garlands;
  • Inspect decorations before you help load them onto trucks;
  • Repair and rehab everything from foliage and lights to delicate Christmas tree ornaments.
  • Work at a Park during the night so it is transformed for Guests the next day;
  • Help “strike the set” by carefully taking down what you’ve put up;
  • Possibly operate a box truck (up to 26,000 lbs.) on runs to/from the warehouse and the Parks;
  • Precisely catalog the props and decorations before helping to store them safely for use next year; and
  • Enjoy Disney Theme Park Experiences and Cast member exclusives!

Basic Qualifications

Here’s what you’ll need to be successful at this job:
  • Work independently, but be part of a team of over 100 people who rotate assignments regularly;
  • Be comfortable working on ladders and/or scaffolding, at heights ranging from 2’ to 80’ or higher.
  • Use your creativity and artistic eye to decorate and install Holiday Décor;
  • Familiarity with paints and color matching is helpful;
  • Knowledge of how to safely use hand and power tools;
  • Enjoy working with fabric and ribbons;
  • Perform general warehouse duties, like cleaning, repairing, sorting and cataloging;
  • This is a seasonal position that requires the flexibility to work days, nights (including 3rd shift), weekends and holidays, from September 2021 through January 2022.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Three or more years of experience in a scenic or fabrication shop.
  • Theatre/Props experience

Required Education

  • High-school diploma or equivalent

Sign Painters are responsible for maintaining existing signs as well as creating new show-quality signs. They are also responsible for maintaining lettering, striping and graphics for Disneyland Resort.

Responsibilities

  • Restore and maintain existing On Stage and Backstage signage and graphics using all available photos, sketches, blueprints, and other documentation - to Disney standards
  • Design and produce new signs using useful ideas with visual appeal, appropriate size, theming, material, and shape – under the direction of Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI)
  • Produce new project signs from WDI supplied sketches, blueprints, and specs
  • Read work orders, help coordinate needs with other crafts, and track the job until it is picked-up, delivered or installed. If needed, contact the requestor for clarification regarding the work requested, the work procedures, and the materials required
  • Use basic hand tools and/or electric hand tools (using the appropriate personal protective equipment) to complete work
  • Completes projects in a professional and timely manner with minimal supervision, taking into consideration budgets and deadlines.

Basic Qualifications

Schedule Availability
  • Typical schedule is Monday through Friday with occasional shifts on Saturday and Sunday; however, be available to work any day and shift (1st, 2nd, and 3rd shift) including holidays, and overtime.
Technical Abilities
  • Experience, skills and abilities to perform the duties listed under “Responsibilities,” above
  • Exceptional brush-lettering skills
  • Must possess a thorough knowledge of graphic design, color theory and letter forms
  • Ability to design, layout, and produce signs on a variety of substrates using hand lettering, screen-printing, air brushing, aging and graining, and basic computer techniques
  • Ability to use layout, design, measurement and production tools common to commercial and graphic artists. Proficiency with water- and oil-based paints and inks
  • Familiarity with - or the ability to learn - the Computerized Maintenance Management System (MAXIMO)

Additional Information:

Those assigned to the Sign Painter position are required to attend an annual Respiratory Protection Training class and a Lead Awareness class. They are also required to submit to an annual medical evaluation, fit test, and a semi-annual lead/zinc blood test.

description:
Job Summary:

It’s the magic of immersing yourself in a motion picture masterpiece, or a new track from your favorite band, or the spectacle of a live Broadway show. It’s hard to define and even harder to create, but that’s what we do at The Walt Disney Studios. Ours is a culture of innovation, collaboration and creativity. We raise the bar, then step over it, blazing trails through the production and distribution of world-class entertainment around the globe. If you want to help tell compelling, enduring stories through movies, music or stage plays, then we want to hear from you.

The Walt Disney Company

Imagine a career with an organization that brings smiles to millions every day. Imagine working with people whose passion for what they do is simply indescribable. We are The Walt Disney Company, live with a rich legacy of innovation, entertainment, and lifelong memories. With our vast array of both businesses and professionals, you’ll have the opportunity to join a team that’s beloved around the world, and to find out how it feels to love what you do. We invite you to discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you‘ve been looking for.

Combining masterful artistry and storytelling with groundbreaking technology, Walt Disney Animation Studios is a filmmaker-driven animation studio responsible for creating some of the most beloved films ever made. Located in Burbank, WDAS continues to build on its rich legacy of innovation and creativity, stretching from the first fully-animated feature film, 1937’s Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, to 2013’s Academy Award®-winning Frozen, the biggest animated film of all time. At Walt Disney Animation Studios’ top filmmakers, artists and technical wizards collaborate to create the magic of animation. Bring your unique talents, passion and ideas to our team and prepare to play in a creative, artist-friendly environment.

The Director of Development is responsible for shepherding the early development process for animated theatrical feature films and Disney+ streaming content that results in the Walt Disney Animation Studios’ upcoming release slate. As such, the Director of Development partners with Animation Directors & filmmakers to articulate and develop their film & series ideas into multi-million dollar features and streaming productions. Additionally, the DoD, in conjunction with the VP Creative Development, will manage the Development department which manages multiple concepts, ideas & stories for potential future release both theatrical & streaming. Duties include being subject matter experts on storytelling and story structure; building and editing story and pitch presentations that lead to major creative milestones; conducting and managing inspirational research for feature films’ and series’ worlds & characters; and being responsible for on-going, in-depth searches for writers to match the sensibility of the projects, filmmakers, and the filmmaker-driven, collaborative culture of Disney Animation. The Director of Development reports to the VP, Creative Development, and manages a team of Junior Creative Executives in a highly team-oriented environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop the creative strategy on feature films and long- & short-form series projects in development, and provide subject matter expertise to filmmakers to assist and influence the shaping of stories from concept through script, with an emphasis on character & structure, that results in multi-million-dollar film and series releases.
  • Day-to-day management of the Development Department which includes:
    • Monitoring overall department functionality
    • Maintaining solid relationships within studio and with external film-making community
    • Promoting a culture of creative collaboration and facilitating peer feedback throughout the filmmaking process
    • Championing diversity and inclusion in all areas of the development process & department
    • Supporting the strategic priorities of the studio leadership team, particularly in the pursuit of quality, mentorship, diversity & inclusion, and studio engagement
    • Supporting the VP, Creative Development in the growth and mentorship of the creative executives
  • Partners with VP Creative Development & Associate Producer to identify and adapt project milestones, and monitor creative progress for WDAS development slate of potential feature films and long- & short-form series
  • Facilitate & provide creative feedback in pitches, story & notes sessions, and screenings throughout development and during production
  • Manage team of junior creative executives, including strategically assigning projects to meet projects’ needs, setting performance expectations, providing feedback, performance reviews, and developing direct reports.
  • Responsible for writer talent sourcing & matching. This includes leading & managing the constant search for and outreach to writers, both emerging and veteran, to match with directors by soliciting & analyzing scripts and interviewing writers, and management of an on-staff Script Analyst.
  • Responsible for the search and hiring of story & research consultants for multiple feature films and long- & short-form series projects that are in development and/or active production.
  • Responsible for research initiatives, and integration of ongoing research that influences story development
  • Collaborate on story development of various ancillary projects, such as short-form content, and various content exploration programs within the studio
  • Day-to-day management of the Development Department which includes:
    • Monitoring overall department functionality
    • Maintaining solid relationships within studio and with external film-making community
    • Promoting a culture of creative collaboration and facilitating peer feedback throughout the filmmaking process
    • Championing diversity and inclusion in all areas of the development process & department
    • Supporting the strategic priorities of the studio leadership team, particularly in the pursuit of quality, mentorship, diversity & inclusion, and studio engagement
    • Supporting the VP, Creative Development in the growth and mentorship of the creative executives

Basic Qualifications:

  • Excellent understanding of screenplay structure, character and script analysis
  • Deep knowledge of film/tv/theater and the entertainment industry, and strong interest in animation
  • Deep industry contacts with writers & creative talent as well as agents, managers and scouts
  • Ability to effectively communicate and work collaboratively with all levels of creative talent, executives and management, and with diverse personalities and work styles, is crucial
  • Demonstrable flexibility, professionalism, and finesse when handling the multiple and diverse demands of a fast-paced and dynamic creative environment
  • Proven experience in talent sourcing & matching
  • Strong time management, organizational & leadership skills
  • 3+ years of experience in managing a project or a team
  • 7+ years of experience in a relevant, comparable environment is required

description:
Job Summary:

Consumer Products, Games and Publishing (CPGP) is the division of Disney Parks, Experiences and Products (DPEP) that brings beloved brands and franchises into the daily lives of families and fans through products – from toys to t-shirts, apps, books, console games and more – and experiences that can be found around the world, including on the shopDisney e-commerce platform and at Disney Parks, local and international retailers, as well as Disney store locations globally. The business is home to world-class teams of product, licensing and retail experts, artists and storytellers, and technologists who inspire imaginations around the world.

The Assistant Manager will be responsible for helping to deliver strategic public relations campaigns for the Disney Classics and Media Franchises that will drive the consumer products business globally with a focus on North America. The person in this role will act as one of the main consumer products (CP) communications contacts and ensure PR is represented in all relevant forums.

The Assistant Manager will work with their leader and key stakeholders to develop cross-category plans to drive awareness of Disney Classics and Media products – inclusive of toys, apparel, accessories, games, publishing, interactive experiences and more – 365 days a year, with additional support for tentpole theatrical, television and digital releases and during key times for retail (e.g., back to school, holiday, etc.). In addition, this role will work closely with the global, B2B, Retail, Licensing, Publishing and Games teams to ensure an effective, two-way flow of information and sharing of resources.

The Assistant Manager will also be responsible for building and maintaining relationships with media central to the specified Franchises, including but not limited to, consumer, lifestyle and tech outlets, in addition to key fan sites and social influencers.

Responsibilities:

Campaign Development and Delivery
  • Share ideas and support the buildout of strategic PR plans that deliver on business goals and help drive buzz and coverage of priority programs and products, including licensed consumer goods, games, publishing and interactive experiences
  • Support strategic PR activities, such as press events, trade shows, media tours, influencer programs, new product launches and events
  • Monitor brand landscape for potential issues and work closely with leaders and public affairs team to develop crisis communication plans, draft statements, etc.
  • Draft press releases and ensure the appropriate distribution in collaboration with PR Managers and above
  • Collect learnings on key campaigns and ensure notes are shared out with the team
  • Support the coordination of activities of third-party agencies as necessary, challenging them to deliver the best results
  • Support other Franchise campaigns as needed
Media
  • Have a finger on the pulse of the PR industry and media landscape and be able to identify strategic PR & event opportunities
  • Maintain existing and actively pursue contacts with key media and constantly seek out new opportunities to grow network
  • Engage with media contacts across trade, business and consumer facing publications in collaboration with your leaders
  • Develop media strategies, providing meticulous details on product descriptions for trend stories
  • Help define media strategy around specific campaigns and initiatives to deliver the best possible results
  • Ensure seasonal campaigns tap into the media agenda effectively to maximize impact

Relationship Management
  • Act as one of the main CP communications contacts for specified Franchises for global counterparts and other divisions of CPGP, providing counsel to internal Franchise and marketing teams
  • Build relationships with Franchise teams and proactively share plans/results to maximize impact
  • Lead and/or participate in meetings, presentations and brainstorming sessions to cultivate creative ideas and PR opportunities
  • Manage ongoing communications with licensee and retail PR teams and review/route all press releases and materials for approval in collaboration with PR Manager
  • Develop relationships with and ensure the appropriate flow of information between different channels in the business (including content partners, marketing and retail)
  • Maintain regular dialogue with marketing teams to align on activity and ensure cross-collaboration when and where appropriate
  • Work closely with PR Manager to ensure priorities, deadlines and expectations are met
  • Understand how to prioritize tasks and activities in a deadline driven environment
  • Ensure quality control of all media materials
  • Manage press and social tracking and reporting

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum three to five years of Communications or Public Relations experience with a Fortune 500 company or public relations agency; retail or consumer products experience preferred
  • Able to embrace a fast moving, action-oriented environment with a “can do” and positive attitude
  • Experience with problem solving and coming up with creative solutions
  • Acts as a Brand Ambassador and embodies the Disney culture and values in all aspects of his/her work
  • Able to develop strong, trusting relationships with team members and external partners
  • Approaches work with a high degree of professionalism and commitment
  • Exhibits strong communication skills and an ability to work with others who may have diverse communication and work styles
  • Flexibility, resourcefulness and an ability to thrive in a fast-paced, changing and growing environment

Required Education

  • Bachelor's degree in communications, journalism or marketing (an emphasis in public relations preferred), or equivalent professional experience

description:
At Disney, we‘re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life through our movies, products, interactive games, parks and resorts, and media networks. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.

The focus of this role is part of the Disney Worldwide Services, Inc. Strategic Sourcing team primarily supporting stakeholders in Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI). The Sourcing Specialist will execute sourcing decisions in selecting service providers to maximize the value of multi-million dollar annual spend, and to mitigate risks through smart contract negotiations. This includes supporting key category and Supplier Relationship Management (SRM), writing contracts, developing and running RFPs, negotiating deals, managing suppliers, ensuring regulatory compliance, facilitating process improvements and bringing stakeholders together for collaboration to leverage opportunities.

Responsibilities

The Sourcing Specialist will be responsible for developing and implementing strategic sourcing commercial and technical contractual arrangements through competitive bids and contract negotiations. This individual should have a proven proficiency with all aspects of the sourcing process for design, professional and construction services, and should have experience with various contracting methodologies, including but not limited to lump sum, design build, guaranteed maximum cost, blanket/master agreements and general procurement of goods and services. Other responsibilities include:
  • Evaluate suppliers and consultants based on pre-determined selection criteria
  • Analyze historical data to provide a baseline to support savings and cost avoidance
  • Facilitate and lead a Request for Qualification (RFQ), Request for Proposal (RFP) or Invitation to Bid (ITB) from start to finish (inquiry to contract award/execution), with all associated contract management support through close-out. Includes contracts for design/engineering, professional/consulting services and construction.
  • Advise, identify and mitigate potential risk throughout the ITB process, which includes, but is not limited to bidder list development, sourcing/contract strategy input & development and compilation/facilitation of a complete ITB/RFP (includes scope of work/services, schedule, drawings, specs, etc.).
  • Analyze bids based on best value in order to achieve overall optimal value
  • Prepare and execute clear, structured negotiation strategies utilizing Strategic Sourcing methodology
  • Prepare and execute contracts as well as perform post-award administration
  • Understand and assist in the development and execution of performance management programs with suppliers that focus on quality, responsiveness and cost
  • Ensure compliance with Strategic Sourcing policies and best practices
  • Communicate and report to management the status of any critical external relationships that could affect planning and decision-making
  • Analyze market industry trends and conditions that affect internal stakeholders and external suppliers and/or pricing
  • Ability to effectively engage all internal stakeholders (leadership, legal, risk management, diversity & inclusion) for key decision making and consensus associated with project portfolio contract/packaging strategies, contract awards or other key matters critical to the line of business.
  • Mentor/train interns or newer cast in sourcing process/procedure
  • Collaborate with other sourcing teams to consolidate efforts when bidding same categories
  • Participate in professional development activities to keep abreast of current industry best practices
  • Demonstrate exemplary integrity and ethics in all instances
  • Issue internal reports to Management and Stakeholders related to department spend and savings initiatives
  • Advocate the utilization of Diverse Business Enterprises
  • Provide support to multiple segments as needed
  • Some work responsibilities (e.g. facilitating prebid meetings) will require meeting in the field and/or on Property outside of normal business hours (i.e. prior to Park opening, etc.)

Basic Qualifications

  • 1-3 years working within a design/construction-related industry
  • Ability to interact with and establish relationships with employees and team members at all levels
  • Strong strategic agility
  • Strong analytical skills, with the ability to effectively report out findings
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Strong negotiation skills
  • Ability to collaborate in a team environment
  • Internal customer focus and excellent internal client support skills
  • Ability/desire to work in diverse and ever-changing environment
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity
  • Knowledge of Sourcing processes, basic legal terms and conditions, and entertainment industry trends and conditions
  • Experience in drafting and executing design, construction, service, and professional agreements as well as change orders.
  • Established experience working with legal department on matters concerning boilerplate revisions to terms and conditions
  • Ability to work with and adapt to company systems, such as SAP and Ariba along with a proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
  • Willingness to travel (position may require 5-10% travel)

Required Education

  • Undergraduate degree in any above-mentioned related field/discipline

Preferred Education

  • Master’s degree in business or another quantitative discipline

About Walt Disney World Resort:

Since opening in 1971, Walt Disney World Resort has played an important role in many childhood and family memories. Today, hundreds of millions of guests from around the globe visit this magical place to enjoy a Disney vacation. Through a combination of creativity, innovation and technology, the resort immerses guests in classic Disney tales and new kinds of family entertainment. Drawing from a rich heritage of storytelling, Walt Disney World Resort cast members bring Disney magic to life through unmatched attention to detail and superior guest service.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Disney Worldwide Services, Inc., which is part of a business we call Walt Disney World Resort.

Disney Worldwide Services, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

description:
Job Summary:

"We create happiness.” That is our motto at Walt Disney Parks and Resorts, and it permeates everything we do. At Disney, you’ll help inspire that magic by enabling our teams to push the limits of entertainment and create the never-before-seen!

Walt Disney Imagineering is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of The Walt Disney Company. Its talented corps of Imagineers is responsible for the creation - from concept initiation through installation - of all Disney Resorts, theme parks and attractions, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, and new media projects.

The WDI Show Lighting Department provides lighting designs for all areas our guests see when they enter our parks. This includes lighting for attractions, retail spaces, restaurant spaces, display areas, landscape, facades and area development. The staff of the Show Lighting Department interface and support other WDI divisions and departments within our parks including Creative, Architectural, Engineering, Show Art, Show Ride, Park Operations and Park Maintenance. Through the medium of light, it is the mission of the Show Lighting Department to create highly entertaining environments in which the magic of each Disney story is possible.

Responsibilities:

  • Support the design implementation and lighting installation effort as directed by the Principal lighting design leads for the project
  • Interfaces and coordinates with other show related disciplines
  • Support mock-ups and presentations including set-ups and strikes
  • programming of show related lighting control and light levels
  • Document the implemented design
  • Perform test and adjust tasks
  • Communicate Show Lighting design concepts
  • Perform primary work with electrical engineering disciplines to insure placement of lighting design on electrical drawings
  • Direct or support field implementation of Show Lighting design

description:
Job Summary:

In 2019, the Walt Disney Company launched Disney+, a Disney-branded streaming service featuring an incomparable collection of content from its brands and franchises recognized and respected all over the world. The Direct-To-Consumer (DTC) service will serve as the exclusive home for viewing original movies, series, short-form, and more, along with a vibrant catalogue that spans classic Disney Animation to the most recent movie releases.

We’re looking for talented team players with an entrepreneurial spirit, who will thrive upon the legacy of our company yet embrace unconventional thinking, and who are passionate about contributing to The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer experience through strategic hard work and determination.

We are seeking a proactive, strategic Content Operations Associate - Artwork who will be part of the Disney Streaming Global Content Operations team in Glendale, CA, and reporting to the Sr. Manager of Content Operations - Artwork. You will be responsible for static artwork management for all titles that will launch on Disney+ globally including, but not limited to artwork ordering, milestone tracking and adjustments, and ensuring delivery. The role will require strong collaboration with multiple teams across the company.

The ideal candidate will have proven experience in artwork management and execution and in making sense out of chaos. They will be proactive to find solutions and make the right connections with people in order to problem-solve. They will be savvy with data visualizations and systems in order to present title status and summaries. They will not be afraid to innovate new paths or influence to get buy-in from partner teams or escalate when needed.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage the ordering assets with various internal and external teams for upcoming titles
  • Track and ensure delivery milestones are met
  • Coordinate the localization of artwork across all asset types and languages working with our localization partners on the Library Technical Services Team
  • Ensure delivery and ingest of all assets across all languages ordered into Asset Management System (AEM) and internal proprietary system (Wonderland)
  • Effectively communicate project and title level updates cross-functionally and with our internal and external partners
  • Assist with various workflows within the artwork team including Collections/CTAs, local language Third Party Acquisition titles and local language Originals titles.
  • Communicate both detailed and high-level progress to stakeholders at large, including executives
  • Create and maintain documentation, including title progress trackers, templates, and reports, as needed
  • Work with partner teams to request delivery through proprietary delivery system

Basic Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of experience managing artwork
  • Exceptional data management skills and attention to detail
  • Strong communicator, both written and verbal
  • Ability to communicate effectively on a regular cadence to wide audiences on overall project health
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Global mindset, sensitive to other cultures
  • Comfortable using various data management systems and tools (Excel, Google and Microsoft suites, Smartsheet, etc.)
  • Ability to solve for the short term while constantly thinking of sustainable long-term plans

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Personal affinity for the brands and franchises of The Walt Disney Company
  • Experience with international expansion and digital platform launches
  • Streaming service experience

Preferred Education

  • BA Degree, associate degree, or equivalent experience

Additional Information:

Disney Streaming Services is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including the ESPN+ premium sports streaming service; the upcoming Disney subscription video service; and BAMTECH Media, a global leader in direct-to-consumer video streaming products and solutions. Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. We serve consumers by bringing the world’s most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. We strive daily to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives consumers the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location.

description:
Job Summary:

Consumer Products, Games and Publishing (CPGP) is the division of Disney Parks, Experiences and Products (DPEP) that brings beloved brands and franchises into the daily lives of families and fans through products – from toys to t-shirts, apps, books, console games and more – and experiences that can be found around the world, including on the shopDisney e-commerce platform and at Disney Parks, local and international retailers, as well as Disney store locations globally. The business is home to world-class teams of product, licensing and retail experts, artists and storytellers, and technologists who inspire imaginations around the world.

The Manager, Communications will drive the business-to-business communications strategy and execution, proactive campaigns that position the business across key areas of opportunity and serve as the main liaison in driving international alignment across teams. In this role, the candidate will work with the senior leadership team to craft and pitch business and trade media, develop presentations and write scripts, and manage campaigns that proactively position the business, while also helping to protect the reputation of the segment and the company. This role requires deep collaboration with various stakeholders domestically and internationally to align efforts around our key communications priorities. The role also requires cross collaboration with LOB Comms leaders to uncover key stories and strategies tied to those businesses.

This role will report into the Director, Communications and Public Affairs, CPGP

Responsibilities:

  • Establish and drive the overarching business-to-business communications strategy for Disney’s consumer products, games and publishing businesses.
  • Manage presence at industry events to drive our key priorities with partners, media and consumers, including preparing executive presentations, scripting showcases and crafting event communications and surveys.
  • Craft/pitch business and trade stories tied to the consumer products, games and publishing narrative that is cross-category/cross-franchise.
  • Manage global campaigns from start to finish tied to diversity, equity and inclusion, sustainability, healthy living and digital transformation, and positioning our business as a place people want to work.
  • Craft earnings call recaps, ongoing communications briefs and regular industry news updates for senior leadership.
  • Collaborate with CPGP licensees and retailers to review and approve messaging in advance of investor events and presentations.
  • Identify opportunities and submit CPGP for industry awards and key industry lists.
  • Serve as primary liaison to international leads and formalize a process for cross-collaboration/information sharing to ensure communications team remains strategically consistent and tactically divergent.

Basic Qualifications:

  • 5+ years experience in corporate communications, public relations, journalism or equivalent
  • Must be a self-starter, team player with a genuine enthusiasm for communications and public relations
  • Ability to partner across a matrixed organization, and take into account the needs of multiple stakeholders
  • Ability to synthesize large amounts of information into compelling, actionable insights
  • Excellent PC and Mac literacy; Internet and social media savvy with experience using SharePoint or other Content Management System, Microsoft Office suite, Keynote, etc.

Required Education

  • Bachelor's degree in communications, journalism, or marketing or equivalent work experience, preferably with an emphasis in Corporate Communications.

Additional Information:

description:
Job Summary:

The Operating Participants & Real Estate team is composed of 20+ professionals located in Orlando at the Walt Disney World Resort (WDW) and Anaheim at the Disneyland Resort (DLR) and is responsible for the strategy, tenanting and oversight of third parties that operate on our resort property land as tenants, including retailers, restaurants, hotels and service providers. It also identifies and executes strategic real estate transactions in and around WDW property. Overall, the Operating Participants team manages over [100] accounts that deliver substantial operating income contribution to the sites. In addition, the team coordinates with local operating participant teams at Disneyland Paris (DLP) and Shanghai Disney Resort (SHDR). From a strategic perspective, the Operating Participants team endeavors to leverage third-party brand strength and operational expertise to expand the diversity of complementary offerings at our Resorts, driving length of stay, capturing broader guest demographics on property and generating incremental guest visits from local residents.

Responsibilities:

We are seeking an inspiring leader with experience developing deals and managing contractual relationships to lead the WDW team. Reporting to the Vice President of Operating Participants & Real Estate, this role is based in Orlando. Significant responsibilities include:

LEASE MANAGEMENT: Partner with stakeholders to develop overall negotiation and deal term strategy for renewal of retail, restaurant, and entertainment leases as well as development of hotel leases. In addition, this role will be expected to negotiate side agreements; maximize tenant asset utilization; support forecasting and budgeting tenant revenues and new project expenses; and partner with numerous internal organizations (i.e. Legal, Operations, Line of Businesses, Walt Disney Imagineering, Consumer Insights, Finance, etc.). Lead Operating Participant concept pitch and design review meetings track progress, prepare mitigation and contingency plans and identify any applicable risks to Disney stakeholders.

NEW BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT: As needed, negotiate large complex contracts with new or existing Entertainment and Hotel Operating Participants. Evaluate mix of tenants (retail, F&B, entertainment), advise and develop tenanting strategy, initiate new tenant outreach, develop deal terms, negotiate initial terms, and recommend go-forward approach to Disneyland senior leaders. Evaluate with Operations to determine tenant or Disney operator for specific locations.

ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT: Ensure compliance with negotiated contracts with third party operators, partnering with key Disney teams such as Operations, Facilities, Walt Disney Imagineering, Legal, Finance, Corporate Alliances, etc. Ensure adherence to Disney standards; act as owner’s representative on new projects; assist with development and implementation of global qualitative measures and processes. Understand business unit goals, initiatives, scope of operations and current issues.

GUEST/CLIENT SATISFACTION: Nurture business relationships across WDW, and with segment partners, and TWDC partners; develop, drive and manage non-RD&E Operating Participants; provide guidance and support to Disney operational leadership and LOB/functional key stakeholders.

CAST EXCELLENCE/DEPARTMENT: Oversee and maintain the development of departmental operating guidelines, policies and procedures; build alliances with key stakeholders at all levels of the organization to articulate an understanding of the Operating Participant business.

Basic Qualifications:

  • 10+ years progressive leadership experience in relevant businesses
  • 5+ years contracting, negotiating and business development experience
  • Strong track record in fact-based negotiations or equivalent contract experience
  • Proven ability to establish relationships, trust and credibility internally and externally
  • Ability to analyze deal terms to create a financial model of the agreement and understand practical implications of executing each of the terms: develop formal negotiation plans with talking points for each negotiation session; work interactively with legal resources and business unit stakeholders throughout the negotiation process and document final agreement with a package of a signed contact, financial model and preliminary execution plan to communicate with business unit stakeholders
  • Proven leadership experience and ability to motivate and inspire cast members
  • Strong communication, facilitation and conflict management skills and strong business acumen
  • Unquestioned ethics, transparency and integrity

Preferred Qualifications:

Direct experience in the commercial real estate industry working on significant retail or restaurant projects

Required Education

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Communications or related field

Preferred Education

MBA strongly preferred
