description:
Job Summary:

We make magic. That's our motto at Walt Disney Parks and Resorts and it permeates everything we do. We are Disney's Yellow Shoes, the in-house creative agency for Disney Parks and Resorts Worldwide. Every day, we create compelling, impactful creative content for one of the most beloved brands on the planet. Help inspire that magic by being part of a team that exists to push the limits of entertainment marketing and create the never-before-seen!

We are looking for outstanding Writers with a passion for uncovering "the big idea," and who have a mastery of writing, storytelling, digital and social ideation. You will be well-versed in current trends, have experience with omni-channel creative, and delivering award-winning creative campaigns.

Your #1 Responsibility:
Bring your unique self and perspective to our team and culture.

Make no mistake, as a Copywriter, you'll have other responsibilities too. Like creating new and conceptual ideas for Disney Parks and Resorts alongside talented team members, and mentoring Jr. creatives. You will showcase your ability to navigate issues and think creatively for a range of advertising media. Social and digital by design, we expect EVERY YS creative team member to grasp the importance of thinking creatively in a tech-inspired world. Solid, imaginative design ability, expert understanding of the production process and engaging storytelling are expected. A passion to learn will take you very far.

Responsibilities:

You Will

  • Work well with an Art Director partner to achieve compelling, 360 campaign concepts.
  • Create content for all digital and social channels associated with the Disney Parks and Resorts group.
  • Interpret creative briefs and act upon client feedback.
  • Be a strong project manager with an eye for deadlines.
  • Participate in creative discussions with music houses directors, editors, and other vendors as they relate to the creative output.
  • Construct and provide cohesive creative presentations.
  • Work with Sr. Creatives (Sr., ACD, CD) to complete assignments to their level of expectation and with their direction.
  • Overall comfort level with internal client presentations.
  • Can pick up Live Canvas and stay proficient on the changing functionality offered on social platforms.

Basic Qualifications:

Will Have

  • Storytelling abilities and enthusiasm when sharing ideas internally.
  • Proficiency in Adobe Photoshop and InDesign.
  • Competency in ideating in the digital and social space.
  • Experience working within quick timelines.
  • Exceptional writing and grammatical skills.
  • Must be proficient in presentation software and have a working knowledge of PowerPoint, Keynote and Google Slides.
  • Knowledge and genuine interest in the Walt Disney Company history– including films, animation, television and theme parks.
  • 2+ years in an agency setting, or related experience.
  • An ear for music.

Required Education

  • A minimum of an Associates (2 year) degree in advertising, art, graphic art or design OR relevant experience.

Additional Information:

description:
Job Summary:

"We Change Lives." Walt Disney Imagineering is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of The Walt Disney Company. Its accomplished corps of Imagineers manage the creation - from concept initiation through installation - of all Disney Resorts, theme parks and attractions, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, and new media projects.

The Information Designer will support the WDI Business Planning and Integration Planning Studio which drives strategic alignment and process improvement throughout the WDI business. The team works with the other WDI planning studios and projects management teams and external to WDI including Operations, Finance, Marketing, & Global Business Development to manage and evolve master plans for all global locations to drive the greatest business and strategic value.

What we’re looking for…

An Information Designer will manage a variety of visual representations of strategies, process, plans, and data from inception through production. You will design presentations, reports, and exhibits that are adaptable for a variety of different audiences and mediums to clearly communicate Walt Disney Parks and Resorts planning.

A portfolio review is required for this position. For full consideration, please include a link to your portfolio on your résumé. Applicants without a portfolio link on their résumé, or a completed application packet, may not be fully considered for the position.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, create, and execute compelling presentations, reports, exhibits, and assisting visuals to various related Studios for internal & external presentations
  • Create new ways of visualizing information and update existing templates
  • Identify relevant assets and information to assemble presentation materials
  • Perform research and reconciliation to provide reference materials
  • Perform different basic technical tasks and presentation preparation including plotting/printing presentation materials, gathering required images and visuals, maintaining and updating recurring reports and presentations
  • Collaborate/coordinate with other team members/departments as part of a larger, multi-disciplinary team of varying backgrounds
  • Contribute to the culture and community of the Studio
  • Direct the work of additional designers and/or intern(s)

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum three years' experience in Information Design, Graphic Design, or related practice
  • Visual design background with experience in both print and digital mediums
  • Ability to analyze data and complex information and translate into engaging messages accessible to a wide audience
  • Demonstrated thoughtful design, typographic skills, color theory, and judgment in solving layout and hierarchy challenges
  • Demonstrated mastery of Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, and Keynote
  • Diligent worker that provides extremely high-quality materials on short timeframes

Job Summary:


At the Hong Kong Disneyland Resort, dream jobs do exist. After all, a company built on imagination and wonder means the work will be definitely be interesting. The job of Lifeguard Cast Members at the Hong Kong Disneyland Resort is to ensure the well being of our Guests, keeping pool areas clean, answering Guest questions, providing information and assistance.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensuring the safety of Guests
  • Enforcing regulations at pool and Inspiration Lake
  • Monitoring activities of Guests, rescuing and providing first aid treatment
  • Greeting Guests with positive, friendly and helpful attitude; Proactively address guest needs by answering questions, giving directions and other information regarding the resort or surrounding areas
  • Handling general care and cleaning of the pool area; conduct simple tests to determine water quality
  • Complete pool attendance and other required reports and perform other duties as may be assigned by the location manager

Basic Qualifications:

  • Must Possess a valid Pool Lifeguard Award / Pool Lifeguard Management Award / Advanced Pool Lifeguard Award issued by Hong Kong Life Saving Society or equivalent
  • Must Possess a valid First Aid Certificate that issued by Hong Kong St.John Ambulance / Hong Kong Red Cross / Auxillary Medical Service or equivalent
  • Strong observational skills to proactively identify Guest needs and ensure safety guidelines are being followed
  • Strong verbal communication skills, able to positively engage with Guests, team members, and Management
  • Able to speak Cantonese, Putonghua and English
  • Willingness to work at different locations in the resort area, including outdoor locations
  • This role is Full-Time and requires full availability for any shift

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Ability to speak conversational Putonghua
  • Qualification with relevant housekeeping training course will be an advantage

Additional Information:

SCHEDULE AVAILABILITY Our Theme Park and Resort Hotels operate 365 days a year. Candidate should be available for any shift on a MINIMUM of 5 days per week from June 2021 to January 2022. He/She will need to work shifts according to a roster that is determined by the Company, including shifts on Saturdays, Sundays and Public Holidays. Less availability will be considered as Part Time Lifeguard

SUBMITTING YOUR APPLICATION After clicking “Apply for this job” below, the employment application will open in a new window. Please complete ALL pages of the application in ENGLISH by clicking “Next” on each page, then “Submit” on the final page.

CONTRACT END GRATUITY Upon successful completion of the entire Term and subject to satisfactory performance on your part as reflected by your Line of Business Executive’s assessment on your performance during the Term, you will receive a Contract End Gratuity

description:
Job Summary:

At Disney, we’re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life through our movies, television programs, parks and resorts, and consumer products. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.
This Management Audit (MA) position is primarily responsible for assisting the Managers and Directors of MA with the execution of annual audit plan, including performing financial, information technology and operational audits across the Disney Media Entertainment Distribution, including Studio, General Entertainment, Sports and Direct to Consumer, and Parks, Experiences and Products segments, as well as International Operations and our Corporate functions.
Stories are better when the storytellers represent the vast experiences of the people who will hear them. At Disney, we have the opportunity and the responsibility to create authentic, unforgettable stories, experiences, and products that capture the imagination of generations of people around the world. We are committed to doing that in a way that counts everybody in.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist the Managers and Directors in high quality execution of the annual audit plan in accordance with the MA methodology
    • Perform audit planning activities such as the development of risk and control matrices, data analytics within key processes under audit, drafting of key communications to audit stakeholders and preparation of document request lists
    • Execute fieldwork by performing audit testing through inquiry, data analytics, observation and re-performance and documenting results in working papers
    • Prioritize audit procedures by thinking strategically and understanding business processes within the broader context of the Company operations
  • Identify the impact of audit findings (e.g. control weaknesses) on financial statements, operations and brand
  • Formulate well-written, concise and clear audit findings and assist the Managers and Directors in the operation of audit reports
  • Build effective relationships and work closely with audit stakeholders across all business units of the Company
  • Support the Managers and Directors in department initiatives related to the MA Project Management Office, annual audit planning, audit quality review and department budget
  • Quickly develop and understanding of Disney’s culture and company structures
    • Gain and apply historical knowledge of the department’s audit work in order to leverage internal department experience in future audits

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum 3 years work experience in auditing and/or accounting
  • Willingness to travel up to 25-40% (domestic and international) upon business travel resumption
  • Excellent team player, who possesses solid interpersonal and organizational skills
  • Possess high energy level, decisiveness and strong work ethic
  • Able to work in a flexible team environment and handle multiple assignment simultaneously
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to adapt quickly in a fast paced environment

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience at a top accounting firm or the internal audit function of a reputable public company
  • Experience with spreadsheets, databases, Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI, ACL, SAS or other data / analytical tools
  • Knowledge of scripting languages
  • Entertainment industry experience

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Information Systems, Accounting, Finance, or related business field

Preferred Education

  • CPA (or other accounting certificate), CIA, CISA, CISSP or other relevant professional certifications

description:
Job Summary:

OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY

Star

Star India has defined the Indian media landscape for more than 30 years, and today is one of the country’s leading media conglomerates, reaching around 700 million viewers a month on TV across India and over 100 other countries. Star India’s channel portfolio cuts across general entertainment, films, sports, infotainment, kids, and lifestyle content across eight languages. The network generates over 20,000 hours of content every year and broadcasts 70+ channels, reaching 9 out of 10 C&S TV homes in India. The Star Sports network is one of the leading sports networks with 17 channels in its bouquet. It is home to a number of leading domestic and international sports and is making quantum leaps in transforming sports in the country, helping India become a multi-sporting nation. Disney+ Hotstar, India’s largest premium streaming platform has changed the way Indians watch their entertainment - from their favourite TV shows and movies to sporting extravaganzas. With the widest range of content in India, Disney+ Hotstar offers more than 100,000 hours of TV Shows and Movies in 8 languages, regional and national News, and coverage of every major global sporting event, including the IPL. The company is present in the Indian movie production and distribution space through Fox Star Studios. The studios is also responsible for the marketing and distribution of its Hollywood slate in the country. For more details visit us at http://www.startv.com/

JOB DESCRIPTION

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Analyze on-air and in-development shows and combine data, consumer speak and creative to sharply identify and articulate the problem statement
  • To work pre-launch under Development along with Editors (who are dealing w Producer/ Writer/ Director) on pitch, story, script, and insights of shows
  • To work with closely with Editorial and creative teams character development/ journey and reviewing conflict/ inflexion points
  • To be deeply involved in episodic story feedback for ~8-12 weeks pre-launch
  • To be continuously involved in the show post launch and intervene as and when required
  • To research templates around story character and inflexion points as needed
  • To project manage show launch timelines and red-flag interventions, as needed

PERFORMANCE MEASURES

  • Show launch TVR & TSV for the first 6-8 weeks
  • Performance on shows that they work on – TVR, TSV of shows
  • Number of break-through characters created
  • Adherence to development & launch milestones

QUALIFICATION

  • Graduate/ P.G. in any stream. Preferably Mass Media
  • Consulting/Marketing background preferred – a read of data/strategy or consumer

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Good communication: can articulate, take others along in their vision
  • Avid content consumer across platforms- books, OTT, TV, Films
  • Ability to multitask
  • Expertise and experience in content creation and/or writing; Social and political awareness – understands India deeply, soulfully; Creative imagination: ability to bring a concept alive in script/ telling

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES

  • High commitment to excellence: deep ambition to bring riveting stories, tracks, characters to life
  • Learning mindset – applying, morphing, re-applying tools & concepts
  • Dependable: Ability to marshal support & garner trust by Editors, Production Houses & external content creators

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.



About Star:

Star India has defined the Indian media landscape for over two decades and today is one of the country’s leading media conglomerates, reaching approximately 650 million viewers a month across India and more than 100 other countries. Star generates 20,000 hours of content every year and broadcasts 40+ channels in 8 different languages, reaching 9 out of 10 C&S TV homes in India. The network’s entertainment channel portfolio includes Star Gold, Channel V, Star World, Star Movies, Star Utsav, Life OK, Movies OK and Star Plus, India's No. 1 Hindi General Entertainment Channel. It has a leading presence in regional broadcasting as well, through a bouquet of affiliate channels which includes Star Jalsha, Jalsha Movies, Star Pravah, Asianet, Asianet Plus, Suvarna, Suvarna Plus, Vijay and now Maa. It is also present in the Indian movie production and distribution space through Fox Star Studios, an affiliate joint venture company.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Star India Private Limited, which is part of a business we call Star.

Job Summary:

The Manager of Financial Systems will lead the support for the Forecast & Planning process for the DPEP Segment. This role provides expertise in analysis, evaluating business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, requirements, and data usage across financial systems technology platforms. Collaborate with Finance Business teams and technology teams to develop new solutions and enhance existing systems and processes.

The individual will need to leverage knowledge of finance and technology to lead and collaborate with finance and business colleagues at all levels and be committed to continuous improvement in systems and processes. This candidate should be familiar with current best practices and have the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate should have a strong accounting or finance background with experience in Longview and/or Cognos.

Responsibilities:

Strategy
  • Translates strategy into specific priorities, objectives and action plans
  • Connects their segment & process priorities to the greater organizational goals.
  • Makes sound business decisions that balance competing priorities
  • Participates in the strategic business planning with business units (within Segments and across the Enterprise) and IT to formulate enhancement options to address specific functional issues / requirements
  • Recommends and implements process improvement/reengineering initiatives

Project Management
  • Liaises with IT to drive system enhancements, upgrades and modifications; ensures architecture supports business requirements
  • Manages smaller scale/budget, lower risk, and single-process focused projects.
  • Leads the design, resource management, implementation and support of finance system solutions for each Segment and the Enterprise
  • Effectively communicates with management, stakeholders, subject matter experts and project team members
  • Assists in developing project infrastructure for team (i.e. templates, project management methodology and execution)
  • Assists in the development of project plans specifying goals, strategy, staffing, scheduling, identification of risks, contingency plans and allotment of resources for each phase of the project
  • Coordinates & executes project activities to ensure project progresses on schedule
  • Monitors project results against objectives, milestones and scope.
  • Develops and solution testing, training and communication.
  • Obtains project signoff of completion and appropriately close-out
  • Collaborates and solves problems

Leadership
  • Promotes teamwork both internally and externally
  • Manages team resources and ensure they are utilized appropriately
  • Proactively recruits, retains and develops a diverse range of talented people
  • Supports productivity and morale of the team
  • Ability to positively confront issues and resolve conflict with sound judgment
  • Ability to define a clear vision and motivate others to embrace change

Process Support and Governance
  • Lead team that enhances and sustains 5 Longview Instances supporting the DPEP segment (F&P WDW and DLR, WD Imagineering, DLP F&P, SHDR F&P, HKDL F&P, Controllership (Cause of Change)
  • Lead team that enhances and sustains 4 Consumer Products Cognos configurations (Licensing, Publishing, Consumer Products, National Geographic)
  • Direct management of governance and finance system compliance in accordance with company policies, standards and SOX requirements
  • Applies expert knowledge and understanding of financial and US GAAP accounting principles to our systems and business processes
  • Proactively identifies and troubleshoots issues (data or process) and take appropriate action to resolve
  • Manages end user support and training. This includes request management (incidents/system enhancements) and training (standard materials, course design and delivery)
  • Manages testing efforts for system implementations, enhancements and modifications
  • Coordinates testing with end users, IBM staff and peers supporting other Disney business units
  • Ensures orderly, accurate and timely completion of all required test scripts, localizes test scripts as necessary to ensure each Segment’s specific business needs are addressed
  • Completes the most complex tasks and projects

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience in Finance Transformation initiatives
  • Minimum of 5 to 7 years work experience with financial or accounting, preferably in a large SAP installation
  • Minimum of 5 years working with SAP or other ERP systems
  • Experience working for large company and within a matrix organization
  • Experience with Longview product suite
  • Experience with Cognos product suite
  • Experienced in using the Microsoft Office applications (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project)
  • Experience in using SAP or another ERP

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Management experience
  • CPA or CMA license, or equivalent
  • PMP or other professional project management certification
  • Six Sigma certification
  • Experience in using Business Objects and/or Cognos reporting tools
  • Experience developing end user training
  • Experience implementing financial processes and systems
  • Experience using systems designed to manage issues, changes and testing (e.g. Service Manager, Rational Team Concert, ALM)

Required Education

  • Bachelor's Degree, or equivalent work experience
  • Accounting, Finance, Information Technology, Business, or a related field

Preferred Education

  • Graduate Degree
  • Accounting, Finance, Information Technology, Business, or a related field

« Walt Disney Imagineering Creative Paris » (WDI), département responsable de la continuité artistique et qualitative des parcs Disney en France, recherche un(e) candidat(e) voulant rejoindre une équipe d’une cinquantaine de personnes d’expertises différentes et renforcer particulièrement le groupe « Design ».

Job Summary:

The software engineer is responsible for the ongoing design, management and hygiene of multiple tech systems across the Walt Disney company, ensuring they are operating at peak efficiency and extracting clean, valuable data for use across all lines of business.

Working closely with the Tech Lead, Disney, the software engineer will evaluate Disney Digital’s range of technological systems and identify limitations and deficiencies and their associated processes, procedures and methods.

The software engineer will research, consult, analyse and evaluate system needs, with a view to bringing interoperability across multiple lines of business, helping Disney extract clean, usable data for use across the suite of digital products. These will include, but are not limited to, data enrichment, martech, adtech and personalisation.

Responsibilities:

Systems architecture

  • Manage and maintain AWS infrastructure for all non-Matterhorn Disney destinations, ensuring they are operating at maximum efficiency and using industry best practice tools & systems.
  • Working with Disney Global Information Security, uphold tech infrastructure security and risk mitigation standards.
  • Oversee and implement data tracking for use by Data Management Platform software and other products as needed.

Database administration:

  • Working with the Tech Lead and Digital Director, architect solutions for the Disney Data Strategy to ensure maximum value for all lines of business across the Walt Disney Australia
    & NZ.
  • Ensure the hygiene of all data from multiple sources across the Walt Disney Company for clean extraction and insertion into third-party systems, including Snowflake, LiveRamp, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Adobe Target and other data management and enrichment systems.
  • Ensuring the regular analysis and reporting on data sets, helping identify key new opportunities to deliver value across all Disney Lines of Business.
  • Working with Product Managers and the Business Analyst, use data & analytics to help plan new products, features and improved user experiences.
  • Ensures best practice knowledge of industry trends to constantly improve data management practices.

Basic Qualifications:

We're seeking someone with 5+ years of experience of Software Engineering experience, and exposure to the media and entertainment industry will be highly advantageous.

This is unique opportunity to join the talented team that develops and delivers unparalleled entertainment across Australia and New Zealand so if this role captures your imagination then apply now!

The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse and inclusive workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. We are committed to building a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

Additional Information:

Applications close Friday 27th May 2022. Please apply before then to be considered.

About Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution:

Comprised of the Company’s international business units and various direct-to-consumer streaming services, Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) aligns technology, media distribution and advertising sales into a single business segment to create and deliver personalized entertainment experiences to consumers around the world.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with The Walt Disney Company (Australia) Pty Limited, which is part of a business we call Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution.

Job Summary:

OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY

Star

Star India has defined the Indian media landscape for more than 30 years, and today is one of the country’s leading media conglomerates, reaching around 700 million viewers a month on TV across India and over 100 other countries. Star India’s channel portfolio cuts across general entertainment, films, sports, infotainment, kids, and lifestyle content across eight languages. The network generates over 20,000 hours of content every year and broadcasts 70+ channels, reaching 9 out of 10 C&S TV homes in India. The Star Sports network is one of the leading sports networks with 17 channels in its bouquet. It is home to a number of leading domestic and international sports and is making quantum leaps in transforming sports in the country, helping India become a multi-sporting nation. Disney+ Hotstar, India’s largest premium streaming platform has changed the way Indians watch their entertainment - from their favourite TV shows and movies to sporting extravaganzas. With the widest range of content in India, Disney+ Hotstar offers more than 100,000 hours of TV Shows and Movies in 8 languages, regional and national News, and coverage of every major global sporting event, including the IPL. The company is present in the Indian movie production and distribution space through Fox Star Studios. The studios is also responsible for the marketing and distribution of its Hollywood slate in the country. For more details visit us at http://www.startv.com/

JOB DESCRIPTION

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Drive projects of long-term importance that will significantly 'change the business'

  • Identify opportunities for business process improvement, re-engineering, automation and digital transformation
  • Deliver transformation through re-engineering, automation, consolidation and innovation in business processes, to enhance
    • Commercial value of the business, in terms of both revenue and cost
    • Quality, accuracy and timeliness of business processes
    • Customer, stakeholder and employee experience
  • Manage the overall project process effectively
  • Ensure alignment on scope, timelines, deliverables and interim milestones for each project at the start and ensure adherence to outlined process and timelines
  • Engage with project sponsor and business head regularly on solution
  • Identify areas requiring cross-functional/ senior management approval and ensure timely setup of Steering Committee Meetings

Own project solution delivery end-to-end

  • Leverage subject matter expertise of project sponsor and their team and integrate solution components driven by multiple functions as part of the overall solution
  • Pro-actively seek out outside-in learnings (e.g. by studying external benchmark companies, by leveraging external experts/ consultants on specific topics) to build best-in-class solutions
  • Critically challenge and enhance solutions developed by team and other stakeholders
  • Provide support to functions to continue execution of solution post rollout and stabilization
  • Transfer ownership of project solution to respective function sponsor and on-board function teams with the requisite capabilities to deploy solution

Share and evangelize the business transformation agenda in the organization

  • Gain buy-in across the organization on the new changed ways of working to ensure that partner-facing teams drive change in the end-consumer ways of working

PERFORMANCE MEASURES

  • No. of Technology and process improvements to reduce/ eliminate non-customer facing activities and cost
  • % BT budget utilized
  • On time delivery of projects
  • Achievement of the agreed project deliverables
  • Achievement of business targets post roll-out of initiatives
  • Quality of solution delivered in Business Transformation projects

QUALIFICATION

  • MBA from a premier institute / CA Ranker (preferred), or Bachelors degree (required)
  • 10-15 years of work experience, with at least 6-7 years in Process Excellence / Transformation functions
  • Six Sigma Master Black Belt or Black Belt, in-role and/or with certification

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

  • Lean and Six Sigma methodologies (Practitioner)
  • Robotic Process Automation (Expert)
  • Ability to “Re-think” or “re-imagine” business processes (Understanding)
  • Project & program design, planning and execution (Practitioner)
  • Strong on managing internal and external stakeholders (Expert)
  • Navigation skills, with ability to drive cross-functional initiatives (Understanding)
  • Commercially astute (Understanding)

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES

  • Self-driven go-getter, with ability to work on limited inputs.
  • Comfortable with unstructured responsibilities
  • Lateral thinking abilities
  • Creative problem solving
  • Adaptable to change
  • Excellent communication, and fast learner
  • Presentation and influencing skills

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.



About Star:

Star India has defined the Indian media landscape for over two decades and today is one of the country’s leading media conglomerates, reaching approximately 650 million viewers a month across India and more than 100 other countries. Star generates 20,000 hours of content every year and broadcasts 40+ channels in 8 different languages, reaching 9 out of 10 C&S TV homes in India. The network’s entertainment channel portfolio includes Star Gold, Channel V, Star World, Star Movies, Star Utsav, Life OK, Movies OK and Star Plus, India's No. 1 Hindi General Entertainment Channel. It has a leading presence in regional broadcasting as well, through a bouquet of affiliate channels which includes Star Jalsha, Jalsha Movies, Star Pravah, Asianet, Asianet Plus, Suvarna, Suvarna Plus, Vijay and now Maa. It is also present in the Indian movie production and distribution space through Fox Star Studios, an affiliate joint venture company.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Star India Private Limited, which is part of a business we call Star.

Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering has been creating World Class creative content for the past 70 years. Consistently pushing forward in areas of technology and research/development we strive to provide our Guests with the most awe-inspiring environments to transport them to another time/place. With this goal comes great responsibility to deliver content that is on-brand and accurately set within its theme. This mission requires us to pay attention to each and every detail to deliver excellent Disney Parks, Experiences and Products around the globe.

We’re looking for an energetic, talented, and team-oriented Executive Assistant to support our Design and Planning Studio team. The Executive Assistant (EA) will provide exceptional administrative support to the Design and Planning (D+P) Studio Executives and secondary support to additional leaders as needed and assigned. The EA serves as the primary point of contact for Design and Planning Executives with an emphasis on complex daily scheduling and project support. The EA is an integral member of the Walt Disney Imagineering D+P executive support team and plays a key role in helping cultivate a strong and vibrant studio culture. In this role, you may not only find yourself at the center of our studio’s executive team “hub”, but also serving as a trusted partner to individuals in departments throughout the studio, with an emphasis on supporting design talent and supporting the vision of WDI. Therefore, the position requires a positive & engaging demeanor, exemplary service orientation, a high level of organization, independent problem solving and the ability to proactively, accurately and responsively deliver several tasks/projects, sometimes simultaneously. To be most effective, the EA will be collaborative, organized, curious and willing to learn. The EA will possess a personal commitment to equity, inclusion and belonging to help us cultivate Imagineers who can bring their fullest talents to the studio.

Responsibilities:

On any given day, your role may require you to complete many of these tasks:

Schedule Management & Administration
  • Proactively manage leader(s) and team calendars with an understanding of leader and studio goals
  • Exercise judgment and prioritize complex schedules and tasks accordingly
  • Proactively prepare leader(s) for meetings, ensuring that agendas are prepared in advance, communicated and that key leadership and management are aware of and involved in critical meetings
  • Anticipate future needs and problems with regards to scheduling, communication and support; effectively meet deadlines through multi-tasking, prioritizing and delegating
  • Book travel and create detailed itineraries when needed
  • Manage and reconcile expense reports, invoices and receipts, and flag upcoming expenses for budgetary purposes
  • Successfully run day to day tasks and operations, which may include but are not limited to:
    • Phone, email and mail correspondence
    • Shipping
    • Contacts and electronic paper files
    • Working meals and catering needs
    • Office supply needs
    • Organizational charts
Communication
  • Partner with leader(s) and key studio leadership to effectively manage changing schedule priorities and communicate to all involved parties
  • Speak on behalf of and represent leader in conversations and meetings in leader’s absence using a high level of diplomacy, judgment with autonomy as needed
  • Regularly handle sensitive information in a discrete and confidential manner
  • Accurately communicate and collaborate with production or operational departments or people at all levels
  • As requested, draft communications on behalf of and in the style of leader(s)
  • Build and/or assemble presentations/decks to communicate strategies and initiatives
  • Create and support a friendly professional atmosphere within the team and department
  • Establish positive rapport with other assistants, operations teams, production departments, and studio leadership
  • Take on advisory and advocate role within team, providing support to the department and other assistants as needed
Special Projects
  • Project manage initiatives, programs and one-off projects as needed in support of leader(s) goals and assignments
  • Plan and execute both small and large events including studio-wide meetings, on and off-site meetings, large presentations, social events, morale/team building events, etc.
  • Work with individuals outside of the company on a variety of activities which may include scheduling visiting Executive or VIP meetings and arranging for all necessary event details (agendas, catering, travel coordination and day-of event management)
  • Participate in the hiring process as needed
  • Provide leadership, assistance with training, and mentorship within the assistant community; provide backup for assistant positions across the department or studio when necessary

Basic Qualifications:

  • At least 2 years of experience in an administrative support role
  • Superior interpersonal skills and baseline emotional intelligence in both written and verbal communication
  • Ability to maintain composure in high pressure situations and effectively “read the room”
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
  • High levels of trust, customer service, professionalism, punctuality and reliability
  • Consistent and regular follow through on all requests
  • Ability to make others comfortable and at ease
  • Ability to effectively communicate and connect with both creative and technical people and engage with individual contributors and Senior Executives with an equal level of respect and composure
  • Initiative to learn new skills, studio procedures, and pipeline through self and studio education
  • Ability to work onsite and work overtime, as needed

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of administrative experience supporting an executive in a dynamic and demanding environment
  • Proficiency in technology required to perform the role (may include Microsoft Office, Excel & PowerPoint and SAP/Workday), and a quick learner of new applications
  • Design and/or Construction industry experience
  • Deep network and understanding of Disney systems and processes
  • Strong presentation building experience
  • Ability to make others comfortable and at ease
  • Ability to effectively communicate and connect with both creative and technical people and engage with individual contributors and Senior Executives with an equal level of respect and composure
  • Initiative to learn new skills, studio procedures, and pipeline through self and studio education

Required Education

High school diploma or equivalent

Preferred Education

Bachelor's degree or equivalent

description:
Job Summary:

Apprenti(e) Archiviste/Documentaliste Digital
WDI Paris

CONTEXTE
Walt Disney Imagineering Paris – Design & Show Quality est assistance à maîtrise d’ouvrage (AMO). En tant que maître d’ouvrage délégué, nous sommes chargés de faire l’interface entre le maître d’œuvre (Le constructeur) et le maître d’ouvrage (le client interne DLP) afin d’aider ce dernier à définir clairement ses besoins et de vérifier auprès du maître d’œuvre si l’objectif est techniquement réalisable.
Nous sommes donc responsables de la fixation des objectifs, pour le compte de nos clients internes. Le maître d'œuvre a pour mission de réaliser l'ouvrage, dans les conditions de délais, de qualité et de coût fixées par nos soins, et généralement conformément aux délais imposés par le calendrier d’avancé des projets de construction, et au plus proche des délais convenus dans le cadre de demandes de travaux.
Le contenu de notre mission doit permettre de réaliser la synthèse architecturale des objectifs et des contraintes du projet, et de s'assurer du respect, lors de l'exécution de l'ouvrage, des études que nous avons effectuées.
MISSION
Au sein de Walt Disney Imagineering Paris – Design & Show Quality, au sein de l’équipe en charge des solutions informatiques, vous serez amené(e) à travailler de façon transversale et exploiter des systèmes de gestion de documents numériques, alimenter des bases de données et des plateformes de stockage et de partage de documents, analyser, indexer et exploiter les documents, en adéquation avec les objectifs du service et ce, en respectant les Cinq Clés : Sécurité, Courtoisie, Inclusion, Spectacle et Efficacité. Vous serez rattaché(e) au responsable IT, en charge des projets.
Vos missions :

Vous participerez à la mise en œuvre de notre solution d’archivage et de documentation et assurerez le support des systèmes mis en place et futur, en lien avec nos collègues Américains, et nos collègues de Disneyland Paris (Doc Control, FAM, FOS Etc.).

Vous travaillerez pour cela de façon transverse avec les parties prenantes de WDI Paris – Design & Show Quality : Directeur Artistiques, Show Production, Design Studio, Show Technical etc.

Votre domaine d'activité intègrera :
  • Les tâches d'exécution nécessaires à la gestion d'un système documentaire
  • Alimenter les bases de données, analyser, indexer et exploiter les documents
  • Rechercher, traiter et communiquer l’information : vous participerez à la formation des équipes et à l’accompagnement au changement
  • Vous contribuerez au maintien de la solution d’archivage et à la réflexion stratégique de son évolution
  • Coordonner les échanges et les interactions entre les parties prenantes de WDI Paris – Design & Show Quality (Directeur Artistiques, Show Production, Design Studio, Show Technical etc.) afin de s'assurer du respect des procédures de stockage/destruction et de recollement de données.
  • Coordonner les échanges avec les partenaires internes (FAM, FOS, Doc CONTROL) afin d'assurer une communication claire des besoins et un alignement du processus de stockage digital.
  • Partager, échanger et recueillir les informations des sites Disney dans le monde afin d'améliorer les pratiques à Walt Disney Imagineering Paris – Design & Show Quality.


PRINCIPALES COMPETENCES
  • Profil recherché :
  • Anglais B2/C1 (lu, écrit, parlé)
  • Maitrise du Pack Office
  • Gestion des priorités
  • Bonne communication avec les autres services
  • Attitude positive
  • Capacité à gérer l’urgence
  • Esprit De Synthèse
  • Minutie, Méthodique
  • Approche Technique Digital indispensable

Début souhaité : Octobre 2022

A rejoindre 15 000 collaborateurs (Cast Members) partageant la même ambition professionnelle : celle de faire vivre la magie Disneyland Paris pour nos 15 millions de visiteurs annuels ?
Il ne vous reste plus qu’à postuler, car nous sommes prêts à vous donner les moyens de faire rayonner vos talents !

description:
Job Summary:

The Editor, Audiobooks & Podcasts will support the senior editorial team in the development and production of audiobooks and podcasts based on Disney, Marvel, Lucasfilm, and Pixar properties. The candidate will oversee the editorial workflow of original fiction audiobooks and podcasts, partnering closely with franchise stakeholders and audio production team.

Must have a strong passion for children’s publishing, exceptional editorial, writing, and proofreading skills, and can efficiently manage diverse responsibilities in a high-volume work environment. You will report to the Executive Editor.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and edit audiobook and podcast series for Disney/Marvel/Lucasfilm/Pixar franchises in partnership with 3rd party licensees
  • Collaborate with Editorial, Audio Production, Managing Editorial and Copyediting during the creative development and production of audiobooks and podcasts
  • Provide cover concept descriptions to Art & Design teams
  • Write proposals for new series, edit manuscripts, check passes against copyediting notes
  • Review audio productions for quality and accuracy
  • Prepare creative briefs for new projects, set up projects in title management system, request ISBNs/ISSNs
  • Facilitate brainstorm meetings with franchise leads, editors, and writers
  • Communicate with studio brand managers for approvals
  • Manage editorial needs of licensee partnerships
  • Prepare catalogs, presentations, one-sheets to facilitate communication to licensees and global territories
  • Monitor new trends in the audio/podcast market

Basic Qualifications:

  • 3-4 years editorial experience
  • Experience with audiobook and podcast production
  • Passion for Disney/Marvel/Lucasfilm/Pixar franchises
  • Mastery of story development, plot structure, character development, and serialized fiction
  • Experience brainstorming new ideas with a large team and independently
  • Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to develop and track multiple projects at the same time
  • Experience working under pressure to meet deadlines
  • Proficiency in Office suite, Adobe Acrobat, Keynote

Required Education

  • BA/BS

Additional Information:

Disney Publishing Worldwide (DPW) is one of the world's largest publishing brands, igniting imagination through storytelling in ever-inventive ways. As part of the Disney Parks, Experiences and Products segment, DPW and its affiliates through its publishing business bring the magic of The Walt Disney Company’s powerful brands and franchises, including Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, ESPN, 20th Century Studios, and National Geographic, to fans everywhere. DPW, through its vertical publishing operations and global licensing structure, creates and publishes best-selling books, comics, magazines, learning and digital interactive storytelling products, audio books, eBooks, and apps. DPW publications and storytelling products are available in more than 70 countries in 45 languages.

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

#CPGPJobs
#DPEPFLA

description:
Job Summary:

Global Development is a highly visible department charged with systematically assessing the long-term goals, growth strategy, and capital expansion opportunities that drive investment decisions to maximize value for Disney’s Parks, Experiences and Products businesses. The team’s work spans across all businesses (e.g. theme parks & resorts, signature experiences, consumer products licensing & publishing) and geographies (e.g. US, Asia, Europe). The team plays a key role in helping the businesses deliver predictable and sustainable long-term earnings growth.

The Disney Parks, Experiences, and Products Global Development team is seeking highly qualified candidates for the Senior Manager of Global Development position. This role requires excellent strategic thinking, proven analytical acumen, strong communication skills, and the ability to effectively collaborate. A team-oriented attitude and a sense of fun are essential.

Responsibilities:

  • Proactively support company leaders’ financial and commercial decision-making by driving cross-functional projects including leading research/analytics, developing presentations, and managing relationships with partners
  • Develop work plans for projects under management, ensuring timely delivery of work needed from the Global Development team and partners
  • Define and lead strategic planning, research, modeling, and analytics, and incorporate outputs in the overall project storyline while also identifying past trends and predicting the future needs of our businesses and our consumers/Guests
  • Develop own recommendation and autonomously build presentations
  • Build and engage cross-functional teams to deliver projects, ensure shared ownership of recommendations
  • Deliver presentations and actively contribute to meetings with senior leadership
  • Explore new approaches and frameworks to solve issues
  • Proactively develop and maintain relationships with partners across the company
  • Provide ongoing development support to all levels within the team
  • Partner with Marketing/Consumer Insights, Revenue Management, Imagineering, Finance, Controllership, etc. to gather internal data and opinions

Basic Qualifications:

  • 7-10 years of progressive experience in business development and/or consulting
  • Excellent research and problem-solving skills
  • Advanced quantitative analysis skills with the ability to translate into actionable insights and recommendations
  • Demonstrated strategic and structured thinking
  • Self-starter with the ability to handle ambiguity
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively across functions
  • Experience in coaching and mentoring direct reports
  • Ability to lead and inspire teams
  • Strong organizational and project management skills

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Passion for the Disney brand and in particular, Disney’s theme parks, signature experiences, and consumer products
  • Enthusiasm for the markets and industries addressed by our segment
  • International work experience
  • Multilingual

Required Education

  • Bachelors Degree required

Preferred Education

  • MBA preferred

description:
Job Summary:


Alternance – Développeur(se) Web Mobile H/F

Au sein de la division Walt Disney Imagineering, dans l’équipe en charge des solutions informatiques nous recherchons un Développeur(se) Web Mobile.
Rattaché(e) au responsable Creative IT, en charge des projets, et en collaboration avec notre Développeur Web vous serez amené(e) à prendre part à des projets de développement d'applications web et mobile métier, d’interconnexion des systèmes d’information, et de création d’outils d’aide à la gestion.
Vos missions :
Vous participerez à l'étude technique, la création, la mise en œuvre et le support de composants de ces systèmes d’information.
Votre domaine d'activité intègrera :
  • Le développement d’applications mobiles iPad/Android avec mode offline
  • Le développement Frontend & Backend impliquant la conception des éléments techniques nécessaires au fonctionnement des systèmes.
  • La gestion des bases de données, leur évolution et leur optimisation
  • La participation à des analyses techniques et/ou fonctionnelles
  • La définition et participation aux tests techniques et fonctionnels (depuis les tests unitaires jusqu'aux tests de performances et fail-over)
  • Vous contribuerez à la communication avec les équipes
Dans le cadre de vos activités courantes, vous serez notamment amené(e) à :
  • Développer des applications métiers selon le principe Make it work, Make it fast, Make it well
  • Veiller au maintien d’un répertoire Git et l’évolution de celui-ci (Peer reviewing, pull requests, branching)
  • Effectuer le contrôle qualité et veiller à la performance et la sécurité des systèmes
  • Tenir un rôle d’interface avec les clients ; Méthodologie Agile pour réagir rapidement aux demandes client
  • Rédiger la documentation et notamment les spécifications techniques, le cahier de recette, les documents d’exploitation et de support des solutions mises en œuvre ;
  • Préparer les supports de déploiement applicatif ;
  • Assurer la transition des applications vers le Responsable de Domaine lors de la mise en production.
Le Profil pour mener à bien cette mission :
  • Idéalement inscrit dans un cursus Master ou License en systèmes d’information vous avez un niveau bac +2 minimum.

description:
Job Summary:

The Walt Disney Company's Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) is a new, global business segment for The Walt Disney Company with the mission of providing consumers around the world access to the content they want most, on the latest platforms, at a time of rapidly-evolving consumer habits. Combining the Company's direct-to-consumer streaming services – ESPN+, the Disney+ streaming service and its ownership stake in Hulu -- alongside Disney's international media businesses, DMED aligns cutting-edge technology with world-class content and beloved brands to expand the Company's global footprint and deliver highly-personalized entertainment experiences to diverse consumers around the world.

The Reporting, Analytics, & Data Solutions team is tasked with normalizing a data culture within DMED that aligns with the principle that all data is relational and management of it should be central, accessible, sustainable, and flexible. We consult with partners to provide the path to better solutions through streamlined processes, proactively identify areas of opportunity and seek innovative solutions that solve problems before they exist and deliver solutions to functional HR partners.

This is a position with the Disney Media and Entertainment Distribution (DMED) segment Reporting, Analytics, & Data Solutions team, supporting the Human Resources organization

Responsibilities:

This role is responsible for development, delivery, and support of a portfolio of critical business data intelligence tools that key stakeholders rely on to effectively operate their businesses.

•Defines, develops, and delivers relational HR data systems and applications for cross-functional HR teams.
•Builds data solutions, spanning data collection, storage, and delivery that joins HR System of Record with offline data. Builds and releases data applications that support and integrate into HR business processes.
•Utilizes MS Office 365 applications and data repositories for creation and delivery of data tools, web apps, and visualizations, including Azure Data Studio (database) and Microsoft Power Suite (UI and automation).
•Participates in discovery processes with stakeholders to define HR data needs and develop solutions. Proposes and scopes technical solutions to meet HR stakeholder needs.
•Solves complex data problems, proactively develop best practices for operating and optimizing delivery of data to HR client groups and stakeholders.
•Contributes to team discussions around how to collect, prepare, and visualize data.
•Continuously explores new tools, techniques, working models to improve design, increase data integration and imagine potential opportunities for innovation in data delivery (Automation/Optimization).
•Develops and implements new data collection and validation processes for clients and projects
•Maintains and troubleshoots Data Solutions built databases and data tools, including continuously improving automated ETL processes and data delivery methods
•Manages and maintains DMED SQL server footprint; drives data solutions products to migrate from disparate local databases to SQL server
•Supports the right level of access for different users and manages the quality of data within TWDC systems.
•Iterates on data infrastructure design and/or functionality. Regularly revises data and reporting products based on the changing needs of end users.

Basic Qualifications:

•5+ years of experience in roles working with relational HR data directly or in a consulting capacity
•Must have experience with full Microsoft Office 365 suite of applications, with proficiency in Access, Excel, Power Query, Power BI, Power Automate and other Office 365 power applications
•Experience with Microsoft SQL Server and Azure Data Studio
•Proficient in SQL; working knowledge of VBA or TypeScript/JavaScript a plus
•Familiarity with data structures in HR Management Systems; SAP or Workday a plus
•Working knowledge of Human Resources concepts and operational practices
•Emphasizes partnership and collaboration in working with a team
•Ability to multi-task
•Strong written, verbal, and graphic communication skills
•Business-oriented mindset
•Enjoys working in a fast-paced environment
•Ability to work with sensitive information and maintain confidentiality
•At least 2 years of experience with development of tools for delivery of large data sets, data integration and data intelligence solutions

Preferred Qualifications:

•Work experience with a large corporate employer, leading consulting firm and/or emerging technology roles preferred

Required Education

•Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management Information Systems, Data Science or related field

Preferred Education

•Master’s degree in Business, Management Information Systems, Data Science or related field

description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research arm of The Walt Disney Company’s (TWDC) Parks and Resorts business segment. Representing more than 150 disciplines, the talented corps of Imagineers are responsible for the creation of Disney resorts, theme parks and attractions, hotels, water parks, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, cruise ships and new media technology projects.

The WDI Technology Studio is looking for talented software developers to create and deploy the next generation of show technologies that will drive our guest experiences in upcoming attractions and venues.

Responsibilities:

  • Estimation, design, implementation, peer review, testing, documentation, training, and turnover of all Show Control software artifacts pursuant to attraction and/or venue scope.
  • Task definition, organization, prioritization, scheduling, status tracking, and distribution of tasks among software project team members.
  • Must work closely with other technical divisions of work to ensure constructed systems (inclusive of both hardware and software) operate cooperatively and reliably over the expected usable life of project.
  • Must balance evolving technical requirements with fixed budgets and schedules, and communicate both risks and options to Studio, and Project leadership (as appropriate) in a timely fashion.
  • Partner with both Studio and Project leadership to execute project goals while employing best software development practices and adhering to relevant company and industry standards.
  • Work with other software project and product developers to provide incremental and overall updates to status and condition of software product progress.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum 5 years of Industrial Automation and/or Process Control experience, primarily focused on software development within the same domain
  • Knowledge and experience with modern software development practices, including version control and workflow management tools including JIRA, Clarity, Github, Gitlab, Subversion, Perforce, Bitbucket, Bamboo, Crucible, Jenkins, etc.
  • Knowledge and experience with process control/controls engineering industry standards, platforms/languages/technologies, including PLCs, FPGAs, embedded controllers/microcontrollers, RTOS programming environments, HMI and SCADA solutions.
  • Prior experience authoring and/or augmenting motion control software packages for Industrial or Entertainment focused applications.
  • Demonstrable technical writing, documentation, and communication skills.
  • Willing to travel on behalf of company to project destinations for the purposes of business trips (between overnight and 6 months stay), and also relocation (between 6 month and two year stay).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with: IEC61131-3 programming languages, EtherCAT, ADS, DS-402, Profibus, DMX/sACN, OPC-UA, MQTT, C#, Python, Java.
  • Familiarity and/or experience with: MS Visual Studio, RSLogix, Matlab, Robot OS (ROS), AutoDesk Maya, Motion Builder, AutoCAD
  • Experience with TwinCAT3 is a strong plus.

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, electrical engineering, computer engineering from accredited college or university. Advanced degrees preferred.

* Task definition, organization, prioritization, scheduling, status tracking, and distribution of tasks among software project team members.
* Must work closely with other technical divisions of work to ensure constructed systems (inclusive of both hardware and software) operate cooperatively and reliably over the expected usable life of project.
* Must balance evolving technical requirements with fixed budgets and schedules, and communicate both risks and options to Studio, and Project leadership (as appropriate) in a timely fashion.
* Partner with both Studio and Project leadership to execute project goals while employing best software development practices and adhering to relevant company and industry standards.
* Work with other software project and product developers to provide incremental and overall updates to status and condition of software product progress.

* Minimum 5 years of Industrial Automation and/or Process Control experience, primarily focused on software development within the same domain.
* Knowledge and experience with modern software development practices, including version control and workflow management tools including JIRA, Clarity, Github, Gitlab, Subversion, Perforce, Bitbucket, Bamboo, Crucible, Jenkins, etc.
* Knowledge and experience with process control/controls engineering industry standards, platforms/languages/technologies, including PLCs, FPGAs, embedded controllers/microcontrollers, RTOS programming environments, HMI and SCADA solutions.
* Prior experience authoring and/or augmenting motion control software packages for Industrial or Entertainment focused applications.
* Demonstrable technical writing, documentation, and communication skills.
* Willing to travel on behalf of company to project destinations for the purposes of business trips (between overnight and 6 months stay), and also relocation (between 6 month and two year stay).

* Experience with: IEC61131-3 programming languages, EtherCAT, ADS, DS-402, Profibus, DMX/sACN, OPC-UA, MQTT, C#, Python, Java.
* Familiarity and/or experience with: MS Visual Studio, RSLogix, Matlab, Robot OS (ROS), AutoDesk Maya, Motion Builder, AutoCAD
* Experience with TwinCAT3 is a strong plus.
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, electrical engineering, computer engineering from accredited college or university. Advanced degrees preferred.

description:
Can you imagine walking around Disneyland, knowing you help the fun stay up and running? If you’re interested in doing work that makes people feel happy and safe, keep reading…

We’re looking for skilled, confident Electronic Technicians who have experience maintaining and repairing equipment like the rides and attractions at Disneyland and Disney California Adventure. If this sounds like a challenge you’re ready to undertake, apply today to join the team!

This position currently reports to the Reliability Manager.

We proudly and enthusiastically welcome Electronic Technicians with experience in the US Military.

New Higher Pay rate!
The starting pay rate for this position is $30.75 per hour.

Responsibilities

You would join a unit whose mission is to keep everything working perfectly – it’s all about minimizing downtime and maximizing Guest experience. Your skills will help keep the kids smiling and the parents feeling relaxed and secure.

Every day as an Electronic Technician is different. On any given day or night, you might:
  • Be called to repair circuits/assemblies at Pirates of the Caribbean;
  • Troubleshoot high-efficiency laser lighting systems for one of the Main Street parades;
  • Re-set breakers on the Haunted Mansion;
  • Perform preventive maintenance on the rides in Toy Story Land;
  • Repair and maintain electrical/electronic systems/assemblies on It’s A Small World;
  • Replace/install lamps and switches to keep the parks light and bright;
  • Insure the Monorail hums along with PLC preventive maintenance;
  • Work on animations like the Yeti on the Matterhorn, on R2D2, and on the Little Mermaid;
  • Use your experience and know-how to spot problems before they happen;
  • Experience the Parks at night, when the Guests have left and it’s just you and the rides; and
  • Enjoy Disney with your exclusive Cast Member perks, including steep discounts on things people like you

Basic Qualifications

We proudly and enthusiastically welcome Electronic Technicians with experience in the US Military.

To be successful in this role, you will need:
  • Technical competence, the ability to read and understand detailed instructions, blueprints, flowcharts, schematics and engineering documents, and pass all compliance necessary for technical and safety training
  • Knowledge of control and repair of circuits and motor
  • Sharp troubleshooting skills and comfort working alone or as part of a team
  • Ability to evaluate the scope of a job, determine needed parts/materials, and order through authorized vendors
  • Expertise using common hand tools, meters, gauges and other associated test and measurement equipment, as well as ability to measure current, voltage and amperage
  • Mastery of the basic math skills needed to do the job, the ability to differentiate colors, computer literacy, and full understanding of the National Electric Code
  • Familiarity with CCTV systems, audio/public address systems, theatrical lighting fixtures, video projectors and wireless networks
  • Reliable on-time behavior and the flexibility to work at night as well as on weekends/holidays
  • Good communication skills with outside vendors as well as fellow Cast Members, a Guest/customer focus, high energy, respect for diversity, reliability, and a can-do, team-first attitude
  • Stamina and the physical ability to undertake the job. You might walk, bicycle, bend, kneel, climb, push vehicles to re-position them for repair, work with arms/hands above shoulder level for an extended period of time, climb (sometimes as high as 200 ft.) and more, all on a regular basis
  • Ability to use 2-way radios, learn CMMS (MAXIMO work order system), and attend/pass compliance and other training sessions to ensure correct maintenance documentation
  • Electronic Technicians may work outdoors in all weather conditions, in an industrial workshop, in kitchens with wet/slippery surfaces, and may have occasional exposure to high temperatures, noise levels and fumes
  • In addition to the physical tasks listed above, Electronic Technicians may need to push/pull and/or lift up to 10 lbs. constantly, up to 25 lbs. frequently, up to 75 lbs. occasionally, and rarely up to/over 100 lbs.

Preferred Qualifications

  • 2 – 5 years of experience
  • Ideal backgrounds include trade school, apprenticeship and related experience

Preferred Education

We’re more interested in your years of experience – and your mastery of the skills needed to do the job well – than a degree, but education in the field is always welcome.

We proudly and enthusiastically welcome Electronic Technicians with experience in the US Military.

Additional Information:

KEYWORD: DLR Casting, dlrcasting, Disneyland Resort Casting Hourly Jobs , DLRResortRoles, DLR Resort Roles, Facilities, HeroesWorkHere, electronic, electronic technician, component-level troubleshooting, soldering

About Disneyland Resort:

When Walt Disney opened Disneyland on July 17, 1955, he said he hoped it would be “a source of joy and inspiration to all the world.” Since then, the Disneyland Resort has welcomed more than 800 million guests, expanding to become an approximately 500- acre, multifaceted, world-class family resort destination, complete with two renowned Disney theme parks, three hotels and the exciting shopping, dining and entertainment area known as Downtown Disney District. Through a combination of creativity, technology and innovation, the resort brings storytelling to new heights, and Disneyland Resort cast members play an integral part in bringing that Disney magic to life for thousands of guests every day.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc., which is part of a business we call Disneyland Resort.

Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

description:
Job Summary:

Disney Streaming is looking for a QA Analyst II to join the Quality Assurance team. The Quality Assurance team is responsible for validating all work before it goes to production, this includes software: web, mobile, connected device applications, media, non-consumer facing products and more. Additionally, the Quality Assurance teams creates and maintains the framework used for automation testing at DSS and performs all performance testing.
  • The QA Analyst will be responsible for analyzing requirements, user stories, and design documentation to ensure that they are clearly defined, complete, and testable.
  • The QA Analyst will be responsible for the creation and execution of test plans, test cases, and test scripts to verify new and existing (regression) software functionality.
  • The QA Analyst will test the applications via Black Box, Regression, Release, Stress, and Negative testing methods.
  • The ideal candidate will contribute both to the definition and the enforcement of quality assurance processes and procedures based on best practice methodology.
  • The QA Analyst will be accountable for participating in test activities, creating detailed test plans and writing test cases.
  • Provide status updates for all QA/TPM/Dev resources during the testing cycle.
  • Proactively learn the backend infrastructure, new testing and technology trends, upcoming releases.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Typically has 2+ years of experience in Quality Assurance or a similar customer centric technical field.

Preferred Education

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Computer Science or related field, or equivalent training or work experience

Additional Information:

Disney Streaming is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including Disney+, ESPN+, Star+, and Hulu. Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. We serve consumers by bringing the world’s most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. We strive daily to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives consumers the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location.
