description:
Job Summary:

The Disney Media, Entertainment, and Distribution (DMED) product team is responsible for the product strategy, definition, development, and operation of the world’s most engaging digital products, serving millions of consumers across the world across brands like ESPN, Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, and more.

In this role, the Senior Product Manager I will be a member of the Fantasy and Gaming product team within DMED, and will play a critical role in building out and maintaining ESPN’s sports betting-related products while also contributing to ESPN’s industry-leading free-to-play gaming business.

The Senior Product Manager I, Betting and Games will work with product design, engineering, QA, project management and other stakeholders to conceive, design, build, and grow sports betting products and integrations across ESPN’s digital touchpoints. A successful candidate will also contribute to the creation and growth of digital sports games that are made available to users across ESPN Digital platforms, including the ESPN Fantasy App, ESPN App, and ESPN.com. A successful candidate in this role will serve as the day-to-day lead for active design and development of key sports betting products for ESPN and DMED.

The right candidate will be a passionate sports fan with deep knowledge of game mechanics and market trends, including sports betting. Furthermore, this person will have a diverse background and a demonstrable track record of successfully building and managing scaled, high-quality, innovative applications, products, and services for a consumer-oriented organization. The right candidate must be a self-motivated, team player who can drive the overall business objectives of the organization. This person must be able to work closely with other internal and external product and technology experts.

The Product Manager, Games will report directly to the Director of Product Management, Fantasy Games.

Responsibilities:

  • Articulate a product vision for sports betting at ESPN as well as other interactive experiences, partnering with Engineering, Design, Editorial, Business, and other Product teams to deliver engaging experiences on all platforms.
  • Define a roadmap and execute on the development of those features and improvements, through an agile software development lifecycle, across multiple platforms concurrently.
  • Write and communicate product requirements effectively to developers, designers, and stakeholders.
  • Work closely with development teams on a daily basis to build and deliver features for products.
  • Collect and analyze data to understand behavioral patterns of our users and use that insight to improve fan experiences and increase engagement within the Fantasy and Betting product suite.
  • Balance the priorities of a diverse group of stakeholders, while still delivering high quality products in consistent releases.
  • Provide transparency and recommendations on project trade-offs, understanding and coordinating dependencies across multiple teams with competing priorities.
  • Facilitate the ideation and development of new features and functionality around ESPN’s consumer-facing products.
  • Translate strategy and product vision into project deliverables with launch targets.
  • Become an expert in sports betting mechanics and ESPN digital products.
  • Communicate effectively with senior executives and external partners.
  • Be an ambassador for ESPN digital gaming and products internally and externally

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Passionate sports fan and regular user of ESPN products and services.
  • Experience playing ESPN Fantasy games across a variety of platforms.
  • Basic understanding of intricacies across sports, i.e. scoring, stats, etc.
  • Experience managing product requirements and release deliverables in JIRA.
  • Passion for sports betting and other emerging markets within Sports.

Required Education

  • 5+ years of professional experience in product management.
  • Demonstrated experience and knowledge driving product development.
  • Previous experience managing product requirements, release deliverables, and technical documentation
  • Previous experience working with large, cross-functional, agile development teams.
  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
  • Strong ability to multi-task and context-switch with ease, in a fast-paced and ever-evolving organization.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in data analysis and analytical thinking, preferably with Adobe Analytics or other similar tools.
  • High level of comfort communicating with executives inside and outside of ESPN, including strategic partners.
  • Familiarity and passion for app development on native platforms (iOS/Android).
  • High energy and capable of multi-tasking and context-switching with ease, in a fast-paced and ever-evolving organization.
  • Ability to operate effectively in a team-oriented and collaborative environment.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to work cross organizationally.
  • Process-driven and extremely detail-oriented.
  • Bachelor’s degree

Additional Information:

ESPN, Inc., The Worldwide Leader in Sports, is the leading multinational, multimedia sports entertainment company featuring the broadest portfolio of multimedia sports assets with over 50 business entities. Headquartered in Bristol, Connecticut, ESPN is 80% owned by ABC, Inc. (a subsidiary of The Walt Disney Company), and 20% by the Hearst Corporation.

ESPN was founded by Bill Rasmussen and launched on September 7, 1979. Now with over 6,500 employees, each year ESPN televises more than 5,100 live and/or original hours of sports programming. The company’s mission is to serve sports fans. Anytime. Anywhere.

Imagine a career with an organization that brings smiles to millions every day. Imagine working with people whose passion for what they do is simply indescribable. We are The Walt Disney Company, live with a rich legacy of innovation, entertainment, and lifelong memories. With our vast array of both businesses and professionals, you’ll have the opportunity to join a team that’s beloved around the world, and to find out how it feels to love what you do. We invite you to discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you‘ve been looking for.

ESPN is an equal opportunity employer – Female/Minority/Veteran/Disability. Our goal is to create an inclusive workplace for all.




This role is considered hybrid, which means the employee will work a portion of their time on-site from a Company designated location and the remainder of their time remotely.

About Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution:

Comprised of the Company’s international business units and various direct-to-consumer streaming services, Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) aligns technology, media distribution and advertising sales into a single business segment to create and deliver personalized entertainment experiences to consumers around the world.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Disney Streaming Technology LLC, which is part of a business we call Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution.

Disney Streaming Technology LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

description:
Job Summary:

Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) brings together the Company’s best-in-class product, technology, and commercialization teams into one global organization. DMED is responsible for all distribution, networking, engineering operations, sales, advertising, P&L management, data, and key technology functions for the Company's worldwide content engines. DMED manages operations of the Company's streaming services including Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+, and Disney+ HotStar as well as domestic broadcast and cable television networks. DMED Technology delivers Disney content to users, viewers, and fans worldwide with more choice, personalization, and convenience than ever before. We do this for the DMED segment and for The Walt Disney Company by driving strategic development and use of technology; innovating scalable systems, platforms, and products that empower our businesses and engage our consumers. With global scale, local presence, and deep technological excellence DMED Technology optimizes DMED and The Walt Disney Company’s technology, platforms, and resources while bringing creative ideas to life through industry-shaping approaches. This role is a part of the DMED Media Software Engineering team - which drives design and engineering for DMED Technology’s global infrastructure and production facilities. Areas of focus include content creation systems and the distribution of digital and linear networks worldwide; our private global fiber network; linear content protection and security infrastructure; linear production and content management systems and services; radio stations; video encoding; media processing; interactive graphics and animation technologies; and leading all testing-to-adoption of video formats and standards. We strive to be a diverse team, passionate about great technology applied in imaginative ways to solve complex business challenges. We are a motivated team committed to lifelong learning and improvement both in and out of the office. We position ourselves to be flexible and adaptable to change both in how we execute projects and through the technologies used to deliver our solutions. We care about detail because every pixel, every line of code, and every consumer interaction with our products will determine whether we are delivering on our commitment to producing the absolute best. You will be joining a talented team that works interdependently toward aggressive goals delivering technically sound solutions. We work to ensure we share both accountability and credit as a team. We often include our clients as part of our team and we work to connect on a human level, understanding their world so we can best deliver software they will love to use.

As a Senior Software Engineer, the candidate will focus on engineering efficient and reusable front-end systems that drive complex web applications. They will use deep and creative UI engineering skills to take an influential role in iteration and continuous deployment of new features, functionality, and products to our customers. They will drive an agile and automation culture where collaboration with backend and product teams to drive UI architecture, champion UI code quality, and build optimized experiences for end-users. The candidate is someone who has risen through web software development ranks - possessing 4+ years' experience in design and architecture of highly scalable and performant web applications, with a proven ability to identify and implement improvements across codebases, product areas and systems. The candidate must be fluent in ES6+ JavaScript, while also combining expertise with modern asynchronous programming, libraries, tools, and runtimes to engineer abstract, secure, reusable, and testable UI components and applications; having collaborated tightly with creative teams to champion and influence component reusability, maintainability, and configurability across a diverse UI portfolio. The right person will blend their engineering abilities while collaborating with Product Designers, Product Managers, and Software Engineers to deliver compelling client-facing products. The Walt Disney Company is a large company, ideally the candidate will have previous experience working in multiple roles. We strive to for tasks to be completed quickly, at high quality, and are committed to the agile methodology. Our work is guided by lean principles. We are looking for a passionate, impactful, technical leader who wants to do their absolute best work and make their mark every day, to add their chapter to the long and storied history of The Walt Disney Company. Someone who holds themselves and their teammates accountable in a professional, collaborative manner. A collaborative technologist who seeks to bring the best out in themselves and those around them. Someone who can bring fresh perspective and innovative insight to our initiatives.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide hands on UI engineering leadership across various product teams
  • Collaborate with leads to design and architect cloud native and service-oriented UI components and applications
  • Collaborate with team and peers to design complex applications. Review code for design, testability, and clear usability
  • Enable continuous improvement by identifying opportunities to improve the system/product/service with each iteration.
  • Enable continuous deployment by championing quality engineering practices: linting, unit testing, web UI testing, pipeline automation
  • Exercises judgment in selecting methods and techniques to resolve issues.
  • Identify problems and opportunities and recommend the development of solutions
  • Collaborate with and influence product teams to design, build and maintain system standards, processes, and adoption
  • Check-in valuable, clean code daily adding new features and capabilities.
  • Create reference implementations for the purpose of mentoring and leading more junior staff.
  • Investigate and resolve production issues from end user (UI) to persistence layer.
  • Work with the project management team to ensure that all deliverables are on time and of high quality
  • Assist in rapid prototyping of design concepts to prove and test ideas with end-users

Basic Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in web application development or software engineering in a large enterprise environment using modern frameworks
  • Expertise with ES6+ JavaScript, modern JavaScript libraries, REST/SOA patterns.
  • High-level of fluency and experience using JavaScript, React, Node.js
  • Strong attention to detail to ensure UI code is written in a way that can be tested both with unit tests and automated UI tests.
  • Experience with deployment tools to packaging and deploy components using webpack or similar tools.
  • Strong understanding of browsers, devices, OS, and other user agent interoperability and compatibility concerns
  • Experience working with high-performing teams using Agile and Lean methodologies and frameworks
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
A passion for efficiency and collaboration, with a history of establishing great relationships with UX and Product Management teams across time zones

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Hands on experience with reactive programming using Redux, TypeScript, SCSS, Jest, WebSocket protocol, Enzyme, Selenium/Nightwatch, Sauce Labs, Webpack, Babel, Node/Express, oAuth 2.0/JWT
  • Working knowledge of GitLab CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Kubernetes.
  • Previous work experience in media production, broadcast and/or distribution.
  • Experience working with vendor teams to ensure quality, timeliness, and alignment with project goals.
  • Strong curiosity about how Disney delivers Magic and a desire to be a part of it

Required Education

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Engineering, or another technical field

Preferred Education

  • A Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related technical discipline is highly desirable.

Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

sections.text:
Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) brings together the Company’s best-in-class product, technology, and commercialization teams into one global organization. DMED is responsible for all distribution, networking, engineering operations, sales, advertising, P&L management, data, and key technology functions for the Company's worldwide content engines. DMED manages operations of the Company's streaming services including Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+, and Disney+ HotStar as well as domestic broadcast and cable television networks. DMED Technology delivers Disney content to users, viewers, and fans worldwide with more choice, personalization, and convenience than ever before. We do this for the DMED segment and for The Walt Disney Company by driving strategic development and use of technology; innovating scalable systems, platforms, and products that empower our businesses and engage our consumers. With global scale, local presence, and deep technological excellence DMED Technology optimizes DMED and The Walt Disney Company’s technology, platforms, and resources while bringing creative ideas to life through industry-shaping approaches. This role is a part of the DMED Media Software Engineering team - which drives design and engineering for DMED Technology’s global infrastructure and production facilities. Areas of focus include content creation systems and the distribution of digital and linear networks worldwide; our private global fiber network; linear content protection and security infrastructure; linear production and content management systems and services; radio stations; video encoding; media processing; interactive graphics and animation technologies; and leading all testing-to-adoption of video formats and standards. We strive to be a diverse team, passionate about great technology applied in imaginative ways to solve complex business challenges. We are a motivated team committed to lifelong learning and improvement both in and out of the office. We position ourselves to be flexible and adaptable to change both in how we execute projects and through the technologies used to deliver our solutions. We care about detail because every pixel, every line of code, and every consumer interaction with our products will determine whether we are delivering on our commitment to producing the absolute best. You will be joining a talented team that works interdependently toward aggressive goals delivering technically sound solutions. We work to ensure we share both accountability and credit as a team. We often include our clients as part of our team and we work to connect on a human level, understanding their world so we can best deliver software they will love to use.

As a Senior Software Engineer, the candidate will focus on engineering efficient and reusable front-end systems that drive complex web applications. They will use deep and creative UI engineering skills to take an influential role in iteration and continuous deployment of new features, functionality, and products to our customers. They will drive an agile and automation culture where collaboration with backend and product teams to drive UI architecture, champion UI code quality, and build optimized experiences for end-users. The candidate is someone who has risen through web software development ranks - possessing 4+ years' experience in design and architecture of highly scalable and performant web applications, with a proven ability to identify and implement improvements across codebases, product areas and systems. The candidate must be fluent in ES6+ JavaScript, while also combining expertise with modern asynchronous programming, libraries, tools, and runtimes to engineer abstract, secure, reusable, and testable UI components and applications; having collaborated tightly with creative teams to champion and influence component reusability, maintainability, and configurability across a diverse UI portfolio. The right person will blend their engineering abilities while collaborating with Product Designers, Product Managers, and Software Engineers to deliver compelling client-facing products. The Walt Disney Company is a large company, ideally the candidate will have previous experience working in multiple roles. We strive to for tasks to be completed quickly, at high quality, and are committed to the agile methodology. Our work is guided by lean principles. We are looking for a passionate, impactful, technical leader who wants to do their absolute best work and make their mark every day, to add their chapter to the long and storied history of The Walt Disney Company. Someone who holds themselves and their teammates accountable in a professional, collaborative manner. A collaborative technologist who seeks to bring the best out in themselves and those around them. Someone who can bring fresh perspective and innovative insight to our initiatives.

Provide hands on UI engineering leadership across various product teams 
* Collaborate with leads to design and architect cloud native and service-oriented UI components and applications 
* Collaborate with team and peers to design complex applications. Review code for design, testability, and clear usability 
* Enable continuous improvement by identifying opportunities to improve the system/product/service with each iteration. 
* Enable continuous deployment by championing quality engineering practices: linting, unit testing, web UI testing, pipeline automation 
* Exercises judgment in selecting methods and techniques to resolve issues. 
* Identify problems and opportunities and recommend the development of solutions 
* Collaborate with and influence product teams to design, build and maintain system standards, processes, and adoption 
* Check-in valuable, clean code daily adding new features and capabilities. 
* Create reference implementations for the purpose of mentoring and leading more junior staff. 
* Investigate and resolve production issues from end user (UI) to persistence layer. 
* Work with the project management team to ensure that all deliverables are on time and of high quality 
* Assist in rapid prototyping of design concepts to prove and test ideas with end-users

5+ years of experience in web application development or software engineering in a large enterprise environment using modern frameworks 
* Expertise with ES6+ JavaScript, modern JavaScript libraries, REST/SOA patterns. 
* High-level of fluency and experience using JavaScript, React, Node.js 
* Strong attention to detail to ensure UI code is written in a way that can be tested both with unit tests and automated UI tests. 
* Experience with deployment tools to packaging and deploy components using webpack or similar tools. 
* Strong understanding of browsers, devices, OS, and other user agent interoperability and compatibility concerns 
* Experience working with high-performing teams using Agile and Lean methodologies and frameworks 
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills 


A passion for efficiency and collaboration, with a history of establishing great relationships with UX and Product Management teams across time zones

Hands on experience with reactive programming using Redux, TypeScript, SCSS, Jest, WebSocket protocol, Enzyme, Selenium/Nightwatch, Sauce Labs, Webpack, Babel, Node/Express, oAuth 2.0/JWT 
* Working knowledge of GitLab CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Kubernetes. 
* Previous work experience in media production, broadcast and/or distribution. 
* Experience working with vendor teams to ensure quality, timeliness, and alignment with project goals. 
* Strong curiosity about how Disney delivers Magic and a desire to be a part of it
A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Engineering, or another technical field

description:
Job Summary:

Imagine yourself as a Sr. Workforce Analyst in People Insights where your natural curiosity for problem solving will help ensure we are leveraging data effectively to drive decisions within Human Resources. In this role, you will be able to blaze new paths in this data rich environment through reporting and analysis that support functions within HR and the business. You will have the chance to leverage your expertise and knowledge to maximize the Company’s investment in our employees through complex analysis, creative resolutions and impactful solutions.

You have a curiosity that leads you to always ask, “What's possible?” and you have the ability to bring those concepts to reality in everything you touch from operational reporting to strategic analytics.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with organizational leaders, analysts and subject matter experts to understand business processes, evaluate needs and analyze data
  • Identify areas of opportunity to increase operational efficiency and influence clients, across job levels and business units, towards the optimal solutions
  • Provide consultative support for clients across the organization to truly understand core questions and current priorities to ensure reporting and analysis align with business objectives
  • Work collaboratively with other team members to ensure internal alignment and efficiency
  • Empower stakeholders to self-serve, interpret, and apply insights through training and consultation
  • Effectively articulate actionable information to help make informed business decisions.
  • Translate high-level business objectives into consistent, accurate, efficient and effective reporting and analysis
  • Evaluate business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions
  • Provide subject matter expertise regarding data, systems and the business, advising on how to best utilize the data
  • Connect to and transform data using a consistent, sustainable approach leveraging our suite of BI tools and data.

Basic Qualifications:

  • You have strong critical thinking skills and ask relevant questions to improve processes and build efficiencies
  • You are capable of solving complex problems in creative, sustainable ways
  • You possess the talent for strong influencing and networking skills that result in consultative relationships; supporting synergy and collaboration
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; Able to communicate complex analytical concepts in a compelling way to non-technical audiences
  • You have a passion for attention to detail and quality
  • You have the ability to make timely and effective decisions to meet fluid deadlines and changing priorities
  • You can focus on the here and now while keeping an eye to the future to prioritize work
  • You are proactive and self-motivated with the capability to work autonomously and make independent decisions to meet deliverables with minimal oversight
  • You are passionate about continuous improvement with a strong desire to continue learning in order to stay relevant to business changes and industry trends
  • You are highly skilled in business intelligence tools with a thorough understanding of data and systems' infrastructures
  • You have a strong technical foundation and experience applying your knowledge to develop reports and analyses
  • You can effectively handle and maintain confidential information
  • Experience with Cognos, Tableau, Workday, and Snowflake is a plus.
You will write the rest of the chapters because this is YOUR story. And that story could begin here!

description:
Job Summary:

The Walt Disney Imagineering Technology Studio Art & Media Pipeline team is looking for a Senior level developer with 8-10 years’ experience to assist with programming tasks and technical responsibilities of the group. The Technology Studio is a group of technologists working within Imagineering to create and deploy software and software/hardware integration tools to help increase the capabilities of Imagineering art and design practice.

Responsibilities:

  • Digital pipeline tools development for 3D content creation including theme-park visualizations, animated animatronic animations, ride vehicles, simulated projectors, and other dynamic show elements
  • Troubleshoot and support previously built software products and/or proof-of-concepts
  • Engage with designers and artists to better support them and gather new requirements

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 8-10 year's experience as Technical Director or similar working in VFX Pipeline and/or Video game pipeline
  • Autodesk Maya (scripting and API (C++/Python/OpenMaya API) development experience as well animation rigging experience
  • Programming proficiency in Python (with an emphasis on packaging/deployment/ custom user tools)
  • Unreal (general, asset workflow / basic blueprints)
  • Working with Windows systems
  • Communication skills (written and spoken), problem-solving, adaptability and a willingness to mentor junior developers

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Virtual Reality experience in both content development and/or systems development
  • Game engine development (game logic, plugin, core engine) experience
  • CAD software (SolidWorks, REVIT, Rhino or equivalent)
  • Shotgrid
  • UI/UX prototyping or programming experience and/or tools (PyQt, Qt, Wx, CSS)
  • Web programming (HTML5/CSS3, Javascript, jQuery, Ruby on Rails, Django)
  • Developing cross-platform software (Windows, Mac OS, Linux)
  • Strong 3D math skills and computer graphics programming experience (OpenGL/DirectX)
  • Ability to learn new APIs and SDKs quickly
  • Familiarity with USD
  • Familiarity with REZ
  • Shader programming experience (GLSL/HLSL/Cg)
  • Physics based simulation (Simulink, ANSYS)
  • Knowledge of 3D/2D content creation software (Autodesk Maya, MotionBuilder, SolidWorks, Houdini, Substance Painter, etc.)

Required Education

  • Bachelors or equivalent experience

description:
Job Summary:

Be a part of an innovative team and culture…

Imagine working side-by-side with industry leaders in your field of study. Imagine building upon the skills you’ve learned in the classroom through real-world hands-on work experience. Now imagine yourself in a Professional Internship with Disney Corporate. When your extraordinary talents, our renowned legacy and the promise of an even brighter future unite, just imagine the stories you could be part of!

Disney Worldwide Shared Services is an expanding team of process experts and accounting professionals who provide shared accounting services to The Walt Disney Company, inclusive of all Segments. You'll be directly working with the team supporting Corporate Real Estate and partnering with them to ensure proper accounting of lease holdings across The Walt Disney Company.

Responsibilities:


A Day in the Life…
  • Journal Entries
  • Balance Sheet Account Reconciliations
  • Accounting Research and Analysis
  • Accruals
  • Close Related Tasks
  • Lease Accounting Straight Line Schedules
  • SOX Compliance
  • Processing Invoices

Basic Qualifications:

What we are looking for…
  • Strong quantitative and analytical skills
  • Intermediate to advanced MS Excel skills
  • The ability to build strong relationships in a highly professional “client service orientation” environment
  • Team player
  • Solid interpersonal and organizational skills
  • Excellent communicator in both oral and written settings
  • Flexible, “special-projects” orientation coupled with solid multi-tasking abilities
  • Self-driven, independent thinker

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Previous accounting work experience

Required Education

  • Incoming student, currently pursuing, or recently graduated within 6 months with a Graduate Master's degree in Accounting
  • A or B in Intermediate Accounting
  • Undergraduate degree in Accounting

Preferred Education

  • Working towards a CPA

Additional Information:

Internship Eligibility:
  • Must be enrolled in a college/university taking at least one class in the semester/quarter (spring/fall) prior to participation in the internship program OR must have graduated from a college/university within the past six (6) months OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Professional Internship
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must not have completed one year of continual employment on a Disney internship or program.
  • Must possess unrestricted work authorization
  • Program Dates: Candidates must be fully available for 40 hours/week from June 2022 through January 2023
  • Must provide own housing and transportation to and from work in the Orlando area. We provide limited housing opportunities for Florida Based Professional Interns through American Campus Communities, for more information click here.

Materials Required:

College transcripts (official or unofficial) - Please upload your transcript while completing the online application
To upload this document:

  • Log into your dashboard
  • Click the second tab "Applications"
  • Select "Submitted Applications"
  • Click on the title of this position
  • Click the "Add Files" button
  • Under what you want to add, select "Transcript"
  • Be sure your document is saved in this format: FirstName_LastName_Transcript

Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of Disney’s Parks and Resorts business segment. Representing more than 150 disciplines, its talented corps of Imagineers are responsible for the creation of Disney resorts, theme parks and attractions, hotels, water parks, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, cruise ships and new media technology projects

Responsibilities:

  • Schedules meetings, distributes mail, fills catering requests, orders department supplies, takes meeting notes, logs, and fills out forms.
  • Manages expense reports, process timesheets.
  • Acts as backup for senior management’s secretarial functions.
  • Manages calendars, screens calls, makes travel arrangements domestic & international, sets up & maintains dept filing system, completes & tracks expense reports and purchase requisitions.
  • Coordinates & prepares office space for new employees.
  • Trains temporaries or new personnel occasionally.
  • Manages contract and temporary employee requests
  • Maintains confidentiality of highly sensitive information.
  • Answers department specific questions over telephone and redirects calls.
  • Review decks and proofread for spelling accuracy.
  • Acts as liaison for managers in department or division.
  • Compiles information for department manuals.
  • Monitors department reports for accuracy.
  • Answers or directs complex questions in management’s absence.
  • Must be task-oriented with an excellent sense of priority, highly organized and capable of handling a number of sensitive and important issues simultaneously.
  • Performs other duties as assigned
  • Minimum 3 years’ experience in an administrative support role.
  • Working knowledge of operating office equipment.
  • Ability to proactively manage calendar tracking.
  • Knowledge of letter and report formatting.
  • Strong experience in managing expense reports both domestic & international.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Ability to interface with all levels of the organization.
  • Proven ability to multi-task.
  • Extensive knowledge of Software packages including:
    • Word
    • Excel
    • Outlook
    • PowerPoint
    • SAP
  • Very good Business Vocabulary Skills
  • Very good Business English Skills
  • Very good Business Math Skills
  • Very good Business Double-checking

  • High School Diploma or equivalent

  • Some College preferred

description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of Disney Parks, Experiences and Products business segment. Representing more than 150 disciplines, its talented corps of Imagineers are responsible for the creation of Disney resorts, theme parks and attractions, hotels, water parks, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, cruise ships and new media technology projects worldwide which includes other Disney Intellectual Property such as Marvel, Pixar and Lucasfilm.

Innovation is at the center of everything we do at WDI, and nothing reflects that more than our work environment. We celebrate collaborative thinking and promote cross-disciplinary partnerships to foster a culture of diversity and creativity.

Our vision is to expand the capabilities of Imagineering into new product categories and industry-leading innovations that will define the future of entertainment.

The New Experience Development Executive is a leadership role within Walt Disney Imagineering charged with expanding Disney reach and growth by developing innovative experiences for new markets and new consumer segments. This experienced executive brings equal parts creative visionary, product strategist, brand expert and process pioneer. Our mission is to invent new ways of working, exploring and inventing with creativity at the core of all we do. This leader harnesses that mission and their well-honed skills to combine our incredible wealth of stories and brand strengths into new experiential categories that span physical and virtual realms. This individual is a master relationship manager who will build and leverage a network spanning project and creative executives, business and investment partners and stakeholders across and beyond The Walt Disney Company. This leader thrives in an entrepreneurial, fast-advancing environment, where consumer and market insights, creative instinct, value creation and team building meet to take ideas from initial brainstorm to an approved proposal at the highest levels of the Company.

The New Experience Development Executive will report to the VP-Creative & Advanced Development, Disney Live Entertainment. The team will relocate to Orlando, Florida in late 2024.

Responsibilities:

Key Responsibilities
  • Lead ideation of new experience initiatives and proof of concept ideas into scalable applications that bring Disney magic to new frontiers
  • Transform Disney storytelling and IP into experiences that target consumer desire and demand at a global scale
  • Partner with creative directors, producers and experience creators across the range of Walt Disney Imagineering development process
  • Define Disney brand quality standards and process in new partnership models
  • Develop an integrated menu plan of projects, investments and scale to forecast Company, DPEP and WDI planning of capital, growth and talent
  • Define resource, casting, talent and consultant strategies across a range of initiatives in partnership with relevant studio and department leaders
  • Actively generate and seek out content partnership potential across broader TWDC in association with Studios, Disney Television Networks, and DMED businesses (Disney+, Hulu, etc…)
  • Partner with Global Development to inform and advance new business models, schedules and deal terms, and clear articulation of WDI roles, responsibilities and commitments in contracts with outside partners
  • Challenge the status quo of process, roles and techniques to unlock innovation and speed to market of new business concepts
  • Ensure new experience concepts are feasible within cost, schedule and quality parameters defined by the business case
  • Define the Disney differentiator brand and IP elements and required specialty procurement strategies leveraging internal and external capabilities
  • Work across the WDI organization to define and approve process, including responsibilities, staffing and soft cost plans, and validated delivery methodologies to drive efficient models of product development and execution
  • Lead the upfront reporting of progress, milestones, budget and risk management for assigned New Experience initiatives
  • Oversee smooth transition of approved project(s) based on an agreed plan for WDI detailed design, delivery and execution as required
  • Highly complex with high risk, novel process and models and high degree of sensitivity
Communication/Influence and Effectiveness
  • Entrepreneurial thinker comfortable defining new ways of working along the way
  • Develop and build teams with diverse, globally-relevant experiences and mindsets
  • Develop a roster of outside industry-leading creative consultants, business partners, and cultural thought leaders to contribute to existing and new DPEP business endeavors
  • Create presentation materials that synthesize business and creative considerations for senior level DPEP leadership that enable confident review and approvals
  • Assist in setting strategies and priorities and developing deliverables for the executive review (with Chairman, CEO, DPEP Chairman & DPEP Executive Committee)
  • Partner with a wide range of stakeholders, all with responsibility for shared success

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 10 years relevant experience in leading business strategies/projects
  • Proven advanced knowledge of Disney or similarly complex brand(s) with an expert ability to translate and evolve brand into business-leading growth ideas
  • Deep knowledge of new and established trends in the travel, tourism, entertainment and leisure industries
  • A strong, confident creative sensibility balanced with strategic and business parameters of success
  • Understanding of strategic planning, business principles, forecasting and budget management at a global level
  • Experienced in leading the integration of multiple data sources into clear, actionable insights to build concrete solutions
  • Keen understanding of the creative and delivery process, in particular new product types and innovative concepts by Disney and the broader industry
  • Excellent communication skills, including verbally, written and in formal speech/presentation settings, and strong executive presence
  • Strong storytelling and communication skill; paints a compelling vision of what’s possible
  • Proven, trusted builder of relationships and partnerships at all levels of a complex, matrix and globally
  • Positive attitude and proven ability to influence partners and create an energized environment
  • Skilled manager of teams, including prioritizing work and driving high level output
  • Flexible and adaptable to changing priorities and business needs
  • Ability to both think at a high level and execute at a tactical level
  • Willingness to travel domestically and internationally

Required Education

  • BS/BA in finance, business, design and/or engineering. MBA a plus

Additional Information:

This role will initially be based in Glendale, CA but will relocate to Orlando, FL in late 2024.

Our Benefits: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

This leader thrives in an entrepreneurial, fast-advancing environment, where consumer and market insights, creative instinct, value creation and team building meet to take ideas from initial brainstorm to an approved proposal at the highest levels of the Company. 
The New Experience Development Executive will report to the VP-Creative & Advanced Development, Disney Live Entertainment. The team will relocate to Orlando, Florida in late 2024.

Key Responsibilities
* Lead ideation of new experience initiatives and proof of concept ideas into scalable applications that bring Disney magic to new frontiers
* Transform Disney storytelling and IP into experiences that target consumer desire and demand at a global scale 
* Partner with creative directors, producers and experience creators across the range of Walt Disney Imagineering development process
* Define Disney brand quality standards and process in new partnership models 
* Develop an integrated menu plan of projects, investments and scale to forecast Company, DPEP and WDI planning of capital, growth and talent 
* Define resource, casting, talent and consultant strategies across a range of initiatives in partnership with relevant studio and department leaders 
* Actively generate and seek out content partnership potential across broader TWDC in association with Studios, Disney Television Networks, and DMED businesses (Disney+, Hulu, etc…)
* Partner with Global Development to inform and advance new business models, schedules and deal terms, and clear articulation of WDI roles, responsibilities and commitments in contracts with outside partners 
* Challenge the status quo of process, roles and techniques to unlock innovation and speed to market of new business concepts 
* Ensure new experience concepts are feasible within cost, schedule and quality parameters defined by the business case
* Define the Disney differentiator brand and IP elements and required specialty procurement strategies leveraging internal and external capabilities 
* Work across the WDI organization to define and approve process, including responsibilities, staffing and soft cost plans, and validated delivery methodologies to drive efficient models of product development and execution
* Lead the upfront reporting of progress, milestones, budget and risk management for assigned New Experience initiatives 
* Oversee smooth transition of approved project(s) based on an agreed plan for WDI detailed design, delivery and execution as required 
* Highly complex with high risk, novel process and models and high degree of sensitivity

Communication/Influence and Effectiveness
* Entrepreneurial thinker comfortable defining new ways of working along the way
* Develop and build teams with diverse, globally-relevant experiences and mindsets 
* Develop a roster of outside industry-leading creative consultants, business partners, and cultural thought leaders to contribute to existing and new DPEP business endeavors
* Create presentation materials that synthesize business and creative considerations for senior level DPEP leadership that enable confident review and approvals
* Assist in setting strategies and priorities and developing deliverables for the executive review (with Chairman, CEO, DPEP Chairman & DPEP Executive Committee) 
* Partner with a wide range of stakeholders, all with responsibility for shared success

* Minimum of 10 years relevant experience in leading business strategies/projects
* Proven advanced knowledge of Disney or similarly complex brand(s) with an expert ability to translate and evolve brand into business-leading growth ideas 
* Deep knowledge of new and established trends in the travel, tourism, entertainment and leisure industries
* A strong, confident creative sensibility balanced with strategic and business parameters of success 
* Understanding of strategic planning, business principles, forecasting and budget management at a global level
* Experienced in leading the integration of multiple data sources into clear, actionable insights to build concrete solutions 
* Keen understanding of the creative and delivery process, in particular new product types and innovative concepts by Disney and the broader industry 
* Excellent communication skills, including verbally, written and in formal speech/presentation settings, and strong executive presence
* Strong storytelling and communication skill; paints a compelling vision of what’s possible
* Proven, trusted builder of relationships and partnerships at all levels of a complex, matrix and globally
* Positive attitude and proven ability to influence partners and create an energized environment
* Skilled manager of teams, including prioritizing work and driving high level output
* Flexible and adaptable to changing priorities and business needs
* Ability to both think at a high level and execute at a tactical level
* Willingness to travel domestically and internationally
BS/BA in finance, business, design and/or engineering. MBA a plus

description:
Job Summary:

It’s the magic of immersing yourself in a motion picture masterpiece, or a new track from your favorite band, or the spectacle of a live Broadway show. It’s hard to define and even harder to create, but that’s what we do at The Walt Disney Studios. Ours is a culture of innovation, collaboration and creativity. We raise the bar, then step over it, blazing trails through the production and distribution of world-class entertainment around the globe. If you want to help tell compelling, enduring stories through movies, music or stage plays, then we want to hear from you.

The Walt Disney Company

Imagine a career with an organization that brings smiles to millions every day. Imagine working with people whose passion for what they do is simply indescribable. We are The Walt Disney Company, live with a rich legacy of innovation, entertainment, and lifelong memories. With our vast array of both businesses and professionals, you’ll have the opportunity to join a team that’s beloved around the world, and to find out how it feels to love what you do. We invite you to discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you‘ve been looking for.

Combining masterful artistry and storytelling with groundbreaking technology, Walt Disney Animation Studios is a filmmaker-driven animation studio responsible for creating some of the most beloved films ever made. Located in Burbank, WDAS continues to build on its rich legacy of innovation and creativity, stretching from the first fully-animated feature film, 1937’s Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, to 2013’s Academy Award®-winning Frozen, the biggest animated film of all time. At Walt Disney Animation Studios’ top filmmakers, artists and technical wizards collaborate to create the magic of animation. Bring your unique talents, passion and ideas to our team and prepare to play in a creative, artist-friendly environment.

This is a OPEIU position covered by a collective bargaining agreement.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist with calling/completing WDAS Facilities requests
  • Deliver supply room items as requested and maintain stock
  • Assist with sales of Merchandise Corner items
  • Ensure that the vending machine inventory is at acceptable levels
  • Assist with the set-up of bagels every Friday
  • Assist with distribution of employee giveaways
  • Help with other events as requested
  • Identify common areas in the building that require replacement of light bulbs, batteries, etc.
  • Keep mail station organized and tidy
  • Deliver paychecks as needed
  • Maintain food areas in the caffeine patch, including fresh fruit, cereal bar and peak time snacks

Basic Qualifications:

  • Motivated, creative and highly curious nature
  • Proficiency with MS Word, Excel, Google Suite, etc.
  • Resourceful, flexible and ability to maintain professionalism under pressure
  • Ability to prioritize multiple, at times conflicting demands and meet deadlines
  • Demonstrated strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent organizational skills and detailed oriented
  • Ability to work early morning hours or flexible work hours, as needed

Preferred Education

  • Bachelor’s degree preferred

Additional Information:

This is a OPEIU position covered by a collective bargaining agreement.

description:
The Graphic Design Artist is part of the Product Optimization Team which is responsible for playing a pivotal role in revenue generation by developing product, strategies, standards and executing operational initiatives to enhance the Guest experience and grow operational income.

This role will report to and support the Food and Beverage Product Development Manager producing graphic design from concept to final artwork. Responsibilities include graphic design, illustration and layouts for F&B projects at all levels of complexity.

Responsibilities

  • Develops graphics designs, layouts and illustrations for F&B Novelty products and assortments across multiple properties and cross divisions
  • Contributes ideas for product development
  • Contributes in new product in brainstorming sessions
  • Responsible for maintaining high graphic design / illustration standards for F&B
  • Develops a strong graphic design for F&B specific efforts
  • Understands graphic design and how it translates to products
  • Fresh inventive and alternative thinker
  • Awareness of marketplace trends
  • Able to present creative concepts on both formal and informal settings
  • Ability to sketch concepts in real time
  • Ability to be reliable, responsible and fulfilling obligations
  • Skilled team player that is able to maintain a high quality standard

Basic Qualifications

• 2-5 years of related work experience in graphic design, character art or product design
• Understands principles of illustration
• Exposure to multiple medium (sculpting, painting and drawing)
• Extensive knowledge of Graphic Design
• Strong traditional, digital drawing skills, and concepting skills
• Pro-active / Can-do attitude
• Strong creative computer skills
• Experience in ADOBE, Illustrator, InDesign, PhotoShop
• Experience in Microsoft Office
• Portfolio required

Preferred Qualifications

Content knowledge of Pixar, Disney, Marvel, Lucas, Burton, Muppets, Walt Disney Imagineering, Entertainment, Food and Beverage, Yellow Shoes and Product Design

Required Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Art and Design or equivalent

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

#DPEP_MEDIA

This role is considered hybrid, which means the employee will work a portion of their time on-site from a Company designated location and the remainder of their time remotely.

About Disneyland Resort:

When Walt Disney opened Disneyland on July 17, 1955, he said he hoped it would be “a source of joy and inspiration to all the world.” Since then, the Disneyland Resort has welcomed more than 800 million guests, expanding to become an approximately 500- acre, multifaceted, world-class family resort destination, complete with two renowned Disney theme parks, three hotels and the exciting shopping, dining and entertainment area known as Downtown Disney District. Through a combination of creativity, technology and innovation, the resort brings storytelling to new heights, and Disneyland Resort cast members play an integral part in bringing that Disney magic to life for thousands of guests every day.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc., which is part of a business we call Disneyland Resort.

Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

description:
Job Summary:

Global Development is a highly visible department charged with systematically assessing the long-term goals, growth strategy and capital expansion opportunities that drive investment decisions to maximize value for Disney’s Parks, Experiences and Products businesses. The team’s work spans across all businesses (e.g. theme parks & resorts, signature experiences, consumer products licensing & publishing) and geographies (e.g. US, Asia, Europe). The team plays a key role in helping the businesses deliver predictable and sustainable long term earnings growth.

Responsibilities:

  • Proactively support company leaders’ financial and commercial decision-making by driving cross-functional projects including leading research/analytics, developing presentations and managing relationships with partners.
  • Develop work plans for projects under management, ensuring timely delivery of work needed from the Global Development team and partners.
  • Define and lead strategic planning, research, modeling and analytics, and incorporate outputs in overall project storyline while also identifying past trends and predicting the future needs of our businesses and our consumers/Guests.
  • Develop own recommendation and autonomously build presentations
  • Deliver presentations and actively contribute to meetings with senior leadership
  • Explore new approaches and frameworks to solve issues
  • Proactively develop and maintain relationships with partners across the company
  • Provide ongoing development support to all levels within the team
  • Partner with Marketing/Consumer Insights, Revenue Management, Imagineering, Finance, etc. to gather internal data and opinions

Basic Qualifications:

  • 5 years of progressive experience in business development and/or consulting
  • Excellent research and problem-solving skills
  • Advanced quantitative analysis skills with the ability to translate into actionable insights and recommendations
  • Demonstrated strategic and structured thinking
  • Self-starter with the ability to handle ambiguity
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively across functions
  • Experience in coaching and mentoring direct reports
  • Ability to lead and inspire teams
  • Strong organizational and project management skills

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Passion for the Disney brand and in particular, Disney’s theme parks, signature experiences and consumer products
  • Enthusiasm for the markets and industries addressed by our segment
  • International work experience
  • Multilingual

Required Education

  • MBA and/or professional certification (e.g., CPA, CFA) from a leading program

description:
Job Summary:

Disney’s Consumer Products, Games & Publishing (CPGP) division is the business of The Walt Disney Company that brings stories and characters to life through innovative and engaging physical products and digital experiences across more than 100 categories, from toys and t-shirts, to apps, books and console games; as well as multiple franchise brands including Disney, Pixar, Star Wars, Marvel, and National Geographic. CPGP comprises four main lines of business: Licensing, Retail, Games and Publishing. It is home to world-class teams of app and game developers, licensing and retail experts, a leading retail/ecommerce business (Disney Store & shopDisney), artists and storytellers, and technologists who inspire imaginations around the world.

The CPGP Division Finance team is a fast-paced, dynamic team with responsibilities for division-wide financial planning, including forecasts, annual plan and long range plan; monitoring of division/business unit operating performance; franchise planning and various special projects. The group is also charged with developing presentations to inform division Senior Management regarding forecasted financial performance and business trends.

Responsibilities:

This position is ideal for a finance professional who possesses strong strategic, analytical, managerial and interpersonal skills. Across all responsibilities, the Manager, Finance will be challenged to support high level decision making by overseeing the development and improvement processes of financial models, and working effectively with analysts, various lines of business and international partners.

Responsibilities include supporting the following key functions:
  • Help lead the financial strategy and management for the Marvel team and the cross-brand Softlines team. Pull and analyze big data to form and present professional recommendation to senior management
  • Support forecasting, budgeting, and short & long term business planning
  • Support the completion of ad-hoc analysis
  • Create detailed analysis for presentations and reporting packages to CPGP and DPEP Senior Management teams
  • Consolidation, analysis, and review of Domestic and International financial submissions. Built relationships and ask necessary questions to fully understand the content of the submission
  • Collaborate with international finance teams outside of Consumer Products to develop deep understanding of allocations sent to CP
  • Support process efficiencies by leveraging tools such as Excel, Cognos and other tools

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 5 years of robust financial analysis in fast-paced environment
  • Strong attention to detail, demonstrated ability to create executive level deliverables
  • Extensive experience in Excel and PowerPoint required (Experience with data consolidation tools (Cognos, SAP preferred)
  • At least one year experience managing a team of analysts
  • Effective communicator. Excellent oral/written communication and presentation skills, experienced in building relationships with teams, and strong organizational skills
  • Proven ability to solve problems creatively and lead a team
  • Service oriented individual who wants to help and push the team forward
  • Self-starter who excels in a team environment and who challenges the status quo by continually searching for opportunities to improve internal processes

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in an analytical discipline

description:
Job Summary:

Imagine being able to cook Asian fare, traditional American favorites, or Italian specialties, all without changing the place you work? How about deepening your skills in table service, quick service, or catering? Now imagine all this at the happiest place on earth – Disney! As a Chef de Cuisine at Disneyland Resorts, you would help make magical experiences by pleasing the palettes of Guests of all ages, from all over the world.

You will report to an Executive Chef.

Responsibilities:

  • Direct multiple complex culinary concepts
  • Take calculated risks and challenge status quo to integrate processes, remove barriers and align performance goals
  • Create new and higher quality, service and product standards while innovating food combinations, texture and flavors.
  • Educate Culinary Cast Members on seasonal and ethnic products, culinary styles and techniques.
  • Inspire/Educate Cast Members and Guests on fads, trends, lifestyles and special dietary needs with consideration of product, equipment and cost.
  • Understand, support and teach the "role in the show" cuisine concept.
  • Provide an environment that supports our Diversity & Inclusion values and beliefs.
  • Inspire, provide direction and drive effectiveness of the Leadership Team
  • Initiate and sustain mutually beneficial relationships and effective partnerships.
  • Identify, influence and develop career path of Cast Members.
  • Hold Direct Reports accountable for job performance.
  • Anticipate potential business impacts, drives the management of financial profit and operating expenses
  • Inspire the delivery of "World-Class" seamless Guest experiences.
  • Ensure excellent Cast experiences delivered through Direct Reports.
  • Respond to special dietary needs.
  • Ensure that products are properly ordered, received and stored.
  • Ensure maintenance and cleanliness of equipment and facilities.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum five years of leading a Culinary Management Team.
  • Knowledge of union contracts and maintains positive business relationships with shop stewards and business agents
  • Experience managing a variety of complex budgets
  • Experience with inventory controls, procedures and efficiency management
  • Flexibility to work a varying scheduled, including variable days off.
  • Working knowledge of overall kitchen design, space planning and blueprint development.
  • Working knowledge of the Food & Beverage core equipment standards list.
  • Ability to lead concept ideation.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Advanced degree in Culinary Arts or Food Sciences.
  • Inspire creativity and new ideas that adapt to our business.
  • Knowledge of industry trends and practical business application that contribute with greater results while using less tools.
  • Knowledge of wines and spirits/sommelier certification.
  • Experience developing annual operating plans.
  • A focus on research and development that not only brings new ideas, but that also leverages trends and technology.
  • Speak and present to large groups of people, including but not limited to Company Executives.

Required Education

  • High School degree or equivalent

Preferred Education

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
  • Advanced degree in Culinary Arts or Food Sciences

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

description:
Job Summary:

Are you a born organizer? Do you keep your cool under pressure? Do you have experience supporting a high-level executive? And do you have a soft spot for Disney? If you’re nodding your head, then an Executive Support Professional position in Disney Parks, Experiences and Products at The Walt Disney Company might be right for you.

Our Executive Support Professionals are highly-respected because their skills are essential to the success of the company. At Disney, we are storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life through our movies, products, interactive games, parks and resorts, and media networks. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.

The mission of Disney Parks, Experiences and Products (DPEP) is to bring the magic of Disney into the daily lives of families and fans around the world to create magical memories that last a lifetime. Whether managing a theme park, building a cruise ship, producing a new toy, publishing a book, or creating an online adventure, we want to be able to give our fans and customers the best Disney experience possible.

This position currently reports to the Director HR and Director Employee Relations

Responsibilities:

You would be responsible for the day-to-day workings of the leader(s) you support. Our HR teams supports DPEP cast, crew and Imagineers. It goes without saying that there will be expense reports, travel planning, hundreds of phone messages and endless calendar jockeying, but this job is very much about people, about forming strong relationships with your leaders and co-workers, and about understanding how to leverage the human capital within the Disney enterprise to help your executive(s) flourish. As the “face” of your executive(s) within The Walt Disney Company, your professionalism, loyalty and attitude are a reflection of the office, and as such, are a critical component to its success. Every day as an Executive Support Professional is different! On any given day you might:
  • Create a multi-city travel itinerary, taking into account time zones, weather delays, traffic and fatigue levels;
  • Review your leader’s schedule to build-in time for things like thinking, and getting to/from meetings in our sprawling campus;
  • Understand the day’s priorities so you can be smart about how you direct phone calls;
  • Schedule conference rooms, meetings and video chats;
  • Be ready to throw the entire schedule out the door when an emergency comes up, then pick it up again when the dust settles;
  • Read relevant newspapers and trade journals so you understand the mission of the office;
  • Draft letters and emails on behalf of your leaders;
  • Act as “casual buyer” of all office supplies for the department, and manage purchase orders and vendor contracts;
  • Prepare regular reports and summaries -- you’ll have tasks that you “own” completely;
  • Collaborate on projects by conducting research, writing and fact-checking;
  • Assist with on-boarding new employees – you’ll be the “friendly face” that newbies count on to answer all their questions, including many who are quite senior in the organization;
  • Mentor and train other support professionals in hard skills like computer programs, and soft skills like teamwork;
  • Plan high-profile, complex events like offsites as well as smaller-scale gatherings such as service recognition parties;

Basic Qualifications:

  • At least 5 years of administrative experience supporting Managers or above;
  • Sharp written and verbal communication skills, including clean grammar and a robust vocabulary;
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize deadlines/deliverables;
  • Strong proficiency with all types of computers, phones and office equipment;
  • Mastery of Microsoft Office programs, good skills in SAP, Sharepoint and Concur;
  • A calm head and steady hand to deal with the unexpected;
  • Confidence to learn new programs when necessary;
  • Complete reliability handling confidential information;
  • Desire to truly be helpful to your leaders and co-workers, to go the extra mile without being asked, to build solid inter and intra-team relationships;
  • Some flexibility in your schedule – we value work/life balance, but in a pinch, a bit more time is needed;
  • Very strong organizational skills and attention to detail; and
  • A professional demeanor, positive outlook and a can-do attitude.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Good knowledge of working with global time zones
  • Experience working in a large publicly-traded company;

Required Education

High school degree

Preferred Education

Bachelor’s degree

description:
Job Summary:

Disney Streaming is responsible for developing and operating The Walt Disney Company's direct-to-consumer video businesses globally, including the ESPN+ premium sports streaming service; Star+ which brings live sports and general entertainment exclusively to the Latin America region; and Disney+, the dedicated streaming home for entertainment from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic. Our core mission is to deliver global audiences the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location. We serve consumers by bringing the world's most beloved characters, timeless stories, legendary athletes, and epic sporting events to global audiences through best-in-class direct-to-consumer video services. We strive daily to imaginatively challenge convention with innovative technology that gives consumers the freedom to access content on their terms across any connected device, time or location.

The Media Operations Department at Disney Streaming Services consists of agile and responsive teams of technicians that perform the daily processes and procedures of our live and on-demand streaming video products. The department's responsibilities consist of round-the-clock support for these products, ensuring proper functionality across all platforms.

The Streaming Media Assistant is part of a streaming Media Operations team staffed 24/7. SMA's routinely provide live, hands-on operational and procedural support for our partner products, including system health monitoring and incident management, in addition to live and VOD streaming media orchestration using proprietary software.

Responsibilities:

  • Must be available to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends, and holidays.
  • Strong understanding of computers and applications.
  • Must have an exemplary attention to detail.
  • Must possess strong communication skills, including written and verbal.
  • Must possess solid organizational skills.
  • Must be able to learn quickly and adapt to new situations.
  • Must have a strong ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced, time-sensitive environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • A solid computer and technical background, with experience working in digital media and online organizations.
  • Familiarity with streaming and broadcast media, particularly HTTP Live Streaming (HLS)
  • A team player who is enthusiastic with a strong work ethic.
  • Ability to troubleshoot efficiently.
  • 1-2 years of relevant working experience.

description:
Job Summary:

Disney Parks, Experiences and Products (DPEP) brings stories and characters to life through innovative and engaging physical products and digital experiences across more than 100 categories, from toys and t-shirts to apps, books, console games and much more. The business is home to world-class teams of app and game developers, licensing and retail experts, leading retail and e-commerce businesses – Disney store and shopDisney.com – as well as renowned artists, storytellers and technologists who inspire imaginations around the world.

Disney Publishing Worldwide develops original, award-winning Learning and Storytelling content for Disney, Marvel, Lucas and own-created brands, which fuels both DPEP and TWDC. It is considered the largest children’s publishing brand in the world.

We are seeking a motivated Senior Financial Analyst to support and help drive the Digital Experiences business within Disney Publishing Worldwide.

Responsibilities:

  • Support planning across key business cycles: Annual Operating Plan, Long-Term Strategic Plan, Monthly Forecasts and Quarter Close, including the preparation of presentations to Publishing and DPEP Executive teams and financial deliverables to Disney Publishing Global teams
  • Build modeling tools to perform business analysis and deal valuation - deep dive analysis to support business growth strategies including greenlight financials, special projects, and presentations for various internal stakeholders
  • Create and maintain financial models and P&Ls (revenue, costs, and managed operating income) - report, monitor and manage key financial and non-financial performance indicators
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders: internal finance team; functional teams for developing forecasts and budgets; accounting team for close process; partner teams for cross-functional deals/projects
  • Report directly to a Senior Manager responsible for global vertical print and digital operations, including commercialization support

Basic Qualifications:

  • 3 to 5 years of work experience in finance or accounting preferred
  • Strong financial modeling and analytical abilities
  • Attention to detail, desire for accuracy, and a strong sense of urgency
  • Business intelligence, data analysis, or market analysis exposure
  • General knowledge and experience with contract deals and revenue recognition
  • Ability to quickly learn new concepts, solve problems, implement solutions, and adapt to new systems/tools
  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
  • Collaborative and enjoys working with peers across a variety of products and regions
  • Advanced Excel and PowerPoint ability; SAP and Cognos TM1 experience preferred.

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree required (preferably in Finance or equivalent)
