description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research arm of The Walt Disney Company’s (TWDC) Parks and Resorts business segment. Representing more than 150 disciplines, the talented corps of Imagineers are responsible for the creation of Disney resorts, theme parks and attractions, hotels, water parks, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, cruise ships and new media technology projects.

Learn more about the work done at the Tech Studio:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EdDJ77uDwWQ

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YGOY4KaLLNw

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7Is5pykvgH0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AYbFZHLRGqw

Responsibilities:

The WDI Technology Studio is looking for talented software developers to develop apps, platforms, tools and technologies that enable and empower the design and development of upcoming attractions and experiences.
  • Software estimation, scheduling, planning, design, implementation, and closeout activities for assigned project scope.
  • Develop and/or maintain whole feature sets of software. This includes both architecture, design, implementation and testing.
  • Work with other software developers and software project leads to provide incremental and overall updates to status and condition of software product progress.

Basic Qualifications:

  • ​​​​​1-3 year experience
  • Knowledge and experience with modern software development practices, including version control and workflow management tools including JIRA, Github, Gitlab, Jenkins, etc.
  • Demonstrable technical writing, documentation, and communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Expertise in C, C++, C#, JavaScript or Python.
  • Familiarity and/or experience with: ShotGrid Pipeline Development, AutoDesk Maya, Motion Builder, AutoCAD Touch Designer, BIM, Unreal Engine or MS Visual Studio
  • Proven ability to learn new programming languages and work within complicated systems.

Required Education

  • Bachelor degree in computer science, computer engineering, or equivalent experience.

About Parks, Experiences and Products:

The Parks, Experiences and Products segment includes Disney’s iconic travel and leisure businesses, which include six resort destinations in the United States, Europe and Asia, a top-rated cruise line, a popular vacation ownership program, and an award-winning guided family adventure business. Disney’s global consumer products operations include the world’s leading licensing business across toys, apparel, home goods, digital games and apps; the world’s largest children’s publisher; Disney store locations around the world; and the shopDisney e-commerce platform.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc., which is part of a business we call Parks, Experiences and Products.

Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

description:
Job Summary:

The desire to help people is in your bones: That is why you entered the Health Care Profession and became a Paramedic. Imagine how great it would be to use your skills to help people who are 'enjoying the magic' at the most magical place on earth – Walt Disney World!

We assist our Guests when they have the unexpected happen. We help our guests with medical needs or help them get to additional care. We help them restore the Magic of their vacation.

Our Guest First Aid locations are Guest focused, fast-paced, and have multiple ways to meet the Guest’s needs. If you have a passion for Guest Services, helping people with energy, talent, and a desire to join an amazing team, please apply today!

You will report to the Guest Services Manager.

We proudly and happily welcome veterans of the US armed forces.

Responsibilities:

As an experienced Paramedic, most of your responsibilities will be familiar to you - making initial contact with people who have a need, listening, thinking of solutions, providing first aid solutions, performing vital signs, and elevating advanced care to a Registered Nurse. There will also be supporting clinical and administrative tasks, such as – collaborating with the nurse for minor and urgent care treatment, assisting with arrangements for transport, assisting Guests with storage of medications and medical equipment, completing checklists, stocking, and inventorying medical supplies and equipment, while maintaining a clean work environment. You will make sure the highest standards of quality and confidentiality are met at all times and will be as precise with your documentation as you are with your hands-on patient work.

You will join a team that works while others play. Keeping Guests safe is something we are very proud to do. You will have to work on weekends and holidays, but you will also have days off where you can play also.

On any given day, you might:
• Welcome our Guests with a positive, friendly, helpful attitude who present with a medical question or need.
• Perform and provide intervention and first aid services within your scope of practice as a Paramedic
• Work collaboratively with Registered Nurses to escalate assessments and support treatment plans for Guests needing additional care
• Administer Basic Life Support (including use of AED) when indicated
• Assist with the arrangements for Guests
• Complete daily checklist, maintain and stock treatment areas, perform inventory and ordering supply tasks
• Maintain a clean work area and follow disinfecting protocols
• Communicate effectively with Registered Nurse colleagues and other Partners
• Uphold the Walt Disney Company's standards of business conduct
• Document and maintain accurate, detailed records related to interactions and treatment provided
• Quality check work daily to catch any errors or omissions
• Enjoy the perks of being a Disney Cast Member!

Basic Qualifications:

Here is what you need to be successful in the job:
• 3+ years of experience as a Paramedic
• Current BLS Certification
• State of Florida Paramedic Certification
• Compassionate, genuine bedside manner and a deep desire to give the best possible care and Guest service
• Physical stamina to stand for long periods of time, walk, lift, squat, push, pull and/or carry heavy objects up to 30 lbs.
• Scrupulously protect patient confidentiality
• Flexibility to work weekends, holidays, and occasional overtime
• Knowledge of basic computer programs and ability to work with a laptop/desktop
• Valid Florida Driver's License

Preferred Qualifications:

• Ability to speak additional languages, i.e. Spanish
• National Paramedic Certification
• Some College Preferred

Required Education

• High School or GED Required

Additional Information:

Safety22
#DPEPFLA
#LA-TA

description:
Job Summary:


Are you the type who loves to connect with people? Do you have the gift of gab? And can you imagine how cool it would be if your "office" was the happiest place on earth: Walt Disney World?! If you answered "yes" to any of these questions, a Disney Vacation Club Associate position might be the perfect fit.

Disney Vacation Club is a vacation ownership/timeshare that gives guests the ability to enjoy Disney vacations and travel experiences around the globe, for many years to come. Promoting Disney Vacation Club is a true team effort, but it all begins with “you”, bringing the idea to our Guests while they're having fun throughout the Walt Disney World complex. Associates earn a guaranteed hourly rate of pay -- plus Variable Pay -- so if you’re thinking this is you, please apply today.

Your role would be to staff our kiosks throughout the Parks & Resorts. You will help guide and inspire guests into taking their next steps in learning about Disney Vacation Club's membership programs. This is done by you scheduling appointments with our sales team members; as they promote different opportunities in becoming our newest members. In addition to providing superior sales and service face to face, you will also make phone calls to welcoming Disney families on vacation while entering data into our system of record. This is all done under the careful guidance of our DVC Sales Experience Manager.

Responsibilities:

Every day as a Disney Vacation Club Associate is different! On any one day you will:

  • Get to know Guests from around the world
  • Work at different indoor and outdoor locations and engage guests through Disney service excellence
  • Proactively greet guests and spark a conversation about Disney and vacation possibilities
  • Apply your sales skills to influence guests to learn about Disney Vacation Club by asking for guest contact information for continued sales conversations
  • Inspire and invite guests to learn more while they are on vacation at WDW, and commit to taking next steps in learning about Disney Vacation Club
  • Overcome objections and utilize persuasive skills to promote Disney Vacation Club and the different ways to learn more sooner vs. later
  • Share your passion for, and knowledge of, everything Disney with our Guests

Basic Qualifications:


You Bring:
  • Willingness to approach people you don't know and engage them in conversation
  • Experience in sales and Guest interactions
  • A history of taking the initiative and being a self-starter
  • Flexibility to work different shifts, on weekends and on holidays
  • Work independently and as part of a team
  • Stamina to stand and work outdoors in all weather conditions, including rain, heat and cold
  • A true passion for Guest Service, and Disney
  • Professional reliability
  • Proficiency with computers: Apple iPad/Windows-based systems

Preferred Qualifications:


If would be great if you also have:
  • Bilingual skills
  • Knowledge of Disney Vacation Club
  • Understanding of the Walt Disney Parks & Resorts standards and expectations
  • Prior sales experience and knowledge of the sales process

Required Education

  • High School Diploma or Equivalent

Additional Information:

Are you the type who loves to connect with people? Do you have the gift of gab? And can you imagine how cool it would be if your "office" was the happiest place on earth: Walt Disney World?! If you answered "yes" to any of these questions, a Disney Vacation Club Associate position might be the perfect fit.

Disney Vacation Club is a vacation ownership/timeshare that gives guests the ability to enjoy Disney vacations and travel experiences around the globe, for many years to come. Promoting Disney Vacation Club is a true team effort, but it all begins with “you”, bringing the idea to our Guests while they're having fun throughout the Walt Disney World complex. Associates earn a guaranteed hourly rate of pay -- plus Variable Pay -- so if you’re thinking this is you, please apply today.

Your role would be to staff our kiosks throughout the Parks & Resorts. You will help guide and inspire guests into taking their next steps in learning about Disney Vacation Club's membership programs. This is done by you scheduling appointments with our sales team members; as they promote different opportunities in becoming our newest members. In addition to providing superior sales and service face to face, you will also make phone calls to welcoming Disney families on vacation while entering data into our system of record. This is all done under the careful guidance of our DVC Sales Experience Manager.

Every day as a Disney Vacation Club Associate is different! On any one day you will: 
* Get to know Guests from around the world
* Work at different indoor and outdoor locations and engage guests through Disney service excellence
* Proactively greet guests and spark a conversation about Disney and vacation possibilities
* Apply your sales skills to influence guests to learn about Disney Vacation Club by asking for guest contact information for continued sales conversations
* Inspire and invite guests to learn more while they are on vacation at WDW, and commit to taking next steps in learning about Disney Vacation Club
* Overcome objections and utilize persuasive skills to promote Disney Vacation Club and the different ways to learn more sooner vs. later
* Share your passion for, and knowledge of, everything Disney with our Guests

You Bring:

* Willingness to approach people you don't know and engage them in conversation
* Experience in sales and Guest interactions
* A history of taking the initiative and being a self-starter
* Flexibility to work different shifts, on weekends and on holidays
* Work independently and as part of a team
* Stamina to stand and work outdoors in all weather conditions, including rain, heat and cold
* A true passion for Guest Service, and Disney
* Professional reliability
* Proficiency with computers: Apple iPad/Windows-based systems

If would be great if you also have:

* Bilingual skills
* Knowledge of Disney Vacation Club
* Understanding of the Walt Disney Parks & Resorts standards and expectations
* Prior sales experience and knowledge of the sales process
* High School Diploma or Equivalent

description:

The vision of the Walt Disney World Marketing Strategy organization is to be the most imaginative marketers of immersive entertainment, inspiring people worldwide to make their Disney dreams come true. Our ultimate objective is to create consumer demand, visitation, and revenue goals for the Walt Disney World Resort by developing strategies and communication plans to reach and influence the consumer mindset and behavior. As the Multicultural Marketing Strategy Associate, you will work with multiples teams to determine needs. Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

description:
Job Summary:

Combining masterful artistry and storytelling with groundbreaking technology, Walt Disney Animation Studios is a filmmaker-driven animation studio responsible for creating some of the most beloved films ever made. Located in Burbank, WDAS continues to build on its rich legacy of innovation and creativity. WDAS is breaking new ground in episodic storytelling, bringing theatrical quality animation to the series format for Disney+.

Join the Tiana Long-Form Series Team!

We are excited to continue the story of The Princess & The Frog in our upcoming long-form Disney+ series. Tiana follows the newly crowned Princess of Maldonia as she sets off for a grand new adventure, but a calling to her New Orleans past isn’t far behind. We are looking for passionate Environment Concept Painters to join the Tiana Series filmmaking team.

Environment Concept Painters visually explore and collaborate in the creation of animated worlds and their logic through design ideas, dramatic story moments, mood and tonal pieces, and prop and vehicle designs that all serve a film’s storytelling. Artists also prepare production-focused designs including orthographic views, breakdowns, and fully rendered paintings to provide art direction to downstream departments.

We’re looking for Environment Concept Painters who have a rich imagination, a sense of whimsy and appeal, stylistic versatility, and masterful drawing and painting skills. Expertise in design, layout and composition, color and lighting, and architectural and organic forms are key skills in breathing life into our worlds. The ability to work both traditionally and in digital media is appreciated. We welcome artists who will bring fresh and unexpected viewpoints to our filmmaking and our team. We encourage and embrace original thinking and passion.

To apply for this position you must upload a portfolio and a resume consisting of your environmental concept work.

What You’ll Do:
  • Design inspiring worlds and moments based on a director’s vision
  • Execute detailed technical paintings to expedite collaboration with other departments in the pipeline
  • Know your research and inspire through your art
  • Work collaboratively and take direction
Requirements
  • Proficiency in Photoshop
  • At least 2 years of professional visual development experience required
  • Professional experience in background painting encouraged
  • Graphic design and traditional painting skills encouraged
  • Bachelors degree or equivalent experience
Portfolios Should Include:
  • Paintings and environment designs that demonstrate stylistic versatility, strong draftsmanship skills, and a strong understanding of storytelling, observation, mood, clarity, staging, color, lighting, perspective, and appeal
  • Paintings and drawings of narrative moments, character and environment interactions encouraged
  • Variety of environmental work including organic, architectural, interiors, and high concept
  • Observational studies
  • If any of your work is password protected, please include the password with your application (even if just included on your resume)
  • Social media accounts may be submitted as a supplement to your portfolio but should not be your primary portfolio (websites or multipage PDF files submitted via a Google drive preferred)

description:
Job Summary:

Disneyland Paris adapte sa stratégie commerciale pour toujours proposer une expérience inoubliable à ses guests (visiteurs). Notre équipe e-Commerce lance plusieurs initiatives de transformation des plateformes pour concevoir et offrir des parcours plus fluides, plus immersifs et répondant mieux aux attentes de nos guests. Dans ce contexte de forte transformation digitale, nous renforçons nos équipes et sommes à la recherche d’un.e Lead Product Designer UX/User eXperience pour manager les product designers et ainsi contribuer à l’atteinte d’ambitieux objectifs.


Vos Missions ?
  • Animer une équipe d’environ 5 Product Designers
  • Contribuer à définir la vision UX e-Commerce
  • Etre responsable de l’expérience e-Commerce
  • Appliquer des méthodes de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur afin de traduire les besoins utilisateur, les objectifs métier et les capacités technologiques en expériences utilisateur de premier ordre

En tant que Lead, vous serez amené. à :
  • Co-créer la vision Design avec le Head of Product Design
  • Porter la vision dans le département & au-delà
  • Apporter l’expertise UX et assurer une veille
  • Définir & appliquer des modes de collaboration avec les principaux partenaires & parties prenantes : Product Managers, Product Owners, développeurs, testeurs et l’ensemble des parties prenantes pour imaginer l'expérience de demain
  • Participer au suivi du plan de charge (à coordonner avec les Product Managers qui leadent le sujet)
  • Animer l’équipe de Product Designers : organisation de rituels et suivi de l'état d'esprit du groupe
  • Coacher les Designers sur leur métier
  • Challenger les productions
  • Assurer l'application des bonnes pratiques
  • Contribuer à la transformation digitale en étant force de proposition & en supportant le changement

En tant que Designer, vous serez amené. à :
  • Recueillir et analyser les avis des utilisateurs, les besoins existants et identifier les opportunités
  • Concevoir, planifier et animer des test utilisateurs
  • Traduire les résultats des recherches en experience map, empathy map, user journeys, etc.
  • Concevoir les personas et les cas d’usage correspondants
  • Animer des workshops dédiés d’idéation / de co-création
  • Proposer des A/B tests, analyser les résultats des lancements produits et proposer des pistes d’améliorations et d’innovation
  • Définir l’architecture de l’information, les principes de navigation, de guidage et de structuration tout en expliquant les choix de conception
  • Matérialiser les solutions permettant d’optimiser l’expérience, en particulier en situation de mobilité ; concevoir des wireframes et prototypes des interfaces web et mobile
  • Développer le modèle et la structure de navigation primaire et secondaire
  • Créer des prototypes
  • Travailler en collaboration avec la squad et les différents services techniques, expliquer vos partis-pris à l’ensemble de l’équipe et collaborer avec l’UI designer
  • Collaborer et échanger au sein d’équipes projet pluridisciplinaires (directeurs artistiques, webdesigners, développeur, consultants métiers…).
  • Tenir compte de la faisabilité avec les équipes techniques et créatives

Vos atouts pour réussir ?
  • Idéalement titulaire d'un Bac+5, vous avez une expérience de 7 ans minimum dans l’UX et la recherche utilisateur dans une agence digitale, cabinet de conseil, en entreprise ou startup
  • Les techniques « Design Thinking » n’ont pas de secret pour vous
  • Vous maitrisez les outils et les méthodes les plus innovantes et faites parfaitement la différence entre culture Produit vs culture Projet
  • Vous êtes familier avec les approches Agiles et les démarches collaboratives basées sur la co-construction
  • Vous faites preuve de persuasion pour porter la vision de votre produit et facilitez la communication et la collaboration entre l’ensemble des parties prenantes
  • Votre leadership, votre esprit d'initiative et vos qualités relationnelles vous permettront d'assurer avec succès les missions qui vous seront confiées, et de vous adapter rapidement à un environnement international dynamique
  • Vous parlez et écrivez couramment l'anglais


La différence Disneyland Paris ?
  • Un environnement exceptionnel, international et multiculturel concentré sur un site unique
  • Un programme d‘intégration complet sur votre poste et l’accès à de nombreuses formations
  • Des opportunités de développement de votre carrière
  • Télétravail et d’autres avantages dont prise en charge partielle des frais de transports
  • Contribuer à la transformation digitale & travailler sur des projets stratégiques et ambitieux


Prêt(e) à participer à une formidable aventure humaine ? A rejoindre nos collaborateurs (Cast Members) partageant la même ambition professionnelle : celle de faire vivre la magie Disneyland Paris pour les millions de visiteurs qui viennent dans nos parcs tous les ans ?
Il ne vous reste plus qu’à postuler car nous sommes prêts à vous donner les moyens de faire rayonner vos talents !


‘Disneyland Paris est soucieux d’offrir à ses Cast Members les conditions de travail les plus favorables à leur épanouissement professionnel. Dans ce cadre et pour garantir une flexibilité optimale, les emplois qui ne nécessitent pas une intervention ou l’accès à des installations ou applications sur site et/ou des interactions physiques peuvent s’exercer en télétravail, avec un minimum de présence requis de cinq jours par mois sur site.
